ENGLISH: Do you not know that if you give yourselves to anyone as thralls, to do what he says, you are his thralls since you do what he says – perhaps thralls of sin, leading to death, perhaps thralls of obedience , leading to righteousness.
QUENYA: Ma ualde ista i qui antalde inde aiquenen ve móli, carien ya quetis, nalde móliryar pan carilde ya quetis – cé úcareo móli, tulyala qualmenna, cé canwacimiéno móli, tulyala failienna.

ENGLISH: To let also you know my matters, how I am doing, Tychicus – a beloved brother and a faithful servant in the Lord – will make everything known to you.
QUENYA: Lavien yando elden ista ninye nattor, manen cáran, Ticico – melda háno ar voronda núro i Herusse – caruva ilqua sinwa len.

ENGLISH: As he was still speaking to the crowds, look! his mother and his brothers stood on the outside and wished to speak with him.
QUENYA: Íre en quétanes i şangannar, yé! amillerya ar hánoryar tarner i ettesse ar merner carpa óse.

ENGLISH: When this man heard that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, he went to him and asked of him that he was to come down to heal his son, for he was near to death.
QUENYA: Íre nér sina hlasse i Yésus náne túlienwa et Yúreallo mir Alilea, lendes senna ar arcane sello i tulumnes undu nestien yondorya, an anes hare qualmenna.

ENGLISH: if indeed you heard him and were instructed by him, as is true in Jesus:
QUENYA: qui é hlasseldes ar náner peantaine lo sé, ve nanwa ná Yésusse:

ENGLISH: When he came to the house of the ruler and saw the flute-players and the crowd making clamour,
QUENYA: Íre túles coanna i turwa ar cenne i simpetari ar i şanga cárala yalme,

ENGLISH: Jesus answered them: “Is it not written in your Law: I said: You are gods – ?
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente téna: “Ma ua técina Şanyeldasse: Quenten: Nalde ainoli – ?

ENGLISH: He said to him: “What are they?” Jesus answered: “You shall not kill, you shall not steal, you shall not speak a lying witness,
QUENYA: Quentes senna: “Mana nalte?” Yésus hanquente: “Ávalye nahta, ávalye pile, ávalye quete hurila vettie,

ENGLISH: Thus is also the resurrection of dead: It is sown in a destructible state; it is raised in a state beyond destruction.
QUENYA: Sie ná yú i enortáve qualinaiva: Nas rérina mi nancárima sóma; nas ortana mi sóma han nancarie.

ENGLISH: And I went to the angel and said to him that he was to give me the little book; and he said to me: “Take it and eat ; it shall be bitter to your belly, but sweet as honey in your mouth.”
QUENYA: Ar lenden i valanna ar quente senna i nin-antauvanes i pitya parma; ar quentes ninna: “Ása mapa ar mata; nauvas sára cumbalyan, mal lisse ve melu sangolyasse.”

ENGLISH: And he summoned the twelve disciples and gave to them power over unclean spirits, for them to throw them out, and for them to heal every disease and every ailing condition.
QUENYA: Ar tultanes i hildor yunque ar antane tien túre or úpoice fairi, et-hatieltan te, ar nestieltan ilya hlíve ar ilya nimpa sóma.

ENGLISH: And anything that you pray for in my name, that I will do, that] the Father will be glorified by means of the Son.
QUENYA: Ar aiqua ya arcalde essenyanen, ta caruvan, i nauva i Atar alcaryaina i Yondonen.

ENGLISH: The blind see again, and the lame walk, the leprous are being cleansed and the deaf are hearing, and the dead are being raised, and the poor ones are hearing the gospel made known,
QUENYA: I laceníti cenir ata, ar i lalevíti vantar, i halmahlaiwar nar poitaine ar i hlárelórar hlárar, ar i qualinar nar ortaine, ar i penyar hlárar i evandilyon carna sinwa,

ENGLISH: Then a person in the crowd said to him: “Teacher, say to my brother that is necessary for him to give me a portion in the inheritance!”
QUENYA: Tá quén i şangasse quente senna: “Peantar, queta hánonyanna i mauya sen anta nin masse i aryoniesse!”

ENGLISH: These men are not full of wine as you suppose, for this is the third hour of the day.
QUENYA: Queni sine é uar quante limpeo ve intyalde, an si i neldea lúme i aureo ná.

ENGLISH: Jesus answered: “The first is: Hear, Israel! The Lord our God, the Lord is one;
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente: “I minya ná: Hlara, Israel! I Héru Ainolva, i Héru ná er,

ENGLISH: Give glory to all, love the brotherhood, fear God, give glory to the king!
QUENYA: Á anta alcar illin, mela i otornasse, ruca Erullo, á anta alcar i aranen!

ENGLISH: After making a consideration he went to the house of Mary, mother of John who had the nickname Mark. In the house a quite large number of people were assembled, praying.
QUENYA: Apa carie úvie lendes coanna Maríava, amil Yoháno ye sáme i epesse Marco. I coasse fárea nóte queniva náner ocómienwe, hyámala.

ENGLISH: And if somebody says anything to you, say: The Lord has need of them . Then, in the same moment, he will send them!”
QUENYA: Ar qui quén quete aiqua lenta, queta: I Heru same maure túva. Tá, mi imya lú, mentauvas tu!”

ENGLISH: Thus also Jesus, for him to hallow the people by his own blood, suffered on the outside of the gate.
QUENYA: Sie yando Yésus, airitieryan i lie véra serceryanen, perpére ettesse i ando.

ENGLISH: and he delivered him out of all his tribulations and gave him grace and wisdom before Pharaoh king of Egypt. And he put him to rule Egypt and his entire house.
QUENYA: ar etelehtanes se et ilye şangieryallon ar antane sen lisse ar sailie epe Fáro aran Mirrandoro. Ar hé panyane se turien Mirrandor ar quanda coarya.

ENGLISH: But to every single person among us the grace has been given, by the measure by which the gift of the Christ is distributed.
QUENYA: Mal ilya erya quenen mici vi i lisse anaie antaina, i lestanen yanen i Hristo anna etsátina ná.

ENGLISH: And he led him away from the crowd to a lonely place and put his fingers into the man's ears and, after spitting, he touched his tongue.
QUENYA: Ar se-tulyanes oa i şangallo eressea nómenna ar panyane leperyar mir i nero hlaru ar, apa piutie, appanes lambarya.

ENGLISH: I say to you: This man went home being more righteous than the other, for everyone that exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”
QUENYA: Quetin lenna: Nér sina lende marda nála faila lá i exe, an ilquen ye orta inse nauva nucumna, mal sé ye nucume inse nauva ortaina.”

ENGLISH: Happy are the thralls whose master, when he returns, finds them watching! Truly I say to you: He will bind around his hip and will allow them to lie at the table, and he will come to be a servant to them.
QUENYA: Valime nar i móli ion heru, íre nanwenis, hire te tíra! Násie quetin lenna: Notuvas os oşwerya ar lavuva tien caita ara i sarno, ar tuluvas náven núro tien.

ENGLISH: And the crowed arose against them , and the judges, after the tore their cloaks from them , commanded that one was to beat them with sticks .
QUENYA: Ar i şanga oronte túna, ar i námor, apa narcanelte collattar tullo, canner i mo palpumne tu rundainen.

ENGLISH: Going from there he saw also two others who were brothers, James son of Zebedee and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, repairing their nets – and he called them.
QUENYA: Lelyala talo cennes yú exe atta yet nánet hánor, Yácov Severaion ar Yohannes hánorya, i luntesse as Severai ataretta, envinyatála rembettar – ar yaldeset.

ENGLISH: For if anyone has caused grief, he has not caused it to me, but in a measure – not to speak in too harsh a manner – to all among you.
QUENYA: Mal qui aiquen atyárie nyére, uas atyárie sa inyen, mal mi lesta – lá carpien mi acca naraca lé – illin mici le.

ENGLISH: As you see, his faith worked with is acts, and by his acts his faith was made perfect.
QUENYA: Ve cenil, savierya móle as cardaryar, ar cardaryainen savierya náne carna ilvana.

ENGLISH: Thus you were made an example for all that believe in Macedonia and Achaia.
QUENYA: Sie anelde cárine epemma illin i savir Maceroniasse ar Acaiasse.

ENGLISH: Since we have heard that some people from among us have caused you difficulty with their words, trying to overturn your soul though we have not given them instructions,
QUENYA: Pan ahlárielme in ennoli ho mici mé atyárier len urdie quettaltainen, névala nuquere fealda ómu ualme ánie tien peantier,

ENGLISH: But Peter said to her: “How is that you were of one mind to test the Lord's spirit? Behold! The feet of that brought your husband to his grave are before the door, and they will carry you outside.”
QUENYA: Mal Péter quente senna: “Manen ná i aneste er sámo tyastien i Héruo faire? Yé! I talu ion taller verulya sapsaryanna nát epe i fenda, ar coluvalte lyé ettenna.”

ENGLISH: Therefore, now when you have put away lie, speak truth, everyone among you with his neighbor, for we are each one the other's body-parts .
QUENYA: Etta, sí íre apánielde oa huru, queta nanwie, ilquen mici le as armarorya, an nalve ilquen i exeo hroarantar.

ENGLISH: And after three days they found him in the temple, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them.
QUENYA: Ar apa auri nelde hirnettes i cordasse, hámala imíca i peantari, lastala téna ar maquétala téna.

ENGLISH: For God has not given us a timid spirit, but a spirit of power and love and of health of mind.
QUENYA: An Eru ua ánie ven caurea faire, mal faire túreva ar melmeva ar máleva sámo.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, though you were dead in your crimes and in your lack of circumcision in your flesh, God made you alive with him. He forgave us all our crimes
QUENYA: Ente, ómu anelde qualinar ongweldassen ar penieldasse oscirie hráveldasse, Eru le-carne coirie óse. Apsennes ven ilye ongwelvar

ENGLISH: Then they put their hands on him and seized him.
QUENYA: Tá panyanelte máltat sesse ar namper se.

ENGLISH: Thus the tongue as well is a small body-part, and yet it boasts greatly. Behold, how small is the fire that can kindle so great a wood!
QUENYA: Sie yando i lamba ná pitya hroaranta, ananta laitaxe ita. Yé, manen pitya ná i náre ya pole narta ta hoa taure!

ENGLISH: a path that he opened up to us as a new and living path through the veil, that is, the flesh,
QUENYA: tie ya pantanes ven ve vinya ar coirea tie ter i fanwa, ta ná, i hráve,

ENGLISH: And he wished to fill himself with the pods that the pigs were eating, but no one gave him a thing.
QUENYA: Ar mernes quate inse i vainínen yar i polcar manter, mal úquen antane sen nat.

ENGLISH: And the Lord’s angel stood by them, and the Lord’s glory shone about them, and great fear seized them.
QUENYA: Ar i Héruo vala tarne ara te, ar i Héruo alcar caltane os te, ar túra caure nampe te.

ENGLISH: But they did not remember to bring breads with them, and except for one bread they had nothing in the boat.
QUENYA: Mal ualte renne mapa massar aselte, ar hequa massa er sámelte munta aselte i luntesse.

ENGLISH: and the body-parts that we think less honorable, to them we give that more abundant glory, and so our unseemly parts have more abundant beauty,
QUENYA: ar i hroarantar yar sanalve mis laitime, tain antalve ta ambe úvea alcar, ar sie úvanime rantalvain samir ambe úvea vaniesse,

ENGLISH: But also if you did get married to a woman, you were not going to sin . And if a virgin got married, she was not going to sin . But who do so will have tribulations in their flesh. But I try to save you from grief.
QUENYA: Mal yú qui é veryanel nissenna, ual úcarumne. Ar qui vende veryane, uas úcarumne. Mal i carir sie samuvar şangier hráveltasse. Ono nevin le-rehta nairello.

ENGLISH: which you learnt and you received and you heard and you saw by means of me, do them, and the God of peace will be with you.
QUENYA: Yar parnelde ar camnelde ar hlasselde ar cennelde inyenen, tai cara, ar i Aino raineva euva aselde.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, they cannot more die, for they are like angels, since they are children of God by being children of the resurrection.
QUENYA: Ente, ualte pole ambe quale, an nalte ve valar, pan nalte Eruo híni návenen i enortaleo híni.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “If you want to be perfect, go and sell your goods and give them to the poor, and you will receive a treasure in heaven; then come and follow me!”
QUENYA: Yésus quente senna: “Qui meril náve ilvana, mena ar vaca armalyar ar átai anta i penyain, ar camuval harma menelde; tá tula ar áni hilya!”

ENGLISH: Therefore I wish that these younger widows are to marry, and that they bear children and manage a home; thus who stands against us will not have a reason for speaking mockery.
QUENYA: Etta merin i sine ambe nesse verulórar veryuvar, ar i colilte híni ar mahtar mar; sie ye tare venna ua samuva casta quetien yaiwe.

ENGLISH: But in answer Jesus said to him: “Simon, I have something that I want to say to you.” He said: “Teacher, say it!”
QUENYA: Mal hanquentasse Yésus quente senna: “Símon, samin nat ya merin quete lyenna.” Eques: “Peantar, queta sa!”

ENGLISH: And some among who stood there, when they heard that, said: “Listen! He is calling Elijah!”
QUENYA: Ar quelli imíca i tarner hare, íre hlasselte ta, quenter: “Á lasta! Yálas Elía!”

ENGLISH: But we are sending with him a brother whose praise has spread through all the congregations because of his work for the gospel.
QUENYA: Mal mentealme óse háno yeo laitale ivintie ter ilye i ocombi molieryanen i evandilyonen.

ENGLISH: And he commanded them, saying: “Take head, watch out concerning the leaven of the Pharisees and Herod's leaven.”
QUENYA: Ar cannes tien, quétala: “Cima, ettira pa Farisaron pulmaxe ar Herolo pulmaxe.”

ENGLISH: But the greater number among them did not please God, for their corpses were scattered in the wilderness.
QUENYA: Mal i ambe rimbe queni mici te uar fastane Eru, an loicoltar náner vintane i ravandasse.

ENGLISH: And while he sat on the Mount of Olives across from the temple, Peter and James and Andrew asked him, now that they were alone:
QUENYA: Ar lan hamnes Orontesse Milpioiva olla i cordallo, Péter ar Yácov ar Yoháno ar Andréas maquenter senna, sí íre anelte erinque:

ENGLISH: May God and the Father of Jesus Christ our Lord be blessed, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort,
QUENYA: Nai Eru ar Yésus Hristo Herulvo Atar nauva aistana, i Atar oraviéron ar Aino ilya tiutaleo,

ENGLISH: Concerning the gospel they are enemies by reason of you, but concerning the choosing they are beloved, by reason of their fathers.
QUENYA: Pa i evandilyon nalte ñottor castanen eldeo, mal pa i cilie nalte melde, castanen atariltaron.

ENGLISH: Therefore they called for a second time the man who formerly was blind and said to him: “Give glory to God; we know that this man is a sinner.”
QUENYA: Etta yaldelte attea lússe i nér ye yá náne lomba ar quenter senna: “Á anta Erun alcar; istalme i ná nér sina úcarindo.”

ENGLISH: You judge by the flesh; I do not judge anyboy at all.
QUENYA: Lé namir i hrávenen; inye laume name aiquen.

ENGLISH: In answer he said: “Wicked and dull thrall, then you knew that I reap where I did not sow and gather where I did not scatter?
QUENYA: Hanquentasse eques: “Olca ar lenca mól, tá sintel i cirihtan yasse uan rende ar comyan yasse uan vintane?

ENGLISH: When it was full, they pulled it up onto the beach and sat down and gathered the good ones into vessels, but the worthless ones they threw away.
QUENYA: Íre anes quanta, tunceltes ama i fáranna ar hamuner ar comyaner i márar mir veneli, mal i úmirwar hantelte oa.

ENGLISH: And out of the heart come evil thoughts, killings, marriage-breaking, fornication, thefts, lying testimonies, blasphemies.
QUENYA: An et i endallo tulir olce sanwar, nahtier, vestaleracie, úpuhtale, pilwi, húrala vettier, naiquetier.

ENGLISH: and we said farewell to one another, and we went into the boat, but they returned home.
QUENYA: ar quentelme namárie quén i exenna, ar lendelme mir i lunte, mal té nanwenner marda.

ENGLISH: Then he started to curse and say with oaths: “I do not know the man!” And in the same moment a cock sounded.
QUENYA: Tá yestanes húta ar quete vandalínen: “Uan ista i nér!” Ar mí imya lú tocot lamyane.

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “If they do not listen to Moses and the Prophets, a person returning from dead will also fail to change their mind.”
QUENYA: Ono quentes senna: “Qui ualte lasta Mósenna ar i Erutercánonnar, quén nanwénala qualinillon yando loituva vista sámalta.”

ENGLISH: Therefore, brothers, do everything that you can to make firm your calling and your choosing, for so doing you shall by no means fall.
QUENYA: Etta, hánor, cara ilqua ya polilde carien tulca yalielda ar cilmelda, an sie cárala laume lantuvalde.

ENGLISH: Then he turned to the woman and said to Simon: “Are you seeing this woman? I came into your house; you did not give me water for my feet. But this woman made my feet wet with her tears and wiped them away with her hair.
QUENYA: Tá quernes inse i nissenna ar quente Símondenna: “Ma cénal nís sina? Túlen mir coalya; ual antane nin nén talunyant. Mal nís sina carne talunyat mixe níreryainen ar aupsarne tai findeleryanen.

ENGLISH: The fourth angel sounded his trumpet, and a third part of Sun was smitten , and a third of Moon, and a third of the stars. Thus a third of their light became darkness; was no light for a third of the day, or for a third of the night.
QUENYA: I cantea vala lamyane hyólarya, ar nelesta Anaro náne pétina, ar nelesta Işilo, ar nelesta i tinwion. Sie nelesta calalto olle mornie; lá enge cala nelestasse i aureo, hya nelestasse i lómio.

ENGLISH: To him the door-watcher opens, and the sheep listen to his voice, and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them outside.
QUENYA: Sen i fennatir latya, ar i mámar lastar ómaryanna, ar yalis vére mámaryar essenen ar te-tulya etsenna.

ENGLISH: Now was the preparation of the Passover; was around the night hour. And he said to the Jews: “Behold your king!”
QUENYA: Sí enge i manwie i Lahtiéva; náne os i nertea lúme. Ar quentes i Yúrannar: “Ela aranelda!”

ENGLISH: What, then, am I to say about these things? If God is with us, who will stand against us?
QUENYA: Mana, tá, quetuvan pa nati sine? Qui Eru ea aselve, man taruva venna?

ENGLISH: Do not make one another deprived, except when you are of one mind to be away from the other, for a time, to give yourselves opportunity for prayer. Then come together again, to stop Satan from tempting you since you cannot control your lust.
QUENYA: Áva care quén i exe racine, hequa íre naste er sámo náve oa i exello, ter lúme, antáven lent ecie hyamien. Tá tula uo ata, pustien Sátan şahtiello let pan uaste pole ture mailesta.

ENGLISH: Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he came forth from God and was to go to God,
QUENYA: Yésus, istala i náne i Atar antienwa ilye nati máryanta, ar i ettúles Erullo ar menumne Erunna,

ENGLISH: Until I shall come, give heed to the reading, the comfort, the teaching.
QUENYA: Tenna tuluvan, cima i hentie, i tiutie, i peantie.

ENGLISH: But these sayings seemed to them like folly, and they did not believe what the women said.
QUENYA: Mal quetier sine şéner tien ve aucie, ar ualte sáve ya i nissi quenter.

ENGLISH: But when he was asked by the Pharisees about the time when God's kingdom was going to come, he said to them in answer: “God's kingdom does not come in a manner allowing people to see it with their eyes.
QUENYA: Mal íre anes maquétina lo i Farisar pa i lúme yasse Eruo aranie tulumne, quentes téna hanquentasse: “Eruo aranie ua tule mi lé lávala quenin cenitas hendultanten.

ENGLISH: For I was hungry and you gave he food; I was thirsty, and you gave me something to drink; I was a stranger, and you received me,
QUENYA: An anen maita ar antanelde nin matta; anen soica, ar antanelde nin nat sucien; anen ettelea ar camnelde ni,

ENGLISH: Therefore, if you that are wicked know to give good gifts to your children, how more the heavenly Father will give Holy Spirit to those that ask of him!”
QUENYA: Etta, qui elde i nar olce istar anta máre annar hínaldain, manen ole i menelda Atar antuva Aire Fea in arcar sello!”

ENGLISH: and they said: “Men from Galilee, how is that you are standing looking at heaven? This Jesus, who was taken up from you into the cloud, shall return so, in the same manner that you watched him go into heaven.”
QUENYA: ar quentette: “Neri Alileallo, manen ná i táralde yétala menel? Yésus sina, ye náne cámina ama lello mir i lumbo, entuluva sie, mí imya lé ya tirneldes lelyea mir menel.”

ENGLISH: and he will speak to you sayings by which you will be saved, you and your family.
QUENYA: ar quetuvas lyenna quetiéli yainen nauval rehtana, elye ar nosselya.

ENGLISH: And after they said the request, the place where they were assembled was being shaken, and everyone among them was filled by the Holy Spirit and spoke God's word with boldness.
QUENYA: Ar apa quentelte i arcande, i nóme yasse anelte ócómienwe náne pálaina, ar ilquen mici te náne quátina i Aire Feanen ar quente Eruo quetta veriénen.

ENGLISH: And on his journey towards Jerusalem he passed though the middle of Samaria and Galilee.
QUENYA: Ar lendaryasse Yerúsalemenna langanes ter i ende Samário ar Alileo.

ENGLISH: But great fear seized them, and they said one to the other: “Who indeed is he, since also wind and sea do as he says?”
QUENYA: Mal hoa caure te-nampe, ar quentelte quén i exenna: “É man náse, pan yando súre yo ear carit ve quetis?”

ENGLISH: they had breast-plates like breast-plates of iron, and the sound of their wings was like the sound of many chariots with horses that are running to war.
QUENYA: sámelte ambassi ve angaine ambassi, ar i lamma rámaltaron náne ve i lamma rimbe norolleron arwe roccoron i nórar ohtanna.

ENGLISH: A crowd sat around him, and they said to him: “Behold! Your mother and your brothers on the outside are seeking you.”
QUENYA: Şanga hamne os se, ar quentelte senna: “Yé! Amillelya ar hánolyar i ettesse lye-cestear.”

ENGLISH: For numerous ones are called, but few are chosen!”
QUENYA: An rimbar nar yáline, mal mancar nar cíline!

ENGLISH: But these people will answer concerning this to that is ready to judge the living and the dead.
QUENYA: Mal queni sine hanquetuvar pa si yen ná manwa namien coirear ar qualini.

ENGLISH: to show mercy on our fathers and to recall his holy covenant,
QUENYA: tanien oravie atarilvassen ar enyalien aire vérerya,

ENGLISH: No one fastens a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old cloak, for its full power will pull from it, and there will be a worse tearing.
QUENYA: Úquen tace lilma alapihta lanneo yára collasse, an quanta túrerya tucuva sallo, ar euva ambe faica narcie.

ENGLISH: And while the words were still in his mouth, behold, there came Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great crowd having swords and clubs came from the chief priests and the elders among the people.
QUENYA: Ar íre i quettar en enger antoryasse, yé, tasse túle Yúras, quén i yunqueo, ar óse hoa şanga arwa macillion ar rundalion túle ho i hére airimor ar i amyárar mici i lie.

ENGLISH: And men were being burned by a great heat, but they cursed the name of God, who had authority over these plagues, and they did not find repentance so as to give him glory.
QUENYA: Ar atani náner urtaine túra úrenen, mal huntelte i esse Eruo, ye sáme hére or ungwaler sine, ar ualte hirne inwis antáven sen alcar.

ENGLISH: Now I made known to you, brothers, the gospel that I gave to you, which I also received, in which you also stand,
QUENYA: # Sí carin sinwa len, hánor, i evandilyon ya antanen len, ya yú camnelde, yasse yú tarilde,

ENGLISH: and who by Holy Spirit spoke through the mouth of David our father, your servant: 'How is that nations rise up up and peoples are thinking about empty things?
QUENYA: ar ye Aire Feanen quente ter i anto Lavir atarelmo, núrolya: 'Manen ná i nóreli amortar ar lieli sánear pa luste natali?

ENGLISH: But I am sending the brothers, that my praise concerning you will not be empty in this matter, but as I have said you will indeeed be ready.
QUENYA: Mal mentean i hánor, i laitalelma pa elde ua nauva lusta pa natto sina, mal ve equétien é nauvalde manwe.

ENGLISH: and he told them everything and sent them to Joppa.
QUENYA: ar nyarnes ilqua tien ar te-mentane Yoppanna.

ENGLISH: Indeed there will still be a sabbath-rest for God's people.

ENGLISH: Everyone who comes to me and hears my words and does them – I will show you with whom one can compare him:
QUENYA: Ilquen ye tule ninna ar hlare quettanyar ar care tai – tanuvan len as man mo pole sesta se:

ENGLISH: And he commanded the crowd to lie down upon the ground, and he took the seven breads, gave thanks, broke them and gave them to his disciples, for them to put them before the people, and they put them before the crowd.
QUENYA: Ar cannes i şangan caita undu i talamenna, ar nampes i massar otso, antane hantale, rance tai ar antane tai hildoryain, panieltan tai epe i queni, ar panyaneltet epe i şanga.

ENGLISH: And the whole city was stirred, and the people ran together, and they seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple. In the same moment the gates were closed.
QUENYA: Ar i quanda osto náne valtana, ar i lie norne uo, ar nampelte Paulo ar tuncer se et i cordallo. Mí imya lú i andor náner avalatyane.

ENGLISH: And he said to him: “Rise and go; by your faith you have received health.”
QUENYA: Ar quentes senna: “Á orta ar mena; savielyanen acámiel mále.”

ENGLISH: and you do not have my word remaining in you. For that he sent, in him you do not believe.
QUENYA: ar ualde same quettarya lemyala lesse. An ye mentanes, sesse ualde save.

ENGLISH: And another came out, a fiery-red horse; and to who sat on it was given to take peace away from earth, for them to slay one another; and a huge sword was given to him.
QUENYA: Ar exe ettúle, narwa rocco; ar yen hamme sesse náne antana mapa raine oa cemello, nahtieltan quén i exe; ar haura macil náne sen antana.

ENGLISH: Now when their slipping brings riches to the world, and their being deprived brings riches to the nations, how much more will their full number do so!
QUENYA: Sí íre taltielta tala almare i marden, ar návelta nehtane tala almare i nórin, manen ita ambe quanta nótelta caruva sie!

ENGLISH: And behold, some among the scribes said to themselves: “This man is blaspheming!”
QUENYA: Ar yé, queneli mici i parmangolmor quenter intenna: “Nér sina naiquéta!”

ENGLISH: Now while Peter was beneath in the court, one among the maidservants came,
QUENYA: Sí lan Péter náne undu i pacasse, quén imíca i núri túle,

ENGLISH: I planted, Apollos poured water, but God gave the growth.
QUENYA: Inye empanne, Apollo ulyane nén, mal Eru antane i alie.

ENGLISH: but the others, seizing his servants, behaved towards them with scorn and killed them.
QUENYA: mal i exi, mápala núroryar, lenganer tien yaiwenen ar nacanter te.

ENGLISH: And I saw, and look! a white horse, and who sat upon it had a bow; and a crown was given to him, and he went forth conquering and to conquer.
QUENYA: Ar cennen, ar yé! ninque rocco, ar ye hamme sesse sáme quinga; ar ríe náne sen antana, ar etelendes túrula ar turuyen.

ENGLISH: Then they said: “Lord, see, here are two swords.” He said to them: “They are enough.”
QUENYA: Tá quentelte: “Heru, ela, sisse eat macil atta.” Quentes téna: “Tú faryat.”

ENGLISH: for forty days, being tempted by the Devil. And he ate nothing in those days, and when they were gone, he was hungry.
QUENYA: aurin canaquean, nála şahtaina lo i Arauco. Ar mantes munta yane auressen, ar íre anelte vanwe, anes maita.

ENGLISH: “How this fragrant oil was not sold for three hundred denarii and the money given to the poor?”
QUENYA: “Manen níşima millo sina úne vácina lenári húmi nelden ar i tyelpe antaina i únain?”

ENGLISH: that heard that said: “Then who can be saved?”
QUENYA: I hlasser ta quenter: “Tá man pole náve rehtaina?”

ENGLISH: And the fifth poured his bowl upon the throne of the beast. And its kingdom was in darkness, and people gnawed their tongue because of the pain,
QUENYA: Ar i lempea ulyane tolporya i mahalmanna i hravanwa. Ar aranierya morniesse né, ar queni ñwarner lammalta i ñwalmanen,

ENGLISH: And while they were at the table, eating, Jesus said: “Truly I say to you: One among you, who is eating with me, will give me over.”
QUENYA: Ar lan anelte ara i sarno, mátala, Yésus quente: “Násie quetin lenna: Qúen mici lé, ye máta óni, ni-antuva olla.”

ENGLISH: And tongues as of fire being distributed appeared to them, and it settled on everyone among them.
QUENYA: Ar lambali ve etsátaina náreva nemner tien, ar hamunes ilquende mici te.

ENGLISH: But if you were raised with the Christ, seek the high things, in which the Christ is sitting by God's right hand.
QUENYA: Mal qui anelde ortaine as i Hristo, á cesta i artar, yassen i Hristo hára ara Eruo forma.

ENGLISH: For since, in God's wisdom, the world by its own wisdom did not know God, it was good in God's eyes that he would save that believe by the foolishness that we make known.
QUENYA: An pan, Eruo sailiesse, i mar véra sailieryanen ua sinte Eru, náne mára Eruo hendusse i rehtumnes i savir i úhandiénen ya carilme sinwa.

ENGLISH: Cause all your affairs to happen in love.
QUENYA: Tyara ilye nattoldar marta melmesse.

ENGLISH: And yet some persons from the order of the Pharisees that believed, arose from their seats and said: “It is necessary to circumcize them and command them to keep the law of Moses.”
QUENYA: Ananta ennoli i herenello i Farisaron i sáver, oronter sondaltallon ar quenter: “Mauya osciritat ar cane tien himya Móseo şanye.”

ENGLISH: And night will be no more, and they will not have need of light of a lamp or light of Sun, for the Lord God shall illuminate them, and they will rule forever and ever.
QUENYA: Ar lóme lá ambe euva, ar ualte samuva maure calava calmo hya calava Anaro, an i Héru Eru te-calyuva, ar turuvalte tennoio ar oi.

ENGLISH: The disciples of John and the Pharisees had a fast. And they came and said to Jesus: “How is that the disciples of John and the Pharisees' disciples have fasts, but your disciples do not have fasts?”
QUENYA: Hildoryar Yoháno ar i Farisar sámer lamate. Ar túlelte ar quenter Yésunna: “Manen ná i hildoryar Yoháno ar i Farisaron hildor samir lamati, mal hildolyar uar same lamati?”

ENGLISH: But anyone who causes the fall of one of these little ones who believe in me, it is better for him if a mill-stone of the kind drawn by an ass is put around his neck, and he is thrown into sea.
QUENYA: Mal aiquen ye tyare i lante queno mici pityar sine i savir nisse, ná arya sen qui mulondo i nostaleo túcina lo pellope ná panyaina os yahtya, ar náse hátina mir ear.

ENGLISH: Or who is the king who will meet another king at war and does not first sit down to make a consideration whether he can with ten thousand warriors fight against who comes against him having twenty thousands?
QUENYA: Hya man ná i aran ye veluva hyana aran ohtasse ar ua minyave hame undu carien úvie qui polis ohtarinen húmi quean mahta yenna tule senna arwa húmi yúquean?

ENGLISH: Therefore they came and made a petition to them , and after they brought them outside, they asked that they would go away from the city.
QUENYA: Etta túlelte ar carner arcande tun, ar apa talleltet ettenna, arcanelte i autumnette i ostollo.

ENGLISH: For though I am away in the flesh, I am still with you in the spirit, having joy and beholding how you are well-organized and true in your faith in Christ.
QUENYA: An ómu nanye oa i hrávesse, nanye en aselde i fairesse, arwa alasseo ar yétala manen nalde partaine ar şande mi savielda Hristosse.

ENGLISH: For God's kingdom is not eating and drinking, but justice and peace and joy by Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: An Eruo aranie ua matie ar sucie, mal failie ar raine ar alasse Aire Feanen.

ENGLISH: Therefore God also made him supreme and gave him the name over all names,
QUENYA: Etta Eru yando carne se arata ar antane sen i esse or ilye essi,

ENGLISH: that fell among the thorns, they are that have heard, but being carried away by the anxieties of this life and by riches and by joys, they are choked and complete nothing.
QUENYA: I lantaner imíca i neceli, té nar i ahlárier, mal nála cóline oa coive sino querelínen ar larnen ar alassínen, nalte quórine ar telyar munta.

ENGLISH: And while they looked up into heaven when he went away, behold! two men in white garments stood by them,
QUENYA: Ar íre yentelte ama mir menel íre oantes, yé! nér atta mi ninqui larmali tarnet ara te,

ENGLISH: In the days of his flesh Jesus sent prayers and petitions to who could save him from death, with strong cries and tears, and he was heard for his awe for God.
QUENYA: Hráveryo auressen Yésus mentane hyamiéli ar arcandeli yenna polle se-rehta et qualmello, polde rambelínen ar nírelínen, ar anes hlárina áyaryanen Eruva.

ENGLISH: Pilate answered: “Surely I am not a Jew? Your own nation and the chief priests turned you over to me. What have you done?”
QUENYA: Piláto hanquente: “Lau inye Yúra ná? Véra nórelya ar i hére airimor arantaner lye inyen. Mana acáriel?”

ENGLISH: After we compelled ourselves to leave them and sailed away, we went straight to Cos, but on the following day to Rhodos, and from there to Patara.
QUENYA: Apa mauyanelme imme hehta te ar cirner oa, lendelme térave Cosenna, mal i hilyala auresse Rolosenna, ar talo Pataranna.

ENGLISH: In answer the governor said to them: “Who among the two do you wish that I am to release to you?” They said: “Barabbas!”
QUENYA: Hanquentasse i nórecáno quente téna: “Man imíca i atta merilde i lehtuvan lenna?” Quentelte: “Varavas!”

ENGLISH: And as soon as they left the synagogue, they went into the house of Simon and Andreas , with Jacob and John.
QUENYA: Ar ve rongo ve hehtanelte i yomencoa, lendelte mir coa Símon ar Andreaswa, as Yácov ar Yoháno.

ENGLISH: For concerning this we praise ourselves: Our conscience witnesses that in a holy manner and sincerely to God, not with wisdom of flesh but by grace, we have behaved in the world – above everything to you.
QUENYA: An pa si laitalmexer: Immotuntielma vetta i mi aire lé ar holmo Erun, lá sailiénen hráveva mal Erulissenen, elengielme i mardesse – or ilqua elden.

ENGLISH: by our God's compassion of mercy, by which a sunrise out of high will come upon us,
QUENYA: Ainolvo ofelmenen oraviéno, yanen anaróre et tarmenello tuluva venna,

ENGLISH: And you will have joy and happiness, and numerous ones will be happy since he has been born,
QUENYA: Ar samuval alasse ar márie, ar rimbali nauvar valime pan anaies nóna,

ENGLISH: On the following day, when they were on their journey and were coming near to the city, Peter went up to the roof around the sixth hour, in order to pray.
QUENYA: I hilyala auresse, íre engelte lendaltasse ar túlaner hare i ostonna, Péter lende ama i tópanna os i enquea lúme, hyamien.

ENGLISH: Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the chief priest.
QUENYA: Tá Annas se-mentane nútina Caiafas i héra airimonna.

ENGLISH: Now evening was near, and was Preparation, that is, the day before the day of rest.
QUENYA: Sí şinye náne hare, ar náne Manwie, ta ná, i ré nó i sendare.

ENGLISH: Not that we are lords of your faith, but we work with you for your joy, for by the faith you stand.
QUENYA: Lá i nalme heruvi savieldo, mal molilme aselde alassedan, an i saviénen tarilde.

ENGLISH: Indeed they were filled with deepest wonder and said: “He has done all things well, and he causes the deaf to hear and the dumb to speak.”
QUENYA: É anelte quátine antumna elmendanen ar quenter: “Acáries ilye nati mai, ar tyaris i hlárelórar hlare ar i úpar quete!”

ENGLISH: Thus from one man, who also was like dead, were born children numerous like the stars of heaven and like the sands on the shore of the sea, uncountable.
QUENYA: Sie erya nerello, ye yando náne ve qualin, náner nóne hínali rimbe ve menelo tinwi ar ve i litsi earo fárasse, únótime.

ENGLISH: if there is anyone beyond suspicion, husband of a single wife, having believing children that are not under suspicion of a wild life or rebellious .
QUENYA: qui ea aiquen napsa pella, erya verio veru, arwa savila hínalion i uar nu napsa verca coiviéno hya amortala.

ENGLISH: And look, a leprous person cane to him and fell down before him, saying: “Lord, if you wish, you can cleanse me!”
QUENYA: Ar yé, halmahlaiwa quén túle senna ar lantane undu epe se, quétala: “Heru, qui meril, polil poita ni!”

ENGLISH: In his humiliation the judgement was taken away from him. About his generation who will tell? For his life has been taken away from earth.”
QUENYA: Nucumieryasse i námie náne mapana oa sello. Pa nónarerya man nyaruva? An coivierya anaie mapana oa cemello.”

ENGLISH: Indeed he said that openly. But Peter led him to a private place and started to speak against him.
QUENYA: É quentes ta pantave. Mal Péter se-tulyane véra nómenna ar yestane quete ana se.

ENGLISH: Also from Jerusalem and Idumea and from beyond Jordan and from the region around Tyre and Sidon a great host came to him, since they heard about all the things that he did.
QUENYA: Yando ho Yerúsalem ar Irúmea ar han Yordanello ar i ménallo os Tír ar Síron hoa liyúme túle senna, pan hlasselte pa ilye i nati yar carnes.

ENGLISH: And he took a child, made it to stand in their midst and put his arms around it and said to them:
QUENYA: Ar nampes hína, tyarne se tare endeltasse ar panyane rancuryat os se ar quente téna:

ENGLISH: They said: “People say: John the Baptist, others: Eliah, others: Jeremiah or one of the Prophets.
QUENYA: Quentelte: “Queneli quetir: Yohannes i Sumbando, exeli: Elía, exeli: Yeremía hya quén i Erutercánoron!”

ENGLISH: But behold! the Lord's angel stood by him, and a light shone in the room. Tapping Peter's body he woke him up, saying: “Rise quickly!” And his chains fell from his hands.
QUENYA: Mal yé! i Heruo vala tarne ara se, ar cala caltane i şambesse. Támala Pétero hroa hé eccoitane se, quétala: “Á orta lintave!” Ar naxeryar lantaner máryalto.

ENGLISH: Now I am speaking to you, the non-Jews: Being what I am, indeed the apostle of the nations, I praise my ministry ,
QUENYA: Sí quétan lenna, i Úyúrar: Nála ya nanye, é i nórion apostel, laitan núromolienya,

ENGLISH: Numerous ones will say to me in that day: 'Lord, Lord, did we not speak as prophets in your name, and throw out demons in your name, and do many mighty deeds in your name?'
QUENYA: Rimbali quetuvar nin enta auresse: 'Heru, Heru, ma ualme quente ve Erutercánor esselyanen, ar et-hanter raucor esselyanen, ar carner rimbe taurie cardali esselyanen?'

ENGLISH: For everyone asking receives, and everyone seeking finds, and to everyone knocking will be opened.
QUENYA: An ilquen arcala came, ar ilquen cestala hire, ar ilquenen tambala nauva latyaina.

ENGLISH: When the Christ, our life, shall be revealed, then you as well will be revealed with him in glory.
QUENYA: Íre i Hristo, coivielva, nauva apantaina, tá yando elde nauvar apantaine óse alcaresse.

ENGLISH: Thus, with power, the Lord's word grew and was made mighty.
QUENYA: Sie, túrenen, i Heruo quetta alle ar náne carna taura.

ENGLISH: These sayings he spoke in the treasury when he taught in the temple. But nobody seized him, since his time still had not come.
QUENYA: Quetier sine quentes i harwesse íre peantanes i cordasse. Mal úquen nampe se, pan lúmerya en úme túlienwa.

ENGLISH: who is that judge them evil? Christ Jesus is who died, or better, he is who was raised from the dead, who is at God's right hand, who also makes petition for us.
QUENYA: man ná ye name te ulce? Hristo Yésus ná ye qualle; hya arya, náse ye náne ortana qualinallon, ye ea Eruo formasse, ye yú arca ven.

ENGLISH: But the women that came with him from Galilee followed and saw the tomb and the place where his body was placed.
QUENYA: Mal i nissi i túler óse et Alileallo hilyaner ar cenner i noire ar i nóme yasse hroarya náne panyaina.

ENGLISH: Jesus answered him: “If I say what is bad, witness about the badness, but if I said what is right, what is the reason that you beat me?”
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente senna: “Qui quetin ya raica ná, á vetta pa i raicie, mal qui quenten ya ná vanima, mana i casta yanen palpal ni?”

ENGLISH: To all that I love I give rebuke and chastisement. Therefore behave sincerely, and find repentance!
QUENYA: Illin i melin inye anta naitie ar paimesta. Etta á lenga holmo, ar hira inwis!

ENGLISH: Indeed who will prepare himself for fighting if the trumplet gives an obscure sound?
QUENYA: É man manwaxe mahtien qui i hyóla anta nulla lamma?

ENGLISH: and from yourselves will arise some men that speak twisted things, to draw away the disicples after themselves.
QUENYA: ar ho elde ortuvar nelli i quetir rícine natali, tucien oa i hildor apa inte.

ENGLISH: But they did not give heed and went off, one to his own field, one to his business;
QUENYA: Mal ualte cimne ar oanter, quén véra restaryanna, quén mancaleryanna;

ENGLISH: We are pressed from every direction, but we are not in a place that narrow that we cannot move; we do not know what we are to do, but we are not wholly without escape;
QUENYA: Nalme nírine ilya tiello, mal ualme nómesse ta náha i ualme pole leve; ualme ista mana caruvalme, mal ualme aqua ú uşweo;

ENGLISH: On the following day, when the huge crowd that had come to the festival heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
QUENYA: I hilyala auresse, íre i haura şanga ya náne túlienwa i aşarenna hlasse i Yésus né túlala Yerusalemenna,

ENGLISH: But is no intermediary where is one alone, but God is one.
QUENYA: Mal ua ea enelmo yasse ea er erinqua, mal Eru ná er.

ENGLISH: And they came again to Jerusalem. Then the chief priests and the scribes and the elders came to him
QUENYA: Ar túlelte ata Yerúsalemenna. Tá i hére airimor ar i parmangolmor ar i amyárar túler senna

ENGLISH: Furthermore, if Satan has arisen against himself and is split, he cannot stand, but is coming to his end.
QUENYA: Ente, qui Sátan ortanie insenna ar şanca ná, uas pole tare, mal túla mettaryanna.

ENGLISH: While I remain with you I have spoken these things to you.
QUENYA: Íre lemyan aselde equétien nati sine len.

ENGLISH: Therefore, if Demetrius and the craftsmen with him have a dispute with anyone, are court days and are proconsuls : Let them bring the disputes that they have, one with the other, to the judges.
QUENYA: Etta, qui Lemetrio ar i tanor óse samir cos as aiquen, ear auri namiéva ar ear nóreturcor: Lava tien tala i costi yar samilte, quén as i exe, i námonnar.

ENGLISH: And when you see wind that blows from South, you say: It will be hot – and so it will be.
QUENYA: Ar íre cenilde şúre ya váva Hyarmello, quetilde: Lauca nauva – ar sie euva.

ENGLISH: But Jesus, who in the same moment perceived by his spirit that they had such thoughts, said to them: “What is your reason for thinking these things in your heart?
QUENYA: Ono Yésus, ye mí imya lú túne faireryanen i sámelte taite sanwi, quente téna: “Mana castalda sanien nati sine endaldasse?

ENGLISH: But they serve as a type and a shadow of the heavenly things, just as Moses, when he was to make the tent, received the divine command. And he says: "Take heed that you do all things according to the image shown to you on the mountain."
QUENYA: Mal té veuyar ve epemma ar leo i meneldie nation, aqua ve Móses, íre carumnes i lancoa, camne i valaina canwa. An quetis: "Cima i caril ilye nati ve i emma tanaina lyen i orontesse."

ENGLISH: But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe in my sayings?
QUENYA: Mal qui ualde save tecieryar, manen savuvalde ninye quetier?”

ENGLISH: But the healed man did not know who he was, for Jesus had gone away, since was a crowd in the place.
QUENYA: Mal i nestaina nér ua sinte man anes, an Yésus náne autienwa, pan enge şanga i nómesse.

ENGLISH: to your piety brotherly affection , to your brotherly affection love.
QUENYA: ainocimieldan hánonilme, hánonilmeldan melme.

ENGLISH: For we have heard about your faith in Christ Jesus and about the love that you have for all the holy ones,
QUENYA: An ahlárielme pa savielda mi Hristo Yésus ar pa i melme ya samilde ilye i airiva,

ENGLISH: But Jesus gave him firm orders, and quickly he sent him away,
QUENYA: Mal Yésus antane sen tulce canwali, ar lintiénen se-mentanes oa,

ENGLISH: to another, faith from the same spirit, to another, gifts of healing by the sole spirit,
QUENYA: exen, savie i imya fairello; exen, annar nestiéva i erya fairenen;

ENGLISH: And another angel went forth from the temple that is in heaven, he too having a sharp sickle.
QUENYA: Ar hyana vala etelende i cordallo ya ea menelde, yú isse arwa aica circo.

ENGLISH: For a woman who has gotten married to a man is bound to her husband while the man is alive, but if her husband dies, the woman is freed from the law of the husband.
QUENYA: An nís ye evérie nerenna ná nútina veruryanna lan i nér coirea ná, mal qui verurya quale, i nís ná lehtana i veruo şanyello.

ENGLISH: do you say to me whom the Father hallowed and sent into the world: You blaspheme, since I said, I am God’s son – ?
QUENYA: ma quetilde ninna ye i Atar airitáne ar mentane mir i mar: Naiquétal, pan quenten: Nanye Eruion – ?”

ENGLISH: And crying with a mighty voice, Jesus said: “Father, into your hands I give over my spirit!” After saying that he expired.
QUENYA: Ar yámala taura ómanen, Yésus quente: “Atar, mir mátyat antan olla fairenya!” Apa quetie ta effirnes.

ENGLISH: the sole Person having immortal life, who dwells in a light that no one can come to, whom no one aming men has seen or can see. To him be the honor and power forever! Amen.
QUENYA: i erya Quén arwa ilfirin coiviéno, ye mare calasse yanna úquen pole tule, ye úquen mici atani ecénie hya pole cene. Sen na i laitie ar túre tennoio! Násie.

ENGLISH: We know that we have passed from death to life, since we love the brothers. who does not love remains in death.
QUENYA: Istalve i oantielve ñurullo coivienna, pan melilve i hánor. Ye ua mele lemya ñurusse.

ENGLISH: Therefore, as God's chosen ones, holy and beloved, cover yourselves with the feelings of sympathy, of goodness, of a lowly mind, of gentleness, of patience.
QUENYA: Etta, ve Eruo cílinar, airi ar melde, topa inde i felmínen ofelmeva, máriéva, nalda sámava, moiciéva, cóleva.

ENGLISH: that God has made it real to us , their children, by resurrecting Jesus, as is also written in the second psalm: You are my son, I begat you today.
QUENYA: in Eru acárie sa nanwa elven, hínaltar, enortavénen Yésus, ve yú técina ná i attea airelíresse: Tyé yondonya ná, ónen tye síra.

ENGLISH: But in answer he said: “I tell you: If these people were silent, the stones would cry !”
QUENYA: Mal hanquentasse quentes: “Nyarin lenna: Qui queni sine náner quilde, i sarni yamumner!”

ENGLISH: Therefore, knowing the fear of the Lord we lead men to our beliefs, but we have been made manifest to God. But we have the hope that we will also be manifest to your conscience.
QUENYA: Etta, istala i rucie i Herullo tulyalme atani savielmannar, mal anaielme cárine úfanwie Erun. Ono samilme i estel i nalme yando úfanwie immotuntieldan.

ENGLISH: Watch yourselves against men, for they will give you over to tribunals and will flay you in their synagogues.
QUENYA: Tira inde atannar, an antauvalte le olla námocombin ar le-riptuvalte yomencoaltassen.

ENGLISH: What follows? Are we to sin, since we are not under law, but under grace? By no means!
QUENYA: Mana hilya? Ma úcaruvalve, pan ualve nu şanye, mal nu Erulisse? Laume!

ENGLISH: Therefore, brothers, we are indeed debtors, but not to the flesh, in order to live by the flesh.
QUENYA: Etta, hánor, é nalve rohtalie, mal lá i hráven, coitien i hrávenen.

ENGLISH: On the road they found a man for Cyrene called Simon. This man they compelled to carry his cross.
QUENYA: Mí malle hirnelte nér ho Ciréne estaina Símon. Nér sina mauyanelte cole tarwerya.

ENGLISH: I ask of you, not that you take them out of the world, but that you protect them from evil.
QUENYA: Arcan tyello, lá i mapatyet et i mardello, mal i varyatyet ulcullo.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, it was necessary for numerous ones to be priests, since death stopped them from remaining,
QUENYA: Ente, mauyane rimbalin náve airimóli, pan qualme pustane te lemiello,

ENGLISH: now to make known, through the congregation, to those that rule and have lordship in heavenly places God's diverse wisdom,
QUENYA: sí carien sinwa, ter i ocombe, in túrar ar samir hére meneldie nómessen Eruo lincantea sailie,

ENGLISH: But I say to the others among you in Thyatira, to all who do not have this teaching and have not known ‘the deep things of Satan’, as they say: I do not put on you other burden.
QUENYA: Mal quetin i exennar mici le Şiatírasse, illinnar i uar same peantave sina ar uar isistie 'i tumne nati Sátano', ve quetilte: Uan panya lesse hyana cólo.

ENGLISH: But seek the greater gifts with a burning spirit! And yet I show you a surpassing way.
QUENYA: Mal á cesta i ambe túre annar uryala şúlenen! Ananta tanan len lahtala tie.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, we send with them our brother, whom we frequently have tested in numerous matters and have found that he shows urgency in his work. He firmly believes that you are trusty, and therefore he works with still greater urgency.
QUENYA: Ente, mentalme aselte hánolma, ye rimbave atyastielme rimbe nattolissen ar ihírier i tanas horme molieryasse. Savis tancave i nalde sarte, ar etta molis en ambe túra hormenen.

ENGLISH: He led him to Jesus. When Jesus saw him he said: “You are Simon son of John. You will be called Cephas” – which means Peter .
QUENYA: Se-tulyanes Yésunna. Íre Yésus se-cenne eques: “Elye ná Símon Yohannion. Elye nauva estaina Céfas” – ya tea Péter .

ENGLISH: Then the disciples returned to their homes.
QUENYA: Tá i hildor nanwenner marittannar.

ENGLISH: But is there anyone that has hardship? Let him pray ! But is there anyone having joy? Let him sing psalms! .
QUENYA: Ma ea aiquen mici le ye same perperie? Nai hyamuvas! Mal ea aiquen arwa alasseo? Nai linduvas airelíri!

ENGLISH: While you go, make known the message, saying: 'The kingdom of heaven has come near.'
QUENYA: Lan lelyalde, á cara sinwa i menta, quétala: 'Menelo aranie utúlie hare.'

ENGLISH: Then which was said through Jeremiah the Prophet was made true: “And they took the thirty silver pieces, the payment for the man that had his worth fixed, for whom the Children of Israel fixed a payment, and they gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord commanded me!”
QUENYA: Tá ya náne quétina ter Yeremia i Erutercáno náne carna nanwa: “Ar nampelte i telpemittar nelequean, i paityale i neren ye sáme valdierya tulcana, yen i Israelindi tulcane paityale, ar antanelte tai i cemnaro restan, ve i Héru canne nin!”

ENGLISH: Thereafter he and his mother and his disciples went down to Capernaum, but he did not remain there for many days.
QUENYA: Epeta sé ar amillerya ar hánoryar ar hildoryar lender undu Capernaumenna, mal ualte lemyane tasse ter rimbe aureli.

ENGLISH: and want the first seats in the synagogues and the most prominent places at the evening meals,
QUENYA: ar merir i minye sondar i yomencoassen ar i amminde nómi i şinyemattissen,

ENGLISH: For anyone who gives you a cup of water to drink because of your being Christ's – truly I say to you, his reward will not be lost to him.
QUENYA: An aiquen ye anta len yulma neno sucien návelyanen Hristova – násie quetin lenna, paityalerya ua nauva vanwa sen.

ENGLISH: On the contrary, he made himself empty and took a thrall's form and was made like a man.
QUENYA: Úsie, carnes inse lusta ar nampe mólo canta ar náne carna ve atani.

ENGLISH: who by faith conquered kingdoms, did justice, received promises, stopped the mouths of lions,
QUENYA: ye saviénen turuner araniéli, carner failie, camner vandali, pustaner raurolion antor,

ENGLISH: since I am hearing about your love and your faith which you have for Jesus Christ and for all the holy ones,
QUENYA: pan hláran pa melmelya ar savielya ya samil Yésus Hristova ar ilye i airiva,

ENGLISH: And when he came into a village, ten skin-diseased men met him, but they stopped far away from him.
QUENYA: Ar íre túles mir masto, helmahlaiwe neri quean veller se, mal pustanelte haire sello.

ENGLISH: And they shall send the glory and honor of the nations into it.
QUENYA: Ar taluvalte i nórion alcar ar laitie minna sa.

ENGLISH: Also when they have twigs, you know to yourselves by examining that now the summer is near.
QUENYA: Yando íre samilte tuimar, istalde inden cendiénen i sí i laire hare ná.

ENGLISH: You denied the holy and just , and you requested that you were to receive a man who was a murderer,
QUENYA: Elde laquenter i aire ar faila, ar arcanelde i camumnelde nér ye náne nahtar,

ENGLISH: Beloved ones, now we are children of God, but still is not revealed what we will be. We know that when he shall be revealed we will be like him, and we shall see him as he is.
QUENYA: Meldar, sí nalve Eruhíni, mal en ua apantaina ya nauvalve. Istalve i íre sé nauva apantaina nauvalve ve sé, an cenuvalves ve náse.

ENGLISH: And he from the inside says in answer: 'Do not trouble me! The door is shut, and my children are with me in the bed; it is not possible for me to rise to give you .'
QUENYA: Ar sé i mityallo quete hanquentasse: 'Ávani tarasta! I fenna ná pahta, ar hínanyar nar asinye i caimasse; ua ece nin orta antien lyen.'

ENGLISH: For you well allow it if a person comes to you and speaks of another Christ – not the same that we made known – or you get a spirit which is not the same that you got formerly, or a gospel which is not the same that you have received.
QUENYA: An lavilde sa mai qui quén tule ar quete pa hyana Hristo – lá i imya ye elme carner sinwa – hya ñetilde faire ya ua i imya ya eñétielde yá, hya evandilyon ya ua i imya ya acámielde.

ENGLISH: and saying: “Lord, my servant lies lame in the house, having terrible pains!”
QUENYA: ar quétala: “Heru, núronya caita lalevíte i coasse, arwa rúcime ñwalmaron!”

ENGLISH: They went to the chief priests and to the elders and said: “We have given an oath that we are not going to eat before we have killed Paul.
QUENYA: Lendelte i hére airimonnar ar i amyárannar ar quenter: “Ánielme vanda i ualme matuva nó anahtielme Paulo.

ENGLISH: and said: “This man has said: 'I can throw down the temple of God and build it up in three days.'”
QUENYA: ar quentet: “Nér sina equétie: 'Polin hate undu i corda Eruva ar carasta sa ama ter auri nelde!'”

ENGLISH: Here the Pharisees came out and started to quarrel with him, seeking from him a sign from heaven, in order to test him.
QUENYA: Sisse i Farisar ettúler ar yestaner costa óse, cestala sello tanwa menello, tyastien se.

ENGLISH: Also the former covenant indeed had laws about service and a santurary which was of this world.
QUENYA: Yando i noa vére é sáme şanyeli pa vevie ar yána ya náne mar sino.

ENGLISH: Then the Pharisees went out, and they were quick to make plans against him with the Herodians, to undo him.
QUENYA: Tá i Farisar lender ettenna, ar anelte linte carien panoli senna as i Heroldili, nancarien se.

ENGLISH: Thus, when I come to you with joy, by God's will I will be renewed with you.
QUENYA: Sie, íre tulin lenna arwa alasseo, Eruo indómenen nauvan envinyanta aselde.

ENGLISH: Some Pharisees came to him, and in order to test him they asked of him if a man may divorce his wife.
QUENYA: Farisáli túler senna, ar tyastien se maquentelte senna qui nér lerta lehta inse veriryallo.

ENGLISH: and that he showed himself to Cephas, then to the twelve.
QUENYA: ar i tannesexe Céfan, tá i yunquen.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when you see the Disgusting Thing of Destruction, of which Daniel the Prophet spoke, standing in a holy place” – let who is reading understand –
QUENYA: Etta, íre cenilde i Faica Nat Nancariéva, pa ya Laniel i Erutercáno carampe, tárala aire nómesse” – lava yen hentea hanya –

ENGLISH: and his garments glittered with a whiteness far beyond which anyone washing clothes on earth can whiten.
QUENYA: ar larmaryar mirilyaner ninquissenen ambela ya aiquen sóvala lanni cemende pole ninquita.

ENGLISH: Thus, then, while her husband is alive, one was going to say that the woman has broken marriage if she gave herself to another man. But if her husband dies, she is free from the law, and she does not break marriage if she gets married to another man.
QUENYA: Sie, tá, lan verurya coirea ná, mo quetumne in i nís arácie vestale qui antanesexe hyana neren. Mal qui verurya quale, náse léra i şanyello, ar uas race vestale qui veryas hyana nerenna.

ENGLISH: In the same manner, was Rahab the harlot not justified by acts, after she received the spies and sent them away by another road?
QUENYA: Mí imya lé, ma Ráhav i imbacinde úne failanta cardalínen, apa camnes i larmor ar mentaner te oa hyana mallenen?

ENGLISH: Our total number on the ship was two hundred and seventy-six.
QUENYA: Quanda nótelma i ciryasse náne enque otoquean ar tuxa atta.

ENGLISH: But this thing I am saying since that is beneficial for you, not to deprive you of liberty, but to cause you to have proper behavior, in which you adhere to the Lord without impediment.
QUENYA: Ono nat sina quétan pan ta aşea len ná, lá avaleryáven le, mal tyarien le same vanima lengie, yasse himyalde i Heru pen taptie.

ENGLISH: For he was summoned by God, to be a chief priest, in the manner of Melchizedek.
QUENYA: An anes tultaina lo Eru, náven héra airimo, mi lérya Melciserec.

ENGLISH: Therefore, do not give the Devil room.
QUENYA: Ente, áva anta i Araucon nóme.

ENGLISH: And with vigour he indicated the mistake of the Jews, showing from the scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.
QUENYA: Ar veassenen tenges i Yúraron loima, tánala i Tehtelellon i Yésus ná i Hristo.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus spoke firmly to it, and the demon came out of him, and the boy was healed from that hour.
QUENYA: Tá Yésus carampe tulcave senna, ar i rauco ettúle sello, ar i seldo náne nestana lúme yanallo.

ENGLISH: And the Pharisees said to him: “Look! How is that your disciples ar doing what is not allowed on the day of rest?”
QUENYA: Ar i Farisar quenter senna: “Ela! Manen ná i hildolyar cárar ya ua lávina i sendaresse?”

ENGLISH: And after the voice came, Jesus was found alone. But they were silent and did not tell anyone in those days about the things that they saw.
QUENYA: Ar apa i óma túle, Yésus náne hírina erinqua. Mal anelte quilde ar uar nyarne aiquenen yane auressen pa i nati yar cennelte.

ENGLISH: And when you stand praying, forgive anything that you have against anyone. Then your Father who is in heaven will also forgive you your crimes.”
QUENYA: Ar íre tarilde hyámala, apsena aiqua ya samilde aiquenna. Tá Atarelda ye ea menelde yando apsenuva len ongweldar.”

ENGLISH: I have the greatest joy because I have found that some of your children walk in the truth, according to the commandent that we received from the Father.
QUENYA: Samin i antúra alasse pan ihírien i queneli hínalyaron vantar i nanwiesse, ve i axan ya camnelve i Atarello.

ENGLISH: For the slumbering ones are slumbering at night, and that fill themselves with wine drink wine at night.
QUENYA: An i lornar nar lorne lómisse, ar i quatir inte limpenen sucir limpe lómisse.

ENGLISH: The star’s name is Wormwood. A third part of the waters became wormwood, and many people died of the water, for it was made bitter.
QUENYA: I tinweo esse Sárálaique ná. Nelesta i nenion olle sáralaique, ar rimbe ennoli qualler i nennen, an anes carna sára.

ENGLISH: making God's kingdom known and teaching about the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness, without anyone stopping him.
QUENYA: carila Eruo aranie sinwa ar peantala pa i Heru Yésus Hristo ilya veriénen, pen aiquen pustala se.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “Take heed and watch out concerning the leaven of the Pharisees and the Sadducees!”
QUENYA: Yésus quente téna: “Cima ar ettira pa i pulmaxe Farisaron ar Sandúcearon!”

ENGLISH: Therefore, since we have such hope, we are very bold,
QUENYA: Etta, pan samilve taite estel, nalve ita canye,

ENGLISH: and was better if they came before you to speak about my crimes, if they have a complaint against me.
QUENYA: ar náne arya qui té túler epe lye quetien pa ongwenyar, qui samilte nur ninna.

ENGLISH: Therefore, if food causes my brother to stumble , I will not ever eat flesh again, to stop myself from causing my brother to stumble.
QUENYA: Etta, qui matta tyare hánonya talta, uan oi matuva hráve ata, pustien imne tyariello hánonya talta.

ENGLISH: And at the second time Joseph revealed himself to his brothers, and Jospeh's kin was made known to Pharaoh.
QUENYA: Ar mí attea lú Yósef apantane inse hánoryain, ar Yósefo nosse náne carna sinwa Fáran.

ENGLISH: Then who seized Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the chief priest, while the scribes and the elders assembled.
QUENYA: Tá i namper Yésus tulyane se oa Caiafas i héra airimonna, íre i parmangolmor ar i amyárar ocomner.

ENGLISH: And when it took the book, the four living creatures and the four twenty elders fell down before the Lamb, every one having a harp and bowls of gold that were full of incense – which is the prayers of the holy ones.
QUENYA: Ar íre nampes i parma, i coiti canta ar i amyárar canta yúquean lantaner undu epe i Eule, ilya quén sámala ñande ar tolpor maltava yar náner quante nisqueo – ya ná i hyamier i airion.

ENGLISH: Now when he was saying these things, a woman out of the crowd raised her voice and said to him: “Happy the womb that bore you and the teats from which you were suckled!”
QUENYA: Sí íre sé náne quétala nati sine, nís et i şangallo ortane ómarya ar quente senna: “Valime i súma ya lye-colle ar i i tyetsu yalto anel tyétina!”

ENGLISH: Martha said to him: “I know that he will rise in the resurrection on the last day.”
QUENYA: Marşa quente senna: “Istan i ortuvas i enortalesse i métima auresse.”

ENGLISH: And Jesus said to them: “Surely the friends of the bridegroom cannot have a fast while the bridegroom is with them? In the whole time when they have the bridegroom in their midst they cannot have a fast.
QUENYA: Ar Yésus quente téna: “Lau i endero meldor polir same lamate lan i ender ea aselte? Mí quanda lúme yasse samilte i ender endaltasse ualte pole same lamate.

ENGLISH: She said: “Nobody, lord.” Jesus said: “Also I do not judge you. Go; from now do not sin more.”
QUENYA: Eques: “Úquen, heru.” Yésus quente: “Yando inye ua name lye. Mena; ho sí áva úcare ambe.”

ENGLISH: for in a single hour riches so great were destroyed!’
QUENYA: an erya lúmesse lar ta túra nancarna né!’

ENGLISH: But the Scripture, foreseeing that God by faith was going to justify people from the nations, made the gospel known beforehand to Abraham: “By you all the nations will be blessed.”
QUENYA: Mal i Tehtele, apacénala i Eru saviénen failatumne queneli i nórion, carne i evandilyon sinwa nóvo Avrahámen: “Elyenen ilye i nóri nauvar aistane.”

ENGLISH: And after the angels went away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to the other: ”Let us go to Bethlehem to see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.”
QUENYA: Ar apa i vali oanter tello mir menel, i mavari quenter quén i exenna: ”Alve lelya Vet-Lehemenna cenien nat sina ya amartie, ya i Héru acárie sinwa ven.”

ENGLISH: By faith the walls of Jericho fell after they were encircled for seven days.
QUENYA: Saviénen Yerico rambar lantaner apa anelte péline ter auri otso.

ENGLISH: He has helped Israel his servant, to recall mercy,
QUENYA: Amánies Israel núroryan, enyalien oravie,

ENGLISH: But two other men, evildoers, were also led thither to be slain with him.
QUENYA: Mal hyana nér atta, ulcarindor, nánet yando tulyaine tar náven nance óse.

ENGLISH: After their perception of good and evil faded, they gave themselves to loose conduct, to working every kind of uncleanness in greed.
QUENYA: Apa tuntierya máriéva ar ulcuva firne, antaneltexer lehta lengien, molien ilya nostaleo úpoicie milciesse.

ENGLISH: And while he blessed them, he was taken away from them and carried up into heaven.
QUENYA: Ar íre aistanes te, anes mapaina oa tello ar cólina ama mir menel.

ENGLISH: But he answered them: “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
QUENYA: Mal hanquentes ten: “Man nar amillinya ar hánonyar?”

ENGLISH: But he made a gesture to them with his hand, for them to be silent, and he told them everything about how the Lord led him out of gaol, and he said: “Tell these things to Jacob and to the brothers.” Then he went outside and went to another place.
QUENYA: Mal carnes tien hwerme máryanen, náveltan quilde, ar nyarnes tien ilqua pa manen i Heru se-tulyane et mandollo, ar eques: “Nyara nati sine Yácoven ar i hánoin.” Tá mennes ettenna ar lende hyana nómenna.

ENGLISH: Happy are you when people abuse you and persecute you and lying say every evil about you, by reason of me.
QUENYA: Valime nalde íre queni le-naityar ar le-roitar ar húrala quetir ilya ulco pa le, castanyanen.

ENGLISH: You slaves, be obedient to that are your lords in the flesh, in fear and in trembling, out of a whole heart, like to the Christ
QUENYA: A móli, na canwacimye in nar heruldar i hrávesse, mí rucie yo palie, et quanda endallo, ve i Hriston

ENGLISH: Furthermore, have mercy on the people the faith of whom is unsteady;
QUENYA: Ente, alde órava i quenissen ion savie ná iltanca;

ENGLISH: do not cease to give thanks concering you when I recall you in my prayers,
QUENYA: ua pusta anta hantale pa le íre enyalin le hyamienyassen,

ENGLISH: This I find that exists this law: When I wish to do what is proper, evil lies near to me.
QUENYA: Sie hirin in ea şanye sina: Íre merin care ya vanima ná, ulco caita hare ninna.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he said to them: “Cleverly you put away God's commandment, in order to keep your own custom.
QUENYA: Ente, quentes téna: “Fincave panyalde oa Eruo axan, himien véra situlda.

ENGLISH: and petitioned him with urgency, saying: “My little daughter is at life's brink ! Come and put your hands on her, for her to be saved and keep her life!”
QUENYA: ar arcane se hormenen, quétala: “Cinta selyenya ná coivie-lancasse! Tula ar á panya mályat sesse, náveryan rehtaina ar hepe coivierya!”

ENGLISH: saying: “Lord, we have recalled which this man of lies said when he was still alive: 'After three days I shall be raised again.'
QUENYA: quétala: “Heru, enayálielme ya tana nér huruiva quente íre en anes coirea: 'Apa auri nelde nauvan enortana.'

ENGLISH: with Annas the chief priest and Caiaphas and John and Alexander and all that were of the kin of the chief priest.
QUENYA: as Annas i héra airimo ar Caiafas ar Yoháno ar Alexander ar illi i náner i nosseo i héra airimo.

ENGLISH: Among them are Hymenaeus and Alexander, and I have given them into Satan's power, for them to learn by chastisement that they are not to blaspheme.
QUENYA: Mici té nar Himenaio ar Alexander, ar ánien tu mir Sátano túre, pariettan paimestanen i ávatte naiquete.

ENGLISH: for who heeds the flesh is hostile to God, for the flesh does not bow to God's law; indeed that is not possible for it.
QUENYA: an ye cime i hráve ná cotya Erun, an i hráve ua luhta Eruo şanyen; é ta ua ece san.

ENGLISH: I am writing to you, fathers, because you know who is from the beginning. I am writing to you, youths, because you are strong and God’s word remains in you, and you have conquered the Wicked One.
QUENYA: Técan lenna, atari, pan istalde ye ea i yestallo. Técan lenna, nessar, pan nalde polde ar Eruo quetta lemya lesse, ar orutúrielde i Olca.

ENGLISH: Therefore everyone that confesses me before men, I as well will confess before my father who is in heaven;
QUENYA: Etta ilquen ye etequeta ni epe atani, yú inye etequetuva epe Atarinya ye ea menelde;

ENGLISH: It wields the entire authority of the first beast before its eyes. It causes earth and who dwell in it to worship the first beast, whose death-wound was healed.
QUENYA: Mahtas i quanda hére i minya hravano epe henduryat. Tyaris cemen ar i marir sasse tyere i minya hravan, yeo qualmeharwe náne nestana.

ENGLISH: Simon Peter said to him: “Lord, where are you going away to?” Jesus answered: “Where I am going away you cannot follow me now, but you will follow after.”
QUENYA: Símon Péter quente senna: “Heru, manna auteal?” Yésus hanquente: “Yanna autean ual pole hilya ni sí, mal hilyuval apa.”

ENGLISH: for you to recall the sayings beforehand spoken by the holy prophets and the commandment of the Lord and Savior through the apostles sent to you.
QUENYA: enyalieldan i quetier nóvo quétine lo i airi Erutercánor ar i axan i Heruo ar Rehto ter i aposteli mentaine lenna.

ENGLISH: Give a part to the holy ones, as their needs are. Follow the love for strangers!
QUENYA: Á anta ranta i airin, ve maureltar nar. Á hilya i melme etteleaiva!

ENGLISH: But Herodias had a hatred for John and wanted to kill him, but could not.
QUENYA: Mal Herolias sáme tevie Yohánova ar merne nahta se, mal ua polde.

ENGLISH: Now if anyone builds on this foundation – with gold, with silver, with jewels, with wood, with grass, with hay –
QUENYA: Sí qui aiquen carasta to talma sina – maltanen, telpenen, mírinen, toanen, salquenen, şaranen –

ENGLISH: And Joseph took the body and wrapped it in pure linen,
QUENYA: Ar Yósef nampe i hroa ar sa-vaitanes poica páşenen,

ENGLISH: Thus, after he said these things, he went in front of them towards Jerusalem.
QUENYA: Sie, apa quentes nati sine, lendes opo te Yerúsalemenna.

ENGLISH: After he used everything, was a severe famine in that land, and he began to have need.
QUENYA: Apa yuhtanes ilqua enge urda saicele nóre tanasse, ar yestanes same maure.

ENGLISH: But I say to you that everyone who looks at a woman longing for her, has even then broken marriage with her in his heart.
QUENYA: Mal inye quete lenna in ilquen ye yéta nís milyala se, yando tá arácie vestale óse endaryasse.

ENGLISH: For he looks at himself, but in the moment that he goes away, his appearance slips from his memory.
QUENYA: An yétas inse, mal mí lú ya autas, ilcerya talta réneryallo.

ENGLISH: and he has seen in a vision a man called Ananias come in and put his hands on him, for him to see again.”
QUENYA: ar ecénies mi maur nér estaina Ananías túla minna ar panyea máryat sesse, cenieryan ata.”

ENGLISH: Now Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues on the day of rest.
QUENYA: Sí Yésus náne peantala mi er i yomencoaron i sendaresse.

ENGLISH: Then he commanded the crowds that they were to lie down upon the grass, and he took the five breads and two fishes, and looking up towards heaven he spoke a blessing. And after breaking the breads he distributed them to the disciples, and the disciples to the crowds.
QUENYA: Tá cannes i şangar i caitumnelte undu i salquenna, ar nampes i massar lempe ar lingwe atta, ar yétala ama menelenna quentes aistie. Ar apa racie i massar etsanteset i hildoin, ar i hildor i şangain.

ENGLISH: And they came into Jericho. But while he and his disciples and a great crowd were on their way out of Jericho, Bartimaeus the son of Timaeus, a bind beggar, sat by the road.
QUENYA: Ar túlelte mir Yerico. Mal lan sé ar hildoryar ar hoa şanga náner tieltasse et Yericollo, Vartiméo yondorya Timéo, lomba iquindo, hamne ara i malle.

ENGLISH: When the other ten heard about this, they began to be angry with James and John.
QUENYA: Íre i hyane quean hlasser pa si, yestanelte náve rúşie Yácovenna ar Yohánonna.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, in your own Law is written: The witness of two men is true.
QUENYA: Ente, véra Şanyeldasse ná técina: Atan atto vettie nanwa ná.

ENGLISH: Woe to the pregnant women and to those that suckle babies in those days! For shall come a great need on the land and wrath upon this people,
QUENYA: Horro in lapsarwe nissin ar in tyetir vinimor ente auressen! An tuluva túra maure i nóresse ar orme lie sinanna,

ENGLISH: as having grief, but ever full of joy, as poor, but making numerous ones rich, as if we have nothing and yet have everything.
QUENYA: ve arwe nyéreo, mal oi quante alasseo, ve penye, mal cárala rimbali lárie, ve qui samilme munta ananta samir ilqua.

ENGLISH: and he said to them: “What is your reason for being asleep? Rise and pray, to stop yourselves from coming into temptation!”

QUENYA: Aşarello aşarenna náne haime i nórecánova lehtie i şangan quén i mandollo, i nér ye mernelte.

ENGLISH: And taking the child's hand he said to her: Talitha cumi!, which means: “Maiden, I am saying to you, rise!”
QUENYA: Ar mápala i hino má quentes senna: “Talişa cumi!”, ya tea: “Vende, quétan tyenna, á orta!”

QUENYA: Mal olce atani ar hurumor menuvar mir oi ambe tumna ulco, tyarila exi ranya ar tyáraine ranya.

QUENYA: Tá rimbali caramper tulcave senna náveryan quilda, mal i ambe yámes: “Lavirion, órava nisse!”

QUENYA: Íre hamnes Orontesse Milloaldaron, i hildor túler senna íre anelte erinque, quétala: “Nyara men: Mana i lúme yasse nati sine martuvar, ar mana nauva i tanwa entulesselyo ar i tyeldo i rando?”

ENGLISH: If you love me, you will remain in my commandments,
QUENYA: Qui melilden, himyuvalde axaninyar,

ENGLISH: For he is our peace, he who made both one and undid the middle wall between them . The hostile state by his flesh
QUENYA: An sé rainelva ná, sé ye carne yúyo er ar nancarne i enya ramba imbe tu. I cotya sóma hráveryanen

ENGLISH: Therefore I urge you by God's compassion, brothers, that you will give your bodies as a living, holy sacrifice, pleasing to God: a service with your understanding,
