ENGLISH: And they sing the song of Moses, God’s servant, and the song of the Lamb, saying: “Great and wonderful are your works , Lord God, the Almighty. Just and true are your ways, King of nations.
QUENYA: Ar lindalte i líre Móseo, Eruo núro, ar i líre i Euleo, quétala: “Túre ar elmendie nar cardalyar, Héru Eru, i Iluvala. Faile ar şande nar tielyar, Aran nórion.

ENGLISH: After God raised his Son, to you he first sent him to bless you, by turning everyone away from your wicked deeds.”
QUENYA: Apa Eru ortane Yondorya, eldenna minyave se-mentanes aistien le, queriénen ilquen oa olce cardaldallon.”

ENGLISH: And how will they make it known if they are not sent? As is written: “How beautiful are the feel of that bring good news about good things!”
QUENYA: Ar manen caruvaltes sinwa qui ualte mentane? Ve ná técina: “Manen vanime nát i talu ion talar máre sinyar mánaron!”

ENGLISH: For this goal we are indeed always praying for you, praying that our God will count you worthy of his calling and will complete everything that he wants – goodness and deeds of faith – in power,
QUENYA: Tana mehten é hyámalme len illume, arcala i Ainolva notuva le valde yalieryo ar telyuva ilqua ya meris – márie ar cardar saviéno – túresse,

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus said: “When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am he, and that I do nothing by myself , but as the Father taught me I speak these things.
QUENYA: Etta Yésus quente: “Íre ortanielde i Atanyondo, tá istuvalde i ní ná sé, ar i carin munta immonen, mal tambe i Atar peantane nin quetin nati sine.

ENGLISH: For where your treasure is, there also your heart will be.
QUENYA: An yasse harmalda ea, tasse yando endalda euva.

ENGLISH: But who indeed does what is true comes to the light, that will be manifest that his deeds are done in God.”
QUENYA: Mal ye é care ya ná nanwa tule i calanna, i nauva apantaina i cardaryar nar cárine Erusse.”

ENGLISH: But having flayed Jesus he gave him over to be crucified.
QUENYA: Mal riptiéla Yésus se-antanes olla náven tarwestaina.

ENGLISH: But Herod, when he saw Jesus, had great joy, for beforehand he long wished to meet him, after hearing about him, and he had the hope that he was going to see a sign happen by him.
QUENYA: Mal Herol, íre cennes Yésus, sáme túra alasse, an nóvo andave mernes velitas, apa hlarie pa se, ar sámes i estel i cenumnes tanwa martea sénen.

ENGLISH: But while we remained there for a number of days, a prophet whose name was Agabus came down from Judea, and he came to us and took the belt of Paul. He bound his own feet and hands and said: “Thus says the Holy Spirit: The man who owns this belt the Jews in Jerusalem will bind, and they will give him over to non-Jews.”
QUENYA: Mal lan lemnelme tasse ter nóte aurion, Erutercáno yeo esse náne Ahavo túle undu Yúreallo, ar túles menna ar nampe i quilta Paulova. Nuntes vére talyat ar máryat ar quente: “Sin quete i Aire Fea: I nér ye harya quilta sina i Yúrar Yerúsalemesse nutuvar, ar antauvaltes olla Úyúrain.”

ENGLISH: He answered and said to them: “What did Moses command you?”
QUENYA: Hanquentes ar eque téna: “Mana Móses canne len?”

ENGLISH: I have many things to write to you, but I do not want to do so with paper and ink. But I have the hope that I will come to you and speak with you face to face, that your joy will be perfect.
QUENYA: Samin rimbe natali tecien lenna, mal uan mere care sie hyalinnen ar móronen. Ono samin i estel i tuluvan lenna ar quetuva aselde cendelello cendelenna, i alasselda nauva ilvana.

ENGLISH: The appearance of who is sitting there is like jasper and carneol, and around the throne there is a rainbow, like an emerald in appearance.
QUENYA: Ilce yeo hára tasse ná ve nambíre ar culmíre, ar os i mahalma ea helyanwe, ve laimaril ilcesse.

ENGLISH: The number of the riders in their army was twenty thousands times ten thousand; I heard their number.
QUENYA: I nóte i roquenion hosseltasse náne húmi yúquean lúr húmi quean; hlassen nótelta.

ENGLISH: When he came to the house he did not allow anyone to go inside, except Peter and John and Jacob and the maiden's father and mother.
QUENYA: Íre túles i coanna uas láve aiquenen lelya minna, hequa Péteren ar Yohánon ar Yácoven ar i vendeo ataren yo amillen.

ENGLISH: And if this comes to the ears of the governor, we shall speak to him, and you do not be afraid!”
QUENYA: Ar qui si tule i nórecáno hlarunnar, elme quetuvar senna, ar elde áva ruce!”

ENGLISH: Jesus said: “Truly I say to you: is no one who has abandoned house or brothers or sisters or mother or father or fields for my good or for the good of the gospel,
QUENYA: Eque Yésus: “Násie quetin lenna: Ea úquen ye ehehtie coa hya hánor hya amil hya néşar hya atar hya híni hya restar márienyan ar márien i evandilyono,

ENGLISH: and the third got married to her, in the same manner all the seven without a child to follow them, and they died.
QUENYA: ar i neldea veryaner senna, mí imya lé ilye i otso ú híno hilien te, ar quallelte.

ENGLISH: Therefore the Jews surrounded him and said to him: “How long will you keep us in uncertainty? If you are the Christ, tell us openly!”
QUENYA: Etta i Yúrar peller se ar quenter senna: “Manen andave me-hepuval útanciesse? Qui elye ná i Hristo, ámen nyare pantie!”

ENGLISH: Indeed how is beneficial to a man if he obtains the whole world, but his own person is lost or destroyed to him?
QUENYA: É manen ná aşea atanen qui ñetis i quanda mar, mal véra quenerya ná sen vanwa hya nancarna?

ENGLISH: They went up over the broad earth and surrounded the camp of the holy ones and the beloved city. But fire came down from heaven and consumed them.
QUENYA: Lendelte ama olla i palla cemen ar pelder i estolie i airíva ar i melda osto. Mal nár túle undu menello ar te-ammante.

ENGLISH: But Jesus called them to himself and said: “You know the rulers of the nations rule them, and their mighty ones have power over them.
QUENYA: Mal Yésus yalde te insenna ar quente: “Istalde i nórion turi turir tai, ar tauraltar samir túre or te.

ENGLISH: But so you have not learnt about the Christ,
QUENYA: Mal sie elde uar apárie pa i Hristo,

ENGLISH: We are obliged to always give God thanks concerning you, brothers, as is proper; for your faith is growing extremely quickly, and among you everyone's love of the others is ever more great.
QUENYA: Nalme naute illume anta Erun hantale pa lé, hánor, ve vanima ná; an savielda ála ita lintave, ar mici lé ilqueno melme i exiva oi ambe túra ná.

ENGLISH: “Behold! the maiden will be with child and will bear a son, and they will give him the name Immanuel” – which means “With us God.”
QUENYA: “Yé! i vende nauva as hína ar coluva yondo, ar antauvalte sen i esse Immanuel” – ya tea “Aselve Eru”.

ENGLISH: Then some among Pharisees answered him: “Teacher, we wish to see a sign from you!”
QUENYA: Tá queneli mici Farisar hanquenter senna: “Peantar, merilme cene tanwa lyello!”

ENGLISH: Behold the kind of love that the Father has given us, that we were going to be called children of God, and that we are. Therefore the world does not know us, since it has not known him.
QUENYA: Yé i nostale melmeo ya i Atar ánie ven, i umnelve estaine Eruhíni, ar ta nalve. Etta i mar ua ista ve, pan sé uas isintie.

ENGLISH: There was a man of the Pharisees; his name was Nicodemus, a ruler of Jews.

ENGLISH: If we say that we do not sin, we make him a liar, and his word is not in us.

ENGLISH: He said: “He does.” But when he went into the house, before he could speak, Jesus said: “What do you think, Simon? From whom do the kings of earth receive tax or tribute? From their sons or from foreigners?”
QUENYA: Quentes: “Caris.” Mal íre lendes mir i coa, nó polles quete, Yésus quente: “Mana sanal, Símon? Ho man cemeno arani camir tungwe hya rantie? Yondoltallon hya etteleallon?”

ENGLISH: After that happened, the other people on the island that had illnesses also came to him and were healed.

QUENYA: Ar óma túle senna: “Á orta, Péter, á nahta ar á mate!”

ENGLISH: And he spoke and said: “May nobody ever eat fruit from you again!” And his disciples heard it.
QUENYA: Ar carampes ar quente senna: “Nai úquen oi matuva yáve lyello ata!” Ar hildoryar hlasser sa.

ENGLISH: For it is necessary that nobody can speak evil about an overseer as God's steward. It is necessary that he is not a person who pleases himself, not quick to anger or given to wine or one who beats or is greedy for unjust gain,
QUENYA: An mauya in úquen pole quete ulco pa ortirmo ve Eruo mardil. Mauya in uas quén ye fasta inse, lá linta rúşenna hya antaina limpen hya quén ye palpa hya ná milca úfaila ñétien,

QUENYA: Etta i hosseturco túle senna ar maquente: “Ánin nyare, ma nalye Rómea?” Eques: “Nanye.”

ENGLISH: or by earth, for it is the support for his feet, or by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the mighty king.

QUENYA: Ar enge tasse nér yeo esse náne Saccaio, ar anes héra tungwemo ar lárea.

ENGLISH: But when you go into a house, remain there and go away from there.

QUENYA: ar Mattéo ar Şomas ar Yácov yondorya Alfaio, ar Símon ye ná estaina i Selot,

QUENYA: Sí nai i Aino raineva, ye talle ama qualinillon i túra mavar mámaron arwa i serceo oira véreo, Yésus Herulva,

ENGLISH: Give back to her as she gave back, and do to her double of that she has done! Into the cup into which she poured , pour a double measure for her!
QUENYA: Ásen nan-anta tambe ve sé nan-antane, ar cara sen atwa yaron isse acárie! Mir i yulma yanna ulyanes, á ulya atwa lesta issen!

ENGLISH: Again they cried: “Crucify him!”
QUENYA: Ata yámelte: “Áse tarwesta!”

ENGLISH: What is your reason for judging that one cannot believe that God rises dead?
QUENYA: Mana castalda namien i mo ua pole save in Eru orta qualinar?

QUENYA: Ono quentes téna: “I nórion arani nar herultar, ar i samir túre or te nar estaine maicarindor.

ENGLISH: to open their eyes , in order to turn them from darkness to light and from Satan's power to God, for them to receive forgiveness of sins and a part as heirs among who are hallowed by believing in me.'
QUENYA: pantien hendultat, te-querien morniello calanna ar Sátano túrello Erunna, camieltan apsenie úcariva ar ranta ve aryoni imíca i nar airinte saviénen nisse.'

ENGLISH: The Christ traded us to himself out of the curse of the Law by being made a curse in our place, for is written: “Cursed is everyone hanging on a cross.”
QUENYA: Hristo vi-mancane insen et i hútiello i Şanyeo návenen carna hútie nómelvasse, an ná técina: “Húna ná ilquen lingala tarwesse.”

ENGLISH: And Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said: “How is that you are thinking wicked things in your heart?
QUENYA: Ar Yésus, istala sanweltar, quente: “Manen ná i sánealde olce natali endaldasse?

ENGLISH: Hearing that, one among who lay at the table said: “Happy is who eats bread in God's kingdom!”
QUENYA: Hlárala ta, quén mici i cainer ara i sarno quente: “Valima ná ye mate massa mi Eruo aranie!”

ENGLISH: Again the kingdom of heaven is like a net, thrown into the sea and gathering fishes of every kind.
QUENYA: Ata menelo aranie ná ve rembe, hátina mir i ear ar comyala lingwili ilya nostaleo.

ENGLISH: His parents said these things because they feared the Jews, for already the Jews had come to an agreement that if anyone confessed Jesus as Christ, he was to be excluded from the synagogue.
QUENYA: Nostaryat quentet nati sine pan runcette i Yúrallon, an nollo i Yúrar náner túlienwe essámalenna i qui aiquen etequentane Yésus ve Hristo, umnes hehtaina i yomencoallo.

ENGLISH: And her parents were beside themselves; but he instructed them that they were not to tell anyone about which had happened.
QUENYA: Ar nostaryat nánet ara intu; mal peantanes tún i ávatte nyare aiquenen pa ya náne martienwa.

ENGLISH: who died for us. Thus, living ones or dead ones, we shall live with him.
QUENYA: ye qualle ven. Sie, coirear hya qualinar, coituvalve óse.

ENGLISH: To Greeks and to Barbarians alike, to wise ones and to fools I am a debtor.

ENGLISH: When they saw him, they made known the things that were said to them about this child.

ENGLISH: But arose some men from the synagogue called of Freed Ones, and some people that came from Cyrene and Alexandria, to quarrel with Stephen.
QUENYA: Mal oronter nelli i yomencoallo estaina Leryainaiva, ar ennoli i túler Cireneallo ar Alexandriallo, costien as Stefáno.

ENGLISH: The God and Father of Jesus Christ our Lord, indeed who shall be blessed forever, knows that I am not lying.
QUENYA: Yésus Hristo Herulvo Aino ar Atar, é ye nauva laitana tennoio, ista i uan húra.

ENGLISH: I am not writing these things to humiliate you, but to show to you what is right, as my beloved children.
QUENYA: Uan téca nati sine nucumien le, mal tanáven len ya vanima ná, ve melde hínanyar.

ENGLISH: Take heed of yourselves! If your brother sins, rebuke him, and if he has a change of mind, forgive him.
QUENYA: Cima inde! Qui hánolya úcare, áse naitya, ar qui samis inwis, ásen apsene.

ENGLISH: But after I shall be raised I will go before you to Galilee.”
QUENYA: Mal apa nauvan ortaina lelyuvan epe le Alileanna.”

ENGLISH: On the first day of the week, when we were assembled to break bread, Paul talked to them, since he was going away on the following day, and he was speaking until the middle of the night.
QUENYA: I minya auresse i otsolo, íre anelme ocómienwe racien massa, Paulo carampe téna, pan autumnes i hilyala auresse, ar quétanes tenna ende i lómio.

ENGLISH: And the Pharisees and Sadducees came to him, and to test him they asked of him that he would show them a sign from heaven.
QUENYA: Ar i Farisar ar Sandúcear túler senna, ar tyastien se arcanelte sello i tanumnes tien tanwa menello.

ENGLISH: and Jesus walked in the temple, in Solomon’s columnade.
QUENYA: ar Yésus vantane i cordasse, Solomondo otarmiesse.

ENGLISH: This happened a third time, and then the vessel was taken into heaven.
QUENYA: Si martane neldea lú, ar tá i vene náne mapana mir menel.

ENGLISH: After three months we sailed away on a ship that came from Alexandria. It had remained through the winter on the island, and it had the Twins as the figurehead .
QUENYA: Apa astar nelde cirnelme oa ciryasse ya túle Alexandriallo. Termarnelyanes ter i hríve i tollasse, ar sámes i Onóni ve i langoemma.

ENGLISH: I do not speak of you all; I know that I have chosen. But it happens to fulfill the scripture: who ate my bread has turned his back on me.
QUENYA: Uan quete pa le illi; istan i icílien. Mal martas amaquatien i tehtele: Ye mante massanya equérie ponterya ninna.

ENGLISH: I am the door; anyone who comes in through me will be saved, and he will go in and out and will find pasturage.
QUENYA: Inye ná i fenna; aiquen ye tule minna ter ní nauva rehtaina, ar menuvas minna ar etsenna ar hiruva nessele.

ENGLISH: But you are that have remained with me in my trials,
QUENYA: Mal elde nar i elémier asinye tyastienyassen,

ENGLISH: People will exclude you from the synagogue. Indeed the hour is coming when everyone killing you will believe that so he serves God.
QUENYA: Queni le-hehtuvar et i yomencoallo. É i lúme túla yasse ilquen le-nahtala savuva i sie veuyas Eru.

ENGLISH: From afar he saw a fig tree with leaves, and he went to see if maybe he would find some figs on it. But when he came to it, he found nothing except leaves, for that was not the time of figs.
QUENYA: Hairallo cennes relyávalda arwa lasselion, ar lendes cenien qui cé hirumnes relyáveli sesse. Mal íre túles senna, hirnes munta hequa lasseli, an ta úne i lúme relyávion.

ENGLISH: Here is need for intelligence with wisdom: The seven heads are seven mountains, and on them the woman is sitting.
QUENYA: Sís ea maure handaléva arwa sailiéno: I cari otso nar oronti otso, ar tais i nís hára.

ENGLISH: Thus we will not be babes more, thrown up and down by waves and carried hither and thither by every wind of teaching, by the tricks of men, by the cunning in inventing error.

ENGLISH: to who has a ministry it is necessary to work as a servant, for the teacher it is necessary to teach,
QUENYA: yen same núromolie mauya mole ve núro, i peantaren mauya peanta,

ENGLISH: Therefore they made a calf in those days and brought a sacrifice to the idol, and they had joy by the work of their hands.
QUENYA: Etta carnelte mundolle yane auressen ar taller yanca i cordonen, ar sámelte alasse máltato tamannen.

ENGLISH: When I was a babe, I spoke as a babe, I thought like a babe, I judged like a babe; but now that I am a man, I have put away the things of the babe.
QUENYA: Íre anen lapse, quenten ve lapse, sannen ve lapse, namnen ve lapse; mal sí íre nanye veo, apánien oa i lapseo nati.

ENGLISH: Then the steward saod to himself: 'What am I to do, now when my lord is wishing to take away my work as steward? My strength does not suffice for digging. I shall be humiliated if it is necessary for me to beg.
QUENYA: Tá i mardil quente insenna: 'Mana caruvan, sí íre herunya méra mapa oa molienya ve mardil? Poldorenya ua farya sapien. Nauvan nucumna qui mauya nin ique.

ENGLISH: Therefore he cried and said: 'Father Abraham, have mercy on me and send Lazarus, for him to put the tip of his finger in water, to make my tongue cold! For I am tormented in this fire!”
QUENYA: Etta yámes ar quente: 'Atar Avraham, órava nisse ar á menta Lásaro, panieryan leperyo tille nenesse, carien lambanya ringa! An nanye ñwalyaina náre sinasse!”

ENGLISH: And in answer the people said: “Let his blood come upon us and upon our children!”
QUENYA: Ar hanquentasse i lie quente: “Nai sercerya tuluva menna ar hínalmannar!”

ENGLISH: When the man stuck to Peter and John, the entire people, being startled, ran together to them in the place called the Columnade of Solomon.
QUENYA: Íre i nér himyane Péter ar Yoháno, i quanda lie, nála captaine, norner uo téna i nómesse estaina i Tarmatéma Solomondo.

ENGLISH: If I still made men happy, I were not Christ's slave.
QUENYA: Qui en carnen atani valime, únen Hristo mól.

ENGLISH: Thus, who plants and who pours are both nothing; God is that gives growth.
QUENYA: Sie, ye empane ar ye ulya nar yúyo munta; Eru ná ye anta alie.

ENGLISH: Therefore let us not judge one another, but sooner make this your judgement: do not put thing before a brother that causes him to slip or fall.
QUENYA: Etta ávalve name quén i exe, mal ambe ron cara si namielda: áva panya nat epe háno ya tyare se talta hya lanta.

ENGLISH: Then Herod, seeing that he was made a fool by the star-gazers, was filled with great rage, and he sent soldiers to kill all boys in Bethlehem and in all the regions surrounding it, from two years and under that, according to the time of which he had received knowledge from the star-gazers.
QUENYA: Tá Herol, cénala i anes carna auco lo i elentirmor, náne quátina túra ahanen, ar mentanes ohtalli nehtien ilye seldor Vet-Lehemesse ar ilye i ménassen pelila sa, ho loa atta ar nu ta, ve i lúme pa ya camnelyanes istya i elentirmollon.

ENGLISH: And when they have completed their witnessing, the beast that rises from the abyss will make war upon them , and it will conquer them and slay them.
QUENYA: Ar íre etelyaniette vettietta, i hravan ye orya i undumello ohtacaruva túna, ar turúvas tu ar nahtuva tu.

ENGLISH: Also Simon believed, and after being baptized he remained with Philip and was being filled with wonder when he watched the sings and mighy deeds that happened.
QUENYA: Yú Símon sáve, ar apa náve sumbana lemnes as Filip ar náne quátaina elmendanen íre tirnes i tanwar ar taure cardar yar martaner.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, when you go into a city and they receive you, eat the things put before you,
QUENYA: Ente, íre menilde mir osto ar camilde le, mata i nati panyaine epe le,

ENGLISH: But the sitting down at my right or at my left is not for me to give, but it is for the people to whom it has been reserved.”
QUENYA: Ono i harie undu foryanyasse hya hyaryanyasse ua nin antien, mal nas i quenin in anaies sátina.”

ENGLISH: By it we bless the Lord and Father, and yet by it we also curse men that are created in God's image.
QUENYA: Sánen aistalve i Héru ar Atar, ananta sánen yando hútalve atani i nar ontaine Eruo emmasse.

ENGLISH: By no means! But may God be found faithful, though every man will be found a liar, for is written: “In order to show that you will be made just by your words and you will have victory when you are judged.”
QUENYA: Laume! Mal nai Eru nauva hírina voronwa, ómu ilya atan nauva hírina hurindo, an ná técina: “Tanien i nauval carna faila quettalyainen ar samuval apaire íre nalye námina.”

ENGLISH: I say again: Let nobody think that I am a fool! But if you indeed think so, receive me also as if I am a fool, allowing me as well to praise myself in a small measure!
QUENYA: Quetin ata: Lava úquenen sana i nanye auco! Mal qui é sanalde sie, cama ni yando ve qui nanye auco, lávala yando nin laita imne pitya lestasse!

ENGLISH: But nobody in heaven or on earth or under earth might open the book or look into it.
QUENYA: Mal úquen menelde hya cemende hya nu cemen lertane panta i parma hya yéta minna sa.

ENGLISH: Now he led him into Jerusalem and put him on the wing of the temple and said to him: “If you are God's son, throw yourself down from here, for is written: He will command his angels concerning you, to keep you,
QUENYA: Sí se-tulyanes mir Yérusalem ar panyane i cordo rámasse ar quente senna: “Qui nalye Eruo yondo, hata imle undu silo, an ná técina: Canuvas valaryain pa lye, hepien lye,

ENGLISH: That is good and acceptable to God our Savior,
QUENYA: Ta ná mára ar maicámima Eru Rehtolvan,

ENGLISH: And when he spoke with him, he went inside and found numerous people assembled.
QUENYA: Ar íre quentes óse, lendes minna ar hirne rimbe ennoli ocómienwe.

ENGLISH: May God who gives hope fill all among you with joy and with peace since you believe, for you to have an abundance of hope, by the power of the Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: Nai Eru ye anta estel quantuva illi mici le alassenen ar rainenen pan savilde, samieldan úve estelwa, i Aire Feo túrenen.

ENGLISH: But he, full of Holy Spirit, looked into heaven and saw God's glory, and Jesus stand by God's right hand.
QUENYA: Mal isse, quanta Aire Feo, yente mir menel ar cenne Eruo alcar, ar Yésus tára ara Eruo forma.

ENGLISH: speaking beneficial speech which nobody can despise; thus a hostile person will be ashamed, lacking foul thing that he can say about us.
QUENYA: quetila aşea questa ya úquen pole nattire; sie cotya quén nauva naityaina, pénala şaura nat ya polis quete pa vi.

ENGLISH: Indeed was no one having need among them, for all that had fields or houses sold them and brought the money that they got for the sold things
QUENYA: É enge úquen arwa maureo mici te, an illi i sámer restar hya coar vancer tai ar talle i telpe ya ñentelte i vácine natin

ENGLISH: Therefore the Jews sought him at the festival and said: “Where is that man?”
QUENYA: Etta i Yúrar cestaner se i aşaresse ar quenter: “Masse ná sana nér?”

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “How is that they say that the Christ is David's son?
QUENYA: Mal quentes téna: “Manen ná i quetilte i ná i Hristo Laviro yondo?

ENGLISH: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me, for I witnessed about it that its deeds are evil.
QUENYA: I mar ua pole yelta lé, mal yeltas ní, an vettan pa sa i cardaryar nar ulce.

ENGLISH: that in everything you have been made rich by him, in every word and knowledge,
QUENYA: i mi ilqua anaielde cárine lárie lo sé, ilya quettasse ar istyasse,

ENGLISH: Then he came to the disciples and said to them: “Surely you are not still sleeping and resting? Behold, the time is near when the Son of Man will be given over into the hands of sinners!
QUENYA: Tá túles i hildonnar ar quente téna: “Lau en húmalde ar séralde? Yé, i lúme ná hare yasse i Atanyondo nauva antana olla mannar úcarindoron!

ENGLISH: Furthermore, do not judge, and you will by no means be judged; do not say that others are worthy of punishment, and will not be said about you that you are worthy of punishment. Release, and you will be released.
QUENYA: Ente, áva name, ar laume nauvalde námine; áva quete i exi nar valde paimeo, ar ua nauva quétina pa lé i nalde valde paimeo. Á lehta, ar nauvalde lehtaine.

ENGLISH: and after going into a boat they were going over sea to Capernaum. But now it was dark , and Jesus still had not come to them.
QUENYA: ar apa menie mir lunte anelte lelyala olla ear Capernaumenna. Mal sí enge mornie, ar Yésus ena úme túlienwa téna.

ENGLISH: But Saul fell upon the congregation in an extremely harsh manner. Going into house after house and dragging outside men and women alike, he threw them into prison.
QUENYA: Ono Saul lantane i ocombenna mi ita naraca lé. Lelyala mir coa apa coa ar tucila ettenna neri ar nissi véla, hanteset mir mando.

ENGLISH: And he said to me: “It is done! I Tinco and Úre , the beginning and the end. To everyone who is thirsty I will give from the spring of the water of life, for nothing.
QUENYA: Ar quentes ninna: “Nas cárina! Inye Tinco ar Úre, i yesse yo i metta. Ilquenen ye soica ná inye antauva i ehtelello i nenwa coiviéva, muntan.

ENGLISH: and also both Jacob and John, the sons of Zebedee, that were partners with Simon. But Jesus said to Simon: “Do not be afraid! From now you will catch men alive.”
QUENYA: ar yando yúyo Yácov yo Yoháno, yondoryar Severai, i nánet rantarwali as Símon. Mal Yésus quente Símonna: “Áva ruce! Ho sí mapuval atalli coirie.”

ENGLISH: For is written: “I will cause the wisdom of the wise ones to pass away, and the intelligence of the intelligent ones I will put away.“
QUENYA: An ná técina: “Tyaruvan i sailaron sailie auta, ar i handaron handasse panyuvan oa.”

ENGLISH: Allow your word to have grace, its taste strengthened with salt, for you to know how you are to answer everyone.
QUENYA: Lava quettalda illume same lisse, tyáverya antoryaina singenen, istieldan manen hanquetuvalde ilquenna.

ENGLISH: For I know and have been by the Lord Jesus led to the belief that nothing is defiled in itself, except when a man counts a thing as defiled – to him it is defiled.
QUENYA: An istan ar anaien lo i Heru Yésus tulyana i savienna i munta vahtana ná insasse; hequa íre atan note nat ve vahtana – issen nas vahtana.

ENGLISH: And yet, if indeed they kept in mind the place from which they went forth, it was possible for them to return.
QUENYA: Ananta, qui é hempelte sámasse i nóme yallo etelendelte, ence tien nanwene.

ENGLISH: You will be led before governors and kings concernin me, as a witness to them and to the nations.
QUENYA: Nauvalde tulyane epe nórecánor ar arani pa inye, ve vettie tien ar i nórin.

ENGLISH: And in the same moment the stream of blood ceased, and she perceived in her body that she was healed from her painful illness.
QUENYA: Ar mí imya lú i celume serceva pustane, ar túnes hroaryasse i anes nestaina naicelea hlíveryallo.

ENGLISH: After these things Joseph from Arimathea, who was a disciple of Jesus, but in secred for fear of the Jews, made request from Pilate to take away Jesus’ body, and Pilate allowed it. Therefore he came and took his body away.
QUENYA: Apa nati sine Yósef Arimaşeallo, ye náne Yésus hildo, mal nuldiesse ruciénen i Yúrallon, arcane Pilátollo mapie oa Yésuo hroa, ar Piláto láve sa. Etta túles ar nampe hroarya oa.

ENGLISH: I have indeed seen the evil done to my people in Egypt, and I have heard their moaning, and I have come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send you to Egypt.'
QUENYA: É ecécien i ulco carna lienyan Mirrandoresse, ar ahlárien ñónielta, ar utúlien undu etelehtien te. Ar sí tula, lye-mentauvan Mirrandorenna.'

ENGLISH: There was Jacob’s spring. Thus Jesus, tired by the journey, sat down by the spring. The hour was around the sixth.
QUENYA: Tasse enge Yácovo ehtele. Sie Yésus, lumba i lendanen, hamne undu ara i ehtele. I lúme náne os i enquea.

ENGLISH: For if with your mouth you indicate your belief that Jesus is Lord, and you believe in your heart that God raised him out of dead, you will be saved.
QUENYA: An qui antolyanen teal savielya i Yésus Heru ná, ar savil endalyasse in Eru ortane se et qualinallon, nauval rehtana.

ENGLISH: And Pilate asked him: “Are you king of the Jews?” He answered: “You say it.”
QUENYA: Ar Piláto maquente senna: “Ma elye ná aran Yúraron?” Sé hanquente: “Elye quete sa.”

ENGLISH: They crucified him at the third hour.
QUENYA: Tarwestaneltes i neldea lúmesse.

ENGLISH: Concerning these things some Jews seized me in the temple and tried to kill me.
QUENYA: Pa nati sine Yúrali ni-namper i cordasse ar néver nahta ni.

ENGLISH: For if they do thest things when the tree is moist, what will happen when it has withered?”
QUENYA: An qui carilte nati sine íre i alda ná níte, mana martuva íre ehesties?”

ENGLISH: and the cloth that was on his head, not lying with the wraps, but rolled up in a separate place.
QUENYA: ar i lanne ya enge caryasse, lá caitala as i vaimar, mal tolúna satya nómesse.

ENGLISH: May we pay tax to the High King or not?”
QUENYA: Ma lertalve paitya tungwe i Ingaranen hya lá?”

ENGLISH: For who does not stand against us, is for us.
QUENYA: An ye ua tare venna, elven ná.

ENGLISH: Also if I am unskilled concerning words, I am not so concerning knowledge, but in every manner I have showed that to you.
QUENYA: Yando qui nanye úfinya pa quettar, uan sie pa istya, mal mi ilya lé atánielme ta len.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when you give gifts of mercy, do not sound a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and on the roads, to receive glory from them. Truly I say to you: They are receiving their whole reward.
QUENYA: Etta, íre antal annar óraviéva, áva lamya róma epe lye, ve i imnetyandor carir i yomencoassen ar i mallessen, camien alcar ho té. Násie quetin lenna: Cámalte quanda paityalelta.

ENGLISH: And when he was alone, the people around him with the twelve asked him about the comparisons.
QUENYA: Ar íre anes erinqua, i queni os se as i yunque maquenter senna pa i sestier.

ENGLISH: And behold! was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon, and this man was just and fearing God, looking forward to the comfort of Israel, and holy spirit lay upon him.
QUENYA: Ar yé! enge nér Yerúsalemesse yeo esse náne Símeon, ar nér sina náne faila ar rúcala Erullo, yétala ompa i tiutalenna Israelwa, ar aire fea caine senna.

ENGLISH: For the third time he said to them: “Than what evil has this man done? Nothing worthy of death I found in him. After giving him chastisement I will therefore release him.”
QUENYA: Mí neldea lú quentes téna: “Tá mana ulco nér sina acárie? Munta valda qualmen hirnen sesse. Apa antie sen paimesta etta lehtuvanyes.”

ENGLISH: as I also did in Jerusalem, and numerous ones among the holy ones I put in goals after I received power from the chief priests, and when one spoke about killing them, I gave my vote againat them.
QUENYA: ve yú carnen Yerúsalemesse, ar rimbali i airion panyanen mandossen apa camnen túre i hére airimollon, ar íre mo quente pa nahtie te, illume antanen ómanya ana te.

ENGLISH: And the third poured his bowl into the rivers and the springs of water, and they became blood.
QUENYA: Ar i neldea ulyane tolporya mir i síri ar i ehteler nenwa, ar ollelte serce.

ENGLISH: Concerning such a man I will praise myself, but not concerning myself, except concerning my weak state.
QUENYA: Pa taite nér laituvanyexe, mal lá pa inye, hequa pa milya sómanya.

ENGLISH: For they renewed my spirit and your spirit. Therefore receive such people well.
QUENYA: An ceutanelte fairenya ar fairelda. Etta cama taiti queni mai.

ENGLISH: For “who has known the Lord's mind, that he can teach him?” But we have the mind of Christ.
QUENYA: An “man isistie i Héruo sáma, i polis peanta hén?” Mal elme samir Hristo sáma.

ENGLISH: And he said to him: “Truly I say to you: Today you will be with be in Paradise.”
QUENYA: Ar quentes senna: “Násie quetin lyenna: Síra euval asinye mi Paralis.”

ENGLISH: Indeed also when we were with you we told you beforehand that we were going to suffer tribulation, as has also happened and you know.
QUENYA: É yú íre anelme aselde nyarnelme len nóvo i perperumnelve şangie, ve yú amartie ar istalde.

ENGLISH: Thereafter he showed himself to more than five hundred brothers, of whom the greater number remain until this day, though some are dead.
QUENYA: Epeta tannesexe hánoin or tuxar lempe, ion i anhoa nóte lemyar tenna aure sina, ómu ennoli nar qualine.

ENGLISH: Truly, truly I say to you: The hour is coming, and it is now, when dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God, and who hear shall come to life.
QUENYA: Násie, násie quetin lenna: I lúme túla, ar eas sí, íre qualini hlaruvar i Eruiono óma, ar i hlarir tuluvar coivienna.

ENGLISH: For Elizabeth came the time for bearing her baby, and she bore a son.
QUENYA: Elisavéten túle i lúme colien lapserya, ar colles yondo.

ENGLISH: But he taught and said to it: “Is not written: 'My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations?' But you have made it a cave of robbers!”
QUENYA: Mal peantanes ar quentes: “Ma ua técina: 'Coanya nauva estaina coa hyamiéva ilye i nórin'? Mal elde acárier sa rotto piluiva!”

ENGLISH: John's baptism, was it out of heaven or from men?”
QUENYA: Yoháno tumyale, ma anes et menello hya atanillon?”

ENGLISH: I was a stranger and you did not receive me, naked and you did not cover me, sick and in prison, but you did not care for me.'
QUENYA: anen ettelea ar ualde camne ni, helda ar ualde tumper ni, hlaiwa ar mandosse, mal ualde cimbane ni.'

ENGLISH: Furthermore, I say to you: Make friends for yourselves with the unrighteous riches! . Thus, when that fails, they will receive you into the eternal dwellings.
QUENYA: Ente, quetin lenna: Cara meldor elden i úfaila larnen! Sie, íre ta loita, le-camuvalte mir i oire mardi.

ENGLISH: But that slave went out and found a person of the other slaves, who had to him a debt of a hundred denarii. And seizing him, he began to choke him, saying: “Pay me your debt!”
QUENYA: Mal sana mól etelende ar hirne quén i hyane mólion, ye sáme sen rohta lenárion tuxa. Ar mápala se, yestanes quore se, quétala: “Ánin paitya rohtalya!”

ENGLISH: And he said: 'I will do so: I will tear down my stores, and I will build some stores larger than them, and there I will gather all my grain and all my good things,
QUENYA: Ar quentes: 'Caruvan sie: Nancaruvan hauranyar, ar carastuvan haurali hoe lá tai, ar tasse hostuvan ilya orenya ar ilye máre natinyar;

ENGLISH: Or how is it possible for you to say to your brother: 'Allow me to pull the sedge out of your eye', when behold! there is a rafter in your own eye?
QUENYA: Hya manen ece lyen quete hánolyanna: 'Lava nin tuce i lisce et hendetyallo', íre yé! ea pano véra hendelyasse?

ENGLISH: But know this thing, that if the master of the house knew the time when the thief was going to come, he was awake and did not allow anyone to break into his house.
QUENYA: Mal á ista nat sina, i qui i coantur sinte i lúme yasse i arpo tulumne, anes coiva ar ua láve aiquenen race mir coarya.

ENGLISH: Then he said: “I believe, Lord!” And he threw himself down before him.
QUENYA: Tá eques: “Savin, Heru!” Ar hantes immo undu epe se.

ENGLISH: And I saw that the woman was drunk with the blood of the holy ones and with the blood of the witnesses of Jesus.
QUENYA: Ar cennen in i nís náne limpunqua i sercenen i airion ar i sercenen i vettoron Yésuo.

ENGLISH: He told us how he saw the angel stand in his house, saying: Send some men to Joppa and summon Simon who has the nick-name Peter,
QUENYA: Nyarnes men manen cennes i vala tára mi coarya, quétala: Á menta nelli Yoppanna ar á tulta Símon ye same i epesse Péter,

ENGLISH: Faithful the word: If we died with him, we will also live with him;
QUENYA: Voronda i quetta: Qui quallelve óse, yando coituvalve óse;

ENGLISH: But what do you think? was a man with two children. He went to the first one and said: Child, today work in the garden of wines!
QUENYA: Mal mana sanalde? Enge nér as hína atta. Lendes i minyanna ar quente: Hína, síra mola i tarwasse liantassion!

ENGLISH: Therefore, when the garden-master shall come, what will he do to these cultivators?”
QUENYA: Etta, íre i tarwantur tuluva, mana caruvas sine alamoin?”

ENGLISH: Then, quickly, he went into the boat with his disciples and came to the regions around Dalmanutha.
QUENYA: Tá, lintiénen, lendes mir i lunte as hildoryar ar túle i ménannar os Lalmanúşa.

ENGLISH: and fall under judgement since they abandoned their first steadfastness.
QUENYA: ar lantar nu námie pan hehtanelte minya voronwielta.

ENGLISH: Therefore I thought that it was necessary to send the brothers before me to you, to make ready beforehand the blessed gift of which you gave promise formerly. Thus it will indeed be ready as a blessed gift, and not by compulsion.
QUENYA: Etta sannen i mauyane menta i hánor epe ni lenna, carien manwa nóvo i aistana anna pa ya antanelde vanda yá. Sie é nauvas manwa ve aistana anna, ar lá maustanen.

ENGLISH: For we were saved in this hope; but a hope that one sees is not hope, for when a person sees a thing, how does he have hope for it?
QUENYA: An anelve rehtane estel sinasse; mal estel ya mo cene ua estel, an íre quén cene nat, manen samis estel san?

ENGLISH: And you, Capernaum, will you be raised to heaven? Down to Mandos you will come, for if the mighty deeds that happened in you happened in Sodom, that city stood until this day.
QUENYA: Ar elye, Capernaum, ma nauval ortana menelenna? Undu Mandostonna tuluval, an au i túrie cardar yar martaner lyesse martaner Soromesse, tana osto tarne tenna aure sina.

ENGLISH: Beloved ones, I urge you as exiles and people that dwell in foreign lands: Keep yourselves from the lusts of the flesh, that make war against the soul. Behave well among the nations!
QUENYA: Meldar, hortan le ve etyali ar quelli i marir ettelie nóressen: Hepa inde i hráveo mailellon, yar ohtacarir i feanna.

ENGLISH: After five days Ananias the chief priest came down with some elders and an orator whose name was Tertulllus, and they spoke evil about Paul.
QUENYA: Apa rí lempe Ananías i héra airimo túle undu as amyárali ar carpando yeo esse náne Tertullo, ar quentelte ulco pa Paulo.

ENGLISH: And to the angel of the congregation in Philadelphia write: This says who is holy, who is true, who has David’s key, who opens in a manner stopping anyone from closing, and closes in a manner stopping anyone from opening:
QUENYA: Ar i valanna i ocombeo Filarelfiasse teca: Sin quete ye aire ná, ye şanda ná, ye same Laviro latil, ye latya mi lé pustala aiquen holtiello, ar holta mi lé pustala aiquen latyavello:

ENGLISH: And he went outside and let bitter tears flow.
QUENYA: Ar lendes ettenna ar láve sáre nírin sire.

ENGLISH: And Jesus, full of Holy Sprit, went away from Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the desert
QUENYA: Ar Yésus, quanta Aire Feo, lende oa Yordanello ar náne tulyaina lo i Faire mir i erume

ENGLISH: But nations were wrathful, and your own wrath came, and the time for judging the dead and for giving reward to your servants the prophets, and to the holy ones and to those who fear your name, to the small and the great, and for destroying who destroy earth.
QUENYA: Mal nóri náner rúşie, ar véra rúşelya túle, ar i lúme namien i qualinar ar antáven paityale núrolyain i Erutercánor, ar i airin ar in rucir esselyallo, i pityain yo i túrain, ar nancarien i nancarir cemen.”

ENGLISH: And some came, bringing to him a paralyzed man carried by four.
QUENYA: Ar queneli túler, tálala senna úlévima nér cólina lo canta.

ENGLISH: And they asked and said to him: “Then what is the reason that you baptize, if you are not the Christ or Elijah or the Prophet?”
QUENYA: Ar cenşelte ar quenter senna: “Tá mana i casta yanen tumyal, qui umilye i Hristo hya Elía hya i Erutercáno?”

ENGLISH: When his disciples heard it, they came and took up his corpse and put it in a tomb.
QUENYA: Íre hildoryar hlasser sa, túlelte ar ortaner loicorya ar sa-panyaner noirisse.

ENGLISH: And he requested a tablet and wrote: “His name is John.” And all among them were in wonder.
QUENYA: Ar arcanes palma ar tence: “Esserya ná Yoháno.” Ar illi mici te náner elmendasse.

ENGLISH: This is as when a man goes to another country, going away from his house and giving his thralls authority, to everyone concerning his own work, and commanding the gatekeeper to be awake.
QUENYA: Si ná ve íre nér lelya hyana nórenna, autala coaryallo ar antala mólyain hére, ilquenen pa véra molierya, ar cánala i andocundon náve coiva.

ENGLISH: Then, by rage, some said among themselves: “What is the reason for throwing away this fragrant oil?
QUENYA: Tá, ahanen, queneli quenter mici inte: “Mana i casta hatien oa níşima millo sina?

ENGLISH: Then, after sending the crowds away, he went into the boat. And his disciples came to him and said: “Let us understand the comparison about the worthless plants in the field!”
QUENYA: Tá, apa mentie i şangar oa, lendes mir i coa. Ar hildoryar túler senna ar quenter: “Lava men hanya i sestie pa i úmirwe olvar i restasse!”

ENGLISH: But now you too put away everything: wrath, rage, wickedness, blasphemy, and dirty talk out of your mouth.
QUENYA: Mal sí yando elde á panya oa ilqua: rúşe, aha, olcie, naiquetie, ar vára carpie et antoldallo.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when Peter saw him, he said to Jesus: “Lord, what will this man do?”
QUENYA: Etta, íre Péter cenne se, quentes Yésunna: “Heru, mana nér sina caruva?”

ENGLISH: – if indeed you have heard about the oversight of the grace of God which was given me for your good,
QUENYA: – qui é ahlárielde pa i ortírie i Erulisseva ya náne nin antaina márieldan,

ENGLISH: Surely I do not speak so in a man's manner? Or does the law not also say these things.
QUENYA: Lau quetin sie mi atano lé? Hya ma i şanye ua yú quete nati sine?

ENGLISH: But in answer Peter said to them: “If it is just in God's eyes to listen to you and not to God, you judge for yourselves!
QUENYA: Mal hanquentasse Péter quente téna: “Qui faila ná Eruo hendusse lasta lenna ar lá Erunna, alde name inden!

ENGLISH: For in Jesus Christ circumcision and uncircumcision alike cannot do anything, but faith by love can.
QUENYA: An Hristo Yésusse oscirie ar úoscirie véla uar pole care aiqua, mal savie melmenen pole.

ENGLISH: until I shall place your enemies as a support for your feet.'
QUENYA: tenna panyuvan ñottotyar ve tulco talutyant.'

ENGLISH: and saw heaven opened and some kind of vessel that came down like a huge sheet of linen,

ENGLISH: Then he began to rebuke the cities where his most numerous of his mighty deeds happened, since they failed to find repentance: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty deeds that have happened in you happened in Tyre or Sidon, long ago they sought repentance in sackcloth and ash!
QUENYA: Tá yestanes naitya i ostor yasse i amarimbar túrie cardaryaron martaner, pan loitanelte hire inwis: “Horro lyen, Corasin! Horro lyen, Vet-Saira! An au i túrie cardar yar amartier letse martaner mi Tír hya Síron, andanéya cestanelte inwis mi findilanne ar litte!

ENGLISH: Then it goes away and brings with itself seven other spirits, more wicked than itself, and after going inside they dwell there, and that man's final state is worse than the first! So it will be also for this wicked generation!”
QUENYA: Tá lelyas oa ar tala as inse hyane fairi otso, olce lá inse, ar apa menie minna marilte tasse, ar tana nero métima sóma ná faica lá i minya! Sie euva yú olca nónare sinan!”

ENGLISH: When he came near to the decline down from the Mount of Olives the entire host of the disciples began to have joy and to praise God concerning all the mighty deeds that they saw,
QUENYA: Íre túles hare i pendenna undu Orontello Milpieron i quanda liyúme i hildoron yestaner same alasse ar laita Eru pa ilye i túrie cardar yar cennelte,

ENGLISH: They said to him: “John the Baptist, and others: Elijah, and others: One among the prophets.”
QUENYA: Quentelte senna: “Yoháno i Tumyando, ar exeli: Elía, ar exeli: Quén imíca i Erutercánor.”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, over his head they put the accusation against him, written: “This is Jesus, king of the Jews!”
QUENYA: Ente, or carya panyanelte i ongwequetta senna, técina: “Si ná Yésus, aran Yúraron!”

ENGLISH: Therefore he came to a city of Samaria called Sychar, near to the field that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
QUENYA: Etta túles ostonna Samário estaina Sícar, hare i restanna ya Yácov antane Yósef yondoryan.

ENGLISH: And he went, preaching in their synagogues throughout entire Galilee, and expelling the demons.
QUENYA: Ar lendes, nyardala yomencoaltassen ter quanda Alilea, ar et-hátala i raucor.

ENGLISH: How, then, was it counted to him? When he was circumcised, or while he was not circumcised? Not while he was circumcised, but while he was not circumcised!
QUENYA: Manen, tá, sa náne nótina? Íre anes oscirna, hya íre únes oscirna? Lá íre anes oscirna, mal íre únes oscirna!

ENGLISH: For these things happened to fulfull the scripture: “A single bone of his body will not be broken.”
QUENYA: An nati sine martaner amaquatien i tehtele: “Erya axo hroaryo lá nauva rácina.”

ENGLISH: But Peter said: “Man, I do not know what you are saying!” And in that moment, while he was still speaking, a cock sounded.
QUENYA: Mal Péter quente: “Nér, uan ista ya quétal!” Ar mi yana lú, íre en quequentes, tocot lamyane.

ENGLISH: were in Antioch some prophets and teachers in the congregation that was there, Barnabas and Simeon who was called Niger, and Lucius from Cyrene, and Manaen who was instructed with Herod the farthing-ruler, and Saul.
QUENYA: Enger Antiocesse Erutercánoli ar peantalli i ocombesse ya enge tasse, Varnavas ar Símeon ye náne estaina Niher, ar Lucio Cirenello, ar Manaen ye náne peantana as Herol i canastatur, ar Saul.

ENGLISH: Then it says: “I will return to my house from which I moved,” and coming to it, it finds the house empty, but clean and adorned.
QUENYA: Tá quetis: “Nanwenuvan coanyanna yallo léven”, ar túlala sanna, hiris i coa lusta, mal poica ar netyana.

ENGLISH: But Jesus called them and said: “Allow the children to come to me, and do not stop them, for God's kingdom is for suchlike ones.
QUENYA: Mal Yésus yalle te ar quente: “Lava i hínain tule ninna, ar áva pusta te, an Eruo aranie taitin ná.

ENGLISH: And we justly so, for we are receiving that to which we are worthy by the things that we have done, but this man has done nothing evil.”
QUENYA: Ar engwe failave sie, an cámangwe yan nangwe valde i natinen yar carnengwe, mal nér sina acárie munta ulca.”

ENGLISH: We do not do anything at all which will turn people away, not wishing that our ministry will be stained.
QUENYA: Laume carilme aiqua ya queruva queni oa, lá mérala i núromolielma nauva vahtaina.

ENGLISH: After a short time another person, seeing him, said: “You as well one among them!” But Peter said: “Man, I am not!”
QUENYA: Apa şinta lúme hyana quén, cénala se, quente: “Yando elye er mici té!” Mal Péter quente: “Nér, uan!”

ENGLISH: And after coming home he summons his friends and his neighbors and says to them: 'Be happy with me, for I have found my sheep, that was lost.'
QUENYA: Ar apa tulie marda tultas meldoryar ar armaroryar ar quete téna: 'Na valime asinye, an ihírien mámanya, ye náne vanwa.'

ENGLISH: When we came into Rome was permitted to Paul to dwell privately, with the soldier watching him.
QUENYA: Íre lendelme mir Róma náne lávina Paulon mare vérave, as i ohtar tirila se.

ENGLISH: Therefore the disiciples said, one to the other: “Did anybody bring him anything to eat?”
QUENYA: Etta i hildor quenter, quén i exenna: “Ma aiquen tulune senna aiqua matien?”

ENGLISH: And behold! a woman having a flood of blood for twelve years came behind him and touched the rim of his cloak,
QUENYA: Ar yé! nís arwa celumeo serceva ter loar yunque túle ca se ar appane collaryo lane,

ENGLISH: Are they Christ's servants? I speak as if I am out of my mind: I am so still more! I have toiled more, I have been in prison more frequently, I have received more numerous blows, I have been near to death frequently.
QUENYA: Mal nalte Hristo núror? Quetin ve qui nanye ettesse sámanyo: Inye ná sie en ambe! Omótien ambe, anaien mandosse ambe rimbave, acámien ambe rimbe petiéli, anaien hare qualmenna rimbave.

ENGLISH: What, then, are we to do? It is certain that they will hear that you have come.
QUENYA: Mana, tá, caruvalve? Tanca ná i hlaruvalte in utúliel.

ENGLISH: And he taught in their synagogues, receiving praise from all.
QUENYA: Ar peantanes yomencoaltassen, cámala laitale ho illi.

ENGLISH: Then he said to her: “Your sins are forgiven.”
QUENYA: Tá quentes senna: “Úcarelyar nar apsénine.”

ENGLISH: Since this happened on the day of Preparation, the Jews requested from Pilate that their legs were to be broken and the bodies taken away, that they would not remain on the cross on the day of rest, for that day of rest was great.

ENGLISH: Jesus answered: “Do you say this by yourself, or have others talked to you about me?”

ENGLISH: If he does not, perhaps he puts the foundation of the tower , but it is not possible for him to complete it, and all that are watching will perhaps start to speak mockery about him,

QUENYA: Istala si, Yésus quente téna: “Manen ná i cáralde tarastie i nissen, íre acáries mára carda nin?

ENGLISH: He will also make you firm until the end, for you to be perfect on the day of Jesus Christ our Lord.
QUENYA: Isse yú caruva le tance tenna i metta, náveldan ilvane Yésus Hristo Herulvo auresse.

ENGLISH: For I by law died to law, for me to be alive to God.
QUENYA: An inye şanyenen qualle şanyen, návenyan coirea Erun.

QUENYA: Lúme yanasse, íre i şanga náne ocómienwa mi quaihúmeli, ta rimbe i quén vattane i exe undu, yestanes quete hildoryannar minyave: “Hepa inde oa i pulmaxello i Fariryaron, yá imnetie ná.

ENGLISH: For thus our hope for you is firm, since we know that as you have a part in the tribulations, so you will also have a part in the comfort.
QUENYA: Ar sie estelelma len ná tanca, pan istalme i síve samilde ranta i şangiessen, tambe samuvalde yando ranta i tiutalesse.

ENGLISH: Greet Ampliatus, my beloved in Christ.
QUENYA: Á suila Ampliáto, meldanya i Hristosse.

QUENYA: Ar hyana vala, neldea, hilyane tu, quétala taura ómanen: “Qui aiquen tyere i hravan ar emmarya, ar came i tehta timbareryasse hya máryasse,

QUENYA: Íre quentes nati sine, rimbali sáver sesse.

QUENYA: Etta i hildor quenter senna: “Heru, qui acaitie undu serien, nauvas alwa.”

ENGLISH: (if a person does not know lead his own family, how will he oversee God's congregation?),
QUENYA: (qui quén ua ista tulya véra nosserya, manen ortiruvas Eruo ocombe?),

QUENYA: Etta Tomas, ye né estaina i Onóno, quente i hyane hildonnar: “Alve lelya, yando elve, i qualuvalve óse.”

ENGLISH: Notice the birds of heaven, that they do not sow or reap or gather into barns , and yet your heavenly Father gives them food. Are you not more important than them?

QUENYA: An qui i er queno ongwenen qualme sáme túre issenen, ita ambe i camir lisseryo úve ar i anna failiéva turuvar ter sana er quén – Yésus Hristo.

ENGLISH: but have fallen away, then one cannot renew their repentance, for they crucify again the Son of God for themselves and shame him.

ENGLISH: Therefore take heed, for you do not know the day or the hour.

ENGLISH: Thus it will be at the conclusion of the age: The angels will go forth and will separate the wicked from the righteous,

ENGLISH: Hear, whoever has ears to hear !”
QUENYA: Hlara, aiquen ye same hlaru hlarien!”

ENGLISH: Therefore, seeing that we are God's kin, we do not do well if we think about the Deity that he is like gold or silver or stone, or an artifact formed by man's art or thought.
QUENYA: Etta, cenila i nalve Eruo nosse, ualve care mai qui sanalve pa i Aino i náse ve malta hya telpe hya ondo, hya tanwe cátina atano curwenen hya sanwenen.

ENGLISH: Therefore remember which you have fallen from, and find repentance and do the first deeds. If you do not, I am coming to you, and I shall take away your lampstand from its place, if you do not find repentance.

ENGLISH: Thus the Holy Spirit lets us understand that the path into the holy place was not made known when the first tent stood.

ENGLISH: It seemed good to him for whom all things exist and through whom everything exists, when he was bringing many sons to glory, to make the Chief of their salvation perfect through suffering.

ENGLISH: Thus Moses spoke to the Sons of Israel: 'God will raise for you out of your brothers a prophet like me.'
QUENYA: Sin quente Móses Israelindinnar: 'Eru ortauva len et hánoldallon Erutercáno ve ní.'

ENGLISH: And the dragon was wroth with the woman, and went away to make war on who remained of her seed, who keep the commandments of God and have the witness about Jesus.

ENGLISH: But it is necessary for everyone among you to love his wife as he loves himself, and it is necessary for the wife to have awe for her husband.
QUENYA: Mal mauya yando ilquenen mici le mele verirya ve melis inse, ar mauya i verin same áya veruryan.

ENGLISH: But he asked them: “What number of breads do you have?” They said: “Seven.”
QUENYA: Mal maquentes téna: “Mana nóte massaron samilde?” Quentelte: “Otso.”

ENGLISH: So you as well, since with a burning spirit you want the gifts of the spirit: seek to have them in abundance, in order to build up the congregation.
QUENYA: Sie yú elde, pan uryala şúlenen merilde i faireo annar: á cesta samitat úvesse, carastien ama i ocombe.

ENGLISH: But there were there some scribes, sitting and thinking in their heart: “How can this man speak thus? He is blaspheming! Who may forgive sins except one, God?”
QUENYA: Mal enger tasse parmangolmoli, hámala ar sánala endaltasse: “Manen nér sina lerta carpa sie? Naiquétas! Man lerta apsene úcari hequa er, Eru?”

ENGLISH: After we lifted it into the ship we used the emergency equipment and bound around the ship with ropes. Our fear was that the ship was going to hit the hidden rocks in Syrte; therefore they took down the front sail and were carried .
QUENYA: Apa ortanelmes mir i cirya yuhtanelte i mauresorastar ar nunter os i cirya rappalínen. Caurelma náne in i cirya petumne i nurtane ondor Sirtesse; etta nampelte undu i pota-velunte ar náner cóline.

ENGLISH: Firstly, I hear that when you come together in the congration exist divisions among you, and in part I believe it.
QUENYA: Minyave, hlarin in íre tulilde uo i ocombesse ear hyarier mici le, ar mi ranta savinyes.

ENGLISH: And he commanded the cart to halt, and both went into the water, Philip and the minister together, and he baptized him.
QUENYA: Ar cannes i norollen hauta, ar yúyo lendet mir i nén, Filip ar i arandur uo, ar sumbanéses.

ENGLISH: Again he went forth to beside the sea, and the entire crowd came to him, and he taught them.

ENGLISH: But Paul cried with a mighty voice: “Do not harm yourself, for we are all here!”
QUENYA: Mal Paulo yáme taura ómanen: “Áva harna imle, an nalme illi sisse!”

ENGLISH: Thus the promise is by faith, for it to be by grace, to make it firm for all the seed of Abraham, not only that which adheres to the Law, but also that which adheres to Abraham's faith. He is the father of all among us,
QUENYA: Sie i vanda saviénen ná, náveryan Erulissenen, carien sa tanca ilya erden Avrahámo, lá rie ta ya himya i Şanye, mal yú ta ya himya Avrahámo savie. Náse i atar illion mici vi,

ENGLISH: though in his own times he revealed his word by making it known, the work for which I was reserved by the command from God who saves us –
QUENYA: ómu vére lúmeryassen apantanes quettarya cariénen sa sinwa, i molie yan inye náne sátina i canwanen Eru Rehtolvallo –

ENGLISH: Therefore comfort one another with these words, and build up one another, as indeed you are doing.
QUENYA: Etta á tiuta quén i exe sine quettainen, ar á carasta ama quén i exe, ve é cáralde.

ENGLISH: And out of the throne are coming flashes and voices and thunders, and there are seven lamps burning before the throne, which are the seven spirits of God.
QUENYA: Ar et i mahalmallo túlar ítar ar ómar ar hundier, ar ear calmar otso uryala epe i mahalma, yar nar i fairi otso Eruo.

ENGLISH: Thus the other disciples said to him: “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them: “If I will not see in his hands the marks of the nails, and I do not put my hand in his side, I will not believe.”
QUENYA: Sie i hyane hildor quenter senna: “Ecénielme i Heru!” Mal quentes téna: “Qui uan cenuva máryatse i tehtar i taxion, ar uan panya ninya má etteryasse, lá savuvan.”

ENGLISH: And therefore we also give God thanks continually, for when you got God's word which you heard from us, you received it not like men's word, but like that which truly it is: as God's word, which also works in you that believe.
QUENYA: Ar tanen yú elme antar Erun hantale voro, an íre ñentelde Eruo quetta ya hlasselde mello, camneldes lá ve atanion quetta, mal ve ta ya nanwave nas: ve Eruo quetta, ya yú mole lesse i savir.

ENGLISH: When they came to Jerusalem they were received by the congregation and the apostles and the elder men, and they told about all the things that God did by them.
QUENYA: Íre túlelte Yerúsalemenna anelte cámine lo i ocombe ar i aposteli ar i amyáre neri, ar nyarnelte pa ilye i nati yar Eru carne ténen.

ENGLISH: he who also has put his seal on us and has given us security of the spirit in our heart.
QUENYA: sé ye yando apánie lihtarya vesse ar ánie ven varnasse i faireo endalvasse.

ENGLISH: But I say to you: Do not stand against that does evil to you. If anyone strikes you on your right chin, turn also the other one towards him.
QUENYA: Mal inye quete lenna: Áva tare yenna care ulco lenna. Qui aiquen le-pete forya ventalyasse, quera yú i exe senna.

ENGLISH: And he went away and started to make known througout the Ten Cities everything that Jesus did for him, and all were filled with wonder.
QUENYA: Ar lendes oa ar yestane care sinwa ter i Ostor Quean ilqua ya Yésus carne sen, ar illi náner quátine elmendanen.

ENGLISH: But I say to you: Everyone who divorces his wife except by reason of fonication, causes her to break marriage. And who gets married to a woman who has been sent away, breaks marriage.
QUENYA: Mal inye quete lenna: Ilquen ye lehtaxe veriryallo hequa castanen úpuhtiéva, tyare se race vestale. Ar ye verya nissenna ye anaie mentana oa, race vestale.

ENGLISH: in a single moment, in the twinkling of an eye, when the last trumpet shall be heard. For the trumpet will sound, and dead will be raised in a state beyond destruction, and we shall be changed.
QUENYA: mi erya lú, mi hendo tintilie, íre i métima hyóla nauva hláraina. An i hyóla lamyauva, ar qualinar nauvar ortane mi sóma han nancarie, ar elve nauvar vistane.

ENGLISH: But Martha had her hands full with much work, and she came and said: “Lord, is it not important to you that my sister has left me alone in my work? Therefore say to her that it is necessary for her to help me.”
QUENYA: Mal Marşa sáme máryat quante olya moliénen, ar túles ar quente: “Heru, ma ua valda lyen i néşanya ni-ehehtie erinqua molienyasse? Etta queta senna i mauya sen manya ni.”

ENGLISH: but let him turn himself from evil and do good; may be seek peace and pursue it!
QUENYA: mal lava sen quere inse ulcullo ar care márie; nai cestuvas raine ar roituva sa!

ENGLISH: All flesh is not the same flash, but men have their kind, and is another kind in cattle, and another kind of flesh in birds, and another kind in fishes.
QUENYA: Ilya hráve ua i imya hráve, mal atani samir nostalelta, ar ea hyana nostale hráveo mi yaxir, ar hyana nostale hráveo mi aiwi, ar hyana nostale mi lingwi.

ENGLISH: If anybody sees his brother do a sin that does not lead to death, he shall make request, and God will give him life – if he is not among the people whose sin leads to death. is a sin that leads to death; I do not say that one is to make request concerning that.
QUENYA: Qui aiquen cene hánorya cára úcare ya ua tulya qualmenna, arcuvas, ar Eru antuva sen coivie – qui uas mici queni ion úcare tulya qualmenna. Eä úcare ya tulya qualmenna; uan quete i mo arcuva pa ta.

ENGLISH: In former generations this mystery was not made known to the sons of men as now by spirit it has been made known to his holy apostles and to his heralds :
QUENYA: Yane nónaressen fóle sina úne carna sinwa i atanyondoin ve sí fairenen anaies carna sinwa airi apostelyain ar tercánoryain:

ENGLISH: But I say to you that here is which is greater than the temple.
QUENYA: Mal quetin lenna i sisse ea ya ná túra epe i corda.

ENGLISH: when you reach out with your hand to heal, and when signs and portents happen by the name of your holy servant, Jesus.

QUENYA: ar Ása óne Yóhyafat, ar Yóhyafat óne Yóram, ar Yóram óne Ussia,

ENGLISH: But others, in mockery against them, said: “They are full of sweet wine!”
QUENYA: Mal exeli, yaiwesse téna, quenter: “Nalte quante lisse limpeo!”

ENGLISH: But they took the slave, beat him and sent him away empty.
QUENYA: Mal nampelte i mól, se-palpaner ar se-menter oa lusta.

ENGLISH: Do you understand all these things?” They said to him: “Yes!”
QUENYA: Ma hanyanelde ilye sine nati?” Quentelte senna: “Ná!”

ENGLISH: After receiving the sour wine, Jesus said: “It is completed!”, and he let his head drop and expired.
QUENYA: Apa camie i sára limpe, Yésus quente: “Nás telyaina!”, ar láves caryan lanta ar effirne.

ENGLISH: And he preached, saying: “After me comes who is stronger than I – I am not worthy of bending down and of untying his shoelaces .
QUENYA: Ar nyardanes, quétala: “Apa ni túla ye ná tulca lá inye – inye ua valda luhtiéno undu ar avanutiéno hyapalattaryat.

ENGLISH: Who among you, by worrying, can add a single cubit to the length of his life?
QUENYA: Man mici le, quáreleryanen, pole napane erya perranga coivieryo andienna?

ENGLISH: All among them were steadfast in prayer, with some women and Mary mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.
QUENYA: Illi mici te náner voronde hyamiesse, as nisseli ar María amil Yésuo, ar as hánoryar.

ENGLISH: When they went away, Jesus began to speak to the crowd concerning John: “What did you go forth into the desert to see? A sedge moving by the wind?
QUENYA: Íre té oanter, Yésus yestane carpa i şanganna pa Yoháno: “Mana etelendelde mir i erume cenien? Lisce lévala i súrinen?

ENGLISH: No matter what , Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or the things that are now or the things that will come – everything you have, while you are of the Christ, and Christ is of God.
QUENYA: Lá cimila mana, Paulo hya Apollo hya Céfas hya i mar hya coivie hya qualme hya i nati yar ear sí hya i nati yar tuluvar – ilqua elde samir, lan elde nar i Hristova, ar Hristo Eruva ná.

ENGLISH: Then, after going inside, they went up into the upper hall where they dwelt, Peter and John and Jacob and Andrew, Philip and Thomas and Matthew, Jacob son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zelot, and Judas son of Jacob.
QUENYA: Tá, apa menie minna, lendelte ama mir i oromar yasse marnelte, Péter ar Yoháno ar Yácov ar Andréo, Filip ar Şomas ar Mattéo, Yácov Alféoion ar Símon i Sélot, ar Yúras Yácovion.

ENGLISH: In answer Jesus said: “Were not the ten healed? Where, then, are the other nine?
QUENYA: Hanquentasse Yésus quente: “Ma únelte i quean nestaine? Masse, tá, nar i hyane nerte?

ENGLISH: Furthermore, were numerous skin-diseased ones in Israel at the time of Elisha the prophet, and yet no one among them was cleansed, but Naaman from Syria.”
QUENYA: Ente, enger rimbe helmahlaiwali Israelde Elíhya i Erutercáno lúmesse, ananta úquen mici té náne poitaina, mal Náman Siriallo.”

ENGLISH: And John was clad in raiments of hair of camels and had a belt around his hips, and he ate grasshoppers and wild honey.
QUENYA: Ar Yoháno náne vaina mi larmali findeva ulumpion ar sáme quilta os oşwerya, ar mantes salquecápor ar verca lís.

ENGLISH: This matter came to the knowledge of all, of Jews and of Greeks alike, those who dwelt in Ephesus. And fear fell upon all among them, and the name of the Lord Jesus was being praised.
QUENYA: Natto sina túle illion istyanna, Yúraron ar Hellenyaron véla, té i marner Efesusse. Ar caure lantane ilyannar mici te, ar i Heru Yésuo esse náne laitaina.

ENGLISH: And Jesus said to them: “The friends of the bridegroom surely cannot have grief while the bridegroom is with them? But days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will keep fasts.
QUENYA: Ar Yésus quente téna: “I endero meldor lau polir same naire íre i ender ea aselte? Mal rí tuluvar íre i ender nauva mapana oa tello, ar tá hepuvalte lamati.

ENGLISH: Honor widows that truly are widows.
QUENYA: Á anta alcar verulórain i nanwave nar verulórar.

ENGLISH: Now I urge you, brothers, in the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, that all among you will say the same thing, and that will not be divisions among you, but that you will be one in the same mind and the same thought.
QUENYA: Sí le-hortan, hánor, Yésus Hristo Herulvo essenen, in illi mici le quetuvar i imya nat, ar in uar euva şancier mici le, mal i nalde er mí imya sáma ar i imya sanwe.

ENGLISH: But from the days of John the Baptist until now, the kingdom of heaven suffers violence, and those that do violence seize it.
QUENYA: Mal ho réryar Yoháno i Sumbando tenna sí, menelo aranie perpere orme, ar i carir orme mapar sa.

ENGLISH: Thus he has been made greater than angels, being heir to a name more glorious than their name.
QUENYA: Sie anaies carna túra epe vali, nála aryon esseo alcarinqua epe esselta.

ENGLISH: For being certain about this, I know that I shall remain and keep dwelling with all of you, for you to go forwards and for you to have the joy which the faith gives.
QUENYA: Ar nála tanca pa si, istan i lemyuvan ar termaruvan as le illi, menieldan ompa ar i samieldan i alasse ya i savie anta.

ENGLISH: And this man began to speak boldly in the synagogue. When Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him with them and led him to a deeper understanding of God's way.
QUENYA: Ar nér sina yestane quete canyave i yomencoasse. Íre Priscilla yo Aquila hlasset se, nampettes asette ar tulyane se ambe tumna handenna i tieo Eruo.

ENGLISH: And the lord praised the unjust steward, since he behaved wisely – for in their generation, the sons of this age are wiser than the sons of light.
QUENYA: Ar i heru laitane i úfaila mardil, pan lenganes sailave –an nónareltasse, randa sino yondor nar saile lá i calo yondor.

ENGLISH: Therefore our goal is that if we will be pleasing to him, not heeding if we dwell with him or away from him.
QUENYA: Etta mehtelma ná i nauvalme írime sen, lá címala qui marilme óse hya oa sello.

ENGLISH: But for a time he did not want, but thereafter he said to himself: “Though I do not fear God or have respect for man,
QUENYA: Mal ter lúme uas merne, mal epeta quentes insenna: “Ómu uan ruce Erullo hya same áya atanen,

ENGLISH: But the centurion found a ship from Alexandria that was going to sail to Italy, and he commanded us to go into that.
QUENYA: Mal i tuxantur hirne cirya Alexandriallo ya cirumne Italianna, ar cannes men lelya mir ta.

ENGLISH: He is not here, but he has been raised! Recall how he spoke to you when he was still in Galilee,
QUENYA: Uas sisse, mal anaies ortaina! Enyala manen carampes lenna íre en anes Alileasse,

ENGLISH: Saul assented to the murder of him. On that day a great persecution arose against the congregation which was in Jerusalem; all except the apostles were scattered through the regions of Judea and Samaria.
QUENYA: Saul $áquente i nahtie séva. Yana auresse túra roitie oronte i ocombenna ya enge Yerúsalemesse; illi hequa i aposteli náner vintane ter i ménar Yúreo ar Samário.

ENGLISH: But now I will go to Jerusalem to be a servant to the holy ones.
QUENYA: Mal sí lelyuvan Yerúsalemenna náven núro i airin.

ENGLISH: by the hypocrisy of people that speak lies, having a mark on their own conscience as if made by a hot iron.
QUENYA: i imnatyalénen quenion i quetir huruvi, arwe tehto véra immotuntieltasse ve qui carna lauca anganen.

ENGLISH: one that finds his life, to him it shall be lost, but the person whose life becomes lost for my sake , will find it.
QUENYA: Ye hire cuilerya, sen nauvas vanwa, mal i quén yeo cuile ole vanwa márienyan, hiruva sa.

ENGLISH: Or may Barnabas and I alone not be free from labour?
QUENYA: Hya ma Varnavas ar inye erinque uar lerta náve lére moliello?

ENGLISH: Therefore let us go to him outside of the camp, bearing the shameful speech that he bore,
QUENYA: Etta alve lelya senna ettesse i estoliéno, cólala i naityala carpie ya sé colle,

ENGLISH: The scribes and the Pharisees watched him, to see if he was going to heal anyone on the day of rest, for them to find a way with which they could accuse him.
QUENYA: I parmangolmor ar i Farisar tirner se, cenien qui nestumne aiquen i sendaresse, hirieltan lé yanen pollelte ulquete se.

ENGLISH: And the people waited for Zechariah, and they were in wonder since he was so long in the sanctuary.
QUENYA: Ar i lie lartane Secarían, ar anelte elmendasse pan anes ta andave i yánasse.

ENGLISH: I have been a fool! You compelled me to be so, for what you owed me was to speak well about me. For in nothing I fall short of the loftiest apostles, though I am nothing.
QUENYA: Anaien auco! Elde mauyaner nin náve sie, an rohtalda nin náne quete mai pa ni. An mi munta loitan i antare aposteli, ómu nanye munta.

ENGLISH: I speak as to people having insight; judge for yourselves what I say.
QUENYA: Carpan ve queninnar arwe terceno; nama inden ya quetin.

ENGLISH: For this reason I remind you to rekindle like a fire God's gift which is in you, since I put my hands upon you.
QUENYA: Sina castanen rentan lye entinta ve náre Eruo anna ya ea lyesse, pan panyanen mányat to lye.

ENGLISH: My children, let us love, not by word or by tongue, but by deed and by truth.
QUENYA: Hinyar, alve mele, lá quettanen hya lambanen, mal cardanen ar nanwiénen.

ENGLISH: On the contrary, by these sacrifices there is a recalling of sins from year to year,
QUENYA: Úsie, sine yancainen ea enyalie úcariva loallo loanna,

ENGLISH: And the disciples were filled with joy and Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: Ar i hildor náner quátine alassenen ar Aire Feanen.

ENGLISH: But to the others I – not the Lord – say: If is a brother having a wife who does not believe, and the woman by her free will wishes to live with him, he may not abandon the woman.
QUENYA: Mal i exennar inye – lá i Heru – quete: Qui ea háno arwa verio ye ua save, ar i nís léra nirmeryanen mere mare óse, uas lerta hehta i nís.

ENGLISH: No, you wrong and make others deprived, and that your brothers!
QUENYA: Ui, nehtalde ar carir exi racine, ar ta hánoldar!

ENGLISH: For making the body skilled is beneficial for a few things, but reverence is beneficial for all things, since it has a promise for this life for and the coming life alike.
QUENYA: An carie i hroa finwa ná aşea nótime natalin, mal ainocimie ná aşea ilye natin, pan samis vanda coivie sinan ar i túlala coivien véla.

ENGLISH: In answer the man called Cleophas said to him: “Are you the only person dwelling in Jerusalem who does not know the things that have happened in it in these days?”
QUENYA: Hanquentasse i quén estaina Cleopas quente senna: “Ma nalye i erya quén márala Yerúsalemesse ye ua ista i nati yar amartier sasse mi auri sine?”

ENGLISH: When they saw the man that stood with them , he who received health, they had nothing to say against them .
QUENYA: Íre cennelte i nér ye tarne asette, sé ye camne mále, sámelte munta quetien ana tu.

ENGLISH: Then he led him up and showed him all the kingdoms of world in a single moment,
QUENYA: Tá se-tulyanes ama ar tanne sen ilye aranier ambaro mí erya lú,

ENGLISH: And Peter recalled which Jesus said: “Before a cock shall sound, you will deny me thrice!”
QUENYA: Ar Péter enyalde ya Yésus quente: 'Nó tocot lamyuva, ni-laluval nel!”

ENGLISH: for is written: «It is necessary for you to be holy, since I am holy.»
QUENYA: an ná técina: «Mauya len náve airi, pan inye aire ná.»

ENGLISH: As for us, our country exists in heaven, from where we also wait for a Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ,
QUENYA: Pa elve, nórelva ea menelde, yallo yando lertalve Rehton, i Heru Yésus Hristo,

QUENYA: Ulyanes úvea lesta fea sino venna, ter Yésus Hristo, Rehtolva.

ENGLISH: I have come forth from the Father and have come into the world. Furthermore, I go away from the world and go to the Father.
QUENYA: Etutúlien i Atarello ar utúlie mir i mar. Ente, autan i mardello ar mene i Atarenna.

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Whenever you pray, say: Father, let your name be holy. Let your kingdom come.
QUENYA: Tá quentes téna: “Quiquie hyamilde, queta: Atar, na aire esselya. Aranielya na tuluva.
