QUENYA: Ar quentes téna: “Síte rauco ua et-hátima hequa hyamiénen.”

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to them: “Pay back to the High King the High King's things, but God's things to God.” And they were in wonder concerning him.
QUENYA: Tá Yésus quente téna: “Á nampaitya i Ingaranen i Ingarano nati, mal Eruo nati Erun.” Ar anelte elmendasse pa se.

ENGLISH: Be awake and pray, or you will fall into temptation! For the spirit is eager, but the flesh is weak!”
QUENYA: Na coive ar hyama, hya lantuvalde mir úşahtie! An i faire mína ná, mal i hráve milya ná!”

ENGLISH: And some thought, since Judas had the money box, that Jesus said to him: “Buy that we have need of for the festival,” or that he was to give something to the poor.
QUENYA: An quelli sanner, pan Yúras sáme i tyelpecolca, i Yésus quente senna: “Vaca yaiva samilve maure i aşaren,” hya i antumnes nat i únain.

ENGLISH: For the one who says that he is in him it is necessary to walk as he walked.
QUENYA: Yen quete i náse sesse mauya vantie ve sé vantane.

ENGLISH: Therefore, my beloved, free from idol worship.
QUENYA: Etta, meldanyar, uşa cordontyermello!

ENGLISH: For I can to you being weak and in fear and in great trembling,
QUENYA: Ar túlen lenna nála milya ar cauresse ar túra papiesse,

ENGLISH: If you knew me, you knew also my Father. From this moment you know him and you have seen him.”
QUENYA: Qui sintelden, sintelde yando Atarinya. Lú sinallo istaldes ar ecénieldes.”

ENGLISH: Look at which is Israel in the manner of the flesh! Do not those that eat the sacrifices have a part with the altar?
QUENYA: Á yéta ya ná Israel mí lé i hráveo! Ma i matir i yancar uar same ranta as i yangwa?

ENGLISH: But now, in Jesus Christ, you that formerly were far away are now brought near, by the blood of the Christ.
QUENYA: Mal sí, mi Yésus Hristo, elde i yá náner haire nar sí talaine hari, i Hristo sercenen.

ENGLISH: But coming to Jesus they saw that he was already dead and did not break his legs.
QUENYA: Mal túlala Yésunna cennelte i anes nollo qualin ar uar rance telcoryat.

ENGLISH: For all among them gave out of their abundance, but she out of her need gave everything that she had, her entire livelihood.”
QUENYA: An illi mici té antaner et úveltallo, mal sé et maureryallo antane ilqua ya sámes, quanda laulestarya.”

ENGLISH: For they for a short time gave us chastisement, as was good in their eyes, but he does that since is is beneficial to us, for us to receive a share in his holiness.
QUENYA: An té ter şinta lúme antaner ven paimesta, ve náne mára mi hendulta, mal sé care ta pan nas aşea ven, camielvan ranta aireryasse.

ENGLISH: And he said to him: “Friend, how did you come in here without clothes of marriage?” He had nothing that he could say.
QUENYA: Ar quentes senna: “Málo, manen túlel minna sir ú lannion veryangweo?” Sámes munta ya poldes quete.

ENGLISH: and their mouth is full of cursing and of bitterness.
QUENYA: ar antolta ná quanta hútiéno ar sáriéno.

ENGLISH: But if anyone's heart is firm, not having need, but he has power over his own will and has made the choice in his own heart that her he will keep a virgin, he will do well.
QUENYA: Mal qui aiqueno enda tulca ná, lá arwa maureo, mal samis túre or véra nirmerya ar acárie i cilme véra endaryasse i hé hepuvas vende, caruvas mai.

ENGLISH: For I say to you : No one among the men that were invited will taste my supper!'”
QUENYA: An quetin lenna: Úquen imíca i neri i náner tultaine tyavuvar ahtumattinya!'”

ENGLISH: Like the body is dead without breath, so also faith without acts is dead.
QUENYA: Ve i hroa ná qualin ú ºúleo, sie yando savie ú cardaron ná qualin.

ENGLISH: And look, there was an uprising in the sea, covering the boat with the waves, but he was asleep.
QUENYA: Ar yé, enge túra amortale i earesse, túpala i lunte i falmainen, mal isse náne lorna.

ENGLISH: For the Father loves the Son and shows him everything that he does, and he shall show him deeds greater than these, that you will be in wonder.
QUENYA: An i Atar mele i Yondo ar tana sen ilqua ya sé care, ar sen-tanuvas cardali túre lá sine, i nauvalde elmendasse.

ENGLISH: But the sailors, seeking to escape from the ship, put the boat on the sea, saying that they were going to hang anchors from the prow.
QUENYA: Mal i ciryamor, cestala uşe i ciryallo, panyaner i lunte i earesse, quétala i lingumnelte ciryampali i langollo.

ENGLISH: But I have the witness that is greater than John’s, for the deeds that the Father has given me to complete – the deeds that I am doing – those deeds bear witness about me that my Father sent me.
QUENYA: Mal inye same i vettie ya ná túra lá Yohanneo, an i cardar yar ánie nin Atarinya telien – i cardar yar inye cára – sane cardar vettar pa ni i Atarinya mentane ni.

ENGLISH: But the righteousness that comes from believing speaks so: “Do not say in your heart: Who will go up into heaven?” – that is, to bring the Christ down –
QUENYA: Mal i failie ya tule saviello quete sie: “Áva queta endalyasse: Man ortuva mir menel?” – ta ná, talien i Hristo undu –

ENGLISH: The people to whom by oath he refused to come into his peace, who were they, if not that failed to heed his commands?
QUENYA: I queni in vandanen váquentes tule mir sérerya, man anelte, qui lá i loitaner cime canwaryar?

ENGLISH: Then the chief priest tore his garments, saying: “He has blasphemed! What further need for witnesses do we have? Behold! You have heart the blasphemy.
QUENYA: Tá i héra airimo narcane larmaryar, quétala: “Naiequéties! Mana an maure astarmoiva samilve? Yé! Ahlárielde i i naiquetie.

ENGLISH: But woe to you, o Pharisees, since you give the tenth part of the mint and of the rue and of every vegetable, but you pass over the justice and the love for God! These things were necessary for you to do, without passing over the others.
QUENYA: Mal horro len, a Farisar, pan antalde i quaista ranta i minto ar i laiquelisso ar ilya queo, mal langalde i failie ar i melme Eruva! Nati sine mauyaner len care, ú lengiéno i exi.

ENGLISH: When they pursue you in this city, flee to another, for truly I say to you: By no means will you complete the circuit of the cities of Israel before the Son of Man shall come.
QUENYA: Íre roitalte le osto sinasse, uşa hyananna, an násie quetin lenna: Laume telyuvalde i rinde ostoron Israélo nó i Atanyondo tuluva.

ENGLISH: And he took it down and wrapped it with linen, and he put him in a carved-out tomb in the rock, in which no one had lain before.
QUENYA: Ar nampeses undu ar vaitane sa páşenen, ar se-panyanes hrótanoirisse i ondosse, yasse úquen náne caitienwa nóvo.

ENGLISH: but we will still give yourselves to the praying and to the service of the Word.”
QUENYA: mal elme en antauvar imme i hyamien ar i núromolien i Quetto.”

ENGLISH: But so as not to take more of your time, I ask of you that you will listen to us briefly, gracious as you are.
QUENYA: Mal lá mapien amba lúmelyo, arcan lyenna i me-lastuval şintave, raina ve nalye.

ENGLISH: Then there was great clamour, and some scribes that were of the party of the Pharisees arose and said in dispute: “We do not find evil in this man. What if a spirit has indeed spoken to him, or an angel?”
QUENYA: Tá enge hoa yalme, ar parmangolmoli i náner i ranto i Farisaron oronter ar quenter costesse: “Ualme hire ulco mi nér sina. Mana qui faire é equétie senna, hya vala?”

ENGLISH: For every tree is known by its fruit. For people do not gather figs from thorns; furthermore, they do not cut grapes from a thorn-bush.
QUENYA: An ilya alda ná sinwa yáveryanen. An queni uar hosta rélyávi necelillon; ente, ualte cire tiumar ho neceltussa.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Who among you, if his son or his ox falls into a well, does not pull him up on the day of rest?”
QUENYA: Ar quentes téna: “Man mici le, qui yondorya hya mundorya lanta mir tampo, ua tucuva se ama i sendaresse?”

ENGLISH: They said: “Moses allowed the writing of a letter of dismissal and that one divorces her .”
QUENYA: Quentelte: “Móses láve i tecie tecettava aumentiéva ar i mo lehta inse sello.”

ENGLISH: And when he came there, he went in the same moment to Jesus and said to him: “Rabbi” – and he kissed him.
QUENYA: Ar íre túles tar, lendes mi imya lú Yésunna ar quente senna: “Rappi” – ar minqueses.

ENGLISH: Festus, who wanted to receive the good will of the Jews, answered Paul: “Do you want to go up to Jerusalem to be judged there before me concerning these matters?”
QUENYA: Festo, ye merne came i mára nirme i Yúraron, hanquente Paulonna: “Ma meril lelya ama Yerúsalemenna náven námina tasse epe ni pa nattor sine?”

ENGLISH: Everyone who separates himself from his wife and gets married to another, violates marriage, and who gets married to a woman divorsed from her husband, violates marriage.
QUENYA: Ilquen ye cilta inse veriryallo ar verya exenna, race vestale, ar ye verya nissenna ciltaina veruryallo, race vestale.

ENGLISH: But I say, brothers: Flesh and blood cannot be heir of God's kingdom; furthermore, that which is destructible will not possess that which is beyond destruction.
QUENYA: Mal quetin, hánor: Hráve yo serce uat pole náve aryon araniéno Eruo; ente, ya nancárima ná ua haryuva ta ya han nancarie ná.

ENGLISH: Keep yourselves from being causes of stumbling, to Jews and Greeks and God's congregation alike,
QUENYA: Hepa inde návello castar taltiéva, Yúrain ar Hellenyain ar Eruo ocomben véla,

ENGLISH: to establish a plan that he would make real when the time was ready, to gather together all things in Christ – the things in heaven and the things on earth – by him.
QUENYA: tulcie pano ya carumnes anwa íre i lú náne manwa, hostien uo ilye nati i Hristosse – i nati menelde ar i nati cemende – sénen.

ENGLISH: Thus the Law instructed us and led us to Christ, for us to be made just by faith.
QUENYA: Sie i Şanye vi-peantane ar vi-tulyane Hristonna, návelvan cárine faile saviénen.

ENGLISH: He also showed us your love, by spirit.
QUENYA: Yando tannes men melmelda, fairenen.

ENGLISH: Then, when the day was fading, the twelve came to him and said to him: “Send the crowd away, for them to go into the villages and fields around us, to find a place to remain and food, for here we are in a lonely place.”
QUENYA: Tá, íre i aure náne fifírula, i yunque túler senna ar quenter senna: “Á menta i şanga oa, menieltan mir i mastor ar restar os vi, hirien nóme lemien ar matso, an sisse nalve eressea nómesse.”

ENGLISH: After these days we prepared and went on our journey to Jerusalem.
QUENYA: Apa auri sine manwanelme ar lender lendalmasse Yerúsalemenna.

ENGLISH: And reaching out with his hand Jesus touched him, saying: “I want to! Be cleansed!” And in the same moment the skin-disease disappeared from him.
QUENYA: Ar eterahtala máryanen Yésus se-appane, quétala: “Merin! Na poitaina!” Ar mí imya lú i helmahlíve váne sello.

ENGLISH: But the helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father shall send in my name, he will teach you all things and will make you remember everything that I told you.
QUENYA: Mal i şámo, i Aire Fea, ye i Atar mentuva essenyanen, sé peantuva len ilye nati ar tyaruva le enyale ilqua ya nyarnen len.

ENGLISH: May a man account us as Christ's servants, managing God's mysteries.
QUENYA: Nai atan vi-notuva ve Hristo núror, mahtala Eruo fóli.

ENGLISH: And I saw a strong angel who cried out with a mighty voice: “Who is worthy of opening the book and of breaking its seals?”
QUENYA: Ar cennen polda vala ye yáme taura ómanen: “Man ná valda pantiéno i parma ar raciéno lihtaryar?”

ENGLISH: And in the same manner, these people are the ones sown on the rock: In the moment that they hear the word, they receive it with joy.
QUENYA: Ar mí imya lé, queni sine nar i rérinar i ondosse: Mí lú ya ahlárielte i quetta, camiltes arwe alasseo.

ENGLISH: he put him away and raised up David son of Jesse to be king, about whom he also said as a witness: I have found David son of Jesse a man according to my heart, who will do my entire will.
QUENYA: panyanes hé oa ar ortane Lavir Yessaion náven aran, pa ye yú quentes ve vettie: Ihírien Lavir Yessaion nér ve endanya, ye caruva quanda indómenya.

ENGLISH: Seeing this man lie there, and knowing that already he was ill for a long time, Jesus said to him: “Do you want good health?”
QUENYA: Cénala nér sina caitea tasse, ar istala i nollo anes hlaiwa anda lúmesse, Yésus quente senna: “Ma meril mále?”

ENGLISH: and saying: «Where is this return of which he gave promise? For our fathers are dead, but everything is still as it has been from the beginning of creation.»
QUENYA: ar quétala: «Masse sina entulesse pa ya ánes vanda? An atarilmar nar qualini, mal ilqua ná ena ve anaies ontiéno yestallo.»

ENGLISH: Therefore my heart was glad and my tongue spoke about great joy. Furthermore, also my flesh will dwell in hope,
QUENYA: Etta endanya náne valima ar lambanya quente pa túra alasse. Ente, yú hrávenya maruva estelde,

ENGLISH: This matter became known to all in Joppa, and numerous ones believed in the Lord.
QUENYA: Natto sina olle sinwa illin Yoppasse, ar rimbali sáver i Herusse.

ENGLISH: But by the same word the heaven and earth that exist now are destined for fire and are reserved for the day of judgement, in which men hostile to God will be destroyed.
QUENYA: Mal i imya quettanen i menel cemenye yat eat sí nát martyaine ruiven ar nát sátine i auren námiéva, yasse atani cotye Erun nauvar nancarne.

ENGLISH: Or do you not suppose that I can make petition to my Father, for him to send me in this moment over twelve legions of angels?
QUENYA: Hya ual intya i lertan arca Atarinyanna, mentaveryan ninna lú sinasse or lehióni yunque valion?

ENGLISH: Therefore you be strengthened, my child, by the grace that is by Christ Jesus.
QUENYA: Etta alye na turyaina, hinya, i lissenen ya ea Hristo Yésunen.

ENGLISH: The commandments you know: Do not kill, do not commit adultery , do not steal, do not speak untrue witness, do not be false, give glory to your father and to your mother.”
QUENYA: I axani istal: Áva nahta, áva care vestaracie, áva pile, áva quete únanwa vettie, áva na ñauna, á anta alcar atarelyan yo amillelyan.”

ENGLISH: Some cried one thing and others another thing, and the greater number did not know the reason by which they were assembled.
QUENYA: Ennoli yámer er nat ar exeli hyana nat, ar i amarimbar mici te uar sinte i casta yanen anelte ocómiéla.

ENGLISH: You men, love your wives and do not be bitterly angry towards them.
QUENYA: A neri, mela verildar ar áva na sárave rúşie téna.

QUENYA: ar Salmon óne Voas as Ráhav, ar Voas óne Óver as Rút, ar Óver óne Yesse,

ENGLISH: But that are on the good soil, they are that hear the word with a good and beautiful heard and keep it and make fruit by steadfastness.

ENGLISH: By the Holy Spirit David himself said: “The Lord said to my lord: 'Sit beside my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.'
QUENYA: I Aire Feanen Lavir immo quente: “I Héru quente herunyanna: 'Hama ara formanya tenna panyan ñottolyar nu talulyat.'

ENGLISH: And they gave him a piece of broiled fish,
QUENYA: Ar antanelte sen ranta aptaina lingwiva,

ENGLISH: For I judge that in nothing I fall short of the most lofty apostles.
QUENYA: An namin i muntasse loitan i antare aposteli.

ENGLISH: Indeed also that have died in Christ perished.
QUENYA: É yú i aquálier Hristosse váner.

ENGLISH: And he found in the temple those who sold oxen and sheep and doves and the money-changers on their seats.
QUENYA: Ar hirnes i cordasse i vancer mundor ar mámar ar cucuar ar i quaptandor hammaltassen.

ENGLISH: By this reason the Father loves me, since I give my life, that I can receive it again.
QUENYA: Sina castanen i Atar mele ni, pan antan coivienya, i encamuvanyes.

ENGLISH: While Peter was still very uncertain about what the vision that he had seen signified, behold! the men sent by Cornelius stood before the gate after asking their way to the house of Simon.
QUENYA: Íre Péter en náne ita iltanca pa mana i maur ya cennelyanes tenge, yé! i neri mentane lo Cornelio tarner epe i ando apa maquetie tielta i coanna Símonwa.

ENGLISH: But when he came out he could not speak to them, and they perceived that he saw a vision in the sanctuary, and he made gestures to them, still being dumb.
QUENYA: Mal íre ettúles uas polle carpa téna, ar túnelte i cennes maur i yánasse, ar carnes hwermeli tien, en nála úpa.

ENGLISH: For he is counted worthy of a glory greater than that of Moses, since who has built a house has an honor greater that which the house has.
QUENYA: An sé ná nótina valda alcaro túra lá ta Móseo, pan ye acarastie coa same laitie túra lá ya i coa same.

QUENYA: Íre hlasselme si, elme ar i marner tasse véla arcaner sello: “Áva lelya ama Yerúsalemenna!”

ENGLISH: Do not feel wonder about this, because the hour is coming when all that are in the tombs shall hear his voice
QUENYA: Áva fele elmenda pa si, pan i lúme túla yasse illi i ear i noirissen hlaruvar ómarya

QUENYA: Ono Yésus carampe ar quente lan peantanes i cordasse: “Manen ná i quetir i parmangolmor: 'I Hristo ná Laviro yondo' – ?

ENGLISH: What, then, is Apollos? Indeed what is Paul? Some servants by whom you believed, every person as the Lord allowed him.
QUENYA: Mana, tá, Apollo? É mana Paulo? Núror inen sávelde, ilya quén ve i Heru láve sen.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when Pilate heard this saying, he was more frightened,
QUENYA: Etta, íre Piláto hlasse quetie sina, anes ambe ruhtaina,

ENGLISH: And now you know that is keeping him restrained, for him to be revealed at his own time.
QUENYA: Ar sí istalde ya hépa se hampa, náveryan apantaina véra lúmeryasse.

ENGLISH: Then he came to Derbe and also to Lystra. And behold! was there a disciple whose name was Timothy, the son of a believing Jewish woman, but of a Greek father.
QUENYA: Tá túles Lervenna ar yú Listranna. Ar yé! enge tasse hildo yeo esse náne Timoşeo, i yondo savila Yúra nisso, mal Hellenya ataro.

ENGLISH: They said to her: “You are out of your mind!” But she said forcefully that so it was . They said: “It is his angel.”
QUENYA: Quentelte senna: “Nalye ettesse sámalyo!” Mal quentes veassenen i sie ea. Quentelte: “Valarya ná.”

ENGLISH: He said: “Who are you, Lord?” He said: “I Jesus, whom you persecute!
QUENYA: Eques: “Man nalye, Heru?” Eques: “Inye Yésus, ye elye roita!

ENGLISH: By this all shall know that you are my disciples, if you have love among yourselves.”
QUENYA: Sinen illi istuvar i nalde hildonyar, qui samilde melme mici inde.”

ENGLISH: In all times and places, mighty Felix, we receive those with greatest thanks.
QUENYA: Mi ilye lúmi ar nómi, taura Felix, camilme tai antúra hantalénen.

ENGLISH: Looking at them, Jesus said: “To men it is impossible, but to God all things are possible!”
QUENYA: Yétala te, Yésus quente: “Atanin nas úcárima, mal Erun ilye nati nar cárime!”

ENGLISH: giving them understanding and showing that it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and rise from dead, and he said: “This is the Christ, this Jesus that I make known to you.”

ENGLISH: For we by spirit look forward to the righteousness by faith concerning which we have hope.
QUENYA: An elme fairenen yétar ompa i failienna saviénen pa ya samilme estel.

ENGLISH: For anyone who is ashamed over me and over my word, over him the Son of Man will be ashamed when he shall come in his glory and in the Father's and the holy angels' glory.

ENGLISH: in order to stop the body from being split, but it is necessary for its parts to heed the others like they heed themselves.

QUENYA: Tá Yésus quente senna: “Síra rehtie utúlie coa sinanna, an yando sé ná Avraham yondo.

ENGLISH: Here is need of the faithfulness of the holy ones, those who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus.”
QUENYA: Sís ea maure i voronwiéva i airion, i hepir i axani Eruo ar i savie Yésuo.”

QUENYA: Ar i attea túle, quétala: “Minalya, heru, carne minar lempe!”

QUENYA: Ar i valanna i ocombeo Şiatírasse teca: Sin quete i Eruion, ye same henyat ve uruite ruine, ar talyat ve urus:

ENGLISH: And yet the Highest does not dwell in houses made with hands, like the prophet says:
QUENYA: Ananta i Antara ua mare coassen cárine mainen, ve i Erutercáno quete:

ENGLISH: The sting of death is sin, but the power of sin is the Law.

QUENYA: Ar apa yaldes pitya hína insenna, se-tyarnes tare i endesse

ENGLISH: Therefore put away every filthiness and evil, for there is no need for evil. Gently receive the implanting of the word which can save your souls!
QUENYA: Etta á panya oa ilya soa ar ulco, an ua ea maure ulcuva. Moicave cama i empanie i quettava ya pole rehta fealdar!

ENGLISH: This answer I give to that examine me:
QUENYA: Hanquenta sina antan in hentar ni:

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you that anyone who says to this mountain: 'Be lifted up and thrown into sea!', and he is not uncertain in his heart but believes that what he is saying will happen, for him it will happen.

ENGLISH: And he answered and said: “Have faith in God.

ENGLISH: For you know well that the Lord's day will come like a thief in the night.

ENGLISH: Simon, whom he also called Peter, and Andrew his brother, and Jacob and John, and Phillip and Bartholomew
QUENYA: Símon, ye yando estanes Péter, ar Andréo hánorya, ar Yácov and Yoháno, ar Filip ar Varşoloméo

ENGLISH: Indeed I know how to suffer lack, indeed I know how to have abundance. In everything and all conditions I have learnt the secret – how to be full and how to be hungry alike, how to have abundance and how to suffer lack.
QUENYA: É istan manen perpere penie, é istan manen same úve. Mi ilqua ar ilye sómar apárien i fóle – manen náve quanta ar manen náve maita véla, manen same úve ar manen perpere penie.

ENGLISH: was given to them to torment them for five months, but not to kill them, and their torment was like the torment of a scorpion, when it stings somebody.

ENGLISH: They are the ones causing splits, men like animals, lacking spirit.

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to him: “Nobody who has put his hand on the plough and looks at the things that lie behind him, is fit for God's kingdom.”
QUENYA: Ono Yésus quente senna: “Úquén ye apánie márya i hyaresse ar yéta i nati yar caita ca se, ná mára Eruo aranien.

ENGLISH: See that nobody pays for evil with evil, but always pursue what is good, one for the other, and for all.
QUENYA: Cena i uquen paitya ulcun ulcunen, mal illume á roita ya mára ná, quén i exen, ar illin.

ENGLISH: After he went out to the gate, another maiden noticed him and said that were there: “This man was with Jesus from Nazareth!”
QUENYA: Apa lendes ettenna i andonna, hyana vende túne se ar quente innar enger tasse: “Nér sina náne as Yésus Nasaretello!”

ENGLISH: But these things I have spoken to you that, when their time comes, you will recall that I told you about them. These things I did not say to you from the beginning, since I was with you.

ENGLISH: and in that moment he called them. And they left their father in the boat with the paid men and went away after him.

ENGLISH: But though he wanted to kill him, he feared the crowd, for they thought about him as a prophet.
QUENYA: Mal ómu mernes nahta se, runces i şangallo, an sannes pa se ve Erutercáno.

ENGLISH: For I received from the Lord what I also let you receive from me: that in the night when he was given over, the Lord Jesus took a bread,

ENGLISH: But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
QUENYA: Mal Yésus lende Orontenna Milpioron.

ENGLISH: I know your deeds and your labour and your faithfulness, and that you cannot bear evil people, and that you have tried who say that they are apostles, but are not, and you have found that they lie.

ENGLISH: And thus, after Abraham showed patience, he received this promise.
QUENYA: Ar sie, apa Avraham tanne cóle, camnes vanda sina.

ENGLISH: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that slays the prophets and stones those that are sent to her – how frequently I wished to gather your children, as a hen gathers her young under her wings ! But you did not want to.
QUENYA: Yerúsalem, Yerúsalem, ye nahta i Erutercánor ar sarya i nar mentaine senna – manen rimbave mernen comya hínalyar, ve poroce comya nessaryar nu rámaryat! Mal ualde merne.

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to him: “Fellow, what is your reason for coming?” Then they came forward and laid hand on Jesus and took him into custody.
QUENYA: Mal Yésus quente senna: “Málo, mana castalya tulien?” Tá túlelte ompa ar panyaner má Yésusse ar nampe se mir mando.

ENGLISH: And he opened his eyes in Mandos , where he existed in torments, and he saw Abraham far away and Lazarus in his bosom.
QUENYA: Ar latyanes henyat mi Mandos, yasse enges ñwalmelissen, ar cennes Avraham haiya ar Lásaro sumaryasse.

ENGLISH: and through generations and generations his mercy is upon that love him.
QUENYA: ar ter nónaréli ar nónaréli oravierya ea issen melir se.

ENGLISH: As the last the woman died.
QUENYA: Ve i métima i nís qualle.

ENGLISH: I had many things to write to you , and yet I do not want to write to you with ink and with pen.
QUENYA: Sámen rimbe natali tecien lyenna, ananta uan mere tece lyenna móronen ar tecilden.

ENGLISH: When anyone hears the word of the kingdom but does not understand it, the Wicked One comes and snatches away what has been sown in his heart; this is which was sown by the road.
QUENYA: Íre aiquen hlare i quetta i araniéno mal ua hanya sa, i Olca tule ar rapa oa ya anaie rérina endaryasse; si ná ye náne rérina ara i malle.

ENGLISH: But when morning came, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples did not understand that he was Jesus.
QUENYA: Mal íre arin túle, Yésus tarne i fárasse, ono i hildor uar hanyane i anes Yésus.

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom,
QUENYA: Tá quentes téna: “Nóre ortuva nórenna ar aranie aranienna,

ENGLISH: Behold! I send you like sheep among wolves. Therefore be intelligent like serpents and guiltless like doves.
QUENYA: Yé! Mentan le ve mámar mici ñarmor. Etta na hande ve leucar ar cámalóre ve cucuar.

ENGLISH: were seven sons of a man called Sceva, a Jewish high priest, that did so.
QUENYA: Enger yondor otso nero estaina Sceva, Yúra héra airimo, i carner sie.

ENGLISH: For the Son of Man is Lord of the day of rest!”
QUENYA: An i Atanyondo ná Heru i sendareo!”

ENGLISH: A good tree cannot bear worthless fruit; in the same manner, a rotten tree cannot bear good fruit.
QUENYA: Mára alda ua pole cole úmirwa yáve; mi imya lé, quelexima alda ua pole cole mára yáve.

ENGLISH: But also the hairs of your head are all counted. Do not fear; you are more precious than many sparrows.
QUENYA: Mal yando careldo findi nar illi nótine. Áva ruce; nalde mirwe lá rimbe filici.

ENGLISH: In answer he said to them: “It is necessary for the man who has two tunics, to give one to the person that does not have, and it is necessary for who has things to eat to do the same.”
QUENYA: Hanquentasse quentes téna: “Mauya i neren ye same laupe atta, anta er i quenen ye ua same, ar mauya yen same natali matien care i imya.”

QUENYA: Tá Péter carampe, quétala: “Yé, ehehtielme ilqua ar ihílier lyé. Mana, nanwave, euva men?”

QUENYA: Quentes senna: “Alye mele i Héru Ainolya quanda endalyanen ar quanda fealyanen ar quanda sámalyanen.

ENGLISH: “These things that you behold – days will come when stone will not remain upon a stone that will not be thrown down.”

QUENYA: Yésus sina Eru enortane, pa ya illi mici me nar astarmor.

ENGLISH: Beloved, do, not according to what is evil, but according to that which is good. who does good is of God. who does evil has not seen God.

ENGLISH: For my yoke is gentle, and my burden light.

ENGLISH: Sanctify them with truth; your word is truth.
QUENYA: Áte airita i nanwiénen; quettatya nanwie ná.

ENGLISH: continual fights among men corrupted in their minds, from whom the truth has been stolen, since they think about reverence as a path to gain.

ENGLISH: Their feet are swift to pour out blood.

ENGLISH: But recall the former days, in which, after you received the light, you suffered a great fight, having difficulties.
QUENYA: Mal enyala i noe auri, yassen, apa camnelde i cala, perpérelde túra mahtie, arwe urdiéli.

ENGLISH: But now when faith has come, we are no more under an instructor.
QUENYA: Mal sí íre savie utúlie, ualve ambe nu peantar.

ENGLISH: Let the Christ, king of Israel, come down from the cross that we can see and believe ”. Also those who were crucified with him blasphemed against him.

ENGLISH: who loves his life will destroy it, but who hates his life in this world will protect it for eternal life.

QUENYA: Apa oantes talo túles mir yomencoalta.

ENGLISH: May the Lord of peace himself give you peace always, in every manner. May the Lord be with you!
QUENYA: Nai i Heru raineva immo antuva len raine illume, mi ilya lé. Nai i Heru euva aselde!

ENGLISH: Recall the wife of Lot!
QUENYA: Enyala Loto veri!

ENGLISH: firmly keeping the faithful word of his teaching, so that it is possible for him to urge by the beneficial teaching and also rebuke those that speak against him.
QUENYA: tancave hepila i voronda quetta peantieryasse, ecien sen horta i aşea peantiénen ar yando naitya i quetir ana se.

QUENYA: Tasse hirnes nér estaina Éneas, ye cainelyane tulmaryasse loassen tolto, pan anes úlévima.

ENGLISH: who believes in the Son of God possesses the witness within himself. who does not believe in God has made him a liar, since he has not believed the witness that he has given about his Son.

QUENYA: Mal Piláto quente i hére airimonnar ar i şangannar: “Uan hire ongwe atan sinasse.”

ENGLISH: Beloved ones, let us love one another, since love is of God, and everyone who loves is born of God and knows God.
QUENYA: Meldar, alve mele quén i exe, pan melme ná Eruo, ar ilquen ye mele ná nóna Eruo ar ista Eru.

ENGLISH: But who is rich in this world and sees his brother having need, and yet he shuts the door of his compassion to him – how does God love remain in him?
QUENYA: Mal ye ná lára mar sinasse ar cene hánorya arwa maureo, ananta holtas i fenna ofelmeryo sen – manen Eruo melme lemya sesse?

ENGLISH: You know the commandments: Do not violate marriage. Do not kill. Do not steal. Do not witness with a lie. Give glory to your fatehr and to your mother.”
QUENYA: Istal i canwar: Áva race vestale. Áva nahta. Áva pile. Áva vetta hurunen. Á anta alcar atarelyan ar amillelyan.”

QUENYA: Sie savie tule ho ta ya mo hlare, ar ta ya mo hlare tule i quetiénen pa Hristo.

ENGLISH: Do not love the world or that are in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love for the Father is not in him,
QUENYA: Áva mele i mar hya yar ear i mardesse. Qui aiquen mele i mar, i melme i Atarwa lá ea sesse,

ENGLISH: for to whom the Lord loves, he gives chastiment, and he flays everyone that he receives as son."
QUENYA: an yen i Héru mele, antas paimesta, an ripis ilquen ye camis ve yondo."

ENGLISH: But they do not have root in themselves, but remain for a time; then, as soon as tribulation or persecution happens by the word, they fall away.

QUENYA: I nís quente senna: “Heru, ánin anta nén sina, i lá nauvan soica ar lá mauyuva nin tule sinomenna calpien.”

ENGLISH: And he said: “Abba, Father, all things are possible to you; take away this cup from me! And yet not which I want, but which you want!
QUENYA: Ar eques: “Appa, Atar, ilye nati nar cárime tyen; á mapa oa yulma sina nillo! Ananta lá ya inye mere, mal ya tyé mere.”

QUENYA: Mal i Heru quente senna: “Sí, a Farisar! Poitalde i ette i yulmo ar veneo, mal mityaldasse nalde quante pilweo ar olciéno.

QUENYA: Ve rongo ve i yáve ná manwa, i nér menta i circa, pan i yávie utúlie.”

QUENYA: Áva name, lá náven námine,

ENGLISH: But they will do these things since they do not know either the Father or me.

QUENYA: Íre túles i hyana fáranna, mir i nóre i Araryaron, nér atta haryaine lo raucoli vellet se, túlala et i noirillon, ita verce. Etta úquen sáme i huore cilien tana malle.

ENGLISH: For you have had sufficient time in the past having such a life that people of the nations choose, walking in loose behavior, in lust, drinking wine in abundance, having wild parties, overdrinking, and worshiping idols.
QUENYA: An asámielde fárea lúme i vanwiesse arwe taite coiviéno ya queni i nórion cilir, vantala lehta lengiesse, mailesse, súcala limpe úvesse, arwe hravani merendion, accasúcala, ar tyérala cordoni.

ENGLISH: When the Pharisees heard how he stopped the mouth of the Sadducees, they gathered together.
QUENYA: Íre i Farisar hlasser manen pustanes anto i Sandúcearon, ocomnelte uo.

ENGLISH: But God raised the Lord and will also raise us by his might.
QUENYA: Mal Eru ortane i Heru ar yú ortauva vé melehteryanen.

ENGLISH: And when he came into the city, he went through Jericho.
QUENYA: Ar íre túles mir i osto, lendes ter Yerico.

ENGLISH: Again they came into Capernaum. While he was in the house he asked them: “About what did you have a dispute on the road?”
QUENYA: Ar túlelte mir Capernaum. Lan anes i coasse maquentes téna: “Pa mana sámelde cos i mallesse?”

ENGLISH: O thrawn ones, uncircumcized in heart and ears, you always stand against the Holy Spirit; like your fathers, so also you!
QUENYA: A nornar, úoscírine mi enda ar hlaru, tarilde illume i Aire Feanna – tambe atarildar, síve yú elde!

ENGLISH: Then I saw the seven angels that stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.
QUENYA: Tá cennen i vali otso i tarir epe Eru, ar hyólar otso náner tien antane.

ENGLISH: this man, as a person given over, by God's firm plan and the knowledge that he had beforehand, you fastened on a cross by the hand of lawless ones and killed him.

ENGLISH: for he received the urgency, and since he set out with great vigor , he is going to you by his own choice.
QUENYA: an camnes i hortale, ar pan horyanes ole, ménas lenna véra cilmeryanen.

QUENYA: Ar Isaia yame pa Israel: “Ómu Israelindion nóte ná ve earo litse, rie pitya lemyala ranta nauva rehtana.

ENGLISH: And falling on their knees before him they spoke to him with scorn, saying: “Hail, king of the Jews!”
QUENYA: Ar lantala occaltanta epe se carampelte senna yaiwenen, quétala: “Aiya, aran Yúraron!”

ENGLISH: And just as we have borne the image of the person made of dust, we shall also bear the heavenly person's image.
QUENYA: Ar aqua ve ocólielve i emma i queno carna astova, coluvalve yú i meneldea queno emma. TIL HIT

ENGLISH: but from every nation he receives well the person that fears him and does righteousness.
QUENYA: mal ilya nórello camis mai i quén ye ruce sello ar care failie.

ENGLISH: and my spirit is in joy by God my Savior,
QUENYA: ar fairenya ná mi alasse Eru Rehtonyanen,

QUENYA: Ar nampes yulma, ar apa antave hantale sa-antanes tien, quétala: “Suca et sallo, illi mici le!

ENGLISH: But I am telling you the truth: It is beneficial for you that I am going away. For if I do not go away, the Helper will by no means come to you, but if I go away, I will send him to you.
QUENYA: Mal nyáran len i nanwie: Ná len aşea i autean. An qui uan auta, i Şámo laume tuluva lenna, mal qui autan, mentuvanyes lenna.

ENGLISH: And Judas and Silas, since also they were prophets, urged the brothers with many words and strengthened them.
QUENYA: Ar Yúras ar Sílas, pan yú tú nánet Erutercánor, hortaner i hánor rimbe quettalínen ar turyaner te.

ENGLISH: But they found the stone rolled away from the grave, and when they went inside, they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: Mal hirnelte i ondo peltaina oa i noirillo, ar íre lendelte minna, ualte hire i Heru Yésus Hristo hroa.

ENGLISH: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all among you!
QUENYA: Nai Herulva Yésus Hristo lisse euva as illi mici le!

ENGLISH: But we that are of the day, let us keep our keenness of perception, bearing the breastplate of faith and of love, and as a helmet, the hope of salvation.
QUENYA: Mal elve i nar i aureo, alve hepe laicelva, colila i ambasse saviéva ar melmeva, ar ve cassa, i estel rehtiéva.

ENGLISH: He is like a person building a house, who dug and put the foundation upon the rock. Therefore, when was flood, the river beat against that house, but it could not shake it, since it was well built.
QUENYA: Náse ve quén carastala coa, ye sampe ar panyane i talma i ondosse. Etta, íre enge oloire, i síre palpane sana coanna, mal uas polle pale sa, pan anes mai carastaina.

ENGLISH: who are by the road are the people in whom the word is sown, but when they hear it, Satan comes in the same moment and takes away the word that was sown in them.

ENGLISH: But Paul said, defending himself: “Against the Law or against the Jews or against the High King alike I have not done a single sin.”
QUENYA: Mal Paulo quente, varyala inse: “Ana i Şanye hya ana i Yúrar hya ana i Ingaran véla uan acárie erya úcare.”

ENGLISH: In him you were also circumcised with a circumcision which is not by hands or takes flesh away from the body – by the circumcision of the Christ.
QUENYA: Mi sé anelde yando oscírine osciriénen ya ua mainen hya mapa hráve oa i hroallo – i osciriénen i Hristo.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, if we have died with Christ, we believe that we will also live with him.
QUENYA: Ente, qui aquálielve as Hristo, savilve i yú coituvalve óse.

ENGLISH: For false Christs and false prophets will rise up and will give great signs and wonders, to cause also the chosen ones to stray, if that was possible.
QUENYA: An huruhristoli ar hurutercánoli ortuvar ar antauvar túre tanwali ar elmendali, tyarien yando i cílinar ranya, qui tá náne cárima.

ENGLISH: I want to remind you, though you know everything once and for always: The Lord, after saving a people out of Egypt, thereafter destroyed the ones that did not believe.
QUENYA: Merin renta le, ómu istalde ilqua er lú illumen: I Héru, apa rehtie lie et Mirrandorello, epeta nancarne i uar sáve.

ENGLISH: It is necessary for me to praise myself. It is not beneficial, but now I shall come to visions and revelations of the Lord.
QUENYA: Mauya nin laita imne. Uas aşea, mal sí tuluvan ceniennar ar apantiennar i Heruva.

ENGLISH: But all among them seized Sosthenes the synagogue ruler and beat him before the judgement seat. But Gallio gave heed to none of these things.
QUENYA: Ono illi mici te namper Sostenes i yomencoantur ar palpaner se epe i námosonda. Mal Allio cimne munta sine nation.

ENGLISH: But when the chief priests and the elders said that he had done crimes, he did not answer.
QUENYA: Mal íre i hére airimor ar i amyárar quenter i carnelyanes ongweli, uas hanquente.

ENGLISH: When an unclean spirit comes out from a man, it passes through dry places seeking a place of rest, but it does not find .
QUENYA: Íre úpoica faire ettule nerello, lahtas ter parce nómi cestala nóme séreva, mal uas hire.

ENGLISH: Put a widowed woman on the list if she has years not under sixty , wife of a single husband,
QUENYA: Á panya verulóra nís i témasse qui samis loar lá nu enequean, veri erya veruo,

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: Anyone who does not receive God's kingdom as a child , will by no means come into it.”
QUENYA: Násie quetin lenna: Aiquen ye ua came Eruo aranie ve hína, laume tuluva mir sa.”

ENGLISH: If anyone wants to serve me, let him follow me, and where I am, there my servant will be also.
QUENYA: Qui aiquen mere veuya ni, lava sen hilya ni, ar yasse inye ea, tasse yando núronya euva.

ENGLISH: But we, brothers, when you were away from us for a short time – in person, not in heart – we tried with still greater vigour to see your face, by a great desire.
QUENYA: Ono elme, hánor, íre anelde oa mello şinta lúmesse – mi quén, lá mi enda – névelme en ambe túra veassenen cene cendelelda, túra írenen.

ENGLISH: And he made a consideration in his mind, saying: 'What am I to do, now when I lack a place where I can gather my harvest?'
QUENYA: Ar carnes úvie sámaryasse, quétala: 'Mana caruvan, sí ire penin nóme yasse polin hosta yávienya?'

ENGLISH: And this is the love: that we walk according to his commandments. That is the commandment, as you heard from the beginning, in order to walk in it.
QUENYA: Ar si ná i melme: i vantalve ve axanyar. Ta ná i axan, ve ahlárielde i yestallo, vantien sasse.

ENGLISH: and all my things are yours and yours are mine, and I have been glorified among them.

QUENYA: Mal ho Miletus mentanes Efesusenna ar tultane i amyárar i ocombeo.

QUENYA: Ar íre i lúme túle, mentanes mól i alamonnar, antieltan sen i yáveo i tarwallo liantassion. Mal i alamor, apa palpie se, mentaner se oa lusta.

QUENYA: Tá Paulo hanquente: “Mana cáralde, yaimie ar rácala endanya? An inye manwa ná, lá rie náven nútina, mal yú qualien Yerúsalemesse i essen i Heru Yésuo.”

ENGLISH: I am humbled saying that we have been too weak to do that!
QUENYA: Nanye nucumna quétala i elme anaier acca milye carien ta!

ENGLISH: And yet you do have this, that you hate the doings of the Nicolaitans, which also I loathe.
QUENYA: Ananta é samil si, i tevil i cardar i Nicolaiyaron, yar yú inye teve.

QUENYA: Íre anes yálina, Tertullo yestane carpa ana se, quétala: “Túra raine samilme ter lyé, ar envinyatiéli martar nóre sinasse apacenelyanen!

ENGLISH: Only Luke remains with me.
QUENYA: Rie Lúcas lemya óni.

ENGLISH: For the king understands these things, he to whom I am speaking with boldness, for I am certain that nothing of this escapes his notice, for this thing has not been done in a corner.

ENGLISH: He was faithful to the one who made him so, as was also Moses in all the house of that Person.

ENGLISH: You have heard that is said: Love your neighbor and hate your enemy!
QUENYA: Ahlárielde i ná quétaina: Mela armarolya ar teva ñottolya!

ENGLISH: Being greedy, they will use you for their own gain, with lying words. But their judgement from of old does not move slowly, and their destruction is not asleep.

ENGLISH: but a brother has a lawsuit against a brother, and that before people who do not believe?
QUENYA: mal háno same cos hánonna, ar ta epe queni i uar save?

ENGLISH: Thanks to God for his gift beyond words!
QUENYA: Hantale Erun annaryan quettar pella!

QUENYA: An ualme care imme sinwe, mal Hristo Yésus ve Heru, íre elme nar mólildar, Yésuo márien.

QUENYA: Ar íre túlelte hare Yérusalemenna, ana Vet-Fahe ar Vetánia ara Oron Milpioiva, mentanes atta hildoryaron

ENGLISH: Do not think that I have come to take away the Law or the Prophets. I have not come to take away, but to make real!

ENGLISH: For his disciples had gone into the city to buy food.
QUENYA: An hildoryar náner autienwe mir i osto homancien matso.

QUENYA: Tá enge costie imbi Yohanneo hildor as Yúra pa sovalle.

ENGLISH: For you are our glory and our joy!
QUENYA: An elde nar alcarelma ar alasselma!

ENGLISH: In that time you will not ask anything in my name, and I do not say to you that I will ask of the Father concerning you .
QUENYA: Lúme entasse ualde arcuva aiqua essenyanen, ar uan quete len i inye arcuva i Atarello pa le.

ENGLISH: but received a rebuke concerning his own law-breaking: A voiceless beast of burden, speaking with a man's voice, stopped the witless journey of the prophet.

QUENYA: Quentes téna: “Násie quetin lenna, ea úner ye ehehtie coa hya veri hya hánor hya nostaru Eruo aranien

ENGLISH: Greet one another with a holy kiss!
QUENYA: Á suila quén i exe aire miquenen!

ENGLISH: “Return to your home, and tell about the things that God has done for you.” And he went away through the entire city, making known everything that Jesus did for him.
QUENYA: “Nanwena marelyanna, ar nyara pa i nati yar Eru acárie lyen.” Ar lendes oa ter i quanda osto, cárala sinwa ilqua ya Yésus carne sen.

ENGLISH: I wish that those that stir you up will cut off the whole thing!
QUENYA: Merin i té i valtar le ciruvar oa i quanda nat!

ENGLISH: since the sunlight failed. Then the curtain in the temple was torn down the middle.
QUENYA: pan i áre loitane; tá i fanwa i cordasse náne narcaina undu i ende.

ENGLISH: When we told you about the power and the coming of Jesus Christ our Lord, we did not repeat cleverly invented fables; on the contrary, we were bystanders and saw his majesty with our own eyes.
QUENYA: Íre nyarnelme len pa i túre ar i tulie Yésus Hristo Herulvo, ualme enquete fincave autaine nyariéli; úsie, anelme astarmoli ar cenner melehterya vére hendulmanten.

ENGLISH: And he commanded us to make known to the people, and to give them witness, that this man was whom God has placed as judge of living ones and dead ones.
QUENYA: Ar cannes men care sinwa i lien, ar anta tien vettie, i nér sina náne ye Eru apánie ve námo coirearon ar qualinaron.

ENGLISH: Therefore fully keep your keenness of perception, by keeping your mind prepared. Have hope in the grace which will be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ.

ENGLISH: Then the Lord said: “Hear what this unjust judge is saying!
QUENYA: Tá i Heru quente: “Hlara ya úfaila námo sina quéta!

ENGLISH: May they be tested first; thereafter let them be servants, being beyond suspicion.

ENGLISH: And he gathered them and who worked with such things and said: “Men, you know well that by this our work we have our wealth.
QUENYA: Ar comyanes té ar i móler as taiti nati ar quente: “Neri, istalde mai i sina moliénen samilve larelva.

ENGLISH: Make the tree good and its fruit good, or make the tree rotten and its fruit rotten; for by its fruit the tree is known.
QUENYA: Cara i alda mára ar yáverya mára, hya cara i alda quelexa ar yáverya quelexa; an yáveryanen i alda sinwa ná.

ENGLISH: And they sailed to country of the Gerasenes, which lies on the other shore from Galilee.

ENGLISH: not as if you rule the people under your patronage, but by being examples to the flock.
QUENYA: lá ve qui turilde i queni nu ortírielda, mal návenen epemmali i lámáren.

ENGLISH: For who greets him has a part with him in his evil deeds.
QUENYA: An ye se-suila same ranta óse ulce cardaryassen.

ENGLISH: And since we feared that perhaps we were going to strike the rocks, they threw into the sea four anchors from the rear of the ship and longed for the coming of day.
QUENYA: Ar pan runcelme i cé petumnelme i ondor, hantelte mir i ear ciryampar canta i pontillo i ciryo ar milyaner tulesse aureo.

ENGLISH: And reaching out with his hand towards his disciples he said: “Behold my mother and my brothers!
QUENYA: Ar rahtala máryanen hildoryannar quentes: “Ela amillinya ar hánonyar!

ENGLISH: Except by a comparison he did not speak to them, but when he was alone with his disciples, he gave them insight concerning all things.
QUENYA: Hequa sestiénen uas carampe téna, mal íre anes erinqua as hildoryar, antanes tien tercen pa ilye nati.

ENGLISH: And one of the four living cratures gave the seven angels seven bowls of gold that were full of the anger of God, who lives forever and ever.
QUENYA: Ar quén i coition canta antane i valin otso tolpor otso maltava yar náner quante i ormeo Eruo, ye coita tennoio ar oi.

ENGLISH: But know this: In the last days difficult times will come.
QUENYA: Mal á ista si: I métime auressen hrange lúmeli tuluvar.

ENGLISH: and she saw two angels in white sit , one by the head and one by the feet where Jesus’ body had been lying.

ENGLISH: For not under angels he has put the world that is going to come, of which we are speaking.
QUENYA: An lá nu vali apánies i ambar ya tuluva, pa ya quétalve.

ENGLISH: This overseership I put on you, Timothy my child, by the predictions which led to you; thus you can by them fight in the good fight,
QUENYA: Ortírie sina panyan lyesse, Timoşeo hínanya, i apaceninen yar tulyaner lyenna; sie polil tainen mahta i mára mahtiesse,

ENGLISH: Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is caused to fall and I do not burn?
QUENYA: Mal ná milya, ar inye ua milya? Man ná tyarna lanta ar inye ua urya?

ENGLISH: Then the army commander came and took him and commanded: “Bind him with two chains!” And he asked about who he was and about what he had done.
QUENYA: Tá i hosseturco túle hare ar nampe se ar canne: “Áse nute limil attanen!” Ar maquentes pa man anes ar pa mana carnelyanes.

ENGLISH: By these three plagues one third of Men was slain, by the fire and by the smoke and by the sulphur that went out of their mouth.
QUENYA: Nelde sine ungwalínen nelesta Atanion náne nahtana, i nárenen ar i usquenen ar i ussardenen yar lender et antoltallo.

ENGLISH: for the sayings that you gave me I have given to them, and they have received them and indeed they know that you sent me.
QUENYA: an i quetier yar antanetye nin ánien tien, ar acámieltet ar é istalte i tyé mentane ni.

ENGLISH: Now the Passover of Jews was near, and many came up out of the regions to purify themselves.
QUENYA: Sí i Lahtie Yúraron náne hare, ar rimbali lender amba et i ménallon poitien inte.

ENGLISH: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save which was lost.”
QUENYA: An i Atanyondo túle cestien ar rehtien ya náne vanwa.”

ENGLISH: If a man receives circumcision on the day of rest, that the law of Moses is not to be broken, are you angry at me because I gave perfect health to a man on the day of rest?
QUENYA: Qui atan came oscirie i sendaresse, i Móseo şanye lá nauva rácina, ma nalde rúşie nin pan antanen ilvana mále atanen i sendaresse?

ENGLISH: Beloved ones, this letter is the second that I am writing to you, in which, as in my first, I stir your heart to a wakeful understanding by reminding you,
QUENYA: Meldar, tenna sina ná i attea ya técan lenna, yasse, ve minyanyasse, valtan sámalda cuiva handenna rentiénen le,

ENGLISH: Behold! I have given you the power to trample under your feet serpents and scorpions and the entire might of the enemy, and nothing can wound you.
QUENYA: Yé! Ánien len i túre vettien nu taluldat leucar ar nastaror ar i quanda melehte i ñottova, ar munta pole harna le.

ENGLISH: They heeded the word, but they spoke among themselves about what “rising from the dead” meant.
QUENYA: Cimnelte i quetta, mal carampelte mici inte pa mana “ortie qualinillon” tenge.

ENGLISH: And I shall give him the morning star.
QUENYA: Ar antauvan sen i arintinwe.

ENGLISH: As if I am now your enemy since I am telling you the truth?
QUENYA: Ve qui nanye sí cotumolda pan nyáran len i nanwie?

ENGLISH: Furthermore, Elijah and Moses showed themselves to them, and they spoke with Jesus.
QUENYA: Ente, Elía yo Móses tannet intu tien, ar carampette as Yésus.

ENGLISH: In answer he said to them: “Do you not see all these things? Truly I say to you: Here a stone will by no means remain on a stone that will not be thrown down!”
QUENYA: Hanquentasse quentes téna: “Ma ualde cene ilye sine nati? Násie quetin lenna: Sisse ondo laume lemyuva to ondo ya ua nauva hátina undu!”

ENGLISH: But do not count him as an enemy, but warn him as a brother.
QUENYA: Ono áva note se ve ñotto, mal ora sen ve háno.

ENGLISH: But who speaks as a prophet builds up and urges and comforts men with his speech.
QUENYA: Mal ye quete ve Erutercáno carasta ama ar horta ar tiuta atani questaryanen.

ENGLISH: The crowd answered: “You are possessed by a demon! Who is seeking to kill you?”
QUENYA: I şanga hanquente: “Nalye haryaina lo rauco! Man cestea nahta lye?”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered: “I have said to you that I am he. Therefore, if me you are seeking, let them go away”
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente: “Equétien lenna i inye ná sé. Etta, qui ní cestealde, lava tien auta”

ENGLISH: Thereafter, when Jesus saw that everything was completed, he said in order to fulfill the scripture: “I am thirsty.”
QUENYA: Epeta, íre Yésus cenne i ilqua náne telyaina, quentes amaquatien i tehtele: “Nanye soica.”

ENGLISH: Quickly that received the five talents went away and traded with them, and he gained another five.
QUENYA: Lintiénen ye camne i talenti lempe lende oa ar mancane tainen, ar ñentes an lempe.

ENGLISH: but every woman who prays or speaks as a prophet when her head is not covered, brings humiliation upon her head, for that is the same thing as if her hair was cut off.
QUENYA: mal ilya nís ye hyame hya quete ve Erutercáno íre carya ua tópina, tala nucumie caryanna, an ta i imya nat ná ve au findelerya náne aucirna.

ENGLISH: But as soon as the whole crowd saw him, they were startled, and running to him they greeted him.
QUENYA: Mal ve rongo ve i quanda şanga cenne se, anelte captaine, ar nórala senna suilaneltes.

ENGLISH: When they did not have more wine Jesus’ mother said to him: “They are lacking wine.”
QUENYA: Íre ualte sáme amba limpe Yésuo amil quente senna: “Pénalte limpe.”

ENGLISH: Do not lie one to the other. Put away the old man with his doings,
QUENYA: Áva hure quén i exen. Á panya oa i yára atan as carieryar,

ENGLISH: Their throat is an open grave; with their tongue they have lied. Venom of snakes is behind their lips ,
QUENYA: Lanculta láta sapsa ná; lambaltanen uhúrielte. Hloire leucaron ea ca péltat,

ENGLISH: They said this to test him, that they were to have a thing by which they could accuse him. But he bent down and wrote on the ground with his finger.
QUENYA: Quentelte si tyastien se, i samumnes nat yanen ence tien ulquete se. Mal luhtanes undu ar tence i talamesse leperyanen.

ENGLISH: But Pilate could not believe that he died that soon, and he called the centurion and asked him: “Is he now dead?”
QUENYA: Mal Piláton ua ence save i qualles ta rongo, ar yaldes i tuxantur ar maquente senna: “Ma náse sí qualin?”

ENGLISH: And we sailed away from there and went under the shelter of Cyprus, since the winds were against us.
QUENYA: Ar cirnelme oa talo ar lender nu i cauma Ciprusso, pan i súri náner ana me.

ENGLISH: This thing alone I want to learn from you: Did you receive the Spirit by acts of law or by hearing in faith?
QUENYA: Sina nat erinqua merin pare lello: Ma camnelde i Faire cardainen şanyeo hya hláriénen mi savie?

ENGLISH: “The spirit of the Lord is on me, for he annointed me to give good news to poor ones; he sent me to make known to people in prison that they will be freed and to blind ones that they will receive sight, to send the broken ones away by a release,
QUENYA: “I Héruo faire ea nisse, an líves ni antien máre sinyali penyain; ni-mentanes carien sinwa quenin mandosse i nauvalte leryaine ar cénelórain i camuvalte céne, mentien i rácinar oa lehtiénen,

ENGLISH: And I begged of your disciples that they would expel the demon, but was not possible for them.”
QUENYA: Ar inquen hildolyallon i et-hatumner i rauco, mal ua ence tien.”

ENGLISH: For was told me about you, brothers, by the people from the house of Chloe, that there are quarrels among you.
QUENYA: An náne nyárina nin pa le, hánor, lo i queni coaryallo Hloe, i ear costier mici le.

ENGLISH: In the days he was in the temple, teaching, but at night he went out and stayed at the mountain called Mount of Olives,
QUENYA: I auressen anes i cordasse, peantala, mal lómisse etelendes ar marne i orontesse estaina Oron Milpieron,

ENGLISH: You will hear about wars and will receive news of wars; take heed, that you are not terrified. By necessity it will happen, but the end still has not come.
QUENYA: Hlaruvalde pa ohtali ar camuvar sinyali ohtalion; cima in ualde ruhtane! Maurenen martuvas, mal i metta en ua utúlie.

ENGLISH: And all forsook him and fled.
QUENYA: Ar illi se-hehtaner ar úşer.

ENGLISH: For you were called into freedom, brothers; solely do not use this freedom to give an opportunity to the flesh, but by love be thralls one for the other.
QUENYA: An anelde yáline mir lérie, hánor; eryave áva yuhta lérie sina antien ecie i hráven, mal melmenen na móli quén i exen.

ENGLISH: But when the herders saw which had happened, they fled and told it in the city and in the fields.
QUENYA: Mal íre i mavari cenner ya náne martienwa, úşelte ar nyarner sa i ostosse ar i restassen.

ENGLISH: Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns that grew up with them choked them.
QUENYA: Exeli lantaner imíca i neceli, ar i neceli i aller ama aselte quorner te.

ENGLISH: But Jesus, knowing their evil, said: “How is that you test me, hypocrites?
QUENYA: Mal Yésus, istala ulculta, quente: “Manen ná i tyastalde ni, imnetyandor?

ENGLISH: If you died with Christ from the poor things of the world, how is that you, as if you still dwell in the world, behave by the commands:
QUENYA: Qui quallelde as Hristo i mardo penye natillon, manen ná i elde, ve qui en marilde i mardesse, lengar i canwainen:

ENGLISH: He said to them: “I told you already, and you did not listen. What is the reason that you want to hear it again? Do you too want to be his disciples?”
QUENYA: Hanquentes téna: “Nyarnen len nollo, ar ualde lastane. Mana i casta yanen merilde hlaritas ata? Ma yando lé merir náve hildoryar?”

ENGLISH: I found that complaints about disputes touching on their Law are brought against him, but about nothing worthy of death or of chains.
QUENYA: Hirnen i nurreli pa costeli apila Şanyelta nar talane senna, mal pa munta valda qualmeo hya limilion.

ENGLISH: And the apostles said to the Lord: “Give us more faith!”
QUENYA: Ar i aposteli quenter i Herunna: “Ámen anta amba savie!”

ENGLISH: Perhaps, when I shall return, my God will humiliate me among you, and it will be necessary for me to have grief concerning numerous ones that sinned formerly and have not found repentance concerning the uncleanness and the fornication and the loose conduct with which they have behaved.
QUENYA: Cé, íre entuluvan, Ainonya nucumuva ni mici le, ar mauyuva nin same nyére pa rimbali i úcarner yá ar uar ihírie inwis pa i úpoicie ar i hrupuhtie ar i lehta lengie yainen elengielte.

ENGLISH: And Jesus stopped, called them and said: “What do you wish that I will do for you?”
QUENYA: Ar Yésus pustane, yalde tu ar quente: “Mana meriste i caruvan lent?”

ENGLISH: And he threw him into the abyss and closed it and sealed it over him, to stop him from causing nations to stray before the thousand years were passed. After that he will be freed for a short time.
QUENYA: Ar hantes hé mir i undume ar sa-holtane ar sa-lihtane or hé, pustien hé tyariello nóri vare nó i húme loar náner vanwe. Epeta hé nauva leryana şinta lúmen.

ENGLISH: For I want you to know how profound is the struggle that I have on your behalf and of the people in Laodicea and of those that have not seen my face in the flesh,
QUENYA: An merin le ista manen tumna ná i mahtie ya samin rá elden ar i quenin Laoriceasse ar in uar ecénie cendelenya i hrávesse,

ENGLISH: The God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has made Jesus his servant glorious, him that you gave over and denied before the face of Pilate, though he wanted to free him.
QUENYA: I Aino Avrahámo ar Ísaco ar Yácovo, atarelvaron Aino, acárie Yésus núrorya alcarinqua, sé ye elde antaner olla ar laquente epe Piláto cendele, ómu hé merne lerya se.

ENGLISH: He threw down mighty ones from thrones and raised up lowly ones;
QUENYA: Hantes undu taurali mahalmallon ar ortane naldali;

ENGLISH: But followed him a great multitude from the people, and some women that struck themselves with grief and were wailing for him.
QUENYA: Mal hilyane se hoa liyúme i liello, ar nisseli i pentexer nyérenen ar náner yaimie sen.

ENGLISH: You ran well. What stopped you from following the truth still?
QUENYA: Nornelde mai. Mana pustane le hiliello i nanwie en?

ENGLISH: But I do everything for the gospel, for me to have a part in it.
QUENYA: Mal carin ilqua i evandilyonen, samienyan ranta sasse.

ENGLISH: but he said: “It is necessary for the Son of Man to go through many sufferings and to be rejected the elders and chief priests and scribes, and to be slain, and on the third day he will be raised up.”
QUENYA: mal eques: “Mauya i Atanyondon mene ter rimbe perperiéli ar náve auquerna lo i amyárar ar hére airimor and parmagolmor, ar náve nanca, ar i neldea auresse nauvas ortaina ama.”

ENGLISH: And the disciples came to him and said: “What is your reason for speaking to them in comparisons?”
QUENYA: Ar i hildor túler senna ar quenter: “Mana castalya carpien téna sestiessen?”

ENGLISH: among whom you are called ones of Jesus Christ –
QUENYA: mici yar elde nar Yésus Hristo yálinar –

ENGLISH: These people have turned themselves from the truth, saying that the resurrection has happened even now, and they make some peoples' faith unsteady.
QUENYA: Queni sine equérier inte i nanwiello, quétala in i enortie amartie yando sí, ar carilte quenelion savie iltanca.

ENGLISH: After they completed all the things written about him, they took him down from the tree and put him in a grave.
QUENYA: Apa telyanelte ilye i nati técíne pa se, nampeltes undu i aldallo ar panyaner se noirisse.

ENGLISH: You as well can help with your petition for us, and so numerous ones will give thanks on our behalf, for the grace given us as answer to many prayers.
QUENYA: Yando elde polir manya arcandeldanen men, ar sie rimbali antuvar hantale rámen, i Eruannan antaina men ve hanquenta rimbe hyamiélin.

ENGLISH: Then Mary said: “My soul praises the Lord,
QUENYA: Tá María quente: “Feanya laita i Héru,

ENGLISH: If you abide by my commandments, you will remain in my love, as I have abided by the Father’s commandments and remain in his love.
QUENYA: Qui himyalde axaninyar, lemyuvalde melmenyasse, síve inye ihímie i Ataro axani ar lemya melmeryasse.

ENGLISH: Then in harsh speech he instructed them that they were not to say so to anyone,
QUENYA: Tá mi naraca quetie peantanes tien i ávalte quetumne sie aiquenna,

ENGLISH: The Lord said to him: “Rise, go to the street called Straigth, and in the house of Judas seek a man called Saul, from Tarsus. For look! he is praying,
QUENYA: I Heru quente senna: “Á orya, mena i mallenna estaina Téra, ar mi coarya Yúras á cesta nér estaina Saul, ho Tarsus. An ye! hyámas,

ENGLISH: For this reason, though I have great courage in Christ to give you a command about what is proper,
QUENYA: Sina castanen, ómu samin túra huore Hristosse antien lyen canwa pa ya ná vanima,

ENGLISH: After some days he again came to Capernaum, and was told that he was at home.
QUENYA: Apa aureli ata túles Capernaumenna, ar náne nyárina i anes maresse.

ENGLISH: who says that he is in the light, and yet he hates his brother, is still in the darkness.
QUENYA: Ye quete i eas i calasse, ananta yeltas hánorya, ea en i morniesse.

ENGLISH: But she answered him: “Yes, Lord, and yet the dogs under the table eat the crumbs of the children.”
QUENYA: Mal hanquentes senna: “Ná, heru, ananta i huor nu i sarno matir i hínion mier.”

ENGLISH: For the love of money is a root of all evil things, and seeking this love some have been caused to stray from the faith and have pierced themselves with many pains.
QUENYA: An i melme telpeva ná şundo ilye ulce nation, ar cestala melme sina queneli anaier tyárine ranya i saviello ar etérier inte rimbe naicelínen.

ENGLISH: But what I say to you, I say to all: Be awake!”
QUENYA: Mal ya quetin lenna, quetin ilyannar: Na coive!”

ENGLISH: was there a bowl full of sour wine, and they put a sponge on a spear and brought it to his mouth.
QUENYA: Enge tasse salpa quanta sára limpeo, ar panyanelte hwan ehtisse ar tulune sa antoryanna.

ENGLISH: And was given her to be clad in bright, pure linen, for the linen is the righteous deeds of the holy ones.”
QUENYA: Ar náne sen antana náve vaina calima, poica páşesse, an i páşe i faile cardar i airion ná.”

ENGLISH: it does not behave in an unseemly manner, it does not seek its own things, it is not brought to anger. It does not keep a record of evil.
QUENYA: uas lenga mi úvanima lé, uas cesta véraryar, uas talana rúşenna. Uas hepe onotie ulcuva.

ENGLISH: Now came the day of unleavened breads, on which it was necessary to kill the lamb of passover,
QUENYA: Sí túle i aure alapulúne massaron, yasse mauyane nahta i eule lahtiéva,

ENGLISH: To heed the flesh brings death, but to heed the spirit brings life and peace,
QUENYA: Cime i hráve tala qualme, mal cime i faire tala coivie ar raine,

ENGLISH: Thus the earlier commandment is put away, for it is weak and is not beneficial.
QUENYA: Sie i ambe arinya axan ná panyaina oa, an nas milya ar ua aşea.

ENGLISH: And if the ear were going to say: “Since I am not an eye, I am not a part in the body”, it is not therefore outside of the body.
QUENYA: Ar qui i hlas quetumne: “Pan uan hen, uan ranta mí hroa”, uas tanen ettesse i hravo.

ENGLISH: Also who received the two talents came forward and said: “Lord, two talents you gave into my keeping. Behold, I have gained another two talents!”
QUENYA: Yú ye camne i talent atta túle ompa ar quente: “Heru, talent atta antanel mir hepienya. Ela, eñétiel an talent atta!”

ENGLISH: Both men ran, but the other other disciple ran faster than Peter and came first to the tomb,
QUENYA: Yúyo nér nornet, mal i hyana hildo norne linta lá Péter ar túle minya i noirinna,

ENGLISH: Jesus answered and said to them: “One deed I did, and you were all in wonder.
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente ar eque téna: “Erya carda carnen, ar lé enger illi elmendasse.

ENGLISH: After receiving it they grumbled against the garden-master
QUENYA: Apa camie sa nurrunelte i tarwanturenna

ENGLISH: Put my yoke on yourselves and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
QUENYA: Á panya yaltanya indesse ar para nillo, an nanye moica ar nalda endasse, ar hiruvalde sére fealdain.

ENGLISH: And the four and twenty elders that sat before God on their thrones fell on their faces and worshipped God,
QUENYA: Ar i amyárar canta ar yúquean i hammer epe Eru mahalmaltassen lantaner cendeleltannar ar tyerner Eru,

ENGLISH: and you know his will and it is possible for you to judge what is good since you have received instruction out of the Law,
QUENYA: ar istal indómerya ar ece lyen name mana mára ná pan acámiel peantie et i Şanyello,

ENGLISH: Men, brothers, it is me allowed to speak freely to you about the patriarch David, that he expired and was brought to his grave, and his tomb is among us until this day.
QUENYA: Neri, hánor, nin ná lávina quete lérave lenna pa i atartur Lavir, i effirnes ar náne talana sapsaryanna, ar noirirya ea mici vi tenna aure sina.

ENGLISH: Do you know know that which comes in through the mouth, goes into the entrails and passes into the sewer?
QUENYA: Ma ualde ista in ilqua ya tule minna ter i anto, mene mir i hirdi ar auta mir i aucelie?

ENGLISH: But concerning the dead, that they are raised, did you not read in the book of Moses, in the story of the thorn-bush, how God said to him: “I Abraham's God and Isaac's God and Jacob's God' – ?”
QUENYA: Mal pa qualini, i nalte ortaine, ma ualde hentane Móseo parmasse, nyarnasse i neceltusso, manen Eru quente senna: 'Inye Avrahámo Aino ar Ísaco Aino ar Yácovo Aino' – ?

ENGLISH: For who has died has been freed from sin.
QUENYA: An ye aquálie anaie leryana úcarello.

ENGLISH: May your brotherly love remain!
QUENYA: Nai hánonilmelda lemyuva!

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “This word: If you can! All things are possible for who believes!”
QUENYA: Yésus quente senna: “Quetta sina: Qui polil! Ilye nati nar cárime yen save!”

ENGLISH: But the Jews did not believe concerning him that formerly he was blind and had received sight, until they called his parents of the man who received sight.
QUENYA: Mal i Yúrar uar sáve pa se i yá anes lomba ar náne cámienwa céne, tenna yaldelte i nostaru i nero ye camne céne.

ENGLISH: were with us seven brothers, and the first, after he got married to a woman, died; and since he lacked child, he left his wife for his brother.
QUENYA: Enger aselte hánor otso, ar i minya, apa veryanes nissenna, qualle; ar pan pennes hína, hehtanes verirya hánoryan.

ENGLISH: At that time he was most happy by the Holy Spirit and said: “I praise you, Father, Lord over heaven and earth, for you have hidden these things from wise ones and from intelligent ones, and you have revealed them to babes. Yes, Father, for doing so was good in your eyes.
QUENYA: Lúme yanasse anes anvalima i Aire Feanen ar quente: “Laitan tye, Atar, Heru or menel cemenye, an unurtiel nati sine sailallon ar handallon, ar ápantiel tai lapsin. Ná, Átar, an carie sie náne mára hendulyatse.

ENGLISH: Jesus answered and said to him: “What I am doing you do not understand now, but you will understand it after these things.”
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente ar eque senna: “Ya cáran ual hanya sí, mal hanyuvalyes apa nati sine.”

ENGLISH: Beloved ones, do not believe in every spirit, but test the spirits to see if they are of God, for numerous false prophets have gone out into the world.
QUENYA: Meldar, áva save ilya fairesse, mal á tyasta i fairi cenien qui nalte Eruo, pan rimbe hurutercánoli eteménier mir i mar.

ENGLISH: for me to know him and the power of his resurrection and have a part in his sufferings, being shaped by his death
QUENYA: istienyan sé ar enortieryo melehte ar same ranta perperieryaron, nála cátina qualmeryanen,

ENGLISH: But I say to you: Everyone who confesses me before men, him the Son of Man will also confess before God's angels.
QUENYA: Mal quetin lenna: Ilquen ye etequenta ni epe atani, sé i Atanyondo yando etequentuva epe Eruo vali.

ENGLISH: And what they said was good to the entire multitude, and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of Holy Spirit, and Philip and Procorus and Nicanor and Timon and Parmenas and Nicolaus, a proselyte from Antioch,
QUENYA: Ar ya quentelte náne mára i quanda liyúmen, ar cildelte Stefáno, nér quanta saviéno ar Aire Feo, ar Filip ar Procoro ar Nicanor ar Timon ar Parmenas ar Nicolao, quernamo Antiocello,

ENGLISH: Then Jesus talked to them again, saying: “I am the light of the world. who follows me will not walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”
QUENYA: Tá Yésus carampe téna ata, quétala: “Inye i mardo cala ná. Ye hilya ní ua vantuva morniesse, mal samuva i cala coiviéva.”

ENGLISH: But Mary was troubled by the saying and tried to understand what kind of greeting that was.
QUENYA: Mal Mária náne tarastaina i quetiénen ar néve hanya mana nostale suiliéva ta náne.

ENGLISH: and Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the regions of Libya, near to Cyrene, and that have come from Rome, Jews and converted ones alike,
QUENYA: ar Frihia ar Pamfylia, Mirrandor ar i ménar Livio, hare Cirénenna, ar i utúlier Rómallo, Yúrar ar quérinar véla,

ENGLISH: I am in wonder that so quickly you have been turned from who called you into the grace of Christ to another gospel.
QUENYA: Nanye elmendasse i ta lintave anaielde quérine yello le-yalle mir i Hristo lisse hyana evandilyonna.

ENGLISH: Indeed you are defeated in the moment that you have lawsuits at all, one against the other. How is that you are not sooner wronged? How is it that you are not sooner deprived?
QUENYA: É nalde turúne mi lú ya samilde costi aqua, quén i exenna. Manen ná i ualde ambe ron nehtane? Manen ná i ualde ambe ron racine?

ENGLISH: who has my commandments and abides by them, he is who loves me. Furthermore, who loves me shall be loved by my Father, and I will love him and will reveal self to him.”
QUENYA: Ye same axaninyar ar himya tai, sé ná ye mele ni. Ente, ye mele ní nauva mélina lo Atarinya, ar inye meluva se ar apantuva immo sen.”

ENGLISH: and that which you sow is not the body that will exist, but a naked seed – perhaps of grain, perhaps of another kind of plant –
QUENYA: ar ta ya reril ua i hroa ya euva, mal helda erde – cé orio, cé hyana nostale laimo –

ENGLISH: But may no one among you have difficulty because he has done murder or theft or evil or has troubled others concerning their own affairs.
QUENYA: Mal nai úquen mici le samuva urdie pan acáries nahtie hya pilwe hya ulco hya atarastie exeli pa vére nattoltar.

ENGLISH: For to God is nothing impossible.”
QUENYA: An Erun ea munta úcárima.”

ENGLISH: Now we know that you know all things and does not have need that anyone inquires of you. By this we know that you came forth from God.”
QUENYA: Sí istalme i istal ilye nati ar ua same maure i aiquen ceşuva lye. Sinen istalme i ettúlel Erullo.”

ENGLISH: He arose and took the child and its mother and went into the land of Israel.

ENGLISH: Thus Jesus, after groaning again in self, came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone lay before it.
