ENGLISH: For who is the person who will do evil to you if you burn for which is good?
QUENYA: Ar man ná i quén ye caruva ulco len qui uryalde yan mára ná?

ENGLISH: and light of a lamp will by no means shine in you more; for your tradesmen were the prominent men of earth, and by your sorcery all nations were caused to err.
QUENYA: ar cala calmo laume caltuva lyesse ambe, ar óma endero hya indisso laume nauva hlárina lyesse ambe; an macarilyar náner i minde neri cemeno, an ñúlelyanen ilye nóri náner tyárine vare.

ENGLISH: And the kings of earth and the mighty and the commanders and the rich and the strong and every thrall and every free person hid themselves in the caves and among the rocks of the mountains.
QUENYA: Ar cemeno arani ar i taurar ar i cánor ar i lárear ar i poldar ar ilya mól ar ilya léra quén nurtaner inte i rottossen ar imíca i ondor i orontion.

ENGLISH: and saw him say to me: 'Be quick and go away from Jerusalem with urgency, for they will not receive your witness about me.'
QUENYA: ar cenne se quéta ninna: 'Na linta ar á auta Yerúsalemello hormenen, an ualte camuva vettielya pa ní.'

ENGLISH: Thus for a covenant that better Jesus has been given as security.
QUENYA: Etta véren ta arya Yésus anaie antaina ve varnasse.

ENGLISH: and gathering all the chief priests and the scribes among the people, he asked them about where the Christ was to be born.
QUENYA: ar comyala ilye i hére airimor ar i parmangolmor imíca i lie, maquentes téna pa masse i Hristo nauvane nóna.

ENGLISH: If you know these things, happy you are if you do them.
QUENYA: Qui istalde nati sine, alassie nalde qui carilde tai.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to her: “Your brother will rise.”
QUENYA: Eque senna Yésus: “Hánolya ortuva.”

ENGLISH: And after he sent the crowds away, he went up into the mountain to a lonely place, to pray. When evening came, he was alone there.
QUENYA: Ar apa mentanes i şangar oa, lendes ama mir i oron eressea nómenna, hyamien. Íre şinye túle, anes erinqua tasse.

ENGLISH: But when they lead you forward to give you over, do not trouble yourselves beforehand about what you are going to say; but everything that shall be given to you at that time, say that, for you are not the ones who are speaking, but the Holy Spirit .
QUENYA: Mal íre tulyalte le ompa antien le olla, áva tarasta inde nóvo pa mana quetuvalde; mal ilqua ya nauva antaina len mi enta lúme, queta ta, an elde uar i quétar, mal i Aire Fea.

ENGLISH: But others fell upon the good earth, and they arose and grew and made fruit, and they bore added measures, thirty and sixty and a hundred.”
QUENYA: Mal exeli lantaner i mára cemenna, ar orontelte ar aller ar carner yáve, ar collelte napánine lestali, nelquean ar enenquean ar tuxa.”

ENGLISH: For in place he has said about the seventh day: "And God rested on the seventh day from all his works",
QUENYA: An mi nóme equéties i pa i otsea aure: "Ar Eru sende i otsea auresse ilye cardaryallon",

ENGLISH: Concerning that I requested of the Lord thrice that it would go away from me,
QUENYA: Pa ta arcanen i Herullo nel i autumnes nillo,

ENGLISH: For whom God sent speaks God’s sayings, for he does not give the Spirit by measure.
QUENYA: An ye Eru mentane quete Eruo quetier, an uas anta i Faire lestanen.

ENGLISH: known from of old.
QUENYA: sinwe et yalúmello.

ENGLISH: For poor you always have with you, but me you do not always have.”
QUENYA: An únar illume samuvalde mici le, mal ní ualde illume same.”

ENGLISH: If I did not come and talked to them, they did not have sin; but now they do not have reason to give concerning their sin.
QUENYA: Qui uan túle ar carampe téna, ualte sáme úcare; mal sí ualte same casta antien pa úcarelta.

ENGLISH: Concerning this salvation the Prophets sought and inquired, who spoke predictions of the grace that you were going to receive.
QUENYA: Pa rehtie sina i Erutercánor cestaner ar cenºer, i quenter apacelli i Erulisseo ya elde camumner.

ENGLISH: But the shepherds fled, and going into the city they told everything, also concerning the demon-possessed ones.
QUENYA: Mal i mavari úşer, ar lelyala mir i osto nyarnelte ilqua, yú pa i raucoharyanar.

ENGLISH: for a man's wrath does not make God's justice come.
QUENYA: an atano orme ua tyare Eruo failie tule.

ENGLISH: Therefore I count the sufferings of this time as nothing compared to the glory that will be revealed in us.
QUENYA: Etta notin i perperier lúme sino ve munta sestane as i alcar ya nauva apantana elvesse.

ENGLISH: For indeed Christ, when we were still weak, died for godless men when the time came.
QUENYA: An é Hristo, íre en anelve milye, qualle ainolóre atanin íre i lúme túle.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, as Isaiah said beforehand: “If the Lord Sebaoth did not allow a seed to remain for us, we became like Sodom, and we were like Gomorrah.”
QUENYA: Ente, ve Isaia quente nóvo: “Au i Héru Sevaot ua láve erde lemya ven, ollelve ve Sorom, ar anelve ve Omorra.”

ENGLISH: For there is not creature that is not seen by him, but all things are naked and open to his eyes, he to whom it is necessary for us to answer.
QUENYA: Ar ua ea onna ya ua cénina lo sé, mal ilye nati nar helde ar pantaine henyant, sé yenna mauya ven hanquete.

ENGLISH: And the smoke of their torment rises up forever and ever, and day and night they do not have rest, those who worship the beast and its image, and anyone who receives the mark of its name.
QUENYA: Ar i usque ñwalmelto orta ama tennoio ar oi, ar auresse yo lómisse ualte same sére, i tyerir i hravan ar emmarya, ar aiquen ye came i tehta esseryo.

ENGLISH: When you have the light, believe in the light, that you will be sons of light.”
QUENYA: Íre samilde i cala, sava i calasse, i nauvalde yondor calo.”

ENGLISH: and cried when they looked at the reek from her burning and said: ‘Who among cities is like the great city?’
QUENYA: ar yámer íre yentelte i usque ruiveryallo ar quenter: ’Man mici ostor ná ve i túra osto?’

ENGLISH: When they heard this, some among who stood there said: “This man is calling Elijah!”
QUENYA: Íre hlasselte si, queneli imíca i tarner tasse quenter: “Nér sina yála Elía!”

ENGLISH: Make them recall that, and command them before the Lord: Do not quarrel about words, for that is not beneficial, and destroyes who listen.
QUENYA: Áte tyare enyale ta, ar cana tien epe i Heru: Áva costa pa quettar, an ta ua aşea, ar nancare i lastar.

ENGLISH: Therefore, firstly, I exhort that you make petitions, prayers, intercessions , thanksgivings, concerning all men,
QUENYA: Etta, minyave, hortan i carilde arcandi, hyamier, mánacestier, hantaler, pa ilye atani,

ENGLISH: «For if the righteous man is saved with difficulty, what will happen to the one hostile to God and to the sinner?»
QUENYA: «Ar qui i faila nér ná rehtaina urdave, mana martuva i Erucotyan ar i úcarindon?»

ENGLISH: And yet those who ate were four thousand men, except for the women and children.
QUENYA: Ananta i manter náner neri húmi canta, hequa i nissi ar híni.

ENGLISH: But some of the Pharisees, that say that is not resurrection, came and said to him:
QUENYA: Mal quelli i Farisaron, i quetir i ua ea enortale, túler ar maquenter senna:

ENGLISH: Greet Ruphus, the chosen one in the Lord, and his mother and mine.
QUENYA: Á suila Rúfo, i cílina i Herusse, ar amillerya ar ninya.

ENGLISH: And they measured how deep the sea was and found that it was twenty fathoms. They went a short way forward and measured again, and they found fifteen fathoms.
QUENYA: Ar lestanelte manen núra i ear náne ar hirner i anes rangwi yúquean. Lendelte şinta tie ompa ar lestaner ata, ar hirnelte rangwi lepenque.

ENGLISH: And the thrall said: “Lord, what you commanded has been done, and still is place.”
QUENYA: Ar i mól quente: “Heru, ya cannel anaie carna, ar en ea nóme.”

ENGLISH: Watch yourselves, that the we have done will not be lost to you, but you will receive full reward.
QUENYA: Tira inde, i yar acárielve uar nauva len vanwe, mal camuvalde quanta paityale.

ENGLISH: You yourselves know that these hands have given me and who were with me our needs.
QUENYA: Elde istar i mát sine ániet nin ar in enger asinye maurelmar.

ENGLISH: and since the lawlessness grows, love will become cold in the greater number of people.
QUENYA: ar pan i şanyelórie ale, melme oluva ringa i ambe rimbe quenissen.

ENGLISH: But rise and come into the city, and which is necessary for you to do will be told to you.”
QUENYA: Mal á orya ar tula mir i osto, ar ya mauya lyen care nauva nyárina lyen.”

ENGLISH: into praise of his glorious grace which he gave us by his Beloved One.
QUENYA: mir laitale alcarinqua lisseryava ya antanes ven Meldaryanen.

ENGLISH: But are also many other things that Jesus has done. If one were to write about every single thing, I suppose that there is not enough place in the world itself for the books being written.
QUENYA: Mal ear yando rimbe hyane natali yar Yésus acárie. Qui mo tecumne pa ilya erya nata, intyan i lá ea fárea nóme mí mar imma i parmain nála técine.

ENGLISH: Who is the liar, if not who denies that Jesus is the Christ? This is the Antichrist, he that denies the Father and the Son.
QUENYA: Man ná i hurindo, qui lá ye lala i Yésus ná i Hristo? Si ná i Anahristo, sé ye lala i Atar yo i Yondo.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “How is that you call me good? No one is good, except one, God.
QUENYA: Yésus quente senna: “Manen ná i estal ní mane? Úquen mane ná, hequa er, Eru.

ENGLISH: For who is the greatest, who lies at the table or the servant? Is it not who lies at the table? But among you I am like the servant.
QUENYA: An man i ambe túra ná, ye caita ara i sarno hya i núro? Ma uas ye caita ara i sarno? Ono mici le nanye ve i núro.

ENGLISH: “Tell us, what the time when these things will happen, and what is the sign that all these things will be close to being completed?”
QUENYA: “Nyara men, mana i lúme yasse nati sine martuvar, ar mana i tanwa i ilye nati sine nauvar hari náven telyaine?”

ENGLISH: and the stars of heaven fell to earth, as when the unripe figs fall from a fig-tree being shaken by a mighty wind.
QUENYA: ar menelo tinwi lantaner cemenna, ve íre i úmanwe relyávi lantar relyávaldallo pálaina taura súrinen.

ENGLISH: But as is written: “The people to whom he was not made known shall see, and that have not heard will understand.”
QUENYA: Mal ve ná técina: “I queni in únes carna sinwa cenuvar, ar i uar ahlárie hanyuvar.”

ENGLISH: For the gospel was brought to us and to them alike, but the word that they heard did nothing beneficial for them, for they were not united by faith with the ones that listened.
QUENYA: An i evandilyon náne tulúna venna ar téna véla, mal i quetta ya hlasselte carne munta aşea tien, an ualte náne ertaine saviénen as i lastaner.

ENGLISH: For they gave as was possible to them; indeed I am a witness that they gave beyond what was possible for them, and by their own will.
QUENYA: An antanelte ve ence tien; é nanye astarmo i antanelte han ya ence tien, ar véra nirmeltanen.

ENGLISH: I in them and you in me, that they will be made perfect into one, that the world will know that you sent me and that you loved them, as you loved me.
QUENYA: ní tesse ar tyé nisse, i nauvalte cárine ilvane mir er, i istuva i mar i tyé mentane ni ar i méletyet, ve méletye ní.

ENGLISH: And when the time came, Jesus lay at the table, and the apostles with him.
QUENYA: Ar íre i lúme túle, Yésus caine ara i sarno, ar i aposteli óse.

ENGLISH: And having come near he touched the bier, and the bearers stopped, and he said: “Young man, I say to you: Rise!”
QUENYA: Ar túlienwa hare appanes i tulma, ar i colindor pustaner, ar quentes: “Nessa nér, quetin lyenna: Á orta!”

ENGLISH: Then the soldiers wanted to kill the bound men, to stop anyone from escaping by swimming away.
QUENYA: Tá i ohtari merner nahta i nútine neri, pustien aiquen uşiello lutiénen oa.

ENGLISH: And the gaoler told these words to Paul: “The judges have sent some men to release you ! Therefore, now come out and go away in peace!”
QUENYA: Ar i mandocundo nyarne quettar sine Paulon: “I námor ementayer nelli leryaven let! Etta, sí ettula ar á auta rainesse!”

ENGLISH: Therefore speak openly, one to the other, about your sins; and pray one for the other, for you to be healed. A just person's petition carries abundant power when it is at work.
QUENYA: Etta queta pantave, quén i exenna, pa úcareldar; ar hyama quén i exen, náveldan nestaine. Faila queno arcande cole úvea túre íre móteas.

ENGLISH: But I said: By no means, Lord, for nothing defiled or unclean has ever come into my mouth!
QUENYA: Mal quenten: Laume, Heru, an munta vahtana hya úpoica oi utúlie mir antonya!

ENGLISH: And yet I do not count my life that dear to me, if it is possible for me to complete my ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus: Witnessing about the gospel of the grace of God.
QUENYA: Ananta uan note coivienya ta melda nin, qui ece nin telya núromolienya ya camnen i Heru Yésullo: Vettie pa i evandilyon i lisseo Eruo.

ENGLISH: All people went in order to be counted, everyone to his own city.
QUENYA: Ilye queni lender náven nótine, ilquen véra ostoryanna.

ENGLISH: Therefore write that you have seen, that are now and that shall happen after this alike.
QUENYA: Etta teca yar ecéniel, yar ear sí ar yar martuvar apa si véla.

ENGLISH: Therefore numerous ones among them believed, and so did not a few prominent Greek women, also numerous men.
QUENYA: Etta rimbali mici te sáver, ar sie carner lá nótime minde Hellenye nisseli, yú rimbe nelli.

ENGLISH: to cause to bend every knee, of who are in heaven and of that are on earth and of who are under the ground,
QUENYA: tyarien cúna ilya occa, ion ear menelde ar ion ear cemende ar ion ear nu talan,

ENGLISH: Him God raised on the third day and allowed him to show himself,
QUENYA: Sé Eru ortane i neldea auresse ar láve sen tana inse,

ENGLISH: Therefore, do not be troubled about the following day, for the following day will have its own troubles. Every day's evil suffices for it.
QUENYA: Etta, áva na tarastaine pa i hilyala aure, an i hilyala aure samuva vére tarastieryar. Ilya réo ulco farya san.

ENGLISH: May you have mercy and peace and love in abundance!
QUENYA: Nai samuvalde óravie ar raine ar melme úvesse!

ENGLISH: Then bear fruit worthy of the repentance!
QUENYA: Tá cola yáve valda i inwisso!

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Go!” And after coming out they went into the pigs, and behold! the entire herd wend rushing over the precipice into the sea, and they died in the waters.
QUENYA: Ar quentes téna: “Mena!” Ar apa ettulie lendelte mir i poicar, ar yé! i quanda lámáre lende rimpa olla i lanca mir i ear, ar quallelte i nenissen.

ENGLISH: And in the same moment the skin-disease disappeared from him, and he was clean.
QUENYA: Ar mí imya lú i helmahlíve váne sello, ar anes poica.

ENGLISH: Then Peter went forth with the other disciple, and they went to the tomb.
QUENYA: Tá Péter etemenne as i hyana hildo, ar lendette i noirinna.

ENGLISH: for in those days will come a tribulation of a kind that has not happened from the beginning of the creation that God created until that time, and it will not happen again.
QUENYA: an ente auressen tuluva şangie nostaleo ya ua amartie yestallo i ontiéno ya Eru ontane tenna enta lúme, ar uas martuva ata.

ENGLISH: On earth you have had abundance and a life of lust. On the day of slaughter you have made your heart fat. You have judged, you have slain the just one; he did not stop you.
QUENYA: Cemende asámielde úve ar coivie maileva. I auresse nahtiéva acárielde endalda tiuca. Anámielde, anahtielde i faila; uas pustane le.

ENGLISH: And at that time was a great earthquake, and one tenth of the city collapsed, and seven thousand people were killed by the earthquake, and who remained were terrified and gave glory to God of heaven.
QUENYA: Ar lúme yanasse enge túra cempalie, ar quaista i osto atalante, ar queni húmi otso náner nahtane i cempaliénen, ar i lemner náner ruhtane ar antaner alcar Erun menelo.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, some women among us have startled us, for after going early to the tomb
QUENYA: Ente, nisseli mici me acaptier me, an apa menie arinyave i noirinna

ENGLISH: The army chief took his hand and went away to a private place and asked: “What do you have to tell me?”
QUENYA: I hosseturco nampe márya ar lende oa véra nómenna ar maquente: “Mana samil nyarien ninna?”

ENGLISH: When he heard it, Jesus went away from there in a boat, to a lonely place, to be alone; but the crowds heard it and followed him on foot from the cities.
QUENYA: Ire hlasses sa, Yésus lende oa talo luntesse, eressea nómenna, náven erinqua; mal i şangar hlasser sa ar hilyaner se talunen i ostollon.

ENGLISH: Then what are we to say? Non-Jews, through they did not pursue righteousness, have found righteousness – the righteousness that comes by faith.
QUENYA: Tá mana quetuvalve? Úyúrar, ómu ualte roitane failie, ihírier failie – i failie ya tule saviénen.

ENGLISH: But others, in order to test him, sought from him a sign out of heaven.
QUENYA: Ono exeli, tyastien se, cestaner sello tanwa et menello.

ENGLISH: For not heeding how many God's promises are, in him they have their Yes. Therefore also through him the Amen is spoken to God by us, for his glory.
QUENYA: An lá címala manen rimbe Eruo vandar nar, sesse samilte Nálta. Etta yando ter sé i Násie ná quétina Erunna lo elve, alcareryan.

ENGLISH: And they asked them: “Is this person your son, who you say was born blind? How, then, he can see now?”
QUENYA: Ar cenşelte tú: “Ma quén sina ná yondosta, ye quetiste náne nóna lomba? Manen, tá, polis cene sí?”

ENGLISH: If it will then give fruit in the coming year, very well. But if it does not, you will cut it down.'”
QUENYA: Qui tá antuvas yáve i túlala loasse, mára ná. Mal qui laias, ciruvalyes undu.'”

ENGLISH: And he could not do a single great deed there, except that he put his hands on a few sick ones and healed them.
QUENYA: Ar uas polde care erya taura carda tasse, hequa i panyanes máryat mance engwalissen ar te-nestane.

ENGLISH: But when the disciples saw that, they were in wonder, saying: “How did the fig tree wither in a single moment?”
QUENYA: Mal íre i hildor cenner ta, anelte elmendasse, quétala: “Manen i relyávalda hestane mi erya lú?”

ENGLISH: Men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus from Nazareth, a man that God put before you with mighty deeds and signs and portents which God did by him in your midst, as you know,
QUENYA: Neri Israélo, hlara quettar sine: Yésus Násaretello, nér ye Eru panyane epe le taure cardalínen ar tanwalínen ar tannalínen yar Eru carne sénen endeldasse, ve elde istar,

ENGLISH: For Creation was put under an useless state, not by its own will but by who put it under that, although having a hope:
QUENYA: An Ontie náne panyana nu úaşea sóma, lá véra şelmaryanen mal lo ye panyane sa nu ta, ómu arwa estelo:

ENGLISH: But behold! you will be silent and will not be able to speak until the day when these things will happen, since you did not believe in my words, which will be made true in their time.”
QUENYA: Mal yé! nauval quilda ar ua poluva quete tenna i aure yasse nati sine martuvar, pan ual sáve quettanyassen, yar nauvar cárine nanwe lúmeltasse.”

ENGLISH: And he spoke and said to them; “Unfaithful generation, how long is it necessary for me to be with you? How long is it necessary for me to endure you? Bring him to me!”
QUENYA: Ar carampes ar quente téna: “Úvoronda nónare, manen andave mauya nin náve aselde? Manen andave mauya nin perpere le? Áse tala ninna! ”

ENGLISH: If we say that we have a part with him, and yet we walk in the dark, we are lying and do not do the truth.
QUENYA: Qui quetilve i samilve ranta óse, ananta vantalve i morniesse, húralve ar uar care i nanwie.

ENGLISH: And he brought Peter and James and John with himself, and he began to have oppressive feelings and to be troubled.
QUENYA: Ar talles Péter ar Yácov ar Yoháno as inse, ar yestanes same lumne felmeli ar náve tarastaina.

ENGLISH: What I say I do not say from the Lord, but like in the manner of a fool, when I praise myself so surely!
QUENYA: Ya quetin uan quete i Herullo, mal ve lénen auco, íre laitanyexe ta tancave!

ENGLISH: while you take heed that nobody will be deprived of God's grace and do not allow poisonous root to grow up to cause difficulty and to soil many.
QUENYA: íre cimilde i úquen nauva nehtaina lisseo Eruo ar uar lave hloirea şundun tuia ama tyarien urdie ar vahtien rimbali.

ENGLISH: Watch the good thing put in your custody, by the holy spirit that dwells in you.
QUENYA: I mána panyaina mandolyasse tira i aire fairenen ya mare vesse.

ENGLISH: And they ate and were filled, and they gathered the remaining pieces, filling seven food-baskets .
QUENYA: Ar mantelte ar náner quátine, ar comyanelte i lemyala rantar, quátala matsocolcar otso.

ENGLISH: For I am certain about this thing, that he who began a good work in you will also complete it, until the day of Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: An nanye tanca pa nat sina, i sé ye yestane mára molie lesse yando telyuva sa, tenna Yésus Hristo aure.

ENGLISH: “Show me a denarius. Whose picture and writing does it have?” They said: “The High King's.”
QUENYA: “Ánin tana lenár. Mano emma ar tecie samis?” Quentelte: “I ingarano.”

ENGLISH: And after he dwelt there for a time he went away and travelled from place to place through the country of Alatia and Phrygia, strengthening the disciples.
QUENYA: Ar apa marnes tasse ter lúme oantes ar lende nómello nómenna ter Alatia·nórie ar Frihia, tulcala i hildor.

ENGLISH: Heaven and earth shall pass , but my words will not ever pass .
QUENYA: Menel cemenye autuvat, mal ninye quettar uar oi autuva.

ENGLISH: They are not a part of the world, as I am not a part of the world.
QUENYA: Ualte ranta i mardo, síve inye ua ranta i mardo.

ENGLISH: 'After these things I will return and I will rebuild David's fallen shelter, and I will rebuild its ruinous parts and I will raise it agan,
QUENYA: 'Apa nati sine nanwenuvan ar encarastuvan Laviro lantienwa cauma, ar encarastuvan atalantie rantaryar ar ortauvan sa ata,

ENGLISH: son of Mattathias, son of Amos, son of Nahum, son of Esli, son of Naggai,
QUENYA: yondorya Mattatías, yondorya Ámos, yondorya Nahum, yondorya Esli, yondorya Nangai,

ENGLISH: All things you have put under his feet. For when God put all things under him, there is nothing that he allowed to be beyond his power. Now we still do not see all things put under him .
QUENYA: Ilye nati apániel nu talyat." An íre Eru panyane ilye nati nu sé, ea munta yan láves náve han túrerya. Sí en ualve cene ilye nati panyaine nu sé.

ENGLISH: which is his body, the fullness of who fills everything in all things.
QUENYA: ya ná hroarya, i quantie yeo quate ilqua ilye natissen.

ENGLISH: Therefore the Jews said to the healed man: “This is a day of rest; carrying the bed is not allowed for you.”
QUENYA: Etta i Yúrar quenter i nestaina nerenna: “Si ná sendare; colie i caima ui lávina lyen.”

ENGLISH: When a huge crowd of Jews understood that he was there, they came, not solely because of Jesus, but also to see Lazarus, whom he raised from dead.
QUENYA: Íre haura şanga Yúralíva hanyaner i enges tasse, túlelte, lá rie Yésunen, mal yando cenien Lásarus, ye ortanes qualinillon.

ENGLISH: For not by the Law Abraham or his seed has the promise about becoming heir to a world, but through the righteousness by faith.
QUENYA: An lá Şanyenen Avraham hya erderya same i vanda pa olie aryon mardo, mal ter i failie saviénen.

ENGLISH: But they came out from the prison and went to the house of Lydia, and when they saw the brothers they urged them. Then they went away.
QUENYA: Mal túlette et i mandollo ar lendet coaryanna Liria, ar íre cennette i hánor hortanettet. Tá oantette.

ENGLISH: Jesus said: “Make the men sit down.” was much grass in the place. Therefore the men sat down, a number around five thousand.
QUENYA: Eque Yésus: “Á tyare i atani hame undu.” Enge olya salque i nómesse. Etta i atani hamner undu, nóte os húmi lempe.

ENGLISH: And when all among us, without veil covering our face, give back the Lord's glory like a mirror, we are changed into his appearance, from glory to glory – as is done by the Lord, the Spirit.
QUENYA: Ar íre illi mici vi, ú vaşaro tópala cendelelva, nanantar i Heruo alcar ve cilintilla, nalve vistaine mir ilcerya, alcarello alcarenna – ve ná cárina lo i Heru, i Faire.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to him: “Put your sword in its place again, for all that take the sword will be undone by the sword .
QUENYA: Tá Yésus quente senna: “Á panya macilelya nómeryanna ata, an illi i mapar i macil nauvar nancarne i macilden.

ENGLISH: Thus let us make a festival, not with the old leaven, also without leaven of evil and of wickedness, but having unfermented breads of purity and of truth.
QUENYA: Sie alve care aşar, lá i yára pulmaxenen, yú pen pulmaxe ulcuva ar olciéva, mal arwe alapulúne massaron poiciéno ar nanwiéno.

ENGLISH: I am the vine, you are the branches. who remains in me, and I in him, he bears much fruit; for away from me you can do nothing.
QUENYA: Inye ná i liantasse, lé nar i olvar. Ye lemya nisse, ar ní sesse, sé cole olya yáve; pan au nillo polilde care munta.

ENGLISH: I do not wish that people are to come from Macedonia with me and will find you unprepared, for so we – not to say you – will be humiliated because we were so sure.
QUENYA: Uan mere i tuluvar quelli Maceroniallo asinye ar hiruvar le úmanwaine, ar sie elme – lá quetien elde – nauvar nucumne pan anelme ta tance.

ENGLISH: Thus Jesus, six days before the festival, came to Bethany, where was Lazarus whom Jesus had raised from dead.
QUENYA: Sie Yésus, auri enque nó i aşar, túle Vetanianna, yasse enge Lásarus ye Yésus náne ortienwa qualinillon.

ENGLISH: Therefore I am happy when I am weak, when I suffer violence, when I have need, when I am persecuted or in difficulties, for Christ. For when I am weak, then I am strong.
QUENYA: Etta nanye valima íre nanye milya, íre perperin orme, íre samin maure, íre nanye roitaina hya urdiessen, Hriston. An íre nanye milya, tá nanye torya.

ENGLISH: A woman is to learn in quiet, fully submitting herself to authority.
QUENYA: Nís paruva quildesse, aqua panyala inse nu hére.

ENGLISH: It happened on the following day that the rulers and the elders and the scribes in Jerusalem assembled,
QUENYA: Túle i hilyala auresse i ocomner i turi ar i amyárar ar i parmangolmor Yerúsalemesse,

ENGLISH: That is, the children in the flesh are not truly God's children, but the children that exist by the promise are being counted as the seed.
QUENYA: Ta ná, i híni i hrávesse uar nanwave Eruo híni, mal i híni i ear i vandanen nar nótaine ve i erde.

ENGLISH: When the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received God's word, they sent Peter and John to them.
QUENYA: Íre i aposteli Yerúsalemesse hlasser i Samária camnelyane Eruo quetta, mentanelte Péter ar Yoháno téna.

ENGLISH: For I feared you, since you are a harsh man; you take up what you did not put down and you reap what you did not sow.'
QUENYA: An runcen lyello, pan nalye naraca nér; mapal ama ya ual panyane undu ar cirihtal ya ual rende.'

ENGLISH: Do they not speak against the name by which you were called?
QUENYA: Ma ualte nanquete i essenen yanen anelde yáline?

ENGLISH: For if our heart accuses us, God is greater than our heart and knows all things.
QUENYA: An qui endalva ulquete ve, Eru ná túra lá endalva ar ista ilye nati.

ENGLISH: Abraham begat Isaac, and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jakob begat Juda and his brothers,
QUENYA: Avraham óne Ísac, ar Ísac óne Yácov, ar Yácov óne Yehúra ar hánoryar,

ENGLISH: But the boy they brough away alive, and they were comforted beyond measure.
QUENYA: Mal i seldo tallelte oa coirea, ar anelte tiutane lesta pella.

ENGLISH: You are witnesses, like God is, how holy and just and perfect we were among you who believe.
QUENYA: Nalde astarmor, ve Eru ná, manen airi ar faile ar ilvane anelme mici elde i savir.

ENGLISH: he is a man of a double mind, unsteady in all his ways.
QUENYA: náse nér atwa sámo, iltanca ilye malleryassen.

ENGLISH: After saying these words he took a bread, gave thanks to God before them all, and broke it and began to eat.
QUENYA: Apa quetie quettar sine nampes massa, antane hantale Erun epe te illi, ar sa-rance ar yestane mate.

ENGLISH: For you were like sheep, straying; but now we have returned to who oversees our souls.
QUENYA: An anelde ve mámar, ranyala; mal sí enutúlielve i mavarenna ye ortire fealvar.

ENGLISH: He was not this light, but he was to witness about this light.
QUENYA: Lá anes cala sina, mal vettumnes pa cala sina.

ENGLISH: They said to him: “We have nothing here except five breads and two fishes!”
QUENYA: Quentelte senna: “Samilme munta sisse hequa massar lempe ar lingwe atta!”

ENGLISH: God, who long ago at numerous occasions and in numerous manners spoke to our fathers by the prophets,
QUENYA: Eru, ye andanéya mi rimbe lúli ar mi rimbe léli quente atarilvannar i Erutercánoinen,

ENGLISH: You have placed him a little under angels, you gave him a crown of glory and of honor; and you put him over the works of your hands.
QUENYA: Apánielyes pityave nu vali; antanel sen ríe alcarwa ar laitiéva; ar panyanelyes or mályato tamani.

ENGLISH: If anyone speaks, may he speak as if his sayings were God's words. If anyone serves, may he serve as if by the strenght that God gives; thus Gud will receive glory in all things, by Jesus Christ, who has the glroy and the might forever and ever. Amen!
QUENYA: Qui aiquen quete, nai quetuvas ve qui quetieryar náner Eruo quettar. Qui aiquen veuya, nai veuyuvas ve i poldorénen ya Eru anta; sie Eru camuva alcar ilye natissen, Yésus Hristonen, ye same i alcar ar i melehte tennoio ar oi. Násie!

ENGLISH: Sending a message, Joseph summoned Jacob his father and all his kin, seventy-five people.
QUENYA: Mentala menta, Yósef yalde Yácov atarya ar ilya nosserya, queni lempe otoquean.

ENGLISH: To who is not carrying his cross and coming after me, it is not possible to be my disciple.
QUENYA: Yen ua cóla tarwerya ar túla apa ni, ua ece náve hildonya.

ENGLISH: For there was a time that you were not a people, but now you are God's people; you were the ones that did not receive mercy, but now you are who have indeed received mercy.
QUENYA: An enge lúme ya únelde lie, mal sí nalde Eruo lie; anelde i uar camne óravie, mal nalde sí i é acámier óravie.

ENGLISH: Indeed nobody among us lives for himself, and nobody dies for himself,
QUENYA: É úquen mici vi coita insen, ar úquen quale insen,

ENGLISH: But after they were filled he said to his disciples: “Gather the leftover pieces, that nothing will be lost.”
QUENYA: Mal apa anelte quátine eques hildoryannar: “Á comya i hehtaine mittar, i munta nauva vanwa.”

ENGLISH: Therefore Pilate sought a way of releasing him. But the Jews shouted, saying: “If you relase this man, you are not a friend of the High King ! Anyone who makes self a king rises up against the High King!”
QUENYA: Etta Piláto cestane lé senien se. Mal i Yúrar yámer, quétala: “Qui senil nér sina, umilye meldo i Táraráno! Ilquen ye care immo aran amorta i Táraranna!”

ENGLISH: They are to speak evil about no one, not desiring dispute, being reasonable of mind, behaving gently to all men.
QUENYA: Á quetir ulco pa úquen, la merila cos, nála maxe sámo, lengala moicave ilye atanin.

ENGLISH: you that by him believe in God, who raised him from dead and gave him glory, for you to put your faith and your hope in God.
QUENYA: lé i sénen savir Erusse, ye ortane se qualinillon ar antane sen alcar, panieldan savielda ar estelelda Erusse.

ENGLISH: Surely you are not greater than Abraham our father, who died? Also the prophets died. What do you make self?
QUENYA: Lau elye ná túra lá Avraham atarelma, ye qualle? Yando i Erutercánor qualler. Man carilye immo?”

ENGLISH: After he went through those regions and encouraged that were there with numerous words, he came into Greece.
QUENYA: Apa lendes ter sane ménar ar hortane i enger tasse rimbe quettalínen, túles mir Hellas.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, those who ate of the breads were fixe thousand men.
QUENYA: Ente, i manter i massaron náner neri húmi lempe.

ENGLISH: “Therefore a man will leave his father and his mother, and he will stick to his wife, and the two will be one flesh.”
QUENYA: “Etta nér hehtuva atarya ar amillerya, ar himyuvas veriryanna, ar i atta nauvat hráve er.”

ENGLISH: Make known the word, stand ready in good times and in times that are not good, turn away error, speak stern words, speak encouragement , having every patience in your teaching.
QUENYA: Á cara sinwa i quetta, tara manwa máre lúmissen ar lúmissen yar uar máre, quera oa loitie, queta narace quettar, queta hortale, arwa ilya cóleo peantielyasse.

ENGLISH: Have joy in that day and leap, for behold! your reward is great in heaven. For those are the same things that their fathers did to the prophets.
QUENYA: Sama alasse aure entasse ar capa, an yé! paityalelda ná túra menelde. An tai nar i imye nati yar atariltar carner i Erutercánoin.

ENGLISH: Was anyone called circumcized? May he not become uncircumcized. Was anyone called without circumcision? May he not become circumcized.
QUENYA: Ma aiquen náne yálina oscirna? Nai uas oluva úoscirna. Ma aiquen náne yálina pen oscirie? Nai uas oluva oscirna.

ENGLISH: And you know that he was revealed to take away sins, and is not sin in him.
QUENYA: Ar istalde i sé náne apaintaina mapien oa úcari, ar lá ea úcare sesse.

ENGLISH: For this matter we speak to you by God's word: We, the living ones that remain until the Lord's coming, will by no means come before that have died,
QUENYA: An natto sina quetilve lenna Eruo quettanen: Elve, i coirear i lemyar tenna i Heruo entulesse, laume tuluvar epe i aquálier,

ENGLISH: Here, brothers, I use myself and Apollos as examples, for your good. Thus, by heeding us , you may learn this thing: “Do not go beyond the things written, to stop a person from elevating himself over another.”
QUENYA: Sisse, hánor, yuhtan imne ar Apollo ve epemmar, máraldan. Sie, cimiénen met, lertalde pare nat sina: “Áva mene han i técinar, pustien quén ortávello inse or exe.”

ENGLISH: “I was in Joppa city when I saw a vision, a kind of vessel that came down like a huge sheet of linen, being sent down from heaven by its four corners, and it came near to me.
QUENYA: “Engen Yoppa·ostosse íre cennen maur, nostaleo vene ya túle undu ve hoa talat páşeva, mentaina undu menello vincaryainen canta, ar túles hare ninna.

ENGLISH: In that day came to him some Sadducees, that say that is no resurrection, and they asked him:
QUENYA: Yana auresse túler senna Sanduceáli, i quetir i lá ea enortie, ar maquentelte senna:

ENGLISH: But we have courage and wish more to be away from the body and to dwell with the Lord.
QUENYA: Mal samilme huore ar merir ambe náve oa i hroallo ar mare as i Heru.

ENGLISH: when one speaks evil about us, we answer with friendly words. We have been as the world's refuse, a stain to be washed off all things, until now.
QUENYA: íre mo quete ulco pa me, hanquetilme nilde quettainen. Anaielme ve i mardo auhanta, vaxe náven sóvina ilye natillon, tenna sí.

ENGLISH: But one ran, filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on a reed, and let him drink, saying: “Let him be! Let us see if Elijah comes to take him down.”
QUENYA: Mal quén norne, quantane hwan sára limpenen, panyane sa liscesse, ar láve sen suce, quétala: “Lava sen náve! Alve cene qui Elía tule se-mapien undu.”

QUENYA: Íre i Yúrar i enger as María mí coa tiutien se cenner i orontes ar etemenne, etta hilyaneltes, intyala i anes lelyala i noirinna nítien tasse.

QUENYA: Ar íre i toltea auresse túle, náveryan oscirna, camnes i esse Yésus, yanen i vala estane se nó anes nostaina i mónasse.

QUENYA: Tarner tasse calpar enque, ve i şanyer sovalleo Yúraron; ilya calpa polde mapa lestar atta hya nelde.

ENGLISH: We always give thanks to God, the Father of Jesus Christ our Lord, while we are praying about you.
QUENYA: Antalme illume hantale Erun, Yésus Hristo Herulvo Atar, lan hyámalme pa le.

ENGLISH: If there are some widows with a believing woman, it compels for her to help them, not putting a burden on the congregation. Then the congregation can help those that indeed are widows.
QUENYA: Qui ea verulórali as sávala nís, mauya sen manya te, lá panyala cólo i ocombenna. Tá i ocombe pole manya i é nar verulórar.

QUENYA: Ar apa cirnelme ter i eare ara Cilicia ar Pamfilia túlelme hópanna Mírasse mi Licia.

ENGLISH: wishing to be teachers of law, but failing to understand both the things of which they are speaking and the ones of which they talk with bold words.
QUENYA: mérala náve peantari şanyeo, mal loitalte hanya yúyo i nati pa yar quétalte ar tai pa yar carpalte verye quettalínen.

ENGLISH: For the Christ as well did not please himself, but as is written: “The harsh words of who spoke harshly to you have fallen upon me.”
QUENYA: An yú i Hristo ua fastane inse, mal ve ná técina: “I narace quettar ion quenter naracave lyenna alantier ninna.”

ENGLISH: Thereafter he showed himself to Jacob, then to all the apostles,
QUENYA: Epeta tannesexe Yácoven, tá ilye i apostelin,

QUENYA: Tambe i coirea Atar ni-mentane ar samin coivie i Atarnen, sie yando ye mate ní samuva coivie inyenen.

QUENYA: Valima sé ye sáve i nauvar cárine nanwe i nati quétine senna lo i Héru!”

ENGLISH: for our goal is that we will do which is good, not in the Lord's eyes alone, but also in men's eyes.
QUENYA: an mehtelma ná i caruvalme ya mára ná, lá mí Heruo hendu erinque, mal yando mi atanion hendu.

QUENYA: Mal sí samilde valate immolaitieldainen. Ilya taite immolaitie ná olca.

ENGLISH: and saying: “Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is moon-sick and ailing, and he falls frequently into the fire and frequently into the water,
QUENYA: ar quétala: “Heru, órava yondonyasse, an náse ránahlaiwa ar nimpa, an lantas rimbave mir i náre ar rimbave mir i nén,

ENGLISH: But you say: 'Anyone who says to his father or to his mother: 'Anything useful that you were to receive from me, is a gift to God ' –
QUENYA: Mal elde quetir: 'Aiquen ye quete ataryanna hya amilleryanna: 'Aiqua aşea ya camumnetye nillo, ná anna Erun' –

ENGLISH: For Adam was created first, then Eve.
QUENYA: An Atan náne ontaina minyave, tá Éve.

ENGLISH: But in the place where he was crucified was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb, in which nobody was yet put .
QUENYA: Mal i nómesse yasse anes tarwestaina enge tarwa, ar i tarwasse vinya noire, yasse úquen en náne panyaina.

ENGLISH: You slaves, give in everything heed to the will of who are your lords by the flesh, not like eye-servants, as if to please men, but sincerely, fearing the Lord.

ENGLISH: There was with him one more, a beloved son. He sent to him to them last, saying: “They will have awe for my son.”
QUENYA: Enge óse an er, melda yondo. Mentanes téna sé métima, quétala: “Samuvalte áya yondonyan.”

ENGLISH: When the leaf sprouted and made fruit, then also the worthless plants came up.
QUENYA: Íre i lasse tuiane ar carne yáve, tá yando i úmirwe olvar túler ama.

ENGLISH: But you , when you pray, go into your own room, and after closing your door, pray to your Father who is in secret; then your Father who is secretly watching, will pay you.
QUENYA: Mal elye, ire hyamil, mena mir véra şambelya, ar apa holtie fennalya, hyama Atarelyanna ye ea nuldasse; tá Atarelya ye nuldave tíra, paityuva lyen.

ENGLISH: For if a person thinks that he is important when he is nothing, he tells a lie to himself.
QUENYA: An qui quén sana i náse valda íre náse munta, nyaris huru insen.

ENGLISH: Then the other disciple, who came first to the tomb, also went in; and he saw and he believed.
QUENYA: Tá i hyana hildo, ye túle minya i noirinna, yando lende minna; ar cennes ar sáves.

ENGLISH: Therefore they, sent by the congregation, went through Phoenicia and Samaria, telling how some non-Jews were converted , and they brought great joy to the brothers.
QUENYA: Etta té, mentane lo i ocombe, lender ter Foinicia ar Samária, nyárala manen Úyúrar querner inte, ar tallelte túra alasse i hánoin.

ENGLISH: But Peter from afar followed him into the courtyard of the chief priest, and he was sitting before a fire with the servants to be warm.
QUENYA: Mal Péter hairallo hilyane se mir paca i héra airimóva, ar hámanes epe ruine as i núror náven lauca.

ENGLISH: he went one time and forever into the holy place, not having blood of goats or young bulls, but having his own blood, getting an eternal deliverance for us.
QUENYA: lendes erya lú ar tennoio mir i aire nóme, lá arwa serceo nyéniron ar nesse mundoron, mal arwa véra serceryo, ñetala oira etelehtie ven.

ENGLISH: and a man in the field is not to return to his house to pick up his cloak.
QUENYA: ar nér i restasse áva nanwene coaryanna leptien collarya.

ENGLISH: What do the words “he went up” mean, if not that he also went down to the lower regions, that is, to earth?
QUENYA: Mana i quettar “lendes ama” tear, qui lá i yando lendes undu i ambe núre ménannar, ta ná, cemenna?

ENGLISH: Then the Devil led him to the holy city and put him at the pinnacle of the temple.
QUENYA: Tá i Arauco se-talle i aire ostonna ar se-panyane i cordo telmasse.

ENGLISH: And there was much murmuring about him among the crowds. Some people said: “He is a good man.” Others said: “He is not, but he causes the crowd to err!”
QUENYA: Ar enge olya nurrule pa sé imíca i şangar. Quelli quenter: “Náse mane nér.” Exeli quenter: “Uas, mal tyaris i şanga ranya!”

ENGLISH: and know a man will not receive justice by acts of Law, but solely by believing in Jesus Christ – also if we have believed in Jesus Christ in order to have justice by believing in Christ, and not by acts of Law. For is not flesh that will have justice by acts of Law.
QUENYA: ar istar atan ua samuva failie cardainen Şanyeo, mal eryave saviénen Hristo Yésusse – yando qui asávielve Yésus Hristosse samien failie saviénen Hristosse, ar lá cardainen Şanyeo. An ua ea hráve ya samuva failie cardainen Şanyeo.

ENGLISH: But the Jews stirred up the reverent women and the prominent men in the city, and they raised up persecution against Paul and Barnabas and threw them beyond their borders.
QUENYA: Mal i Yúrar valtaner i ainocimye nissi ar i minde neri i ostosse, ar ortanelte roitie ana Paulo yo Varnavas ar hanter tu rénaltar pella.

ENGLISH: And they put their hands on them and put them in gaol until the following day, for evening had come.
QUENYA: Ar panyanelte máltat tusse ar panyaner tu mandosse tenna i hilyala aure, an şinye náne tulinwa.

ENGLISH: Crossing country from there, Jesus came near to the Sea of Galilee, and after going up into a mountain he sat down there.
QUENYA: Lahtala nórie talo, Yésus túre hare i Earenna Alileo, ar apa menie ama mir oron hamunes tasse.

ENGLISH: Now in those days Peter arose out of the middle of the brothers – the crowd was around hundred and twenty persons – and said:
QUENYA: Sí yane auressen Péter oronte et endello i hánoron – i şánga náne os queni yúquean tuxa – ar quente:

ENGLISH: This is what the comparison means: The seed is God's word.
QUENYA: Si ná ya tea i sestie: I erde ná Eruo quetta.

ENGLISH: Therefore he also says in another psalm: You will not allow your faithful one to see a corrupt state.
QUENYA: Etta yú quetis hyana airelíresse: Ual lavuva vorondalyan cene quelexima sóma.

ENGLISH: and so also the men forsook nature's use of the woman and were kindled with their lust one for the other, men with men, doing what is perverse, and receiving in themselves the reward that they were worthy of because of their error.
QUENYA: and sie yú i neri hehtaner nasseo yuhtie i nisseva ar náner nartane maileltanen quén i exeva, neri as neri, carila ya quarca ná, ar camila intesse i paityale yan anelte valde loimaltanen.

ENGLISH: And it happened in those days that a command went forth from Augustus the High King, that one was to count the whole world.
QUENYA: Ar túle ente auressen i etelende canwa Auhusto i Ingaranello, i mo notumne i quanda mar.

ENGLISH: While he still spoke, a man came from house of the chief of the synagogue, saying: “Your daughter has died. Do not trouble the teacher more.”
QUENYA: Íre en quentes, nér túle coallo i turcova i yomencavo, quétala: “Yeldelya aquálie. Áva tarasta i peantar ambe.”

ENGLISH: and without waiting he made Jesus known in the synagogues, that he is the Son of God.
QUENYA: ar pen hopie carnes Yésus sinwa i yomencoassen, in isse i Eruion ná.

ENGLISH: Are you that stupid? After you had your beginning in spirit, are you now completed in flesh?
QUENYA: Ma nalde ta lamanwe? Apa sámelde yestalda fairesse, ma sí nalde telyaine hrávesse?

ENGLISH: The Lord said to my lord: Sit by my right hand until I place your enemies under your feet'– ?
QUENYA: I Héru quente herunyanna: Hara ara formanya tenna panyan ñottolyar nu talulyat – ?

ENGLISH: Among the slaves of the chief priest was one of the family of the man whose ear Peter cut off, and he said: “Did I not see you in the garden with him?”
QUENYA: Imíca i móli i héra airimo enge quén i nosseo i nero yeo hlas Péter aucirne, ar eques: “Ma uan cenne lyé i tarwasse óse?”

ENGLISH: But after two years passed, Felix was followed as governor by Porcius Festus, and since Felix wanted to have the grace of the Jews, he left Paul bound.
QUENYA: Mal apa loa atta vánet, Felix náne hilyana ve nórecáno lo Porcio Festo, ar pan Felix merne same i Yúraron lisse, hehtanes Paulo nútina.

ENGLISH: He said to them: “How, then, may David by the Spirit call him Lord, saying:
QUENYA: Quentes téna: “Manen, tá, lerta Lavir i Fairenen esta se Heru, quétala:

ENGLISH: And he raised his eyes towards his disciples and said: “Happy are the poor, for God's kingdom is yours!
QUENYA: Ar ortanes henduryat hilmoryannar ar quente: “Valime nar i penyar, an Eruo aranie ná lenya!

ENGLISH: When Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul completely gave himself to making the Word known, witnessing to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.
QUENYA: Íre Sílas ar Timoşeo ununter Maceroniallo, Paulo aqua antanexe carien i Quetta sinwa, vettala i Yúrain i Yésus ná i Hristo.

ENGLISH: For this is the covenant that I shall make with the house of Israel after those days, says the Lord: I shall put my laws in their minds, and in their hearts I shall write them. And I shall be their God, and they shall be my people.
QUENYA: An si ná i vére ya caruvan as Israélo már apa auri ente, quete i Héru: Panyuvan şanyenyar sámaltassen, ar endaltasse tecuyanyet. Ar nauvan Ainolta, ar té nauvar lienya.

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus, when he taught in the temple, cried out and said: “Me you know, you know also from where I am. I have not come by myself, but who sent me is true, he whom you do not know.
QUENYA: Etta Yésus, íre peantanes i cordasse, etyáme ar quente: “Ní istalde, yando istalde yallo nanye. Lá utúlien immonen, mal ye ni-mentane şanda ná, sé ye lé uar ista.

ENGLISH: It happened in one of the days that he and his disciples went into a boat, and he said to them: “Let us pass over to the other shore of the lake.” Thus they sailed away.
QUENYA: Túle mi er i aurion i sé ar hildoryar lender mir lunte, ar quentes téna: “Alve lahta i hyana fáranna i ailino.” Sie cirnelte oa.

ENGLISH: Thus you will not be slow, but will do like they do who by faith and patience are hears to the promises.
QUENYA: Sie ualde nauva lence, mal caruvar ve té carir i saviénen ar cólenen nar aryoni i vandaron.

ENGLISH: For as the Father has life in self, so he has given the Son to have life in self.
QUENYA: An tambe i Atar same coivie immosse, sie ánies i Yondon samie coivie immosse.

ENGLISH: For like death came through a man, also resurrection of dead is through a man.
QUENYA: An ve qualme túle ter atan, yú enortáve qualinaiva ter atan ná.

ENGLISH: After they went away to buy, the bridegroom came, and the maidens that were ready went with him to the feast of marriage, and the door was closed.
QUENYA: Apa oantelte homancien, i ender túle, ar i vendi i náner manwe lende óse i merendenna veryangweo, ar i fenna náne holtana.

ENGLISH: For what reason are you inquiring of me? Inquire of who heard what I said to them. Look! They know what I said.”
QUENYA: Mana i casta yanen ní céşal? Ceşa i hlasser ya quenten téna. Yé! Té istar ya quenten.”

ENGLISH: and yet you do not know him. But I know him. And if I said that I do not know him, I should be like you – a liar. But I know him, and his word I keep.
QUENYA: ananta ualde ista se. Mal inye ista se. Ar qui quenten i uan ista se, umnen ve lé – hurindo. Mal istanyes, ar quettarya himyan.

ENGLISH: And the apostles and the elders assembled to make a consideration about this matter.
QUENYA: Ar i aposteli ar i amyárar ocomner carien úvie pa natto sina.

ENGLISH: For I am also now poured forth as a drink-offering, and the time when I shall be freed is near.
QUENYA: An inye ná yando sí etulyaina ve sucieyanca, ar i lúme yasse nauvan leryaina hare ná.

ENGLISH: Put on yourselves the protective gear of God, for you to stand against the Devil's tricks.
QUENYA: Á panya indesse i varyala sorosta Eruo, tarieltan i Arauco fintelennar.

ENGLISH: The wise ones answered: 'Maybe the oil will not suffice for us and for you. Instead go and buy for yourselves!'
QUENYA: I sailar hanquenter: “Cé i millo ua faryuva men ar len. I mende mena ar á homanca elden!”

ENGLISH: Many times it has thrown him into fire and into water alike, to undo him. But if you can, help us , having mercy on us!”
QUENYA: Rimbe lúli se-aháties mir náre ar mir nén véla, nancarien se. Mal qui polil, áment manya, orávala metse!”

ENGLISH: For from time to time an angel of the Lord came down into the pool, causing a stirring of the water, and anyone who went first into the pool after the disturbance of the water was healed from every kind of illness that he had.
QUENYA: An lúllo lúnna Héru vala túle undu mir i ailin, tyárala coire i nenwa, ar aiquen ye lende minya mir i ailin apa i tarastie i nenwa náne nestaina ilya nostaleo hlíveva ya sámes.

ENGLISH: Let both grow until the harvest, and when the harvest shall come, I will say to the ones that will reap: First gather the worthless plants and bind them into bunches to be burnt; then go to gather the grain into my barn!”
QUENYA: Lava yúyon ale tenna i yávie, ar íre i yávie tuluva, quetuvan innar cirihtuvar: Minyave á comya i úmirwe olvar ar nuta te mir loxi náven urtaine; tá mena comien i ore mir hauranya!”

ENGLISH: Indeed all the seven did not leave seed. Last of all the woman also died.
QUENYA: É ilye i otso uar hehtane erde. Métima illion i nís yando qualle.

ENGLISH: The deeds of the flesh are easily seen, and they are fornication, uncleanness, loose conduct,
QUENYA: I hráveo cardar nar aşcénine, ar nalte hrupuhtie, úpoicie, lehta lengie,

ENGLISH: A new command I give you: to love one another. Just as I have loved you, so you too are to love one another.
QUENYA: Vinya axan antan len: melie quén i exe. Aqua ve inye emélie le, sie yando lé meluvar quén i exe.

ENGLISH: But he says to me: “Take heed! Do not do ! I am another servant with you and your brothers who are prophets, and with who heed the words of this book! Worship God!”
QUENYA: Mal quetis ninna: ”Cima! Áva care! Nanye hyana núro as lyé ar hánolyar i nar Erutercánor, ar as i cimir i quettar parma sino! Tyera Eru!”

ENGLISH: a light to take away the veil from the nations and a glory to Israel your people.
QUENYA: cala mapien oa i vaşar i nórellon ar alcar Israel lielyan.”

ENGLISH: And the Pharisees and their scribes grumbled against his disciples, saying: “How is that you eat and you drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
QUENYA: Ar i Farisar ar parmangolmoltar nurruner hildoryannar, quétala: “Manen ná i matilde ar sucilde as tungwemóli ar úcarindoli?”

ENGLISH: They as well, if they do not remain in their lack of faith, will be put into the tree, for God can put them there.
QUENYA: Yú té, qui ualte lemya penieltasse saviéva, nauvar panyane mir i alda, an Eru pole panya te tar.

ENGLISH: Jesus spoke this comparison to them, but they did not understand that he said to them.
QUENYA: Yésus quente sestie sina téna, mal ualte hanyane yar quentes téna.

ENGLISH: according to the glorious gospel of the happy God, which was placed in my keeping.
QUENYA: ve i alcarinqua evandilyon i valima Aino, ya náne panyaina hepienyasse.

ENGLISH: But others said: “He is Elijah.” Still others said: “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of the past.”
QUENYA: Mal exeli quenter: “Náse Elía.” En exeli quenter: “Náse Erutercáno, ve quén i Erutercánoron i vanwiéno.”

ENGLISH: He, being in God's form, did not count being like God a thing that he was going to seize.
QUENYA: Sé, nála Eruo cantasse, ua nonte náve ve Eru nat ya mapumnes.

ENGLISH: When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, do everything that you can to come to me in Nicopolis, for there I have decived to remain for the winter.
QUENYA: Íre mentan Artemas hya Ticico lyenna, cara ilqua ya polil tulien ninna Nicopolisse, an tasse aşantien termare i hrívesse.

ENGLISH: All scriptures breathed by God are also beneficial for instruction, for refuting error, for making matters straight, for chastisement in righteousness.
QUENYA: Ilye tehteler şúyaine lo Eru nar yando aşie peantien, querien oa loitie, carien nattor tére, paimestan failiesse.

ENGLISH: But he was in the back of the boat, asleep on a pillow, and they woke him up and said to him: “Lord, is it not important to you that we are dying?”
QUENYA: Mal sé náne pontisse i lunteo, lorna nirwasse, ar eccoitaneltes ar quenter senna: “Heru, ma ua valda lyen i quélalme?”

ENGLISH: I do not want to receive glory from men,
QUENYA: Uan mere came alcar atanillon,

ENGLISH: But Nathanael said to him: “Can anything good come from Nazareth?”
QUENYA: Mal eque senna Natanael: “Ma aiqua mára pole tule Nasaretello?”

ENGLISH: I saw also the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
QUENYA: Cennen yú i aire osto, Vinya Yerúsalem, túla undu et menello, manwana ve indis netyana veruryan.

ENGLISH: he has now made peace by his fleshly body, by dying, to place you holy and perfect and beyond accusation before himself
QUENYA: sí acáries raine i hroaryanen hráveva, qualiénen, panien le airi ar ilvane ar han ulquetie epe inse

ENGLISH: And Jesus went to them and spoke to them, saying: “All lordship has been given me in heaven and earth.
QUENYA: Ar Yésus lende téna ar carampe téna, quétala: “Ilya hére anaie nin antana mi menel cemenye.

ENGLISH: Then from that time Jesus began to show to his disciples that it was necessary for him to go to Jerusalem and to suffer many things from the elders and scribes, and to be slain, and on the third day to be raised.
QUENYA: Lúme yanallo Yésus yestane tana hildoryain i mauyane sen lelya Yerúsalemenna ar perpere rimbe natali ho i amyárar ar parmangolmor, ar náve nahtana, ar i nelya auresse náve ortana.

ENGLISH: And when the dragon saw that it was thrown down upon earth, it pursued the woman who bore the boy.
QUENYA: Ar íre i hlóce cenne i anes hátina undu cemenna, roitanes i nís ye colde i seldo.

ENGLISH: Nicodemus, one among them who had come to him formerly, said to them:
QUENYA: Nicorémus, quén imíca te ye náne túlienwa senna yá, quente téna:

ENGLISH: made us alive with the Christ, also when we were dead in crimes. By grace we have been saved,
QUENYA: vi-carne coirie as i Hristo, yando íre anelve qualini ongwelissen. Lissenen anaielde rehtaine,

ENGLISH: And Peter said to him: “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Rise and arrange your bed!” And he arose in the same moment.
QUENYA: Ar Péter quente senna: “Éneas, Yésus Hristo nesta lye. Á orya ar á parta caimalya!” Ar oronyes mí imya lú.

ENGLISH: but you sanctify the Christ as Lord in your heart. Always have your answer ready for everyone who demands a reason for the hope that dwells in you, but do so in a mild manner and having awe .
QUENYA: mal alde airita i Hristo ve Heru endaldasse! Illume sama hanquentalda manwa ilquenen ye cane casta i estelen ya mare lesse, ono cara sie mi milya lé ar arwe áyo.

ENGLISH: But he answered them: “ who gave me good health, he said to me: Take up your bed and walk.”
QUENYA: Mal hanquentes téna: “Ye nin-antane mále, sé quente ninna: Á mapa amba caimalya ar á vanta.”

ENGLISH: He that did not know sin he made sin for us, for us to be God's righteousness through him.
QUENYA: Sé ye ua sinte úcare carnes úcare elven, návelvan Eruo failie ter sé.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus answered her: “O woman, your faith is great; may it happen to you as you have believed!” And the daughter was healed from that hour.
QUENYA: Tá Yésus hanquente senna: “A nís, savielya túra ná; nai martuva lyen ve asáviel!” Ar i selye náne nestana lúme yanallo.

ENGLISH: But turn away younger widows, for when their sexual desire draws them away from Christ, they wish to marry
QUENYA: Mal quera oa ambe nesse verúlórar, an íre yérelta tuce te oa Hristollo, merilte verya

ENGLISH: Miserable man that I am! Who will save me from this body of death?
QUENYA: Angayanda nér ye nanye! Man ni-rehtuva sina hroallo qualmeva?

ENGLISH: Therefore I loathed this generation and said: Always they stray in their heart, and they have not known my ways.
QUENYA: Etta feuyanen nónare sina ar quente: Illume ranyalte endaltasse, ar té uar isintier tienyar.

ENGLISH: Therefore some people among them believed and stuck to Paul and Silas, with a great multitude of the Greeks that served God, and not a few of the most prominent women.
QUENYA: Etta ennoli mici te sáver ar himyaner Paulo ar Sílas, as hoa liyúme i Hellenyaron i tyerner Eru, ar lá mancali i amminde nission.

ENGLISH: For when they still were not born, and before they did good or evil – to make God's purpose concerning the choice depend, not on deeds, but on who calls –
QUENYA: An íre en uatte nóne, ar uatte acárie márie hya ulco – tyarien Eruo enne pa i cilme linga, lá cardassen, mal yesse yale –

ENGLISH: For such people are servants, not to Jesus Christ, but to their own bellies, and with fair words and having honey on their tongue they cause to stray the heart of the innocent ones.
QUENYA: An taiti queni nar móli, lá Yésus Hriston, mál vére cumbaltain, ar vanime quettainen ar arwe lisso to lambalta tyarilte ranya i cámalóraron enda.

ENGLISH: But the centurion and with him that were watching Jesus, when they saw the earthquake and the things happening, were extremely terrified, saying: “This man was indeed God's Son!”
QUENYA: Mal i tuxantur ar óse i tíraner Yésus, íre cennelte i cempalie ar i nati martala, náner ita ruhtaine, quétala: “Nér sina é náne Eruo Yondo!”

ENGLISH: Hidden in him are all the treasures of wisdom and of knowlegde.
QUENYA: Nurtaine sesse ear ilye i harmar sailiéva ar istyava.

ENGLISH: For if you believed Moses’ saying you believed mine , for he wrote about me.
QUENYA: An qui sávelde Móseo quetie sávelde ninya, an sé tence pa ni.

ENGLISH: For we shall be ready to punish every deed which is not obedient, after you have been made wholly obedient.
QUENYA: Ar nauvalme manwe paimetien ilya carda ya ua canwacimya, apa elde anaier cárine aqua canwacimye.

ENGLISH: When day came, the Jews made a compact and cursed themselves if they ate or drank before killing Paul.
QUENYA: Íre aure túle, i Yúrar carner vére ar hunter inte qui mantelte hya suncelte nó nahtie Paulo.

ENGLISH: Now came to Ephesus a Jew whose name was Apollo, born in Alexandria. He knew to talk well and was mighty in the Scriptures.
QUENYA: Sí túle Efesusenna Yúra yeo esse náne Apollo, nóna Alexandriasse. Sintes carpa mai ar náne taura i Tehtelessen.

ENGLISH: For me it is a very small matter to be examined by you or by human judges. Indeed I do not examine myself.
QUENYA: Inyen ná ita cinta natto náve hentaina lo elde hya lo fírime námor. É inye ua henta imne.

ENGLISH: Now about Apollos our brother: I urged him with many words to come to us, with the brothers, and yet his will was not to come now, but he shall come when it shall be possible for him.. Be awake, be firm in the faith, be manly, be mighty!
QUENYA: Sí pa Apollo hánolva: Hortanenyes rimbe quettalínen tule menna, as i hánor, ananta şelmarya úne tule sí, mal tuluvas íre ecuva sen. Na cuive, na tance i saviesse, na vie, na taure!

ENGLISH: This is my, Paul's, greeting, by my own hand.
QUENYA: Sisse ea ninya, Paulo, suilie, véra mányanen.

ENGLISH: and Solomon begat Rehoboam, and Rehoboam begat Abijah, and Abijah begat Asa,
QUENYA: ar Solomon óne Rehóvoam, ar Rehóvoam óne Ávia, ar Ávia óne Ása,

ENGLISH: to another, working of wonders, to another, speaking as a Prophet, to another insight on the spirits, to another, kinds of tongues, to another, telling what tongues mean.
QUENYA: exen, molie elmendaiva, exen, quetie ve Erutercáno, exen, tercen i fairissen, exen, nostaler lambion, exen, nyarie mana lambi tear.

ENGLISH: But he talked in the synagogue every sabbath and caused Jews and Greeks to believe.
QUENYA: Mal carampes i yomencoasse ilya sendaresse ar tyarne Yúrar ar Hellenyar save.

ENGLISH: to the holy and faithful brothers in Christ that are in Colossae: Grace to you, and peace from God our Father.
QUENYA: i airi ar voronde hánonnar Hristosse i ear mi Colosse: Lisse len, ar raine Eru Atarelvallo.

ENGLISH: But woe to you that are rich, for you have received your entire comfort!
QUENYA: Mal horro len i nar lárie, an asámielde quanda tiutalelda!

ENGLISH: for the fruit of light is every kind of goodness and justice and truth.
QUENYA: an i calo yáve ná ilya nostaleo márie ar failie ar nanwie.

ENGLISH: for we walk by faith, not by seeing.
QUENYA: an vantalme saviénen, lá ceniénen.

ENGLISH: everyone's work will be shown, for the Day will show it , and it will be revealed as by fire, and everyone's labor, of what kind it is, the fire itself will test.
QUENYA: ilqueno molie nauva tanana, an i Aure tanuva sa, ar nauvas apantana ve nárnen, ar ilqueno molie, mana nostaleo sa ná, i nár imma tyastuva.

ENGLISH: A person among the Pharisees requested that Jesus was to eat with him, and coming into the Pharisee's house he laid down by the table.
QUENYA: Quén imíca i Farisar arcane i Yésus matumne óse, ar túlala mir coa i Farisava caines undu ara i sarno.

ENGLISH: Serpents, brood of worms, how will you escape from the judgment of Gehenna?
QUENYA: Leucar, vembion hín, manen uşuvalde Ehenno námiello?

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “You have said it. But I say to you: From now you will see the Son of God sitting by the right hand of the Power and coming on the clouds of heaven!”
QUENYA: Yésus quente senna: “Elye equétie sa. Mal quetin lenna: Ho sí cenuvalde i Eruion hára ara i Túreo forma ar túla menelo fanyassen!”

ENGLISH: And a white robe was given to everyone among them; and was said to them that it was necessary for them to be still for yet a little while, until the number was filled also of their fellow servants and of their brothers, who were going to be slain like themselves.
QUENYA: Ar ninque vaima náne antana ilquenen mici te; ar náne tien quétina i mauyane tien náve sende an şinta lúmesse, tenna i nóte náne quátina yú ion málonúroltaron ar hánoltaron, i nauvaner nahtane ve inte.

ENGLISH: Therefore, having that great a cloud of witnesses around us, may we as well put away every heavy thing and the sin that quickly ensnares us, and let us run with endurance the race put before us,
QUENYA: Etta, arwe ta hoa fanyo vettolíva os ve, nai yando elve panyuva oa ilya lunga nat ar i úcare ya lintiénen vi-remba, ar alve nore voronwiénen i norme panyaina epe vi,

ENGLISH: Be wrathful, and yet do not sin; do not allow the sun to set on your wrath.
QUENYA: Na rúşie, ananta áva úcare; áva lave Anaren núta rúşeldanna.

ENGLISH: And the crowd came up and began to ask that was done to them as the custom was.
QUENYA: Ar i şanga túle ama ar yestane arca i náne carna tien ve i sito né.

ENGLISH: Indeed there are some that make Christ known out of envy and quarrelling, but others also sincerely.
QUENYA: É ear queneli i carir Hristo sinwa et hrúcenello ar costiello, mal exeli yando holmo.

ENGLISH: Indeed all that wish to have a reverent life in Christ Jesus shall be persecuted.
QUENYA: É illi i merir same ainocimya coivie mi Hristo Yésus nauvar roitaine.

ENGLISH: For sin will not rule you, for you are not under law, but under grace.
QUENYA: An úcare ua le-turuva, an ualde nu şanye, mal nu Erulisse.

ENGLISH: It is sown as a body of matter; it is raised as a body of spirit.
QUENYA: Nas rérina ve hroa ermava; nas ortana ve hroa faireva.

ENGLISH: But after they stretched him out with straps for the flogging, Paul said to the centurion who was standing there: “May you flog a man who is Roman, and who is not judged?”
QUENYA: Mal apa lenuneltes lattalínen i riptien, Paulo quente i tuxanturenna ye tárane tasse: “Ma lertal ripta nér ye Rómea ná, ar ye ua námina?”

ENGLISH: Nathanael said to him: “How do you know me?” Jesus answered and said: “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
QUENYA: Eque senna Natanael: “Manen elye ista ní?” Yésus hanquente ar eque: “Nó Filip yalde lye, íre engel nu i relyávalda, lye-cennen.”

ENGLISH: But now remain faith, hope, love – these three – but the greatest among them is love.
QUENYA: Ono sí lemyar savie, estel, melme – nelde sine – mal i antúra mici tai melme ná.

ENGLISH: And he said: “Where have you put him?” They said to him: “Lord, come and see.”
QUENYA: Ar eques: “Masse apánieldes?” Quentelte senna: “Heru, tula ar cena.”

ENGLISH: And a woman having a husband who does not believe, and yet the man wishes to live with her by his free will, may not abandon her husband.
QUENYA: Ar nís arwa veruo ye ua save, ananta i nér mere mare óse léra nirmeryanen, ua lerta hehta verurya.

ENGLISH: Like the person made of dust, thus are also that were made of dust, and like the heavenly person is, so are also that are heavenly.
QUENYA: Ve i quén cárina astova, sie nar yú i náner cárine astova, ar ve i meneldea quén ná, sie nar yú i nar meneldie.

ENGLISH: And again he began to teach by the sea. A great host gathered near to him, and therefore he went into a boat and sat in the sea, but the whole crowd by the sea was on the shore.
QUENYA: Ar ata yestanes peanta ara i ear. Hoa şanga ocomne hare senna, ar etta lendes mir lunte ar hamne i earesse, mal i quanda şanga ara i ear náne i hrestasse.

ENGLISH: While the words were still in his mouth, behold! a bright cloud overshadowed them, and there was a voice out of the cloud that said: “This is my son, the beloved, with whom I am pleased; listen to him!”
QUENYA: Íre i quettar en náner antoryasse, yé! calima fanya teltane te, ar enge óma et i fanyallo ya quente: “Si yondonya ná, i melda, pa ye nanye fastaina; á lasta senna!”

ENGLISH: While he walked beside the Sea of Galilee he saw Simon and Andrew , Simon's brother, throwing their into the sea, for they were fishermen.
QUENYA: Lan vantanes ara Ear Alileo cennes Símon ar Andreas, Símondo háno, hátala rembettar mir i ear, an anette raitandoli.

ENGLISH: you who instruct others, do you not instruct yourself? You who instruct: “Do not steal,” do you steal?
QUENYA: elye ye peanta exin, ma ual peanta imlen? Elye ye peanta: “Áva pile,” ma pilil?

ENGLISH: And I saw, and behold! the Lamb was standing on Mount Sion, and with it four and forty and a hundred thousands that have his name and the name of his Father written on their forehead.
QUENYA: Ar cennen, ar yé! i Eule tárane to Oron Síon, ar as sé húmi canta canaquean ar tuxa i samir esserya ar i esse Ataryo técine timbareltasse.

ENGLISH: For in it God's righteousness is being revealed by faith and into faith, as is written: “But the righteous – by faith he shall have life.”
QUENYA: An sasse Eruo failie ná apantaina saviénen ar mir savie, ve ná técina: “Mal i faila – saviénen coituvas.”

ENGLISH: And after calling them to himself, he said to them by means of comparisons: “How can Satan throw Satan out?
QUENYA: Ar apa yalie te insenna, quentes ten sestielínen: “Manen Sátan pole et-hate Sátan?

ENGLISH: But when they stood off onto land they saw a coal fire lie there and some fishes lying on it, and bread.
QUENYA: Mal íre hótarnelte nórenna cennelte caitea tasse hyulmaruine ar lingwili caitala sanna, ar massa.

ENGLISH: They seek you with a burning desire, not for good, but they want to cut you away from me, for you to seek them with a burning desire.
QUENYA: Cestalte le uryala írenen, lá márien, mal merilte cire le oa nillo, cestieldan té uryala írenen.

ENGLISH: Now we went before them to the boat and sailed away to Assos, where we were going to receive Paul into the ship. For after he gave commands about that, he himself wished to go on his feet .
QUENYA: Sí lendelme epe te i luntenna ar cirner oa Assosenna, yasse camumnelme Paulo mir i cirya. An apa antanes canwar pa ta, isse merne lelya talyanten.

ENGLISH: And he went into Jerusalem, into the temple, and he looked at all things. But even then the hour was late, and so he wet out to Bethany with the twelve.
QUENYA: Ar lendes mir Yerúsalem, mir i corda, ar yentes ilye nati. Mal yando tá i lúme náne telwa, ar sie etelendes Vetánianna as i yunque.
