ENGLISH: Jesus answered him: “You had no authority at all over me if it was not given you from on high. Because of this the man who turned me over to you has greater sin.”
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente senna: “Laume sámel hére or ní qui úmes antaina lyen táriello. Sinen i nér ye ni-arantane lyen same ambe túra úcare.”

ENGLISH: But he sent also another slave. Him as well they sent away, after beating him and humiliating him.
QUENYA: Mal mentanes yando hyana mól. Yando sé mentanelte oa, apa palpie se ar nucumie se.

ENGLISH: We do not go beyond our borders by praising ourselves about work done by others, but we have the hope that when your faith grows, we as well will be made mighty among you, by the measure given us. Then we will reach still further,
QUENYA: Ualme mene han rénalmar laitiénen imme pa molie cárina lo exi, mal samilme i estel i íre savielda ale, yando elme nauvar cárine taure imíca le, i lestanen antaina men. Tá rahtuvalme en ambe hairave,

ENGLISH: Heed well how great he is, this man to whom Abraham, the patriarch , gave a tenth of the best goods seized in the war.
QUENYA: Cima mai manen túra náse, nér sina yen Avraham, i nossentur, antane quaista i arye armaron mapaine i ohtasse.

ENGLISH: and the person who summoned you will come and say to you: 'Allow this man to have the place!' And then it is necessary for you to go humbled to the lowest place.
QUENYA: ar i quén ye lye-tultane tuluva ar quetuva lyenna: 'Lava nér sinan same i nóme!' Ar tá mauya lyen mene nucumna i amnalda nómenna.

ENGLISH: but said farewell and told them: “I will return to you again, if God wishes.” And he sailed away to Ephesus and came down to Caesarea. And he went up and greeted the congregation, and went down to Antioch.
QUENYA: mal quentes namárie ar nyarne tien: “Nanwenuvan lenna ata, qui Eru mere.” Ar cirnes oa Efesusello ar túle undu Césareanna. Ar lendes ama ar suilane i ocombe, ar ununte Antiocenna.

ENGLISH: If it is possible for me as well to go, they shall go with me.
QUENYA: Qui ecuva yú inyen lelya, lelyuvalte óni.

ENGLISH: But in those days Mary arose and went with urgency to a city in Judea,
QUENYA: Mal yane auressen María oronte ar lende hormenen ostonna Yúreasse,

ENGLISH: doing evil to themselves as a payment for unrighteousness. What they count a joy is to dwell in abundance. They are blots and stains, finding abundant joy in their lying teachings while they make themselves festive with you.
QUENYA: cárala ulco inten ve paityale úfailien. Ya notilte alasse ná marie úvesse. Nalte mordoli ar vaxeli, hírala úvea alasse húrala peantieltassen íre cariltexer merye aselde.

ENGLISH: I sent you to reap which you have not worked . Others have worked, and you have come into their work.”
QUENYA: Inye mentane le cirihtien ya ualde omólie. Exeli omólier, ar lé utúlier mir molielta.”

ENGLISH: Therefore, as had to be , the images of the heavenly things were by them purified, but the heavenly things themselves have been purified by sacrifices which were better than such sacrifices.
QUENYA: Etta, maurenen, i emmar i meneldie nation náner tainen poitaine, mal i meneldie nati inte anaier poitaine yancalínen yar nar arye lá taiti yancar.

ENGLISH: Jesus, when he noticed a crowd gathering, spoke firmly to the unclean spirit, saying to it: “O dumb and deaf spirit, I command you: Pass from him and do not go into him again!”
QUENYA: Yésus, íre túnes şanga ocóma, carampe tulcave i úpoica fairenna, quétala senna: “A úpa ar hlárelóra faire, inye cána lyen: Á auta sello ar áva lelya minna se ata!”

ENGLISH: While I was doing these things, they found me cleansed in the temple, but was not crowd or uprising. But were there some Jews from Asia,
QUENYA: Lan cáranen nati sine, hirnelte ni poitana i cordasse, mal lá enge şanga hya amortie. Mal enger tasse Yúrali Asiallo,

ENGLISH: while we look to who is Chief of our faith and who makes it perfect, Jesus. For the joy that was put before him he suffered the cross, despising shame, and he has sat down to the right of the throne of God.
QUENYA: íre yétalve yenna ná savielvo Cáno ar ye care sa ilvana, Yésus. I alassen ya náne panyaina epe se perpéres i tarwe, nattírala naityale, ar ahámie undu i foryasse i mahalmo Eruva.

ENGLISH: For the death that he died, he died concerning sin a single time and forever, but the life that he lives, he lives for God.
QUENYA: An i qualme ya qualles, qualles pa úcare erya lú ar tennoio, mal i coivie ya coitas, coitas Erun.

ENGLISH: When he saw that, Simon Peter fell down before Jesus' knees, saying: “Go away from me, for I am a sinful man, Lord!”
QUENYA: Íre cennes ta, Símon Péter lantane undu epe Yésuo occat, quétala: “Á auta nillo, an nanye úcarunqua nér, Heru!”

ENGLISH: Saul, who is also Paul , was filled with Holy Spirit, looked at him
QUENYA: Saul, ye ná yú Paulo, náne quátina Aire Feanen, yente se

ENGLISH: son of Cainan, son of Arpachshad, son of Shem, son of Noah, son of Lamech,
QUENYA: yondorya Cainan, yondorya Arpaxar, yondorya Hyem, yondorya Noa, yondorya Lamec,

ENGLISH: Then Agrippa said to Festus: “I as well wish to hear the man.” He answered: “Tomorrow you will hear him.”
QUENYA: Tá Árippa quente Festonna: “Yu inye mere hlare i nér.” Hanquentes: “Enwa hlaruvalyes.”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, when you hear about wars and uprisings, do not be terrified! For it is necessary that these things will come first, but the end does not come at the same time.
QUENYA: Ente, íre hlarilde pa ohtali ar amortiéli, áva na ruhtaine! An mauya i nati sine tuluvar minyave, mal i metta ua tule mí imya lúme.”

ENGLISH: on the day that he shall come to receive glory among his holy ones and to be watched with wonder by all that believed – for the witness that we gave was believed by yourselves.
QUENYA: i auresse ya tuluvas camien alcar mici airiryar ar náven tíraina elmendanen lo illi i sáver – an i vettie ya antanelme náne sávina lo elde.

ENGLISH: And when the Lord saw her, his heart went out to her, and he said to her: “Do not be wailing!”
QUENYA: Ar íre i Heru cenne se, endarya etelende senna, ar quentes senna: “Áva na yaimea!”

ENGLISH: Therefore these soldiers took Paul, as was commanded to them, and brought him at night to Antipatris.
QUENYA: Etta ohtari sine namper Paulo, ve náne tien cánina, ar taller se lómisse Antipatrisenna.

ENGLISH: And to the angel of the congregation in Pergamum write: This says who has the sharp longsword having two edges:
QUENYA: Ar i valanna i ocombeo Peryamumesse teca: Sin quete ye same i aica andamacil arwa címa atto:

ENGLISH: to give knowledge of salvation to his people by forgiveness of their sins,
QUENYA: antien istya rehtiéno lieryan apseniénen úcareltaiva,

ENGLISH: Jesus saw Nathanael come to him and said of him: “Behold a true Israelite, in whom there is no deceit !”
QUENYA: Yésus cenne Natanael túla senna ar quente pa se: “Ela nanwa Israelinde, yesse lá ea vartie!”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, demons came out from numerous ones, crying and saying: “You are God's son.” But he rebuked them and did not allow them to speak, since they knew that he was the Christ.
QUENYA: Ente, raucoli ettúler rimbalillon, yámala ar quétala: “Elye ná Eruo yondo.” Mal naityanes te ar ua láve tien quete, pan sintelte i anes i Hristo.

ENGLISH: Everything that is being sold in a meat market you may eat; it is not necessary for you to ask questions by reason of your conscience,
QUENYA: Ilqua ya vácaina ná mi hrávemancanóme lertalde mate; ua mauya len maquete maquetier castanen immotuntieldo,

ENGLISH: The same thing happened also to the second and to the third, indeed until the seventh.
QUENYA: I imya nat martane yú i attean ar i neldean, é tenna i ostean.

ENGLISH: And when Paul put his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came upon them, and they spoke in tongues and talked like prophets.
QUENYA: Ar íre Paulo panyane máryat tesse, i Aire Fea túle téna, ar quentelte lambelissen ar caramper ve Erutercánor.

ENGLISH: Therefore Pilate went into the palace of the governor and called Jesus and said to him: “Are you the king of Jews?”
QUENYA: Etta Piláto lende mir i túrion i nóreturwa ar yalde Yésus ar quente senna: “Ma elye ná i aran Yúraron?”

ENGLISH: For the poor you have always among you, but you will not always have me.
QUENYA: An i penyar samilde illume mici le, mal ualde illume samuva ni.

ENGLISH: Behold, then, God's goodness and harshness: Towards that fell is harshness, but towards you is God's goodness, if you remain in his goodness; if not, you all well will be cut off.
QUENYA: Yé, tá, Eruo márie ar naracie: Innar lantaner ea naracie, mal elyenna ea Eruo márie, qui lemyalde márieryasse; qui lá, yú elye nauva aucirna.

ENGLISH: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creature; the old have gone away; behold! new ones have come.
QUENYA: Etta, qui aiquen ná i Hristosse, náse vinya onna; i yárar avánier; yé, utúlier vinyali!

ENGLISH: For we know, brothers loved by God, how you are chosen,
QUENYA: An istalme, hánor méline lo Eru, manen nalde cíline,

ENGLISH: The God who made the earth and everything that is in it does not dwell in temples made by hands.
QUENYA: I Aino ye carne i mar ar ilqua ya ea sasse ua mare cordassen cárine mainen.

ENGLISH: to your knowledge self-control, to your self-control endurance, to your endurance piety,
QUENYA: istyaldan immoturie, immoturieldan voronwie, voronwieldan ainocimie,

ENGLISH: and a trumpet's sound and the voice that spoke; when they heard that voice, the people asked that nothing more be spoken to them.
QUENYA: ar hyólo lamma ar i óma ya carampe; íre hlasselte óma tana, i lie arcane i munta amba náve quétina tien.

ENGLISH: since you seek a sign establishing that by me Christ speaks, he who is not weak towards you but powerful among you.
QUENYA: pan cestalde tanwa tulcala i inyenen Hristo quete, sé ye ua milya lenna mal túrea mici lé.

ENGLISH: For we are his work and were created in Christ Jesus for good deeds, which God prepared beforehand, for us to walk in them.
QUENYA: An nalve senya tamna ar náner ontaine mi Hristo Yésus máre cardain, yar Eru manwane nóvo, vantielvan mi tai.

ENGLISH: who is in Babel , chosen with yourselves, greets you, and so does Mark my son.
QUENYA: Ye ea Vavelde, cílina aselde, suila le, ar sie care Marco yondonya.

ENGLISH: Therefore find repentance! If you do not, I will come to you soon, and I will fight against them with the sword of my mouth.
QUENYA: Etta hira inwis! Qui lalye, tuluvan lyenna ron, ar mahtuvan téna antonyo macilden.

ENGLISH: Therefore I send him that more soon, for you to meet him and for you to have joy, and thus I will have less grief.
QUENYA: Etta mentanyes ta ambe rato, velieldan se ar samieldan alasse, ar sie inye samuva mis nyére.

ENGLISH: not like Cain, who was of the Wicked One and killed his brother. And what is the reason by which he killed him? Because his own deeds were evil, but his brother’s deeds righteous.
QUENYA: lá ve Cain, ye náne i Olco ar nahtane hánorya. Ar mana i casta yanen se-nahtanes? Pan vére cardaryar náner ulce, mal hánoryo cardar faile.

ENGLISH: Therefore, since we have this ministry by the grace given us, we do not abandon our courage.
QUENYA: Etta, pan samilme núromolie sina i Erulissenen antaina men, ualme hehta huorelma.

ENGLISH: and when I was in Jerusalem the chief priests and the elders of the Jews told me about him, requesting that I would judge him as having guilt.
QUENYA: ar íre anen Yerúsalemesse i hére airimor ar i amyárar i Yúraron nyarner ni pa se, arcala i namuvan se ve arwa cámo.

ENGLISH: When they heard that, they felt wounded and wished to kill them.
QUENYA: Íre hlasselte ta, fellelte harne ar merner nahta te.

ENGLISH: And he began to say to them with comparisons:“A man planted a garden of vines , surrounded it with a fence, dug a hollow for the vine-press and built a tower. Then he let cultivators use it for money, and went to a foreign country.
QUENYA: Ar yestanes quete téna sestielínen: “Nér empanne tarwa liantassion, pelle sa pelonen, sampe unque i limpevorman ar carastane mindo. Tá láves alamólin yuhta sa telpen, ar lende ettelea nórenna.

ENGLISH: Therefore may we come to the throne of grace having courage, to receive mercy and to find a grace helping us in our time of need.
QUENYA: Etta nai tuluvalve i mahalmanna Erulisseva arwa huoreo, camien oravie ar hirien lisse vi-manyala lúmelvasse maureva.

ENGLISH: And Jesus himself, at the beginning of his labor, had around thirty years. He was, one supposed, son of Joseph, son of Heli,
QUENYA: Ar Yésus immo, molieryo yestasse, sáme os loar nelequean. Anes, mo intyane, yondorya Yósef, yondorya Heli,

ENGLISH: The place where the corpse is, there the eagles will gather!
QUENYA: I nóme yasse i quelet ea, tasse i şorni ocomuvar!

ENGLISH: Peter answered him: “Lord, if that is you, command me that I am to come to you across the waters!”
QUENYA: Péter hanquente senna: “Heru, qui ta elye ná, ánin cane i tuluvan lyenna olla i neni!”

ENGLISH: Brothers, I speak to you by the manner of men: After a covenant has been established, nobody puts it away or adds to it, though it is a man's covenant.
QUENYA: Hánor, quetin i lénen atanion: Apa vére anaie tulcaina, úquen panya sa oa hya napane sanna, ómu nás atano vére.

ENGLISH: Not that alone, but he was also placed by the congregations as my companion, going with us while we carry the collection that we oversee, to the glory of God and to show our good will.
QUENYA: Lá ta erinqua, mal anes yando panyaina lo i ocombi ve sartonya, lelyala aselme ire colilme i hostie ya ortirilme, Eruo alcaren ar tanien mára nirmelma.

ENGLISH: And you are to say to who has the house: “The Teacher says to you: Where is the place where I can eat the passover with my disciples?”
QUENYA: Ar atte quete yenna same i coa: “I Peantar quete lyenna: Masse ea i nóme yassen polin mate i lahtie as hildonyar?”

ENGLISH: And they came and woke him up, saying: “Lord, save us, we are dying!”
QUENYA: Ar túlelte ar eccoitaner se, quétala: “Heru, áme rehta, quálalme!”

ENGLISH: They told him: “Jesus from Nazareth is passing by!”
QUENYA: Nyarnelte sen: “Yésus Násaretello langea!”

ENGLISH: For God does not heed faces .
QUENYA: An Eru ua cime cendeler.

ENGLISH: And abandoning everything he arose and followed him.
QUENYA: Ar hehtala ilqua orontes and hilyane se.

ENGLISH: But they did not understand this saying; it was hidden from them, to stop them for perceiving was it meant, and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.
QUENYA: Mal ualte hanyane quetie sina; anes nurtaina tello, pustien te tuntiello mana tenges, ar runcelte maquetiello senna pa quetie sina.

ENGLISH: You are split from Christ, you who try to be made just by the Law; out of the grace you have fallen.
QUENYA: Nalde şance Hristollo, elde i nevir náve cárine faile i Şanyenen; et i Erulissello alantielde.

ENGLISH: And he said: “What comes out of a person is what soils a person,
QUENYA: Ar quentes: “Ya tule et quenello ná ya vahta quén,

ENGLISH: Thanks to God through Jesus Christ our Lord! Indeed I am a slave of the law of God by my mind, but by my flesh, of the law of sin.
QUENYA: Hantale Erun ter Yésus Hristo Herulva! É inye ná mól i şanyeo Eruo sámanyanen, mal hrávenyanen, i şanyeo úcareo.

ENGLISH: saying: 'Go to this people and say: Indeed you will hear, but you will by no means understand, and indeed you will look, but you will by no means see.
QUENYA: quétala: 'Mena lie sinanna ar queta: É hlaruvalde, mal laume hanyuvalde; ar é yétuvalde, mal laume cenuvalde.

ENGLISH: In the middle where the throne stands, around the throne are four living creatures , full of eyes before and behind:
QUENYA: I endesse yasse i mahalma tare, os i mahalma ear coiti canta, quante hendion epe ar cata:

ENGLISH: And he asked him: “What is your name?” And he answered: “My name is Legion, for we are numerous.”
QUENYA: Ar maquentes senna: “Mana esselya?” Ar hanquentes: “Essenya Lehion, an nalme rimbe.”

ENGLISH: Therefore, when the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they went into their boats and went to Capernaum to seek Jesus.
QUENYA: Etta, íre i şanga cenne i uar enge tasse var Yésus var hildoryar, mennelte mir lunteltar ar lender Capernaumenna cestien Yésus.

ENGLISH: But he did not want to, but he went and threw him into prison until he would pay his debt.
QUENYA: Mal uas merne, ono lendes ar hante hé mir mando tenna hé paityumne rohtarya.

ENGLISH: “Teacher, Moses said: If anyone dies without children, it is necessary for his brother to marry his wife and raise up seed to his brother.
QUENYA: “Peantar, Móses quente: Qui aiquen quale ú hínion, mauya hánoryan verya veriryanna ar orta erde hánoryan.

ENGLISH: For you know the exhortations that we gave you through the Lord Jesus.
QUENYA: An istalde i hortaler yar antanelme len ter i Heru Yésus.

ENGLISH: You will seek me, but you will not find me, for where I am you cannot come.”
QUENYA: Cestuvalden, mal ualde hiruva ni, ar yanna ean lé uar poluva tule.”

ENGLISH: But some among them went to the Pharisees and told them the things that Jesus did.
QUENYA: Mal quelli mici te lender i Farisannar ar nyarner tien i nati yar carne Yésus.

ENGLISH: There is One who gave the law and is a judge, he who can save and undo. But you, how may you judge your neighbor?
QUENYA: Ea Er ye antane i ªanye ar ná námo, sé ye pole rehta ar nancare. Mal elye, manen lertal name armarolya?

ENGLISH: Hypocrites, Isaiah spoke well as a prophet concerning you, when he said: This people give me glory with their lips , but their heart is far from me.
QUENYA: Imnatyandoli, Yesaia quente mai ve Erutercáno pa le, íre quentes: Lie sina nin-anta alcar péltanten, mal endalta ná haira nillo.

ENGLISH: that all will praise the Son as they praise the Father. who does not praise the Son does not praise the Father who sent him.
QUENYA: i illi laituvar i Yondo ve laitalte i Atar. Ye ua laita i Yondo ua laita i Atar ye mentane se.

ENGLISH: Therefore do and keep all the things that they tell you, but to do do according to their deeds, for they say it, but do not perform.
QUENYA: Etta á care ar himya ilye i nati yar nyarilte len, mal áva care ve cardaltar, an quetiltes, mal uar care.

ENGLISH: – on the day that God judges the secrets of men by the gospel which I have made known, through Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: – i auresse ya Eru name atanion nuldar i evandilyonnen ya inye acárie sinwa, ter Yésus Hristo.

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus said to them: “Truly, truly I say to you: Moses did not give you the bread from heaven, but my Father indeed gives you the true bread from heaven.
QUENYA: Etta Yésus quente téna: “Násie, násie quetin lenna: Móses ua antane len i massa menello, mal Atarinya é anta len i nanwa massa menello.

ENGLISH: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers: “If these men do not remain on the ship, it is not possible for you to be saved!”
QUENYA: Paulo quente i tuxanturenna ar i ohtarinnar: “Qui neri sine uar lemya i ciryasse, ua ece len náve rehtane!”

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “Also to the other cities it is necessary for me to make known the gospel, for that is the reason why I was sent forth.”
QUENYA: Mal quentes téna: “Yando i hyane ostoin mauya nin care sinwa i evandilyon, an ta ná i casta yanen anen etementaina.”

ENGLISH: to the place into which Jesus went and opened the way for us, he who has been made a chief priest forever, by the manner of Melchizedek.
QUENYA: i nómenna yanna Yésus lende ar pantane i malle ven, sé ye anaie carna héra airimo tennoio, Melcisiréco lénen.

ENGLISH: In Jerusalem there is a pool called in Hebrew Bethsatha, having five columnades.
QUENYA: Yerúsalemesse ea ailin estaina Heveryasse Vetsáşa, arwa otarmiéron lempe.

ENGLISH: At dawn he returned to the temple, and the whole people came to him, and he sat down and taught them.
QUENYA: Árasse nanwennes i cordanna, ar i quanda lie túle senna, ar hamnes undu ar peantane tien.

ENGLISH: But his disciples sait to him: “You are seeing the crowd press against you, and then you say: Who touched me?”
QUENYA: Mal hildoryar quenter senna: “Cénal i şanga níra lyenna, ar tá quétal: Man ni-appane?”

ENGLISH: And when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard his comparisons, they knew that he spoke about them,
QUENYA: Ar íre i hére airimor ar i Farisar hlasser sestieryar, sintelte i quentes pa té,

ENGLISH: Thus you as well cause your light to shine upon men, for them to see your good deeds and for them to give glory to your Father, who is in heaven.
QUENYA: Sie yú elde tyara calalda calta atannar, polieltan cene máre cardaldar ar antaveltan alcar Atareldan, ye ea menelde.

ENGLISH: Therefore we are representatives on behalf of Christ, as if God made request through us. In Christ's place we urge: Make peace between you and God!
QUENYA: Etta nalme ráqueni rá Hriston, ve qui Eru carne arcande ter me. Hristo mende hortalme: Cara raine imbi lé ar Eru!

ENGLISH: And behold! a woman who was known in the city as a sinner learnt that he was at the table in the house of the Pharisees, and she bought a stone-box of fragrant oil,
QUENYA: Ar yé! nís ye náne sinwa i ostosse ve úcarinde parne i enges ara i sarno coasse i Farisava, ar mancanes insen ondocolca níşima milleo,

ENGLISH: Did that which was good cause death to me? By no means! But sin did so, causing death in me by which is good, to reveal what sin really is , and for it to be sinful beyond measure by the commandment.
QUENYA: Ma ya mára né tyarne nin qualme? Laume! Mal úcare carne sie, tyarila qualme nisse yanen mára ná, apantien úcareo nasse, ar náveryan úcarunqua han lesta i axannen.

ENGLISH: My first account, glorious Theophilus, I wrote about all the things that Jesus started to do and to teach,
QUENYA: Minya quentanya, alcarinqua Şeofílo, tencen pa ilye i nati yar Yésus yestane care ar peanta,

ENGLISH: And what I am doing I shall also do, not to give an opportunity to those that desire an opportuniy, for them to be found equal with us in that of which they praise themselves.
QUENYA: Ar ya cáran yando caruvan, lá antien ecie in merir ecie, náveltan hírine vávie aselme mi ta pa ya laitaltexer.

ENGLISH: and said to him: “What is your authority for doing these things? Or who gave you this authority for doing these things?”
QUENYA: ar quenter senna: “Mana hérelya carien nati sine? Hya man antane lyen hére sina carien nati sine?”

ENGLISH: For with joy you allow fools to do their things – you who are so wise!
QUENYA: An mi alasse lavilde aucoin care natiltar – elde i nar ta saile!

ENGLISH: And 'the country for which they will be thralls I shall judge,' said God, 'and thereafter they will go forth and will do service for me in this place.'
QUENYA: Ar 'i nóre yan nauvalte móli inye namuva,' quente Eru, 'ar epeta etelelyuvalte ar caruvar núromolie nin nóme sinasse.'

ENGLISH: But now God has put the parts in the body – every single among them – just as he wanted.
QUENYA: Mal sí Eru apánie i rantar i hroasse – ilya erya mici tai – aqua ve mernes.

ENGLISH: If anyone wants to go to a judge with you to take your tunic, allow him to take also your cloak.
QUENYA: Qui aiquen mere lelya námonna aselye mapien laupelya, ásen lave mapa yando collalya.

ENGLISH: and Hezeciah begat Manasseh, and Manasseh begat Amon,
QUENYA: ar Ħesecia óne Manasse, ar Manasse óne Ámon, ar Ámon óne Yosía,

ENGLISH: For God is who commanded: "Let light shine out of darkness", and he has shone upon our heart, illuminating the knowledge about God's glory in the face of Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: An Eru ná ye canne: "Cala á calta et i morniello", ar sé acaltie endalmanna, calyala i istya pa Eruo alcar mi Yésus Hristo cendele.

ENGLISH: Indeed I know such a man – in the body or outside of the body I do not know, God knows –
QUENYA: É istan taite nér – i hroasse hya ettesse i hravo uan ista, Eru ista –

ENGLISH: Concerning the non-Jews that believe we have written to them, commanding that it is necessary for them to keep themselves away from what has been sacrificed to idols, from blood, from flesh of strangled animals and from fornication.”
QUENYA: Pa i Úyúrar i savir elve etécier téna, canila i mauya tien hepe inte oa yallo anaie yácina cordonin, ho serce, ho hráve quórine celvaron ar ho hrupuhtie.”

ENGLISH: Woe to you, for you build the tombs for the prophets, but your fathers killed them!
QUENYA: Horro len, an carastalde i noiri i Erutercánoin, mal atarildar nacanter te!

ENGLISH: For if these things exist in you in abundance, they will stop you from being without deeds or fruit after knowing Jesus Christ our Lord.
QUENYA: An qui nati sine ear lesse úvesse, pustuvalte le návello ú cardaron hya yáveo apa istie Yésus Hristo Herulva.

ENGLISH: By no means! In what other manner will God judge the world?
QUENYA: Laume! Mana hyana lénen Eru namuva i mar?

ENGLISH: If thus you cannot do the smallest thing, how is that you have worries about the remaining things?
QUENYA: Qui sie ualde pole care i ampitya nat, manen ná i samilde quárele pa i lemyala nati?

ENGLISH: But we urge that you do this above all, for me to return to you the sooner .
QUENYA: Mal hortan i carilde si or ilqua, entulienyan lenna ta ambe rato.

ENGLISH: In nothing did he behave towards us and them in a different manner, after cleansing their heart by faith.
QUENYA: Mi munta lenganes ven ar tien mi alavéla lé, apa poitie endalta saviénen.

ENGLISH: And when he said that, all that stood against him were humiliated, and the entire crowd had joy concerning all the glorious things that happened by him.
QUENYA: Ar íre quentes ta, ilye i tarner senna náner nucumne, ar i quanda şanga sáme alasse pa ilye i alquarinque nati yar martaner sénen.

ENGLISH: She was put to many pains by many healers, and after using everything that she had she received nothing helpful; on the contrary, she was now more ill.
QUENYA: Anes panyaina rimbe naicennar lo rimbe nestandoli, ar apa yuhtie ilqua ya sámes camnes munta aşea; úsie, anes sí ambe hlaiwa.

ENGLISH: And in his sowing some seeds fell by the road, and the birds came and ate them.
QUENYA: Ar rerieryasse erdeli lantaner ara i malle, ar i aiwi túler ar manter te.

ENGLISH: And he made out of one man every nation of men, for them to dwell on the entire surface of earth, and he appointed the times and the borders for the dwelling of men,
QUENYA: Ar carnes et er atanello ilya nóre ataniva, marieltan i quanda palúresse cemeno, ar santes i lúmi ar i rénar vehten atanion,

ENGLISH: And so Mary, when she came to the place where Jesus was and saw him, fell before his feet, saying to him: “Lord, if you were here my brother was not dead!”
QUENYA: Ar sie María, íre túles i nómenna yasse enge Yésus ar cenne se, lantane epe talyat, quétala senna: “Heru, qui anel sís hánonya úme qualin!”

ENGLISH: And he led them outside and said: “Lords, what is necessary for me to do to obtain salvation?”
QUENYA: Ar tulyanes tu ettenna ar quente: “Heruvi, mana mauya nin care ñetien rehtie?”

ENGLISH: save them by snatching them out of the fire. On these people have mercy, but take heed, loathing even a cloth stained by the flesh.
QUENYA: áte rehta rapiénen te et i ruivello. Sine quenissen órava, mal cima, yeltala yando lanne vahtaina i hrávenen.

ENGLISH: And on her forehead was written a name, a mystery: “Babylon the Great, mother of harlots and the foul things of earth.”
QUENYA: Ar timbareryasse náne técina esse, fóle: “Vável Túra, amil imbacindion ar i şaure nation cemeno.”

ENGLISH: My brothers, a fig tree does not give olives, or a vine figs, no? In the same manner, salt water cannot give sweet water.
QUENYA: Hánonyar, relyávalda ua pole anta milpior, hya liantasse relyávi, lá? Mí imya lé, singwa nén ua pole anta lisse nén.

ENGLISH: The sun's glory is of its own kind, and the Moon's glory is another, and the glory of stars is another; indeed star is not like another star in glory.
QUENYA: Anaro alcar véra nostaleryo ná, ar Işilo alcar exe ná, ar tinwion alcar exe ná; é tinwe ua ve hyana tinwe mi alcar.

ENGLISH: “Blessed be the Lord, God of Israel, since he has heeded and has delivered his people!
QUENYA: “Na aistana i Héru, Israélo Aino, pan icímies ar etelehties lierya!

ENGLISH: And I have made your name known to them and I will make it known again, that the love with which you loved me will be in them, and I in them.
QUENYA: Ar acárien essetya sinwa tien ar caruvanyes sinwa ata, i euva tesse i melme yanen méletye ní, ar inye tesse.

ENGLISH: I give thanks to my God whenever I recall you.
QUENYA: Antan hantale Ainonyan quiquie enyalin le.

ENGLISH: May congregation-servants be husbands of a single wife, leading their own families well.
QUENYA: Nai ocombenduri nauvar veruvi erya nisso, tulyala vére nosseltar mai.

ENGLISH: But when they did not find him, they returned to Jerusalem, seeking him.
QUENYA: Mal íre uatte hirne se, entúlette Yerúsalemenna, cestala se.

ENGLISH: In answer Jesus said: “O unfaithful and twisted generation, how long will it be necessary for me to remain with you and to bear you? Lead your son hither!”
QUENYA: Hanquentasse Yésus quente: “A úvoronda ar rícina nónare, manen andave mauyuva nin lemya aselde ar cole le? Á tulya yondolya sir!”

ENGLISH: Therefore, if you worship me, everything shall be yours.”
QUENYA: Etta, qui elye tyere ní, ilqua nauva lyenya.”

ENGLISH: While I was doing these things – on a journey to Damascus, after receiving power and permission from the chief priests –
QUENYA: Lan cáranen nati sine – mi lenda Lamascusenna, apa camie túre ar lavie i hére airimollon –

ENGLISH: For they speak big words that do nothing good, and by the desire of the flesh and by loose habits they cause those to stray those that a short time ago fled from the people whose conduct is errant.
QUENYA: An quetilte hoe quettali yar carir munta mára, ar i hráveo írinen ar lehte haimalínen tyarilte ranya i ºintanéya úºer i quenillon ion lengie ná ránea.

ENGLISH: though was said to him: " which will be called 'your seed' will come through Isaac."
QUENYA: ómu náne quétina senna: "Ya naiva estaina 'erdelya' tuluva ter Ísac."

ENGLISH: All these things happened in order to make true which the Lord said by his herald , saying:
QUENYA: Ilye sine nati martaner carien nanwa ya i Heru carampe tercánoryanen, quétala:

ENGLISH: And there are seven kings: five have fallen, one is now, and the other still has not come, and when he shall come, he will remain a short time.
QUENYA: Ar ear arani otso: lempe alantier, er ea sí, ar i exe en ua utúlie, ar íre tuluvas, lemyuvas şinta lúmesse.

ENGLISH: But if anyone walks at night, he falls, since the light is not in him.”
QUENYA: Mal qui aiquen vanta i lómisse, taltas, pan i cala lá ea sesse.”

ENGLISH: But if you bite and consume one another, take heed that you are not destroyed one by the other!
QUENYA: Mal qui nacilde ar ammatir quén i exe, cima i ualde nar nancárine quén lo i exe!

ENGLISH: Solely it was necessary for us to remember the poor ones, and that I have sincerely tried to do.
QUENYA: Eryave mauyane ment enyale i penyar, ar ta enévien care holmo.

ENGLISH: For will come a time where they will not tolerate the beneficial teaching, but by their own desires they will gather teachers that tickle their ears,
QUENYA: An tuluva lúme yasse ualte lavuva i aşea peantie, mal vére íreltainen comyuvalte peantari i cityar hlarultat,

ENGLISH: And here he has received power from the chief priests to bind all that call on your name.”
QUENYA: Ar sisse acámies túre i hére airimollon nutien illi i yalir esselyanen.”

ENGLISH: Do not let such a man suppose that he will receive anything from God;
QUENYA: Áva lave taite neren intya i camuvas aiqua i Herullo;

ENGLISH: And numerous other blasphemies they spoke to him.
QUENYA: Ar rimbe hyane naiquetiéli quentelte senna.

ENGLISH: Paul and Silvanus and Timothy to the congregation in Thessalonica, in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: May you have grace and peace!
QUENYA: Paulo ar Silváno ar Timoşeo i ocombenna Şessalonicasse, mi Eru i Atar ar i Heru Yésus Hristo: Nai samuvalde lisse yo raine!

ENGLISH: And he came down with them and stood on a plain, and was a multitude of people from all of Judea and Jerusalemn and from the sea-regions arbout Tyre and Sidon, that came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases.
QUENYA: Ar túles undu aselte ar tarne palaresse, ar enge hoa liyúme queniva ho i quanda Yúrea ar Yerúsalem ar ho i earménar os Tír ar Siron, i túler hlarien se ar náven nestaine hlíveltaron.

ENGLISH: For that rule are not a terror to the good deed, but to the evil one. You wish that it will not be necessary for you to fear the authority? Do which is good, and you will receive praise from it,
QUENYA: An i turir uar ruhtie i mára cardan, mal i ulcan. Elye mere i la mauyuva lyen ruce i hérello? Cara ya mára ná, ar camuval laitale sallo,

ENGLISH: And the Spirit said to Philip: “Go near to the cart and stick to it!”
QUENYA: Ar i Faire quente Filipenna: “Mena hare i norollenna ar ása himya!”

ENGLISH: Therefore, if you are not faithful concerning the unrighteous riches, who will put in your keeping that which is true?
QUENYA: Etta, qui ualde voronde pa i úfaila lar, man panyuva hepieldasse ta ya nanwa ná?

ENGLISH: For we have as a chief priest, not a person who does not know to have sympathy when we are weak, but a person who has ben tested in every manner as are we, but without sin.
QUENYA: An samilve ve héra airimo, lá quén ye ua ista same ofelme aselve íre nalve milye, mal quén ye anaie tyastaina mi ilya lé ve nar elve, mal ú úcareo.

ENGLISH: and you be like men looking forward to their master's return from the marriage, for them to be able to open to him in the same moment that he comes knocking.
QUENYA: ar elde na ve atani yétala ompa herulto entulessenna i veryanwello, polieltan latya sen mí imya lú ya tulis tambala.

ENGLISH: But I say to you: Love your enemies, bless the ones that curse you, do well to those that hate you, and pray for those that pursue you,
QUENYA: Mal inye quete lenna: Mela ñottolyar, á aista i hútar le, cara mai in le-tevir, ar hyama in le-roitar,

ENGLISH: And yet these men blaspheme against all the things that they do not understand, but the things that they do understand – by their nature, like animals without intellect – by those they corrupt themselves.
QUENYA: Ananta neri sine naiquetir ilye i natinnar yar ualte hanya, mal i nati yar é hanyalte – nasseltanen, ve celvar ú handeleo – tainen hastaltexer.

ENGLISH: But he said to him: “Let dead bring their dead to the grave, but you go and make the kingdom of heaven known!”
QUENYA: Mal quentes senna: “Lava qualinin tala qualiniltar i sapsanna, mal elye mena ar cara menelo aranie sinwa!”

ENGLISH: Beginning of the gospel about Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: Yesta i evandilyono pa Yésus Hristo.

ENGLISH: He said to them: “Isaiah spoke well as a prophet about you hypocrites , as is written: 'This people gives glory to me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.
QUENYA: Quentes téna: “Yesaia carampe mai ve Erutercáno pa lé imnetyandor, ve ná técina: 'Lie sina nin-anta alcar péltanten, mal endalta ná haira nillo.'

ENGLISH: And they took the silver-pieces and did as they were instructed, and this saying has been spread among Jews until this day.
QUENYA: Ar nampelte i telpemittar ar carner ve náne tien peantana, ar quetie sina anaie vintaina mici Yúrar tenna aure sina.

ENGLISH: In answer Simon said: “You make request of the Lord for me, to stop the things of which you spoke from coming upon me.”
QUENYA: Hanquentasse Símon quente: “Alde arca i Herullo nin, pustien i nati pa yar quentel tuliello ninna.”

ENGLISH: He also went out around the third hour and saw some others stand without work in the market-place,
QUENYA: Etelendes yú os i neldea lúme ar cenne exeli tára pen molie mí mancalenóme,

ENGLISH: But he did not know her before she bore a son, and he gave him the name Jesus.
QUENYA: Mal uas sinte se nó coldes yondo, ar antanes sen i esse Yésus.

ENGLISH: Thus also Sodom and Gomorra and the cities around them are put before us as a sign of danger, for they fornicated and had a lust for foreign flesh, and now they have received the punishment of eternal fire.
QUENYA: Sie yando Sorom yo Omorra ar i ostor os tú nar panyaine epe vi ve tanwa raxeo, an úpuhtanelte ar sámer maile ettelea hráveva, ar sí acámielte i paime oialea náreva.

ENGLISH: futhermore, man was not created for the woman, but woman for the man.
QUENYA: ente, nér úne ontana i nissen, mal nís i neren.

ENGLISH: Then he summoned the crowd to himself with his disciples and said to them: “If anyone wants to come after me, it is necessary for him to reject himself and lift up his cross and follow me.
QUENYA: Sí yaldes i şanga insenna as hildoryar ar quente téna: “Qui aiquen mere tule apa ni, mauya sen váquete insen ar orta tarwerya ar ni-hilya.

ENGLISH: What does this saying mean that he said: You will seek me, but you will not find me, and where I am you cannot come – ?”
QUENYA: Mana tea quetie sina ya quentes: Cestuvalden, mal ualde hiruva ni, ar yanna ean lé uar poluva tule – ?”

ENGLISH: But in answer Peter said to him: “ if all will fall away from you, I will not fall away!”
QUENYA: Mal hanquentasse Péter quente senna: “Qui illi lantuvar oa lello, inye ua oi lantuva oa!”

ENGLISH: For in this night stood beforeme an angel of the God whose servant I am, and whom I worship.
QUENYA: An mi lóme sina tarne epe ni vala Eruo yeo núro nanye, ar ye tyerin.

ENGLISH: In a spring, sweet and bitter water does not flow from the same hole, no?
QUENYA: Ehtelesse, lisse ar sára nén ua ulya i imya assallo, lá?

ENGLISH: Thereafter I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.
QUENYA: Epeta lenden mir i ménar Sírio ar Cilicio.

ENGLISH: Greet Apelles, who has been tested in the Lord. Greet the people in the house of Aristobulos.
QUENYA: Á suila Apelles, ye anaie tyastana i Hristosse. Á suila i queni mi coarya Aristovúlo.

ENGLISH: to Titus , real child in the faith that we together have: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.
QUENYA: Títonna, anwa hína i saviesse ya uo samingwe: Lisse yo raine ho Eru i Atar ar Hristo Yésus Rehtolva.

ENGLISH: And they threw lots about them, and the lot indicated Matthias, and he was counted among the eleven apostles.
QUENYA: Ar hantelte şanwali pa tu, ar i şanwa tenge Mattías, ar anes nótina imíca i minque aposteli.

ENGLISH: Now in Iconium they went together into the synagogue, and they spoke in a manner causing a huge multitude to believe, Jews and Greeks alike.
QUENYA: Sí Iconiumesse lendette uo mir i yomencoa, ar quentette mi lé tyarila hoa liyúme save, Yúrali ar Hellenyali véla.

ENGLISH: Thereafter he led them as far as Bethany, and he raised his hands and blessed them.
QUENYA: Epeta tulyanes te tenna Vetánia, ar ortanes máryat ar aistane te.

ENGLISH: and cried: “Men of Israel, help! This man is who teaches everyone in every place against the people and the Law, and against this place! Furthermore, he has brought some Greeks into the temple and has defiled this holy place!”
QUENYA: ar yámer: “Neri Israélo, á manya! Nér sina ná ye peanta ilquenen mi ilya nóme ana i lie ar i Şanye, ar ana nóme sina! Ente, atálies Hellenyali mir i corda ar avahtaye XXX aire nóme sina!”

ENGLISH: I Paul am writing with my own hand: I will pay – not to tell you that your debt to me is your own person.
QUENYA: Ni Paulo téca véra mányanen: Paityuvan – lá nyarien lyen i rohtalya inyen ná véra quenelya.

ENGLISH: But take heed that this right of yours will not in way be a cause of slipping for the weak ones.
QUENYA: Mal cima i sina lertielda ua mi lé nauva casta taltiéva i milyain.

ENGLISH: Then he said: “Do you as well fail to understand?
QUENYA: Tá quentes: “Ma yú elde loitar hanya?

ENGLISH: And the serpent sent water like a river from its mouth after the woman, to carry her away by the river.
QUENYA: Ar i leuca mentane nén ve síre antoryallo apa i nís, se-colien oa i sírenen.

ENGLISH: Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and also the fishes.
QUENYA: Yésus túle ar nampe i massa ar antane sa tien, ar yando i lingwi.

ENGLISH: and anyone who receives a single such child in my name, receives me.
QUENYA: ar aiquen ye came erya taite hína essenyanen, came ní.

ENGLISH: After he destroyed ten peoples in Canaan, he caused them to possess their land
QUENYA: Apa nancarnes lier quean mi Canáan, tyarneset harya nórelta

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: He will put him over everything that he has.
QUENYA: Násie quetin lenna: Hé panyuva se or ilqua ya hé same.

ENGLISH: Give us our daily bread day after day,
QUENYA: Ámen anta ilaurea massalma aure apa aure,

ENGLISH: And the woman whom you saw is the great city, that has a kingdom over the kings of earth.”
QUENYA: Ar i nís ye cennel i túra osto ná, ya same aranie or i arani cemeno.”

ENGLISH: at every moment praying also for us, requesting that God will open to us a door of the Word, to speak the mystery concerning Christ, concerning whom I am also in fetters,
QUENYA: mí imya lú hyámala yando elmen, arcala i Eru pantuva men fenna i Quetto, quetien i fóle pa Hristo, pa ya nanye yando naxalissen,

ENGLISH: For «all flesh is like grass, and all its glory is like the flower of the grass; the grass withers, and the flower falls away,
QUENYA: An «ilya hráve ná ve salque, ar ilya alcarerya ná ve salqueo lóte; i salque hesta, ar i lóte lanta oa,

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “Fill the water-vessels with water!” And they filled them brim full.
QUENYA: Eque téna Yésus: “Quata i calpar nennen!” Ar quanteltet penquante.

ENGLISH: and Eliud begat Eleazar, ar Eleazar begat Matthan, and Matthan begat Jacob,
QUENYA: ar Eliur óne Eleásar, ar Eleásar óne Mattan, ar Mattan óne Yácov,

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “Have you not ever read what David did when he suffered need and was hungry, he and the men that were with him?
QUENYA: Mal sé quente téna: “Ma ualde oi ehentie ya Lavir carne íre sámes maure ar náne maita, sé ar i neri i náner óse?

ENGLISH: And behold! Elizabeth, who is of your kin, has herself conceived a son in her old age, and this month is the sixth for her who was called unfruitful.
QUENYA: Ar yé! Elísavet, ye ná nosselyo, inse onostie yondo yárieryasse, ar astar sina ná i enquea sen ye náne estaina yávelóra.

ENGLISH: Or have you not read in the Law that on the day of rest the priests in the temple break the sabbath and yet are without guilt?
QUENYA: Hya ualde ehentanie i Şanyesse i mi sendare i airimor i cordasse racir i sendare ananta nar pen cáma?

ENGLISH: Therefore, let us not be asleep like the others, but let us be awake and keep our keenness of perception.
QUENYA: Etta, ávalve na lorne ve i exi, mal alve na coivie ar hepe laicelva.

ENGLISH: But when Cephas came to Antioch, I stood against him face to face, for he stood judged.
QUENYA: Mal íre Céfas túle Antiocenna, tarnen senna cendelello cendelenna, an tarnes námina.

ENGLISH: And when all saw it, they were murmuring, saying: “With a man who is a sinner he went in to eat.”
QUENYA: Ar íre illi cenner sa, anelte nurrula, quétala: “As nér ye ná úcarindo lendes minna matien.”

ENGLISH: and you will be happy, for they have nothing with which it is possible for them to repay you. For will be repaid to you in the rising of dead!”
QUENYA: ar nauval valima, an té samir munta yanen ece tien paitya lyen. An nauva paityaina lyen qualinion ortiesse!”

ENGLISH: They said to him: “Where do you wish that we are to make it ready?”
QUENYA: Quentette senna: “Masse meril i caruvammes manwa?”

ENGLISH: For the ones that he knew beforhand he also chose beforehand, for them to be fashioned according to the image of his Son, making him the first-born among numerous brothers;
QUENYA: An té i sintes nóvo yú cildes nóvo, náveltan cátine ve i emma Yondoryo, carila sé i minnóna mici rimbe hánor;

ENGLISH: And the beast that was but is not, it is also an eighth king; he comes from the seven and goes away into destruction.
QUENYA: Ar i hravan ye enge mal ea lá, náse yú toltea aran; tulis i otsollo ar lelya oa mir nancarie.

ENGLISH: For like Jonah was made a sign to the people in Nineveh, so also the Son of Man will be a sign to this generation.
QUENYA: An ve Yóna náne carna tanwa i lien Ninevesse, sie yando i Atanyondo nauva tanwa nónare sinan.

ENGLISH: And some began to spit at him and to cover his face and to strike him and say to him: “Play the prophet!” And striking his face, the court attendants took him away.
QUENYA: Ar quelli yestaner piuta senna ar tope cendelerya ar petitas ar quete senna: “Tyala i Erutercáno!” Ar pétala cendelerya, i námonduri se-namper oa.

ENGLISH: May you have grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: Nai samuvalde lisse ar raine ho Eru Atarelva ar i Heru Yésus Hristo.

ENGLISH: And happened, as he passed the grain fields on the day of rest, that his diciples started to pick the heads of grain.
QUENYA: Ar martane, íre lahtanes i orirestar i sendaresse, i hildoryar yestaner lepta i cari oriva.

ENGLISH: Therefore, since he was a prophet and knew that God gave him a promise about placing on his throne a person of the fruit of his loins,
QUENYA: Etta, pan anes Erutercáno ar sinte i Eru antane sen vanda pa panie mahalmaryasse quén yáveo oşweryo,

ENGLISH: I will still bring justice to this woman, or she will come and strike me in the face!”
QUENYA: en taluvan failie nís sinan, hya tuluvas ni-petien i cendelesse!”

ENGLISH: In this way a broad door will be opened to you into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and of our Savior, Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: Sinen landa fenna nauva len letyaina mir i oira aranie Herulvo ar Rehtolvo, Yésus Hristo.

ENGLISH: And is still more easily visible that arises another priest, similiar to Melchizedek,
QUENYA: Ar ná en ambe aşcénima i orta hyana airimo, vávea Melciserecenna,

ENGLISH: Therefore from that day they made plans to kill him.
QUENYA: Etta sana aurello carnelte panoli nahtien se.

ENGLISH: For before the coming of some men from James he ate with people of the nations, but when they came, he turned himself away and separated himself, fearing the circumcised ones.
QUENYA: An nó i tulesse nerelion Yácovello mantes as queni i nórion, mal íre túlelte, quernes inse oa ar ciltane inse, rúcala i oscirnallon.

ENGLISH: And it stood on the sand by sea. And I saw a beast rising out of sea, having ten horns and seven heads, and on its horns it has ten diadems, and on its heads are names of mockery of God.
QUENYA: Ar tarnes i litsesse ara ear. Ar cennen hravan ortala et earello, arwa rassion quean ar carion otso, ar rasseryassen samis şarnuntar quean, ar cariryassen ear esseli yaiweo Eruva.

ENGLISH: I give you Phoebe our sister, who is also a deaconess of the congregation in Cenchreae.
QUENYA: Antan len Foive néşalva, ye ná yú veure i ocombeo mi Cencreai.

ENGLISH: Therefore some of his disciples said, one to the other: “What does this mean that he said to us: After a short time you will not see me more, and after another short time you shall see me again, and: Because I am going away to the Father – ?”
QUENYA: Etta quelli hildoryaron quenter, quén i exenna: “Mana tea si ya quetis venna: Apa şinta lúme ualde cenuva ni ambe, ar apa an şinta lúme encenuvalden, ar: Pan autean i Atarenna – ?”

ENGLISH: And there they made the gospel known.
QUENYA: Ar tasse carnette i evandilyon sinwa.

ENGLISH: For I am not humiliated concerning the gospel, for it is God's power to save everyone who believes, the Jew firstly, then the Greek.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Anyone who divorces his wife and gets married to another commits adultery against her,

QUENYA: Ar tá i tanwa i Atanyondova nauva cénina menelde, ar tá ilye nossi cemeno palpuvar inte nainiesse, ar cenuvalte i Atanyondo túla menelo fanyassen arwa túreo ar olya alcaro;

ENGLISH: For I am the smallest of the apostles, and I am not worthy to be called an apostle, for I have persecuted God's congregation.
QUENYA: An nanye i ampitya i apostelion, ar uan valda náveo estaina apostel, an oroitien Eruo ocombe.

ENGLISH: For one made a first tent-room in which were the lampstand and the showing of the breads, and it is called the Holy.
QUENYA: An mo carne minya lancoa-şambe yasse enger i calmatarma ar i tanie i massaiva, ar nas estaina i Aire.

ENGLISH: If, then, David calls him Lord, how is he his son?”
QUENYA: Qui, tá, Lavir esta se Heru, manen náse yondorya?”

ENGLISH: Therefore Martha, when she heard that Jesus came, met him; but Mary remained in the house.
QUENYA: Etta Marşa, íre hlasses i túle Yésus, velde se; mal María lemyane i coasse.

ENGLISH: And, "In the beginning, o Lord, you founded earth, and heaven is an artifact of your hands.
QUENYA: Ar, "I yestasse, a Heru, elye tulcane cemen, ar menel ná taman mályato.

ENGLISH: And how can Christ and Belial be of one mind? Or what part does a person who believe have with a person that does not believe? For we are a temple of the Living Deity, as God has said: "I shall dwell with them and walk among them, and I will be their God, and they will be my people.
QUENYA: Ar manen polir Hristo ar Vélial náve er sámo? Hya mana ranta same quén ye save as quén ye ua save? An elve nar corda i Coirea Ainova, ve Eru equétie: "Maruvan aselte ar vantuvan imíca te, ar inye nauva Ainolta, ar té nauvar lienya.

ENGLISH: Therefore I say to you: To Tyre and Sidon the Day of Judgement will be more bearable than it will be for you .
QUENYA: Etta quetin lenna: Tíren ar Síronen i Aure Namiéva nauva cólima epe ya nauvas lent!

ENGLISH: Look, you who speak mockery, and be filled with wonder, for I do a work in your days – a work that you will by no means believe even if anyone tells you about it!”
QUENYA: Á yéta, elde i quetir yaiwe, ar na quátine elmendanen, an carin carie réldassen – carie ya laume savuvalde yando qui aiquen nyare len pa sa!”

ENGLISH: But how will they call to him in whom they do not believe? And how will they believe in him about whom they have not heard? And how will they hear if they lack anyone that makes known the gospel?
QUENYA: Ono manen yaluvalte senna yesse ualte save? Ar manen savuvalte sesse pa ye ualte ahlárie? Ar manen hlaruvalte qui penilte aiquen ye care sinwa i evandilyon?

ENGLISH: the eyes of your heart being enlightened, for you to know what the hope is to which he called you – what the glorious riches are which he has reserved for the holy ones that will be heirs to it,
QUENYA: endaldo hendu nála calyaine, istieldan mana i estel ná yan yalles le – mana i alcarinqua lar ná ya asáties i airin i nauvar aryoni san,

ENGLISH: And very early, on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb, after sunrise.
QUENYA: Ar ita arinyave, i otsolo minya auresse, túlelte i noirinna, apa anaróre.

ENGLISH: And to those who sold doves he said: “Take these things away from here! Do not make the house of my Father a house of commerce!”
QUENYA: Ar innar vancer cucuar eques: “Á mapa nati sine oa sio! Áva care i coa Atarinyava coa mancaleo!”

ENGLISH: Love is revealed in this, not that we have loved God, but that he loved us and sent his Son as an atoning sacrifice for our sins.
QUENYA: Melme ná apantaina mi si, lá i elve emélier Eru, mal i sé méle vé ar mentane Yondorya ve tópala yanca úcarelvain.

ENGLISH: and by him all things were created in heaven and on earth, the visible ones and the invisible ones, not heeding if they are thrones or lordships or governments or powers. Everything has been created through him and for him,
QUENYA: an sénen ilye nati náner ontaine menelde ar cemende, i cénimar ar i úcénimar, lá címala qui nalte mahalmali hya héreli hya turiéli hya túreli. Ilqua ter sé ar sén anaie ontaina,

ENGLISH: Jesus answered and said: “This voice did not come for my good, but for yours.
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente ar eque: “Óma sina ua túle ninya márien, mal lenyan.

ENGLISH: He is the disciple who witnesses about this and who has written these things, and we know that his witness is true.
QUENYA: Sé ná i hildo ye vetta pa si ar ye etécie nati sine, ar istalme i vettierya nanwa ná.

ENGLISH: – to God, wise alone, be the glory through Jesus Christ forever. Amen!
QUENYA: – Erun, saila erinqua, na i alcar ter Yésus Hristo tennoio. Násie!

ENGLISH: And yet that is what some among you were. But you have been washed clean, but you have been hallowed, but you have been made just by the name of Jesus Christ our Lord, and by the Spirit of our God.
QUENYA: Ananta ta ná ya ennoli mici le náner. Mal anaielde sóvine poice, mal anaielde airinte, mal anaielde cárine faile, i essenen Yésus Hristo Herulvo, ar Ainolvo Fairenen.

ENGLISH: All the tax collectors and sinners came near to him to hear him.
QUENYA: Ilye i tungwemor ar úcarindor túler hare senna hlarien se.

ENGLISH: John answered and said: “A man cannot receive a single thing if it that is not given him from heaven.
QUENYA: Yoháno hanquente ar eque: “Atan ua pole came erya nat qui ta ui antaina sen menello.

ENGLISH: Therefore they said to him: “Who are you? Let us have an answer for those who sent us. What do you say about self?”
QUENYA: Etta quentelte senna: “Man nalye? Lava men same hanquenta in mentaner me. Mana quetil pa immo?”

ENGLISH: But I have prayed concerning you, that your faith will not be insufficient, and when at time you have returned, bring strength to your brothers.”
QUENYA: Mal inye ahyámie pa elye, i savielya ua nauva loica, ar íre mi lú enutúliel, á tala antoryame hánolyain.”

ENGLISH: But they thought that he was going to swell, or that suddenly he was going to fall dead. After waiting long and seeing nothing bad happening to him, they changed their mind and said that he was a god.
QUENYA: Ono sannelte i pulumnes, hya i lantumnes rincanen qualina. Apa hopie andave ar cenie munta olca martala sen, vistanelte sámalta ar quenter i náse aino.

ENGLISH: Behold! I shall come soon, and what I pay is with me, in order to give back to everyone as his work is.
QUENYA: Yé! Tuluvan ron, ar ya paityan ea asinye, antáven nan ilquenen ve molierya ná.

ENGLISH: But if anyone lacks knowledge, without knowledge he is.
QUENYA: Mal qui aiquen pene istya, ú istyo náse.

ENGLISH: No, but I say that those that the nations sacrifice, they sacrifice to demons and not to God, and I do not wish that you are to have a part with the demons.
QUENYA: Ui, mal quetin i tai yar i nóri yacir, yacilte raucoin ar lá Erun, ar uan mere i samuvalde ranta as i raucor.

ENGLISH: He answered: “The man called Jesus made a mud and put it on my eyes and said to me: Go to Sioam and wash yourself. Therefore I went and washed self, and then I could see.”
QUENYA: Hanquentes: “I nér estaina Yésus carne luxo ar sa-panyane hendunyatse ar quente ninna: Mena Siloamenna ar sova immo. Etta lenden ar sóve immo, ar tá polden cene.”

ENGLISH: In the same manner, my heavenly Father's will is not that a single among these little ones will be lost.
QUENYA: Mi imya lé, meneldea Atarinyo indóme ua in erya mici pityar sine nauva vanwa.

ENGLISH: Hearing that, Jesus was filled with wonder and said to that followed him: “I truly say to you, such faith I have not found in anyone in Israel.
QUENYA: Hlárala ta, Yésus náne quátina elmendanen ar quente innar hilyaner se: “Násie quetin lenna, taite savie uan ihírie aiquende Israelde.

ENGLISH: Again the kingdom of heaven is like a tradesman seeking good pearls:
QUENYA: Ata menelo aranie ná ve macar cestala máre marillar:

ENGLISH: John was baptizing in Aenon, near to Salim, since was an abundance of water there, and people came and were baptized,
QUENYA: Yoháno tumyane Ainonde, hare Salimenna, pan enge úve nenwa tasse, ar queni túler ar náner tumyaine,

ENGLISH: That is the greatest and first commandment.
QUENYA: Ta ná i antúra ar minya axan.

ENGLISH: Paul – God's slave and Jesus Christ's apostle, by the faith of God's chosen ones and by the knowledge of the truth that follows from awe of God,
QUENYA: Paulo – Eruo mól ar Yésus Hristo apostel, Eruo cílinaron saviénen ar i istyanen i nanwiéva ya hilya áyallo Eruva,

ENGLISH: for is written: “As I live, says the Lord, to be every knee will bend, and every tongue will praise God.”
QUENYA: an ná técina: “Ve coitan, quete i Héru, ninna ilya occa cuvuva, ar ilya lamba laituva Eru.”

ENGLISH: Therefore allow no one to despise him. Send him on his journey in peace, for him to come to me, for I am waiting for him, with the brothers.
QUENYA: Etta lava úquenen nattire se. Áse menta lendaryasse rainesse, tulieryan ninna, an hópan sen, as i hánor.

ENGLISH: But suppose that God, though he has the power to show his wrath and to make his power known, with great patience allowed the vessels of wrath to remain, those that are made to be destroyed,
QUENYA: Mal á intya in Eru, ómu samis i túre tanien rúşerya ar carien túrerya sinwa, túra cólenen láve i venin rúşeva lemya, tai yar nar cárine náven nancárine,

ENGLISH: that is among yourselves. Just as it bears fruit and thrives in the whole world, so also among you, from the day that you listened and knew God's grace in truth.
QUENYA: ya ea mici le. Tambe colis yáve ar ale i quenda mardesse, síve yando mici lé, i aurello ya lastanelde ar sinter Eruo lisse nanwiesse.

ENGLISH: and God chose the ignoble ones and that were being despised – them that are nothing – to destroy them that seem important.
QUENYA: ar Eru cilde i mardo úartar ar i náner nattíraine – té i nar munta – nancarien té i nemir valde.

ENGLISH: As newborn babies long for the uncorrupt milk of the word, for you to grow into salvation,
QUENYA: Ve vinyanóne lapsar á milya i alahasta ilin i quettava, alieldan mir rehtie,

ENGLISH: gathering for themselves a good foundation for the time that shall come, in order to seize the real life.
QUENYA: comyala inten mára talma i lúmen ya tuluva, mapien i anwa coivie.

ENGLISH: He said to them: “Come and see!” Therefore they came and saw the place where he stayed, and they remained with him on that day. was around the tenth hour.
QUENYA: Eques túna: “Tula ar cena!” Etta túlette ar cennet i nóme yasse marnes, ar lemyanette óse aure yanasse. Náne os i quainea lúme.

ENGLISH: When I saw her I was in great wonder.
QUENYA: Íre cennenyes anen túra elmendasse.

ENGLISH: As Jannes and Jambres stood against Moses, so also these men stand against the truth, men completely corrupted in their minds, rejected concerning the faith.
QUENYA: Tambe Yannes yo Yambres tarnet Mósenna, síve yando neri sine tarir i nanwienna, atalli aqua hastaine sámaltassen, quérine oa pa i savie.

ENGLISH: There was an uprising of non-Jews and the Jews alike, with their rulers, to humiliate them and to kill them with stones.
QUENYA: Enge amortie Úyúraron ar i Yúraron véla, as turiltar, nucumien tu ar nahtien tu sarninen.

ENGLISH: My children, I am with you for a little while more. You will seek me, and as I said to the Jews: Where I am going away you cannot come, so I say also to you now.
QUENYA: Hinyar, ean aselde an şinta lúmesse. Cestuvalden, ar tambe quenten i Yúrannar: Yanna inye auta lé uar pole tule, sie quetin yando lenna sí.

ENGLISH: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly. In all wisdom instruct one another and show to one another the way with psalms, with songs of praise, with spiritual songs in grace, singing in your heart to God.
QUENYA: Lava i Hristo quettan mare lesse alyave. Ilya sailiesse á peanta quén i exen ar á tana quen i exen i tie airelindínen, lírínen laitaléva, fairelírínen mi lisse, lindala endaldasse Erun.

ENGLISH: I do not say that as a command, but by the urgency of others I want to test if your love is also true.
QUENYA: Uan quete ta ve canwa, mal exion hormenen merin tyasta qui melmelda ná yando nanwa.

ENGLISH: They went down and prayed for them to receive Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: Lendette undu ar hyamnet camieltan Aire Fea.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: Among that are born by women, no one is greater than John the Baptist, but the smallest in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
QUENYA: Násie quetin lenna: Mici i nar nóne lo nissi, úquen ná túra epe Yoháno i Sumbando, mal i ampitya menelo araniesse ná túra epe sé.

ENGLISH: Love has patience and is gentle. Love does not have envy, it does not praise itself, it not haughty,
QUENYA: Melme same cóle ar moica ná. Melme ua same hrucen, uas laitaxe, uas turquima,

ENGLISH: Watch yourselves concerning the false prophets that come to you in sheep's clothing, but on the inside they are devouring wolves.
QUENYA: Tira inde pa i hurutercánor i tulir lenna mámaron lannessen, mal mityasse nalte ammátala ñarmor.

ENGLISH: But now I exhort you: Have courage, for is not a single person among you who will be lost! Only the ship will be.
QUENYA: Mal sí hortan le: Sama huore, an lá ea erya quén imíca le ye nauva vanwa! Rie i cirya nauva.

ENGLISH: but Peter remained on the outside by the gate. Therefore the other disciple, who was known to the chief priest, came out and spoke to who watched the gate and led Peter inside.
QUENYA: mal Péter lemyane i etsesse ara i ando. Etta i hyana hildo, ye náne sinwa i héra airimon, ettúle ar carampe yenna tirne i ando ar tulyane Péter minna.

ENGLISH: For nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom, and will be famines and earthquakes in numerous places.
QUENYA: An nóre ortuva nórenna ar aranie aranienna, ar euvar saiceléli ar cempaliéli rimbe nómelissen.

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus said to the twelve: “Do you not want to go away, you too?”
QUENYA: Etta Yésus quente i yunquenna: “Ma ualde mere auta, yando lé?”

ENGLISH: who believes in the Son has eternal life; who does not do as the Son says will not see life, but God’s wrath remains upon him.
QUENYA: Ye save i Yondosse same oira coivie; ye ua care ve i Yondo quete ua cenuva coivie, mal Eruo rúşe lemya sesse.

ENGLISH: The men that went with him stood dumb, for they heard the voice, but did not see anyone.
QUENYA: I neri i lender óse tarner úpe, an hlasselte i óma, mal uar cenne aiquen.

ENGLISH: But if remaining in life means that I can do work that bears fruit, I do not know what I am to choose.
QUENYA: Mal qui lemie coiviesse tea i polin care molie ya cole yáve, uan ista mana ciluvan.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, a person does not receive this glory by his own doing , but solely when he is called by God, as was also Aaron.
QUENYA: Ente, quén ua came alcar sina insenen, mal eryave íre náse yálina lo Eru, ve náne yando Áron.

ENGLISH: But be awake, always praying that you shall be able to excape all these things that will come, and stand before the Son of Man.”
QUENYA: Mal na coive, illume hyámala i poluvalde uşe ilye nati sine yar tuluvar, ar tare epe i Atanyondo.”

ENGLISH: for which I am an ambassador in fetters – for me to speak it boldly, as it is necessary for me to speak.
QUENYA: yan nanye ráquen mi naxali – quetienyan sa veryave, ve mauya nin quete.

ENGLISH: He said to them: “What do you wish that I will do for you?”
QUENYA: Quentes túna: “Mana meriste i caruvan lent?”

ENGLISH: so that you give to others a part in your faith, by the knowledge of every god thing that we have in Christ.
QUENYA: antielyan exelin ranta savielyo, i istyanen ilya mánava ya samilve Hristosse.

ENGLISH: after John, before his coming, made baptism of repentance known to the entire people of Israel.
QUENYA: apa Yoháno, nó tulierya, carne sumbie inwisteva sinwa i quanda lien Israélo.

ENGLISH: And after Jesus completed all these words he went away from Galilee and came to the regions of Judea, beyond the Jordan.
QUENYA: Ar apa Yésus telyane ilye quettar sine oantes Alileallo ar túler i ménannar Yúreo, Yordan pella.

ENGLISH: But Pilate, when he heard that, asked if the man was from Galilee.
QUENYA: Ono Piláto, íre hlasses ta, maquente qui i atan náne Alileallo.

ENGLISH: Thus the just command of the Law could become real in us that walk, not by the flesh, but by the Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: Sie i Şanyeo faila axan polle ole nanwa elvesse i vantar, lá i hrávenen, mal i Aire Feanen.

ENGLISH: When he heard about Jesus, he sent to him some elders of the Jews to request him to come and to deliver his slave.
QUENYA: Íre hlasses pa Yésus, mentanes senna amyárali i Yúraron arcien sello tule ar etelehta mólya.

ENGLISH: For if you live by the flesh, you will die, but if by the spirit you kill the deeds of your body,, you will live.
QUENYA: An qui coitalde i hrávenen, qualuvalde, mal qui i fairenen nahtalde hroaldo cardar, coituvalde.

ENGLISH: If anyone is hungry, it is necessary for him to eat in his house, or you will come together for judgement. But as concerns the other matters I will give orders when I shall come there.
QUENYA: Qui aiquen maita ná, mauya sen mate coaryasse, hya tuluvalde uo námien. Mal pa i hyane nattor antauvan canwar íre tuluvan tar.

ENGLISH: Therefore my goal is that I will always have a clean conscience towards God and men.
QUENYA: Etta ennenya ná in inye illume samuva poica immotuntie Erunna ar atannar.

ENGLISH: And do not adorn yourselves on the outside, by arrangements of hair, or by putting trinkets of gold on yourselves, or by carrying raiments,
QUENYA: Ar áva netya inde i ettesse, partiénen findeléva, hya paniénen neteli maltava indesse, hya coliénen larmar,

ENGLISH: And after these things Jesus walked in Galilee, for he did not want to walk in Judea, since the Jews sought to kill him.
QUENYA: Ar apa nati sine Yésus vantane Alileasse, an uas merne vanta Yúreasse, pan i Yúrar cestaner nahta se.

ENGLISH: We may bring a sister as wife, as do the others apostles and the Lord's brothers and Cephas, is it not so?
QUENYA: Lertalme tala néşa ve veri, ve carir i hyane aposteli ar i Heruo hánor ar Céfas, ma naite?

ENGLISH: Then they had joy, and they as well ate food.
QUENYA: Tá sámelte alasse, ar yú té manter matta.

ENGLISH: Truly, truly I say to you: who hears my word and believes in who sent me has eternal life, and he does not come to judgement, but has passed from death to life.
QUENYA: Násie, násie quetin lenna: Ye hlare quettanya ar save yesse ni-mentane same oira coivie, ar uas tule namienna, mal oantie ñurullo coivienna.

ENGLISH: And he went away from there and came to his home territory , and his disciples followed him.
QUENYA: Ar oantes talo ar túle atarnómeryanna, ar hildoryar hilyaner se.

ENGLISH: Then the demons went out of the man and went into the swine, and the flock went rushing over the edge into the lake and drowned.
QUENYA: Tá i raucor etelender et i nerello ar menner mir i polcar, ar i lámáre lende rimpa olla i lanca mir i ailin ar quorner.

ENGLISH: May everyone among you, on every first day of the week, set aside money – the sum that it is possible for him to give. Thus, when I shall come, there will not be need to do collections then.
QUENYA: Nai ilquen mici le, ilya minya auresse i otsolo, satuva telpe – i nonwe ya ece sen anta. Sie, íre tuluvan, ua euva maure care hostier tá.

ENGLISH: And the crowds asked him: ”Then what are we to do?”
QUENYA: Ar i şangar maquenter senna: “Tá mana caruvalme?”

ENGLISH: Then he said to another man: “Follow me!” The man said: “Allow me first to go away and bring my father to the grave.”
QUENYA: Tá quentes hyana nerenna: “Áni hilya!” I nér quente: “Lava nin minyave auta ar tala atarinya i sapsanna.”

ENGLISH: For the grace which brings salvation to all men has been revealed,
QUENYA: An i Erulisse ya tala rehtie ilye atanin anaie apantaina,

ENGLISH: This is who came by water and blood, Jesus Christ, not by the water alone, but by the water and by the blood. And the spirit is what is witnessing, since the spirit is truth.
QUENYA: Si ná ye túle nennen ar sercenen, Yésus Hristo, lá i nennen erinqua, mal i nennen ar i sercenen. Ar i faire ná ya vettea, pan i faire nanwie ná.

ENGLISH: And if your hand is causing your fall, cut it off; going into life without a body-part is better for you than passing with two hands into Gehenna, into the fire that burns forever.
QUENYA: Ar qui málya tyára lantelya, ása aucire; menie mir coivie ú hroaranto ná lyen arya lá autie arwa má atto mir Ehenna, mir i náre ya urya tennoio.

ENGLISH: And after he said that, he send the ones having assembled away.
QUENYA: Ar apa quentes ta, mentanes i ocómienwar oa.

ENGLISH: Therefore, be like God, like beloved children,
QUENYA: Etta, na ve Eru, ve méline híni,

ENGLISH: But I am happy since Stephanus and Fortunatus and Achaicus are here, for though you are not with me, they have filled my need.
QUENYA: Mal nanye valima pan Stefánas ar Fortunáto ar Acaico nar sisse, an ómu elde uar asinye, té aquátier maurenya.

ENGLISH: through whom we received grace and a place as apostle, to create heeding of the fath among all the nations concerning his name;
QUENYA: ter ye camnelme lisse ar nóme ve apostel, ontien cimie i saviéva mici ilye i nóri pa esserya,

ENGLISH: For the good that I want I do not do, but the evil that I do not want, that I do.
QUENYA: An i márie ya merin uan care, mal i ulco ya uan mere, ta carin.

ENGLISH: and they will return to their keenness of perception out of the Devil's snare, they that were seized by him in order to do his will.
QUENYA: ar entuluvalte laiceltanna et i Arauco remmallo, té i náner mapaine lo sé carien nírarya.

ENGLISH: Now Peter and John went up into the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.
QUENYA: Sí Peter ar Yoháno lender ama mir i corda i lúmesse hyamiéno, i nertea lúme.

ENGLISH: I tell you: To Sodom the day of judgement will be more bearable than what it will be to that city.
QUENYA: Nyarin lenna: Soromen i aure namiéva nauva cólima lá ya nauvas sana oston.

ENGLISH: For a new birth is given to you, not by corruptible but by incorruptible seed, by the word of the living and lasting God.
QUENYA: An vinya nónie ná len antaina, lá hastima mal alahastima erdenen, coirea ar vórea Eruo quettanen.

ENGLISH: Thus it is necessary also for you to subject yourselves such people and all that work together and toil.
QUENYA: Sie mauya yú elden panya inde nu taiti queni ar illi i molir uo ar mótar.

ENGLISH: And her spirit returned, and she arose in the same moment, and Jesus commanded that one gave her something to eat.
QUENYA: Ar fairerya nanwenne, ar orontes mí imya lú, ar Yésus canne i mo antane sen nat matien.

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Where your faith?” But being scared they were in wonder, saying one to the other: “Who indeed is this man, for he commands also the winds and the water, and they do as he says?”
QUENYA: Tá quentes téna: “Masse savielda?” Mal nála ruhtaine anelte elmendasse, quétala quén i exenna: “É man ná nér sina, an canis yando i şúrin ar i nenen, ar carilte ve quetis?”

ENGLISH: "But he that praises himself, may he praise himself in the Lord."
QUENYA: "Mal ye laitaxe, nai laituvas inse i Hérusse."

ENGLISH: Your body's lamp is the eye. Therefore, if your eye is in health, your entire body will be bright,
QUENYA: Hroalyo calma ná i hen. Etta, qui hendelya ná málesse, quanda hroalya nauva calima,

ENGLISH: And yet all these people, though they received a witness about their faith, did not receive the fulfillment of the promise.
QUENYA: Ananta ilye queni sine, ómu camnelte vettie pa savielta, uar ñente i vando amaquatie.

ENGLISH: Let no one so seduce you, since it will not come before the apostasy has come first, and the man of lawlessness will be revealed, the son of destruction .
QUENYA: Lava úquenen sie şahta le, pan uas tuluva nó i oatarie utúlie minyave, ar i nér şanyelóriéva nauva apantaina, yondo nancariéno.

ENGLISH: But I will show you whom it is necessary for you to fear: Fear who after killing has the power of throwing into Gehenna. Yes, I say to you, fear him!”
QUENYA: Mal tanuvan len manello mauya len ruce: Ruca yello apa nehtie same i túre hatiéva mir Ehenna. Ná, quetin lenna, ruca sello!”

ENGLISH: but glory and honor and peace to everyone that does good, to the Jew firstly and also to the Greek.
