QUENYA: Íre cennes Yesus, yámes ar lantane undu epe se, ar quentes taura ómanen: “Mana nin ar lyen, Yésus, Eru Antaro yondo? Iquin lyello, ávani ñwalya!'

ENGLISH: And the Lord said: “Indeed who is the faithful steward, the intelligent one, in whose oversight his lord will place all his servants, for him to give them their food at the proper time?
QUENYA: Ar i Heru quente: “É man ná i voronda mardil, i handa, yeo ortíriesse herurya panyuva ilye núroryar, antieryan tien matsolta mí vanima lúme?

ENGLISH: For every kind of wild animals and of birds and of reptiles and of creatures in sea have ben made servants of Men.
QUENYA: An ilya nostale hravani celvaron ar aiwion ar hlócion ar onnaron earesse anaier cárine núror Atanion.

ENGLISH: And as soon as dawn came, the chief priest with the elders and the scribes and the entire High Council made a consideration; and they bound Jesus and led him away and gave him over to Pilate.
QUENYA: Ar ve rongo ve ára túle, i héra airimo as i amyárar ar i parmangolmor ar i quanda Tára Combe carner úvie, ar nuntelte Yésus ar tulyaner se oa ar antaner se olla Pilátonna.

ENGLISH: All have strayed, all together have become worthless , is nobody that does kindness, not a single person.
QUENYA: Illi aránier, illi uo olólier úmirwe; ea úquen ye care moicie, lá erya quén.

ENGLISH: By chastisement you are faithful. God behaves towards you as towards sons. For who is the son that the father does not give chastisement?
QUENYA: Paimestanen nalde voronde. Eru lenga len ve yondoin. An man ná i yondo yen i atar ua anta paimesta?

ENGLISH: And after Jesus completed all these sayings, he said to his disciples:
QUENYA: Ar apa Yésus telyane ilye quetier sine, quentes hildoryannar:

ENGLISH: The club-bearers told these words to the judges. They were scared when they heard that they were Romans.
QUENYA: I rundacolindor nyarner quettar sine i námoin. Anelte ruhtane íre hlasselte i anette Rómear.

ENGLISH: concerning sin, since they do not believe in me;
QUENYA: pa úcare, pan ualte save nisse,

ENGLISH: Thus there are also with you who keep the teaching of the Nicolaitans.
QUENYA: Sie ear yú aselye i hepir i peantave i Nicolaiyaron.

ENGLISH: Recall that are in prison, as if you are there with them, and those that suffer evil, since you as well are still in a body.
QUENYA: Enyala i ear mandosse, ve qui nalde tasse aselte, ar i perperir ulco, pan yando elde nar en hroasse.

ENGLISH: for us to be a praise of his glory, we that previously had hope in Christ.
QUENYA: návelvan laitale alcareryava, elve i nóvo sámer estel i Hristosse.

ENGLISH: Since he did not have enough to pay him, his lord commanded that one was to sell him, with his wife and his children, and everything that he had, in order to pay the debt.
QUENYA: Pan uas sáme fáre paitien sen, herurya canne i mo vacumne se, as verirya ar hínaryar, ar ilqua ya sámes, paitien i rohta.

ENGLISH: At that time was in prison a man called Barabbas, having an evil name .
QUENYA: Mi yana lúme enge mandoltasse nér estaina Varavas, arwa ulca esseo.

ENGLISH: While they were eating, Jesus took a bread, and after speaking a blessing he broke it, and giving it to his disciples he said: “Take it, eat! This is my body!”
QUENYA: Lan mátanelte, Yésus nampe massa, ar apa quetie aistie ranceses, ar antala sa hildoryain quentes: “Ása mapa, mata! Si hroanya ná!”

ENGLISH: For he is not Jew who is so on the outside; furthermore, circumcision is not that which exists on the outside, in the flesh.
QUENYA: An isse ua Yúra ye sie ná to i etse; ente, oscirie ua ta ya ea to i etse, i hrávesse.

ENGLISH: For the encouragement which we give does not come from errror or from uncleanness or by a lie,
QUENYA: An i hortale ya antalme ua tule loimallo hya úpoiciello hya hurunen,

ENGLISH: And the four and twenty elders and the four living creatures fell down and worshiped God who was sitting on the throne, and said: “Amen! Hallelujah!”
QUENYA: Ar i amyárar canta yúquean ar i coiti canta lantaner undu ar tyerner Eru i hárane i mahalmasse, ar quenter: “Násie! Hallelúya!”

ENGLISH: For the Son of Man is going away, as he is destined; and yet woe for the person through whom he is given over!”
QUENYA: An i Atanyondo autea, ve náse martyaina; ananta horro i quenen ter ye náse antaina olla!”

ENGLISH: And John's disciples told him about all these things.
QUENYA: Ar Yoháno hildor nyarner sen pa ilye nati sine.

ENGLISH: “Find repentance, for the kingdom of heaven has come near.”
QUENYA: “Hira inwis, an menelo aranie utúlie hare!”

ENGLISH: concerning kings and all that are in prominent places, for them to have a life which is quiet and in peace, in all reverence and seriousness.
QUENYA: pa arani ar illi i ear mi minde meni, samielvan coivie ya ná quilda ar rainesse, mi ilya ainocimie ar sanwelungie.

ENGLISH: Who among the prophets did your fathers not persecute? And they slew who beforehand made known the coming of the Just One, whom you have now given over and you have slain,
QUENYA: Man imíca i Erutercánor atarildar uar roitane? Ar nacantelte i nóvo carner sinwa tulesse i Failo, ye sí ánielde olla ar anahtielde,

ENGLISH: And they had a dispute, one with the other, about their lacking breads.
QUENYA: Ar sámelte cos, quén as i exe, pa penielta massar.

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “You give them something to eat.” They said: “We do not have more than five breads and two fish, if perhaps we are not to go and trade to ourselves food for all these people.”
QUENYA: Mal quentes téna: “Elde áten anta nat matien.” Quentelte: “Ualme same amba lá mastar lempe ar lingwe atta, qui lá cé menuvalme ar mancuvalme immen matso ilye sine quenin.”

ENGLISH: For we write to you nothing except the things that you can read and understand. I have the hope that you will fully understand them until the end,
QUENYA: An tecilme lenna munta hequa i nati yar polilde henta ar hanya. Samin i estel i aqua hanyuvaldet tenna i metta,

ENGLISH: I tell you: Among that were born of women is no one greater than John, but a person among the smaller in God's kingdom is greater than he.”
QUENYA: Nyarin len: Imíca i náner nóne lo nissi ea úquen túra lá Yoháno, mal quén imíca i ambe pityar Eruo araniesse ná túra lá sé.”

ENGLISH: Indeed not only that, but may we also praise ourselves concerning the persecutions, knowing that persecution gives endurance,
QUENYA: É lá rie ta, mal nai yú laituvalve inwe pa i roitier, istala i roitie anta voronwie,

ENGLISH: They will see his face, and his name will be on their forehead.
QUENYA: Cenuvalte cendelerya, ar esserya euva timbareltasse.

ENGLISH: Now when Simon saw how the spirit was being given by putting hands , he put silver-pieces before them,
QUENYA: Sí íre Símon cenne manen i faire náne antaina paniénen mát, panyanes telpemittali epe te,

ENGLISH: Epaphras greets you, he who is from among you, slave of Christ Jesus. Always he fights on your behalf in his prayers, requesting that you will stand perfect and firm in all the will of God.
QUENYA: Epafras suila le, sé ye mici lello ná, mól Hristo Yésuo. Illume mahtas rá elden hyamieryassen, arcala i taruvalde ilvane ar tulce mí quanda indóme Eruo.

ENGLISH: I am writing to you, children, because your sins are forgiven you by means of his name.
QUENYA: Técan lenna, híni, pan úcareldar nar apsénine len esseryanen.

ENGLISH: Indeed circumcision is beneficial if you abide by the Law; but if you break the Law, your circumcision has become lack of circumcision.
QUENYA: É oscirie aşea ná qui himyal i Şanye; mal qui racil i Şanye, oscirielya olólie penie osciriéva.

ENGLISH: And the family heads, full of envy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt. But God was with him,
QUENYA: Ar i nossetúri, quante hrúceno Yósefenna, vancer se mir Mirrandor. Mal Eru enge óse,

ENGLISH: When evening fell, came thither a rich man from Arimathea called Josef, who also was a disciple of Jesus.
QUENYA: Íre şinye lantane, túle tar lára nér Arimaşeallo estaina Yósef, ye yú náne Yésus hildo.

ENGLISH: I have this hope: that when I go to Spain, it will be possible for me to see you when I pass by, and that you will help me to travel thither when I am in measure filled with your company .
QUENYA: samin estel sina: in íre lelyan Spanianna, ecuva nin vele le íre lahtuvan, ar i manyuvalde ni lelya tar íre nanye mi lesta quátina návenen aselde.

ENGLISH: Pray for us, for we are sure that we have a good conscience, wishing to behave well in all matters.
QUENYA: Hyama elmen, an nalme tance i samilme mára immotuntie, mérala lenga mai mi ilye nattor.

ENGLISH: But when day came, he went out and went to a lonely place. But the crowds sought him, and they came to where he was, and they tried to stop him from going away from them.
QUENYA: Ono íre aure túle, etelendes ar menne eressea nómenna. Mal i şangar cestaner se, ar túlelte yanna anes, ar névelte pusta se autiello tello.

ENGLISH: If I have indeed done a crime and I am worthy of death, I do not ask to escape from death, but if I have not done a single one of the crimes which they say I have done, nobody may give me into their hand. I put my case before the High King.”
QUENYA: Qui é acárien ongwe ar nanye valda qualmeo, uan arca uşe qualmello, mal qui uan acárie erya i ongwion yar quetilte acárien, úquen lerta anta ni mir málta. Panyan nattonya epe i Ingaran.”

ENGLISH: Thus he also went away and preached to the spirits in custody,
QUENYA: Sie yando oantes ar nyardane i fairennar mandosse,

ENGLISH: By these things he has given us the precious and greatest promises, for us to have a part in divine nature , after fleeing the marring that is in the world by lust.
QUENYA: Sine natinen ánies ven i mirwe ar antúre vandar, samieldan ranta valaina nasseo, apa uºie i hastie ya ea i mardesse mailenen.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he took a bread, gave thanks, broke it and said: “This is my body, that will be given on your behalf. Do this to recall me.”
QUENYA: Ente, nampes massa, antane hantale, rance sa ar quente: “Si ná hroanya, ya nauva antaina rá len. Cara si enyalien ni.”

ENGLISH: You still have not met temptation beyond which is normal for men. But God is faithful, and he will not allow that you are tested beyond which you can bear, but with the temptation he will also bring the way out of it, to allow you to be firm.
QUENYA: Hinna ualde evélie úşahtie han ya şanya ná atanin. Mal Eru voronda ná, ar uas lavuva i nalde tyastaine han ya polilde cole, mal as i úşahtie yú taluvas i tie et sallo, lavien len náve tulce.

ENGLISH: and through him unite all things with himself, after making peace by the blood of his cross, the things on earth and the things in heaven alike.
QUENYA: ar ter sé erta ilye nati as inse, apa carie raine i sercenen tarweryo, i nati cemende ar i nati menelde véla.

ENGLISH: For no one can put another foundation except that whis is put , which is Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: An úquen pole panya hyana talma hequa ta ya ná panyana, ya Yésus Hristo ná.

ENGLISH: On the following day, when they had come out of Bethany, he was hungry.
QUENYA: I hilyala auresse, íre anelte túlienwe et Vetániallo, anes maita.

ENGLISH: And after he came down from the mountain huge throngs followed him.
QUENYA: Ar apa túles undu i orontello hoe şangar hilyaner se.

ENGLISH: For if they did not ever know the path of righteousness, that was to them better than turning themselves away from it after knowing the holy commandment given to them.
QUENYA: An qui ualte oi sinte i tie failiéva, tá náne tien arya lá querie inte oa sallo apa istie i aire axan antaina tien.

ENGLISH: Sitting by the window was a young man called Eutychus, who fell into deep sleep while Paul was talking, and collapsing in sleep he fell down from the third floor and was dead when he was lifted up.
QUENYA: Hámala ara i lattin enge nessa nér estaina Eutico, ye lantane mir núra húme íre Paulo quétane, ar taltala húmesse lantanes undu i neldea talamello ar náne qualina íre anes ortana.

ENGLISH: that are protected by God's power, by faith, for a salvation that is ready to be revealed in the last time.
QUENYA: i nar varyaine lo Eruo túre, saviénen, rehtien ya ná manwa náven apantaina i métima lúmesse.

ENGLISH: Therefore stand firm, after binding the truth around your hips as a belt, and having the breast-plate of righteousness,
QUENYA: Etta tara tancave, apa nutie i nanwie os oşweldar ve quilta, ar arwe i ambasseo failiéva,

ENGLISH: You heard that was said to the old ones: Do not kill, but anyone that does kill will come under judgement!
QUENYA: Hlasselde i náne quétina i yárannar: Áva nahta; mal aiquen ye é nahta tuluva nu namie!

ENGLISH: But Jesus again cried with a mighty voice and expired.
QUENYA: Mal Yésus ata yáme taura ómanen ar effirne.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, I did not go up to Jerusalem to those that were apostles before me, but I went away into Arabia, and I returned to Damascus.
QUENYA: Ente, uan lende ama Yerúsalemennna innar náner aposteli nó inye, mal lenden oa mir Aravia, ar nanwennen Lamascusenna.

ENGLISH: When I you come, bring the cloak that I left behind in Troas with Carpus, and the books, above everything the parchments .
QUENYA: Íre tulil, á tala i colla ya hehtanen Troasse as Carpo, ar i parmar, or ilqua i helmaparmar.

ENGLISH: “Behold! We will go up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be given over to the chief priests and the scribes, and they will judge him worthy of death
QUENYA: “Yé! Lelyuvalme ama Yerúsalemenna, ar i Atanyondo nauva antana olla i hére airimoin ar i parmangolmoin, ar namuvaltes valda qualmeo

ENGLISH: Also, do not be grumbling, as some among them grumbled and were slain by the Destroyer.
QUENYA: Yú, áva na nurrula, ve ennoli mici té nurruner ar náner nahtane lo i Nancáro.

ENGLISH: Then he said to the man: “Reach out with your hand!” And he reached out with it, and it was renewed and was like the other hand.
QUENYA: Tá quentes i nerenna: “Á rahta mályanen!” Ar rahtanes sanen, ar anes envinyanta ar náne ve i hyana má.

ENGLISH: I have come as a light into the world, and everyone who believes in me shall not remain in the darkness.
QUENYA: Utúlien ve cala mir i mar, i ilquen ye save nisse ua lemyuva i morniesse.

ENGLISH: To the king of eternity, incorruptable, invisible, to the sole God, be honor and glory forever and ever! Amen.
QUENYA: Aranen oialeo, alahastima, alacénima, i erya Ainon, na laitie ar alcar tennoio ar oi! Násie.

ENGLISH: after watching your pure conduct and the awe that you show.
QUENYA: apa tirie poica lengielda ar i áya ya tanalde.

ENGLISH: And all among them ate and were filled.
QUENYA: Ar illi mici te manter ar náner quátine.

ENGLISH: but if you do not forgive men, your Father will in the same manner not forgive your crimes to you.
QUENYA: mal qui ualde apsene atanin, Atarelda mi imya lé ua apsenuva ongweldar len.

ENGLISH: Everything is allowed, but everything is not beneficial. Everything is allowed, but everything does not build up.
QUENYA: Ilqua lávina ná, mal ilqua ua aşea. Ilqua lávina ná, mal ilqua ua carasta ama.

ENGLISH: They say that they know God, but by their deeds they deny him, since they are disgusting and rebellious, and concerning every good doing they are turned away .
QUENYA: Quetilte in istalte Eru, mal cardaltainen lalalte se, pan nalte yelwe ar amortala, ar pa ilya mára carie nalte quérine oa.

ENGLISH: Therefore, since you have received Christ Jesus the Lord, walk in him,
QUENYA: Etta, pan acámielde Hristo Yésus i Heru, á vanta sesse,

ENGLISH: But I say to you: Do not give oaths at all, not by heaven , for it is the throne of God,
QUENYA: Mal inye quete lenna: Aqua áva anta vandar, lá menelden, an nas i mahalma Eruva,

ENGLISH: The children of God and the children of the Devil are revealed by this: Everyone who does not do righteousness is not of God, also not who does not love his brother.
QUENYA: I híni Eruo ar i híni i Arauco nar apantaine sinen: Ilquen ye ua care failie ui Eruo, yando lá ye ua mele hánorya.

ENGLISH: He did not eat for forty days and forty nights, and after this time he was hungry.
QUENYA: Uas mante auressen canaquean ar lómissen canaquean, ar apa lúme sina anes maita.

ENGLISH: is good not to eat flesh or to drink vine or to do anything that causes your brother to fall.
QUENYA: Mára ná lá matie hráve hya sucie limpe hya carie aiqua ya tyare hánolya lanta.

ENGLISH: When the days of his service were complete, he went away to his house.
QUENYA: Íre i auri veuyaleryo náner telyaine, oantes coaryanna.

ENGLISH: Then he ate and was strengthened. For some days he remained with the disciples in Damascus,
QUENYA: Tá mantes ar náne turyana. Rélissen lemnes as i hildor Lamascusse,

ENGLISH: and that they are not to heed fables and genealogies without end, which lead to inquiries before they lead to a distribution of anything by God in the faith.
QUENYA: ar i ávalte cime nyarier ar ontaleparmar ú metto, yar tulyar minaşúriennar nó tulyalte i etsatienna aiquava lo Eru i saviesse.

ENGLISH: From Tyre we came to Ptolemais, completing the voyage . We greeted the brothers and remained one day with them.
QUENYA: Ho Tír túlelme Ptolemaisenna, telyala i luntelenda. Suilanelme i hánor ar lemner er ré aselte.

ENGLISH: Since everyone among you has received a gift, use it while you serve one another, in various graces.
QUENYA: Pan ilquen mici le acámie anna, ása yuhta íre veuyalde quén i exe, mí alavéle Erulissi.

ENGLISH: This man dwells in house of a man whose name is Simon, a leather-worker, who has his house by the sea.”
QUENYA: Nér sina mare coasse quenwa yeo esse Símon ná, alumo, ye same coa ara i ear.”

ENGLISH: When day was near, Paul encouraged all that they were to eat, saying: “Today is the fourteenth day when you are waiting without food, for you have eaten nothing.
QUENYA: Íre aure hare né, Paulo hortane illi i matumnelte, quétala: “Síra ná i canaquea ré yasse hópalde ú matto, an amátielde munta.

ENGLISH: “I am a Jew, born in Tarsus in Cilicia, but instructed in this city before the feet of Gamaliel in the tough manner of the Law of our fathers. I was burning for God like all among you on this day.
QUENYA: “Inye Yúra ná, nóna mi Tarsus Ciliciasse, mal peantana osto sinasse epe talu Amaliélo mí tarya lé i Şanyeo atarilvaron. Anen uryala Erun ve illi mici lé aure sinasse.

ENGLISH: God nobody has ever seen; the only-born Son who is in the Father’s bosom has made him known.
QUENYA: Eru úquen oi ecénie; i ernóna Yondo ye ea i Ataro súmasse acárie se sinwa.

ENGLISH: Everyone that falls against that stone will be broken. Anyone upon whom it falls, it will smash him.”
QUENYA: Ilquen ye lanta tana ondonna nauva rácina. Aiquen yenna lantas, ascatuvas se.”

ENGLISH: and Apphia our sister who is a soldier with us, and to the congregation that is in your house: May you have mercy and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: ar Apfia néşalmanna, ar Arhipponna ye ná ohtar aselme, ar i ocombenna ya ea coalyasse: Nai samuvalde oravie ar raine ho Eru Atarelva ar i Heru Yésus Hristo.

ENGLISH: Therefore go to the roads that lead out of the city, and call anyone that you find to the feast of marriage.
QUENYA: Etta mena i mallennar yar tulyar et i ostollo, ar yala aiquen ye hirilde i veryangweo merendenna.

ENGLISH: How do you not understand what I am saying? Because you cannot listen to my word.
QUENYA: Manen ualde hanya ya quétan? Pan ua ece len lasta quettanyanna.

ENGLISH: Knowing that, Jesus went away from there. Numerous ones also followed him, and he healed all among them,
QUENYA: Istala ta, Yésus oante talo. Rimbali yú hilyaner se, ar nestanes illi mici te,

ENGLISH: Nobody can be a slave for two lords; he will hate the one and love the other, or he will stick to the one and loathe the other. You cannot be slaves for God and for Mammon alike.
QUENYA: Úquen pole náve mól heru attan; tevuvas i mine ar meluva i exe, hya himyuvas i mine ar yeltuva i exe. Ualde pole náve móli Erun ar Mammonden véla.

ENGLISH: At that time Jesus went through the corn-fields on the day of rest. His disciples were hungry and started to pick heads or grain to eat.
QUENYA: Lúme yanasse Yésus lende ter i orirestar i sendaresse. Hildoryar náner maite ar yestaner lepta i cari oriva matien.

ENGLISH: And is nothing hidden that will not be revealed, or anything veiled that will not ever be known or easily seen.
QUENYA: An ea munta nurtaina ya ua nauva apantaina, hya aiqua halyaina ya ua oi nauva sinwa hya aşcénima.

ENGLISH: And beside all these things, a big cleft has been placed between us and you Thus that wish to go from here to you are not able; in the same manner people are not able to pass from there to us.”
QUENYA: Ar ara ilye nati sine, hoa cilya anaie panyaina imbi elme ar elde. Sie i merir lelya silo lenna uar pole; mi imya lé queni uar pole lahta talo menna.”

ENGLISH: In the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city in Galilee called Nazareth,
QUENYA: I enquea astaresse i vala Avriel náne mentaina Erullo ostonna Alileasse estaina Nasaret,

ENGLISH: He said: “I will hear you, when the people that have complaints about you shall arive also.” And he commanded that one was to keep him in gaol in the palace of Herod.
QUENYA: Eques: “Hlaruvan lye, íre i queni i samir nurreli pa lyé yú tuluvar.” Ar cannes i mo hepumne se mandosse mí túrion Herolwa.

ENGLISH: On the third day was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and Jesus’ mother was there.
QUENYA: I neldea auresse enge veryanwe Cánasse Alileo, ar Yésuo amil náne tasse.

ENGLISH: Some women received back their dead by resurrection, but others were tormented since they did not want a release by ransom, for they wanted to receive a better resurrection.
QUENYA: Nisseli nancamner qualiniltar enortiénen, mal exeli náner ñwalyaine pan ualte merne lehtie nanwerenen, an mernelte came arya enortie.

ENGLISH: And in that hour she arose and gave thanks to God, and she talked about the child to all that looked forward to the deliverance of Jerusalem.
QUENYA: Ar yana lúmesse orontes ar antane Erun hantale, ar carampes pa i hína ilyannar i yenter ompa i ehtelehtienna Yerúsalenwa.

ENGLISH: Since numerous ones praise themselves by the flesh, I as well will praise myself!
QUENYA: Pan rimbali laitar inte i hrávenen, yando inye laituvaxe!

ENGLISH: Now I wish that you are to know, brothers, that my condition has caused the gospel to go forward more than stopping it,
QUENYA: Sí merin i istalde, hánor, i sómanya atyárie i evandilyon lelya ompa ambe lá pusta sa,

ENGLISH: For we have brought nothing into the world; in the same manner we can carry nothing out of it.
QUENYA: An atálielve munta mir i mar; mi imya lé polilve cole munta et sallo.

ENGLISH: And the sanctuary was filled with smoke, by the glory of God and by his power, and nobody could come into the sanctuary until the seven plagues of the seven angels were finished.
QUENYA: Ar i yána náne quátina usqueo, i alcarnen Eruo ar túreryanen, ar úquen polde tule mir i yána tenna i ungwaler otso i valion otso náner telyane.

ENGLISH: Now, when he went away, behold! people brought him a dumb man possessed by a demon,
QUENYA: Sí íre oantelte, yé! queni taller senna úpa nér haryaina lo rauco,

ENGLISH: Our letter is you, written in our heart and known and read by all men.
QUENYA: Mentalma elde ná, técina eldalmasse ar sinwa ar cendaina lo ilye atani.

ENGLISH: After they stopped talking, Jacob said: “Men, brothers listen to me!
QUENYA: Apa pustanette carpa, Yácov quente: “Neri, hánor, á lasta ninna!

ENGLISH: was a man who was ill, Lazarus from Bethany, the village of Mary and Martha her sister.
QUENYA: Enge nér ye né hlaiwa, Lasarus Vetaniallo, i masto Mário yo Marşa néşaryo.

ENGLISH: This is the third time that I am coming to you. By the mouth of two or three witnesses every matter will be established.
QUENYA: Si ná i nelya lú yasse túlan lenna. Astarmo atta hya neldeo antonen ilya natto nauva tulcaina.

ENGLISH: about salvation from our enemies and from the hand of that hate us,
QUENYA: pa rehtie ñottolvallon ar ho i má ion tevir ve,

ENGLISH: You are my friends if you do what I command you.
QUENYA: Lé nar meldonyar qui carilde ya canin len.

ENGLISH: He said to them: “Go into the city to so-and-so and say to him: The teacher says: 'My time is near; in your house I will make the Passover with my disciples!”
QUENYA: Quentes téna: “Mena mir i osto ana sie-yo-sie ar queta senna: I Peantar quete: 'Lúmenya hare ná; coalyasse caruvan i Lahtie as hildonyar.'”

ENGLISH: But he looked around himself to see the person who did this.
QUENYA: Ono yentes os se cenien i quén ye carne si.

ENGLISH: He said to them: “You say that I am.”
QUENYA: Quentes téna: “Elde quetir i nanye.”

ENGLISH: Take heed that you do not do your righteousness in front of men to be watched by them, or you will not have reward from your Father in heaven.
QUENYA: Cima i ualde care failielda epe atani náven tíraine lo té, hya ualde samuva paityale Atareldallo menelde.

ENGLISH: When they had nothing to give back to him, he foregave both. Then who among them will love him more?”
QUENYA: Íre sámelte munta nanantien sen, yúyon apsennes. Tá man mici tú meluva se ambe?”

ENGLISH: But I say to you: I will by no means drink of this fruit of the vine until that day when I shall drink it new with you in my Father's kingdom!”
QUENYA: Mal quetin lenna: Laume sucuvan sina yávello i liantasseo tenna enta aure yasse sucuvanyes vinya aselde Atarinyo araniesse!”

ENGLISH: Do we thusly put away law by our faith? By no means, but we establish law!
QUENYA: Ma sie panyalve oa şanye savielvanen? Laume, mal tulcalve şanye!

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “May one on the day of rest do good or do evil, save a person or kill a person?” But they were silent.
QUENYA: Tá quentes téna: “Ma mo lerta i sendaresse care márie hya care ulco, rehta quén hya nahta quén?” Mal anelte quilde.

ENGLISH: Now the festival of Unleavened Breads, which is called Passover, was near.
QUENYA: Sí i aşar Alapulúne Massaron, ya ná estaina Lahtie, náne hare.

ENGLISH: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief, in which heaven will pass away with a great noice, but the heavenly bodies will melt in a terrible heat, and earth and that have been done in it shall be revealed.
QUENYA: Ono i Heruo aure tuluva ve arpo, yasse menel autuva túra ramesse, mal i meneldie hrondor ticuvar rúcima úresse, ar cemen ar yar anaier cárine sasse nauvar apantaine.

ENGLISH: perhaps under governors sent from him to punish who do evil, but to praise who do good.
QUENYA: cé nu cánor mentaine sello pamietien i carir ulco, mal laitien i carir márie.

ENGLISH: I said to him: “My lord, you know!” And he told me: “These people are who come out of the great tribulation, and they have cleansed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
QUENYA: Quenten senna: “Herunya, elye ista!” Ar nyarnes nin: “Queni sine nar i túlar et i túra şangiello, ar opoitielte vaimaltar ar ininquitáyer tai sercesse i Euleo.

ENGLISH: Now I say that while the heir is a babe he is in nothing better than a thrall, though he is lord of all things.
QUENYA: Sí quetin i íre i aryon ná lapse náse muntasse arya lá mól, ómu náse heru ilye nation.

ENGLISH: He said to them: “An enemy, a man, has done this thing!” They said to him: “Do you want that we will go to gather them?”
QUENYA: Quentes téna: “Ñotto, nér, acárie nat sina!” Quentelte senna: “Ma meril i menuvalme comien te?”

ENGLISH: They answered him: “We are Abraham’s seed, and we have not ever been anybody’s slaves. How can you say: You shall be free – ?
QUENYA: Hanquentelte senna: “Nalme Avrahámo erde, ar ualme oi anaie aiqueno móli. Manen lertal quete: Nauvalde lére –?”

ENGLISH: Going into one of the boats, which was Simon's, he asked him to go a short distance from the land. Then he sat down, and from the boat he taught the crowds. When he ceased to speak, he said to Simon: “Go to where it is deep, and you put down your nets for a catch.”
QUENYA: Lelyala mir er i luntion, ya náne Símonwa, arcanes sello lelya şinta tie i norello. Tá hamnes undu, ar i luntello peantanes i şangain. Íre pustanes quete, quentes Símonna: “Á lelya yanna núra ná, ar alde panya undu rembeldar mapien.”

ENGLISH: Simon Peter said to him: “By no means will you ever wash my feet!” Jesus answered him: “If I do not wash you, you do not have part with me.”
QUENYA: Símon Péter quente senna: “Elye laume oi sovuva ninye talu!” Yésus hanquente senna: “Qui uan sove lye, ual same ranta asinye.”

ENGLISH: But when they passed by in an early hour, they saw the fig tree withered up from the roots.
QUENYA: Mal íre lahtanelte arinya lúmesse, cennelte i relyávalda hestiéla i şundullon.

ENGLISH: Thus everyone who eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord without being worthy, will carry guilt concerning the Lord's body and blood.
QUENYA: Sie ilquen ye mate i massa hya suce i Heruo yulma pen náve valda, coluva cáma pa i Heruo hroa ar serce.

ENGLISH: He said to him: 'Out of your own mouth I am judging you, wicked slave! You knew that I am a harsh man who take up what I did not put down and reap what I did not sow?
QUENYA: Quentes senna: “Et véra antolyallo náman lye, olca mól! Sintel i nanye naraca nér ye mapa ya uan panyane undu ar cirihta ya uan rende?

ENGLISH: For is necessary that this destructible puts on itself a state beyond destruction, and is necessary for this mortal to put on itself an immortal state.
QUENYA: An mauya nancárima sinan panya insasse sóma nancarie pella, ar mauya fírima sinan panya insasse ilfirin sóma.

ENGLISH: In his right hand he had seven stars; out of his mouth went a sharp, two-edged longsword having two edges. His face shone as when the Sun shines in its power.
QUENYA: Formaryasse sámes tinwi otso; et antoryallo lende aica andamacil arwa címa atto. Cendelerya calle ve íre Anar cala túreryasse.

ENGLISH: One does not light a lamp and put it under a vessel, but on the lampstand, and it shines on everyone in the house.
QUENYA: Mo ua narta calma ar sa-panya nu calpa, mal i calmatarmasse, ar caltas ilquenna i coasse.

ENGLISH: Through him we also have a gate of faith leading to the grace in which we now stand; and may we praise ourselves as concerns the hope of the glory of God.
QUENYA: Ter hé yú samilve ando saviéva tulyala i Erulissenna yasse sí tarilve; ar nai laituvalve inwe pa i estel alcaro Eruo.

ENGLISH: And when he went out from the temple one among his disciples said to him: “Teacher, look! Behold the stones and behold the buildings! ”
QUENYA: Ar íre lendes et i cordallo quén mici hildoryar quente senna: “Peantar, ela! Yé i ondor ar yé i ataqui!”

ENGLISH: But when they understood that he was a Jew, they cried with one voice for around two hours: “Great is Artemis of Ephesians!”
QUENYA: Mal íre hanyanelte i anes Yúra, yámelte er ómanen ter os lúme atta: “Túra ná Artemis Efesuyaron.”

ENGLISH: And came to him a leprous person, who petitioned him and fell upon his knees, saying to him: “If you want to, you can make me clean.”
QUENYA: Ar túle senna helmahlaiwa quén, ye arcane sello ar lantane occaryanta, quétala senna: “Qui meril, polilye care ni poica.”

ENGLISH: Happy are you that are hungry now, for you will be filled! Happy are you that are wailing, for you will laugh!
QUENYA: Valime nar elde i nar maite sí, an nauvalde quátine! Valime nar elde i nar yaimie, an laluvalde!

ENGLISH: how will we flee if we have failed to heed a salvation so great? In the beginning it was spoken by our Lord, and it was established for ourselves by that heard him,
QUENYA: manen uşuvalve qui oloitielve cime rehtie ta túra? I yestasse anes quétina lo Herulva, ar anes tulcaina elven lo i hlasser se,

ENGLISH: But when all things will be put under his power, then the Son himself will put himself under the power of that put all things under him, to make God everything for all.
QUENYA: Mal íre ilye nati nauvar panyane nu túrerya, tá i Yondo immo panyuvaxe nu i túre yeo panyane ilye nati nu se, carien Eru ilqua illin.

ENGLISH: Him I make return to you, that is, my own heart.
QUENYA: Sé tyarin nanwene lyenna, ta ná, véra endanya.

ENGLISH: But if that thrall says in his heart: 'My master will not come soon', and he begins to strike the servants and the maidservants, and eats and drinks and fills himself with wine,
QUENYA: Mal qui mól tana quete endaryasse: 'Herunya ua tuluva rato', ar yestas pete i núror ar i núri, ar mate ar suce ar quate inse limpenen,

ENGLISH: And all among us are witnesses of the things that he did in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem alike, but they also killed him by hanging him on a tree.

QUENYA: Ar hlassen i nóte i lihtanaron, canta ar canaquean ar húmi tuxa, lihtane et ilya nossello Israelindion:

ENGLISH: Then he saw a poor widowed woman who threw in two small copper pieces,
QUENYA: Tá cennes penya verulóra nís ye minahante pitye urustamitta atta,

ENGLISH: like Sarah did what Abraham said, calling him lord. And you have been made Sarah's children, if you do good and are not timid about anything fearful.
QUENYA: ve Sara carne ya Avraham quente, estala se heru. Ar elde anaier cárine Saro híni, qui carilde márie ar uar caurie pa aiqua rúcima.

ENGLISH: Since he hard the crowd on the move, he asked about what this meant.
QUENYA: Pan hlasses i şanga léva, maquentes pa mana si tenge.

ENGLISH: And Jesus said to him: “Go! Your faith has saved you.” And in the same moment he received sight, and he followed him on the road.
QUENYA: Ar Yésus quente senna: “Mena! Savielya erehtie lye.” Ar mí imya lú camnes céne, ar se-hilyanes i mallesse.

ENGLISH: If it is grace, it is not by works more; if not, the grace is not more grace.
QUENYA: Qui sa lisse ná, uas ambe cardainen; qui lá, i lisse uas ambe lisse.

ENGLISH: But was a man who arose in the High Council, a Pharisee whose name was Gamaliel, a law-teacher dear to the entire people. He commanded: “Lead the men to the outside for a short time.”
QUENYA: Mal enge nér ye oronte i Tára Combesse, Farisa yeo esse náne Amaliel, şanyepeantar melda i quanda lien. Cannes: “Á tulya i neri i ettenna şinta lúmen.”

ENGLISH: For all these things the nations pursue. But your heavenly Father knows that you have need of all these things.
QUENYA: An ilye nati sine i nóri roitar. Mal meneldea Atarelda ista i samilde maure ilye sine nativa.

ENGLISH: And coming forward, that received thmattme five talents brought another five talents, saying: “Lord, you gave five talents into my keeping. Behold, I have gained another five talents!”
QUENYA: Ar túlala ompa, ye camne i talenti lempe talle an talenti lempe, quétala: “Heru, antanel talenti lempe mir hepienya. Ela, eñétien an talenti lempe!”

ENGLISH: Who among these three do you think made himself a neighbor to the man who fell among the robbers?”
QUENYA: Man mici nelde sine sanal carne inse armaro i neren ye lantane imíca i pilur?”

ENGLISH: He who calls you is faithful – who will also do it.
QUENYA: Isse ye le-yale voronda ná – ye yú caruvas sa.

ENGLISH: And yet he said to me: 'Go, for I will send you to far-off nations!'
QUENYA: Ananta quentes ninna: 'Mena, an lye-mentauvan haire nórennar!'

QUENYA: Tá Péter, autala i luntello, vantane olla i neni ar túle Yésunna.

ENGLISH: saying: “This man causes men to believe it is necessary for them to worship God in a manner against the Law.”
QUENYA: quétala: “Nér sina tyare atani save i mauya tien tyere Eru mi lé ana i Şanye.”

ENGLISH: envy, drunkenness, over-drinkings and their likes. About these things I tell you about the danger beforehand, as I also told you formerly: who do such things will not be heirs of the kingdom of God.
QUENYA: hrúcen, limpunquie, accasucier ar vávealtar. Pa nati sine nyarin len pa i raxe nóvo, ve yando nyarnen len yá: I carir taiti nati uar nauva aryoni i araniéno Eruo.

ENGLISH: comfort your heart and make you firm in every good deed and word.
QUENYA: tiuituva endalda ar caruva le tulce mi ilya mára carda ar quetta.

QUENYA: Etta Yésus tá quente téna pantie: “Lásarus aquálie;

QUENYA: ar quentes téna: “Sie ná técina, i perperumne i Hristo, ar i ortumnes i neldea auresse,

ENGLISH: But I could not see, because of the glory of that light, and being led by the hand by that were with me I came into Damascus.
QUENYA: Mal uan polde cene, i alcarnen sana calo, ar tulyaina i mánen lo i enger asinye túlen mir Lamascus.

ENGLISH: And every creature that exists in heaven and earth and under earth and in the sea, and all the things in them, I heard say: “To who is sitting on the throne and to the Lamb be the blessing and the honor and the might forever and ever.”
QUENYA: Ar ilya onna ye ea mi menel cemenye ar nu cemen ar i earesse, ar ilye i nati tais, hlassen quéta: “Yen hára i mahalmasse ar i Eulen na i aistie ar i laitie ar i alcar ar i melehte tennoio ar oi.”

ENGLISH: A fire I have come to throw upon earth, and what am I to wish if it has been kindled even now?
QUENYA: Náre utúlien hate cemenna, ar mana meruvan qui anaies nartaina yando sí?

ENGLISH: The wall was made of jasper, and the city was pure gold, like pure glass.
QUENYA: I ramba náne cárina nambíreva, ar i osto náne poica malta, ve poica cilin.

ENGLISH: Then they came to the place called Gethsemane, and Jesus said to his disciples: “Sit here while I pray.”
QUENYA: Tá túlelte i nómenna estaina Etsemane, ar Yésus quente hildoryannar: “Hama sisse lan hyamin.”

ENGLISH: Nobody can come to me if the Father who sent me does not draw him, and I shall raise him up again at the last day.
QUENYA: Úquen pole tule ninna qui i Atar ye ni-mentane ua tuce se, ar inye enortuvanyes i métima auresse.

ENGLISH: Therefore, brothers, seek among yourselves seven men that have good witness, full of spirit and wisdom, and we will set them to cover this need,
QUENYA: Etta, hánor, á cesta mici inde neri otso i samir mára vettie, quante faireo ar sailiéno, ar panyuvalmet topien maure sina,

ENGLISH: And he went away from them and went out of the city and remained there through the night.
QUENYA: Ar oantes tello ar lende et i ostollo Vetanianna ar lemne tasse ter i lóme.

ENGLISH: trading to yourselves the good moment, for the days are evil.
QUENYA: mancala inden i mára lú, an i auri nar ulce.

ENGLISH: abandoning the straight road, they have been led into an errant path. They have followed the path of Balaam son of Beor, who loved the reward for wrong-doing,

ENGLISH: by the hope of eternal life about which God, who cannot lie, gave a promise before everlasting times,
QUENYA: i estelden i oira coiviéva pa ya Eru, ye ua pole hure, antane vanda nó oialie lúmeli,

ENGLISH: You are the salt of earth; but if the strength goes away from the salt, how will its salty taste come back? It is not more good for a single thing, but is thrown outside, where people will trample upon it.
QUENYA: Elde nar cemeno singe; mal qui i poldore auta i singello, manen singwa tyáverya nanwenuva? Uas ambe mára erya naten, mal ná hátina ettenna, yasse queni vattuvar sanna.

ENGLISH: For I fear that when I shall come, I will not find you as I can wish, and I will not be to you like you can wish, but instead will be in this or that manner quarrelings, envies, angry feelings, strifes, evil speaking about others, whisperings, pride, a disordered state.
QUENYA: An rucin ho i íre tuluvan, uan hiruva le ve polin mere, ar inye ua nauva len ve elde polir mere, mal i mende euvar mi sina hya sana lé costier, hrúceni, rúşie felmi, costi, ulca quetie pa exi, hlustier, valatie, rúcina sóma.

ENGLISH: for you to praise with one mouth the God and Father of Jesus Christ our Lord.
QUENYA: laitieldan er antonen Yésus Hristo Herulvo Aino ar Atar.

ENGLISH: And they came to the other shore of the sea, into region of the Gerasenes.

ENGLISH: You heard the blasphemy! What do you think?” The judgement of all among them was that he was worthy of death.
QUENYA: Hlasselde i naiquetie! Mana sanalde?” I námie illion mici te náne i anes valda qualmeo.

ENGLISH: Therefore, may it be known to you that this salvation has been sent to the nations; they will also hear.”
QUENYA: Etta, nai nauva sinwa len i rehtie sina anaie mentana i nórennar; té yú hlaruvar.”

ENGLISH: out of the tribe of Zebulun twelve thousands, out of the tribe of Joseph twelve thousands, out of the tribe of Benjamin twelve thousand sealed ones.
QUENYA: et nossello Sevulundo húmi yunque, et nossello Yósefo húmi yunque, et nossello Venyamíno lihtanar húmi yunque.

ENGLISH: about Jesus from Nazareth, how God annointed him with Holy Spirit and with power, and he went through the land, doing good deeds and healing all upon which the Devil's power lay heavy, for God was with him.
QUENYA: pa Yésus Násaretello, manen Eru se-líve Aire Feanen ar túrenen, ar lendes ter i nóre, cárala mánar ar nestala illi innar i Arauco túre lumnane, an Eru náne óse.

ENGLISH: And I saw heaven opened, and behold! a white horse. And who sat on it was called Faithful and True, and he judges and he fights in righteousness.

ENGLISH: To our God and our Father be the glory forever and ever! Amen.

QUENYA: Mal pan anelte ruhtaine ar sámer caure, sannelte i cennelte faire.

ENGLISH: comforting you and witnessing to you, for you to walk worthily for God who calls you into his own kingdom and his glory.
QUENYA: tiutala le ar vettala len, vantieldan valdave Erun ye le-yale mir véra aranierya ar alcarerya.

ENGLISH: that receives a prophet since he is a prophet, will receive a prophet's reward, and that receives a just man since he is just, will receive a just man's reward.
QUENYA: Ye came Erutercáno pan náse Erutercáno, camuva Erutercáno paityale, ar ye came faila nér pan náse faila, camuva faila nero paityale.

ENGLISH: and we do not do like Moses, who put a veil on his face, to stop the Children of Israel from seeing the end of the fading glory.
QUENYA: ar ualve care ve Móses, ye panyane vaşar cendeleryasse, pustien i Israelindi ceniello metta i fifírula alcaro.

ENGLISH: Therefore they said, one to the other: “Let us not rend it, but let us cast lots about who will have it” – in order to fulfill the scripture that says: “They parted my robes among themselves, and about my tunic they cast lots.” And the soldiers indeed did so.
QUENYA: Etta quentelte, quén i exenna: “Ávalve narca sa, mal alve hate şanwali pa man samuva sa” – amaquatien i tehtele ya quete: “Ciltanelte larmanyar mici inte, ar pa laupenya hantelte şanwali.” Ar i ohtari é carner sie.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, which they saw was so terrible that it caused Moses to say: "I am afraid and shaking!"
QUENYA: Ente, ya cennelte náne ta rúcima i tyarnes Móses quete: "Rúcan ar pélan!"

ENGLISH: Philip answered: “If you believe with all your heart, that can happen.”
QUENYA: Filip hanquente: “Qui savil quanda endalyanen, ta pole marta.”

ENGLISH: For God is my witness that I long for you all, with the heart of Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: An Eru astarmonya ná i milyan le illi, Yésus Hristo endanen.

ENGLISH: so they as well have broken the commands, which caused you to receive mercy, that they as well will receive mercy.

ENGLISH: For your obedience is being noticed by all. Therefore you give me joy. But I wish that you will be wise about that is good, but innocent about what is evil.
QUENYA: An canwacimielda ná tuntaina lo illi. Etta nin-antalde alasse. Mal merin i nauvalde saile pa ya mára ná, mal cámalóre pa ya ulca ná.

ENGLISH: He said: 'The God of our fathers has chosen you to know his will and to see the Just One and to hear the voice of his mouth,
QUENYA: Quentes: 'Atarilvaron Aino icílie lyé istien indómerya ar cenien i Faila ar hlarien antoryo óma,

ENGLISH: Not that you can turn yourselves fully away from fornicators, or from greedy people or people who worship idols. Then indeed it was necessary for you to pass out of the world!
QUENYA: Lá i polilde quere inde aqua oa ho hrupuhtor, hya ho milce queni hya queni i tyerir cordoni. Tá é mauyane len auta et i mardello!

ENGLISH: that were known beforehand by God the Father, by sanctification by the spirit, by their doing according to God's will and for them to be purified by the blood of Jesus Christ: May you have grace and peace in abundance!
QUENYA: i náner sinwe nóvo lo Eru i Atar, airitiénen lo i Faire, carieltan ve Eruo indóme ar náveltan poitaine Yésus Hristo sercenen: Nai samuvalde Erulisse ar raine úvesse!

ENGLISH: out of the tribe of Asher twelve thousands, out of the tribe of Naphtali twelve thousands, out of the tribe of Manasseh twelve thousands;
QUENYA: et nossello Ahyero húmi yunque, et nossello Naftalio húmi yunque, et nossello Manasseo húmi yunque,

ENGLISH: And after about an hour was past, another man said firmly: “Indeed this man was with him! He is also from Galilee!”
QUENYA: Ar apa os lúme náne vanwa, hyana nér quente tancave: “É yando nér sina náne óse! Náse yando Alileallo!”

ENGLISH: Therefore, since we have been pronounced just by faith, may we have peace with God, by Jesus Christ our Lord.
QUENYA: Etta, pan anaielve quétine faile saviénen, nai samuvalve raine as Eru, Yésus Hristo Herulvanen.

ENGLISH: Therefore strengthen the hands that hang down and the weak knees,
QUENYA: Etta á antorya i mát yat lingat undu ar i milye occat,

ENGLISH: Therefore may no one among you judge you concerning eating or drinking and concerning a festival or new moon or day of rest,
QUENYA: Etta nai úquen mici le namuva le pa matie ar sucie ar pa aşar hya ceuran hya sendare,

ENGLISH: And let us give heed to one another, urging love and good deeds,
QUENYA: Ar alve cime quén i exe, hortien melme ar máre cardar,

ENGLISH: On the contrary, you were saved with precious blood, like that of a lamb without stain or spot – Christ's blood.
QUENYA: Úsie, anelte rehtaine mirwa sercenen, ve ta euleo ú vaxeo hya mordo – Hristo serce.

ENGLISH: And they called lying witnesses, that said: “This man does not cease to speak words against this holy place and against the Law.
QUENYA: Ar yaldelte húrala astarmoli, i quenter: “Nér sina ua pusta quete quettar ana aire nóme sina ar ana i Şanye.

ENGLISH: For we know who said: "Mine is revenge; I will avenge", and again: "The Lord will judge his people."
QUENYA: An istalve ye quente: "Ninya ná ahtarie; inye accaruva", ar ata: "I Héru namuva lierya."

ENGLISH: And do not think that you may say to yourselves: 'Our father is Abraham' – for I say to you that God can rise up children to Abraham from these stones.
QUENYA: Ar áva sana i lertalde quete indenna: 'Atarelva Avraham ná' – an inye quete lenna in Eru pole orta ama híni Avrahámen sine sarnillon.

ENGLISH: as we received them from who first were witnesses and servants of the word,
QUENYA: ve acámielmet illon minyave náner astarmoli ar núroli i quetto,

ENGLISH: But if his faith is not firm, he is beforehand judged evil if he eats, for he does not eat out of faith. Indeed everything that is not out of faith is sin.
QUENYA: Mal qui savierya ua tanca, náse nóvo námina ulca qui matis, an uas mate et saviello. É ilqua ya ua et saviello úcare ná.

ENGLISH: Then he said to his servants: The feast of marriage is indeed ready, but the ones called were not worthy.
QUENYA: Tá quentes núroryannar: I veryangweo meren é manwa ná, mal i yálinar úner valde.

ENGLISH: And it does great signs; also fire it causes to fall down out of heaven to earth before eyes of men.
QUENYA: Ar caris túre tanwar; yando nár tyaris lanta undu et menello cemenna epe hendu atanion.

ENGLISH: This is the bread that comes down from heaven, that anyone can eat of it and not die.
QUENYA: Si ná i massa ya tule undu menello, i aiquen pole mate sallo ar ua quale.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to her: “Woman, for what reason are you crying? Whom are you seeking?” Supposing that he was the gardener, she said to him: “Lord, if you have carried him away, tell me the place where you have put him, and I will take him away.”
QUENYA: Yésus quente senna: “Nís, mana i casta yanen níteal? Man cesteal?” Intyala i anes i tarwandur, quentes senna: “Heru, qui elye se-ocólie oa, nyara nin i nóme yasse apánielyes, ar inye se-mapuva oa.”

ENGLISH: He came near to him and wrapped his wounds, pouring oil and wine over them. Then he placed him on his animal and brought him to an inn and heeded his needs.
QUENYA: Túles hare senna ar vaitane nahteryar, ulyala millo ar limpe or tai. Tá se-panyanes celvaryasse ar talle se sendassenna ar cimne maureryar.

ENGLISH: For just as the body is one, but has many parts, and all the bodyparts, though they are many, are a single body, so also is the Christ.
QUENYA: An aqua ve i hroa er ná, mal same rimbe rantali, ar ilye i hroarantar, ómu nalte rimbe, nar erya hroa, sie yú i Hristo ná.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he said to who invited him: “When you make an evening meal or a supper, do not summon your friends, or your brothers, or the people of your kin, or your rich neighbors. Perhaps they also will invite you again, and that will be for you a paying back.
QUENYA: Ente, quentes yenna tultane se: “Íre caril şinyemat hya ahtumat, áva tulta meldolyar, hya hánolyar, hya i queni nosselyo, hya lárie armarolyar. Cé yando té tultuvar lyé ata, ar ta nauva lyen nampaityale.

ENGLISH: But were seven brothers, and the first got married to a woman, but died without child.
QUENYA: Mal enger hánor otso, ar i minya veryane nissenna, ono qualle ú híno.

ENGLISH: “Who is the man among you having a hundred sheep who does not, if one among them is lost, leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness and will seek the lost sheep until he finds it?
QUENYA: “Man ná i nér mici le arwa mámaron tuxa ye ua, qui er mici te ná vanwa, hehtuva i nerte neterquean i erumasse ar cestuva i vanwa máma tenna hirises?

ENGLISH: But anything unholy and anybody who practices a disgusting thing and a lie will not come into it, but solely who are written in the book of life of the Lamb.
QUENYA: Mal aiqua úaire ar aiquen ye care şaura nat ar huru ua tuluva minna sa, mal rie i nar técine i parmasse coiviéva i Euleva.

ENGLISH: But anyone who causes to fall one among these who believe in me – to him it is more beneficial if a millstone was put around his neck, and he was drowned in the deep sea.
QUENYA: Mal aiquen ye tyare lanta er mici sine i savir nisse – sen nauva ambe aşea qui mulondo náne panyana os yahtya, ar anes quórina mí núra ear.

ENGLISH: They went and made the tomb safe by sealing the stone and by putting the guards there.
QUENYA: Lendelte ar carner i noire varna lihtiénen i ondo ar paniénen i cundor tasse.

ENGLISH: and he said: “Would that you knew in this day that lead to peace! But now they have been hidden from your eyes .
QUENYA: ar quentes: “Nai elye sinte mi aure sina yar tulyar rainenna! Mal sí anaielte nurtaine hendulyalto.

ENGLISH: God is a spirit, and is necessary for who worship him to worship with spirit and with truth.”
QUENYA: Eru faire ná, ar mauya in se-tyerir tyere fairenen ar nanwiénen.”

ENGLISH: And the city wall has twelve foundation stones, and written on them were the names of the apostles of the Lamb.
QUENYA: Ar i ostoramba sáme talmondor yunque, ar técine tais enger i essi i apostelion yunque i Euleo.

ENGLISH: the Spirit of truth, that the world cannot receive, since it does not either see it or know it. You know it, since it remains in you and is in you.
QUENYA: i Faire nanwiéva, ya i mar ua pole came, pan uas var cene sa var ista sa. Lé istar sa, pan lemyas aselde ar ea lesse.

ENGLISH: But one told him: “Your mother and your brothers are standing on the outside, wishing to see you.”
QUENYA: Mal mo nyarne sen: “Amillelya ar hánoldar tárar i ettesse, mérala vele lye.”

ENGLISH: Having gone into the tomb they saw a young man sit on the right, having a white long-tunic , and they were startled.
QUENYA: Méniéla mir i noire cennelte nessa nér háma i foryasse, arwa ninque andalaupeo, ar anelte captaine.

ENGLISH: There we found brothers who requested that we would stay with them for seven days, and thus we came into Rome.
QUENYA: Tasse hirnelme hánoli i arcaner i lemyumnelme aselte ter rí otso, ar sie túlelme mir Róma.

ENGLISH: Five among them were unwise, and five were wise.
QUENYA: Lempe mici te náner alasaile, ar lempe náner saile.

ENGLISH: The Jews said to him: “Now we know indeed that you are possessed by a demon. Abraham died, also the prophets, but you say: If anyone abides by my word, he shall by no means ever see death.
QUENYA: I Yúrar quenter senna: “Sí é istalme i nalye haryaina lo rauco. Avraham qualle, yando i Erutercánor, mal elye quete: Qui aiquen himya quettanya, laume oi cenuvas qualme.

ENGLISH: Therefore that place has been named “Bloodfield” until this day.
QUENYA: Etta tana nóme anaie estaina “Serceresta” tenna aure sina.

ENGLISH: So also the Pharisees asked him how he received sight. He said to them: “He put a mud on my eyes and I washed self, and I can see.”
QUENYA: Sie yando i Farisar cenşer se manen camnes céne. Eques téna: “Panyanes luxo hendunyatse ar sóven immo, ar polin cene.”

ENGLISH: In the end also the woman died.
QUENYA: Mí metta yando i nís qualle.

ENGLISH: He measured also its wall, a hundred and forty-four cubits, by the measure of man, and also an angel’s.
QUENYA: Lestanes yú rambarya, perrangar canta canaquean ar tuxa, i lestanen atano, ar yú valo.

ENGLISH: People from Parthea ar Media and Elam, people that dwell in Mesopotamia, Judea and Capadocia, Pontus and Asia,
QUENYA: Queni ho Parşea ar Meria ar Elam, queni i marir mi Mesopotamia, Yúrea ar Capaprocia, Pontus ar Ásia,

QUENYA: Ar íre i vala lende minna epe se, quentes: “Hara máriesse, elye ye acámie Eruanna; i Héru aselye.”

ENGLISH: And yet all do not have this knowledge. But some, whose habit until now concerns the idol, eat food as a thing sacrificed to an idol, and their conscience, being weak, is being defiled.
QUENYA: Ananta illi uar same istya sina. Mal ennoli, ion haime tenna sí ape i cordon, matir matta ve nat yácina cordonen, and immotuntielta, nála milya, ná vahtaina.

ENGLISH: By this we know his love, because he gave his life for us, and is our debt to give our life for our brothers.
QUENYA: Sinen istalve melmerya, pan sé antane coivierya elven, ar ná rohtalva antie coivielva hánolvain.

ENGLISH: But the Lord's word grew and spread.
QUENYA: Mal i Heruo quetta alle ar vintane.

QUENYA: Mal íre i aposteli Varnavas yo Paulo hlasset pa ta, narcanette collattar ar campet mir i şanga, yámala

QUENYA: Apa sovie talultat ar mapie larmaryar encaines undu ara i sarno ar quente téna: “Ma istalde ya acárien len?

QUENYA: Ono Yésus, cénala si, náne rusca ar quente téna: “Lava i hínin tule ninna; áva neve pusta te, an taition Eruo aranie ná.

ENGLISH: And all the crowd were beside themselves with wonder, and they said: “Maybe this man is the Son of David!”
QUENYA: Ar ilye i şangar náner ara inte elmendanen, ar quentelte: “Cé nér sina ná i Lavirion!”

ENGLISH: Then he touched their eyes, saying: “May it happen to you as you believe!”
QUENYA: Tá appanes henduttat, quétala: “Nai martuva lent ve saviste!”

ENGLISH: They had some quarrels with him about their own worship of the deity, and about a person called Jesus, who is dead, but who Paul said is alive.
QUENYA: Sámelte costeli óse pa véra tyerielta i ainova, ar pa quén estaina Yésus, ye qualina ná, mal ye Paulo quente ná coirea.

QUENYA: Apa nati sine enge aşar Yúraron, ar Yésus lende amba Yerúsalemenna.

QUENYA: Ar Secaría quente i valanna: “Manen polin ista nat sina? An nanye yára, ar verinya same rimbe loali.”

QUENYA: Mal mi imya lú sámes i estel i camumnes telpe Paulollo. Etta se-tultanes ta ambe rimbave, ar carampes óse.

QUENYA: Ata Piláto yalle te, pan mernes lehta Yésus.

QUENYA: Eque senna Yésus: “Inye ye quéta aselye ná sé.”

ENGLISH: since God is one, who pronounces just the circumcised ones out of faith, and that are not circumcised, by faith.
QUENYA: pan Eru ná er, ye quete faile i oscirnar et saviello, ar i uar oscirne, saviénen.

QUENYA: Ar ata luhtala undu tences i talamesse.

QUENYA: Ente, úquen eménie amba menelenna hequa ye utúlie undu menello, i Atanyondo.

ENGLISH: What he says is true. Therefore rebuke them in a harsh manner, for them to have health in the faith,
QUENYA: Ya quetis nanwa ná. Etta áte naitya mi naraca lé, samieltan mále i saviesse,

QUENYA: Úne técina pa sé erinqua i ta náne nótina sen,

QUENYA: Mana, tá, qui cenuvalde i Atanyondo ortea yanna enges yá?

ENGLISH: Your chosen sister’s children greet you
QUENYA: Cílina néşalyo hínar suilar lye.

QUENYA: Mal ennoli i hildoron Yerúsalemello yú lender aselme, talien me i nerenna yeva coasse marumnelme: Mnason, ye náne i minye hildoron.

ENGLISH: For when we were in the flesh, the lusts of sin which were being strirred by the Law worked in our body-parts, causing us to bear fruit to death.

ENGLISH: that I am writing to you – look, before the eyes of God, I am not lying!
QUENYA: Yar técan len – yé, epe Eruo hendu, uan húra!

QUENYA: Etta quentelte i lomba nerenna ata: “Mana elye quete pa se, pan latyanes hendulyat?” I nér quente: “Náse Erutercáno.”

ENGLISH: If I had not done among them the deeds that nobody else has done, they did not have sin; but now they have seen and they have looked at both me and my Father.
QUENYA: Qui uan acárie mici te i cardar yar úquen hyana acárie, ualte sáme úcare; mal sí ecénielte ar eyétielte yúyo ní ar Atarinya.

ENGLISH: But the cultivators took his servants, and one they beat up, another they slew, on another they threw stones until he died.

QUENYA: I hére airimor ar i Farisar náner cánienwe i qui aiquen sinte yasse enges, nyarumnes, i polumnelte mapa se.

ENGLISH: Seeing the star gave them great joy.
QUENYA: Cenie i tinwe antane tien túra alasse.

QUENYA: Ar quentes téna: “Mena ar queta rusco tananna: Yé, et-hatin raucor ar carin nestie síra ar enwa, ar i neldea auresse nauvan telyaina.

ENGLISH: And one among them struck the chief priest's slave and cut off his right ear.
QUENYA: Ar quén mici te pente i héra airimo mól ar aucirne forya hlarya.

ENGLISH: may it be known to all among you and to the entire people of Israel that it happened by the name of Jesus Christ from Nazareth, whom you crucified but God raised out of dead. By him this man is standing here before you in health.
QUENYA: nai nauva sinwa illin mici le ar i quanda lien Israélo i sá martane i essenen Yésus Hristo Nasaretello, ye elde tarwestaner mal Eru ortane et qualinaillon. Issenen nér sina tára sisse epe le málesse.

ENGLISH: And bringing Peter and the two sons of Zebedee with himself, he began to have grief and to be troubled.

ENGLISH: to make known the Lord's year of good will.”

QUENYA: Mal Símon ar i náner óse cestaner se

ENGLISH: Therefore comfort one another with these words.

QUENYA: Ar sí, yé, inye ista in ualde cenuva cendelenya ata, elde illi imíca i vantanenye, carila sinwa i aranie.

QUENYA: Ar sie carnelte, mentala sa i amyárannar Varnavas ar Saulo mánen.

ENGLISH: Then, after he commanded the crowd that they were to lie down on the ground,
QUENYA: Tá, apa cannes i şangan i caitumnelte i talamesse,
