QUENYA: Ar yé! i quanda osto etelende velien Yésus, ar apa cenie se, hortaneltes auta ménaltallon.

ENGLISH: And we know that the Son of God has come, and he has given us understanding to know him who is true, and we are in who is true, by his Son Jesus Christ. He is the true God and eternal life.
QUENYA: Ar istalve i utúlie i Eruion, ar ánies ven hande istien sé ye şanda ná, ar ealve yesse şanda ná, Yondorya Yésus Hristonen. Sé ná i nanwa Aino ar oira coivie.

ENGLISH: When he has so been shamed by the majority , that is enough for such a man.
QUENYA: Íre sie anaies naityana lo i amarimbar, ta farya taite neren.

ENGLISH: as is written: "The person having much did not have too much, and the person having little did not have too little."
QUENYA: ve ná técina: "I quén arwa olyo ua sáme acca olya, ar i quén arwa pityo ua sáme acca pitya."

ENGLISH: And another he sent, and him they killed, and numerous others: Some they flayed and some they killed.
QUENYA: Ar exe mentanes, ar sé nacantelte, ar rimbe exeli: Queneli rípelte ar queneli nacantelte.

ENGLISH: and nobody was allowed to trade or sell except a person having the mark – the beast’s name or the number of its name.
QUENYA: ar úquen náne lávina manca hya vace hequa quén arwa i tehto – i hravano esse hya i nóte esseryo.

ENGLISH: For while I was going through the city, looking at the things that you worship, I found also an alter on which it was written: “To an unknown god.” Therefore, which you worship without knowing it, that I am making known to you.
QUENYA: An lan ménanen ter i osto, yétala i nati yar tyerilde, hirnen yú yangwa yasse náne técina: “Úsinwa ainon.” Etta, ya tyerilde pen istie sa, ta inye cára sinwa len.

ENGLISH: But was in the city a man called Simon, who beforehand did magic and startled the nation of Samaria, saying about himself that he was a great person.
QUENYA: Mal enge i ostosse nér estaina Símon, ye nóvo carne ñúle ar cápe Samário nóre, quétala pa inse i anes túra quén.

ENGLISH: For John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with Holy Spirit not many days from now.”
QUENYA: An Yoháno sumbane nennen, mal elde nauvar sumbane Aire Feanen lá rimbe auri ho sí.”

ENGLISH: Near to that place the most prominent man of the island, called Poplio , had some fields. He received us well and kindly allowed us to dwell in his house for three days.
QUENYA: Hare tana nómenna i tollo amminda nér, estaina Poplio, sáme restali. Camnes me mai ar nildave láve men mare coaryasse ter rí nelde.

ENGLISH: When evening came, the master of the garden said to his overseer: Call the workers and pay them their payment, from the last ones to the first ones!
QUENYA: Íre şinye túle, i tarwantur quente ortirnoryanna: Yala i molindor ar á paitya tien paityalelta, i métimallon i minyannar!

ENGLISH: And death and Mandos were thrown into the lake of fire. This is the second death: the lake of fire.
QUENYA: Ar ñuru ar Mandos náner hátine mir i ailin nárwa. Si i attea ñuru ná: i ailin nárwa.

ENGLISH: It is necessary that everyone heeds, not his own affairs, but also those of the other person.
QUENYA: Mauya in ilquen cime, lá vére nattoryar, mal yú tai i hyana queno.

ENGLISH: And from there the brothers, when they heard the news about us, came to see us as far as Forum Appii and the Three Taverns. Paul, seeing them, gave thanks to God and had courage.
QUENYA: Ar talo i hánor, íre hlasselte i sinyar pa me, túler me-velien tenna Forum Appii ar i Sendassi Nelde. Paulo, cénala te, antane hantale Erun ar sáme huore.

ENGLISH: And they were saying, one to the other: “Who will roll away the stone from the tomb for us?”
QUENYA: Ar quétanelte, quén i exenna: “Man peltuva oa i ondo i noirillo men?”

ENGLISH: And the maiden went out and said to her mother: “What am I to ask?” She said: “John the Baptist's head!”
QUENYA: Ar i vende lende ettenna ar quente amilleryanna: “Mana canuvan?” Eques: “Yoháno i Tumyando cas!”

ENGLISH: And that is not a wonder, for Satan himself changes himself into an angel of light.
QUENYA: Ar ta ua elmenda, an Sátan immo vistaxe mir vala calava.

ENGLISH: When Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the Leper,
QUENYA: Íre Yésus enge Vetaniasse, mi coarya Símon Helmahlaiwa,

ENGLISH: But when evening fell, his diciples came to him and said: “The place is lonely, and the hour is late even now; send the crowds away, for them to to into the villages to trade to themselves food!”
QUENYA: Mal íre şinye lantane, hildoryar túler senna ar quenter: “I nóme eressea ná, ar i lúme ná telwa yando sí; á menta i şangar oa, menieltan mir i mastor mancien inten matta!”

ENGLISH: Or the eighteen upon whom the tower in Siloam fell, killing them – do you suppose that they had a debt greater than which all others that live in Jerusalem have?
QUENYA: Hya i toloque innar i mindo Siloamesse lantane, nahtala te – ma intyalde i sámelte rohta túra lá ya ilye exi i marir Yerúsalemesse samir?

ENGLISH: But concerning some things I am writing to you in a manner very bold, as if to cause you to remember, by the grace given me from God.
QUENYA: Mal pa natali técan len mi lé ita canya, ve qui tyarien le ata enyale – i lissenen antana nin Erullo.

ENGLISH: You too, then, fill your fathers' measure!
QUENYA: Yando elde, tá, quata atarildaron lesta!

ENGLISH: By this we know that in him we remain, and he in us, because he has given us out of his spirit.
QUENYA: Sinen istalve i sesse lemyalve, ar sé vesse, pan ánies ven et faireryo.

ENGLISH: And on that day, when evening had come, he said to his disciples: “Let us cross to the other shore.”
QUENYA: Ar mi yana ré, íre şinye náne túlienwa, quentes hildoryannar: “Alve lahta i hyana hrestanna.”

ENGLISH: and among you the gospel that we brought was not only by words, but it came with power and Holy Spirit and made you fully certain about it, as you know how we behaved among you for your good.
QUENYA: an mici elde i evandilyon ya tallelme úne rie quettainen, mal túles túrenen ar Aire Feanen ar carne le aqua tulce pa sa, ve istalde manen lenganelme mici le márieldan.

ENGLISH: And it is necessary for the prophets to control their spirits.
QUENYA: Ar mauya i Erutercánoin ture faireltar.

ENGLISH: When the people of the nations heard that, they had joy and praised God's word, and all that were destined for eternal life believed.
QUENYA: Íre i queni i nórion hlasser ta, sámelte alasse ar laitaner Eruo quetta, ar illi i náner martyane oira coivien sáver.

ENGLISH: Do you not know that you are God's temple, and that God's spirit dwells in you?
QUENYA: Ma ualde ista i nalde corda Eruva, ar i Eruo faire mare lesse?

ENGLISH: But after not a long time a stormwind, that which is called Euroaquilo, came rushing from the island.
QUENYA: Mal apa lá anda lúme alaco, ta ya estaina Euroaquilo ná, túle rimpa i tollallo.

ENGLISH: He said to them: “But you, who do you say that I am?”
QUENYA: Quentes téna: “Mal elde, man quetilde i nanye?”

ENGLISH: But he walked through their midst and went away.
QUENYA: Mal sé menne ter endelta ar lende oa.

ENGLISH: In him we were also established as heirs, for us to be previously appointed by the purpose of who works everything by the choice of his will,
QUENYA: Sesse anelve yando tulcaine ve aryoni, návelvanen nóvo sátine i mehtenen yeo mole ilqua indómeryo cilmenen,

ENGLISH: For Moses writes concerning the righteousness that comes by the Law: “The man who has done it will live by it.”
QUENYA: An Móses tece pa i failie ye tule i Şanyenen: “I atan ye acárie sa coituva sánen.”

ENGLISH: God did some mighty deeds, beyond what was usual, by Paul's hands.
QUENYA: Eru carne taure cardali, han ya senwa né, Paulo mánten.

ENGLISH: Even now some are turned to follow Satan.
QUENYA: Yando sí queneli anaier quérine hilien Sátan.

ENGLISH: Thus the blessing which Abraham received was going to come to the nations by Jesus Christ, for us to receive by faith the spirit of which we have a promise.
QUENYA: Sie i aistie ya Avraham camne tulumne i nórennar Yésus Hristonen, camielvan saviénen i faire pa ya samilve vanda.

ENGLISH: For the bodies of the animals the blood of which is brought into the holy place by the chief priest, are burnt on the outside of the camp.
QUENYA: An i hroar i celvaron ion serce ná talaina mir i aire nóme lo i héra airimo, nar urtaine ettesse i estoliéno.

ENGLISH: while God judges that are on the outside? Send the evil person away out of your midst!
QUENYA: lan Eru name i ear i ettesse? Á menta i ulca quén oa et endeldallo!

ENGLISH: for about four hundred and fifty years. Thereafter he gave them judges, until Samuel the Prophet.
QUENYA: loain os lepenquean ar tuxar canta. Epeta antanes tien námoli, tenna Sámuel i Erutercáno.

ENGLISH: Now when Jesus finished all these words, the crowds were in wonder at his teaching,
QUENYA: Sí íre Yésus telyane ilye quettar sine, i şángar náner elmendasse peantieryanen,

ENGLISH: But Peter said: “Behold, we have abandoned our own things and have followed you.”
QUENYA: Mal eque Péter: “Yé, ehehtielme vére natilmar ar ihílier lye.”

ENGLISH: Every one of the four living creatures had six wings, and each living creature is full of eyes around his entire body and inside . Rest they do not have, at day and and night saying: “Holy, holy, holy is the Lord God Almighty, who is and who was and who shall come!”
QUENYA: Ilya quén i coition canta same rámar enque, ar ilya coite ná quanta hendion os quanda hroarya ar mityave. Sére ualte same, auresse yo lómisse quétala: “Aire, aire, aire ná i Héru Eru Iluvala, ye ea ar ye enge ar ye tuluva!”

ENGLISH: If I do not do my Father’s deeds, do not believe what I say .
QUENYA: Qui uan care Atarinyo cardar, áva save quetienyar.

ENGLISH: and you are to love the Lord your God with your whole heart and your whole soul and your whole mind and your whole might.
QUENYA: ar alye mele i Héru Ainolya quanda endalyanen ar quanda fealyanen ar quanda sámalyanen ar quanda melehtelyanen.

ENGLISH: But you, beloved ones, remember the saying spoken beforehand by the apostles of Jesus Christ our lord,
QUENYA: Mal elde, a meldar, enyala i quetier quétine nóvo lo Yésus Hristo Herulvo aposteli,

ENGLISH: Always we suffer in our body the killing of Jesus, that also Jesus' life will be shown in our body.
QUENYA: Illume perperilme hroalmasse i nahtie Yésuva, i yando Yésuo coivie nauva tanaina hroalmasse.

ENGLISH: then he says: "Behold, I have come to do your will." He takes away the first to establish the second.
QUENYA: tá quetis: "Yé, utúlien carien indómelya." Mapas oa i minya tulcien i attea.

ENGLISH: which existed from the beginning, which we heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have beheld and our hands have felt concerning the word of life
QUENYA: Ya enge i yestallo, ya hlasselme, ya ecénielme hendulmanten, ya eyétielme ar málmat paltanet pa i quetta coiviéno

ENGLISH: Paul – apostle of Jesus Christ by God's will, by the promise about the life which is in Jesus Christ –
QUENYA: Paulo – Yesus Hristo apostel Eruo indómenen, i vandanen pa i coivie ya ea Hristo Yésusse –

ENGLISH: May your manner of life be without love of money, while you think about the things that exist now, as sufficient for you. For he has said: "I shall by no means leave you and by no means pass away from you."
QUENYA: Nai lélda coiviéno nauva ú melmeo telpeva, íre sanalde pa i nati yar ear sí ve fárie len. An equéties: "Laume hehtuvanyes ar laume autuvan lyello."

ENGLISH: Then they tried to seize him, but nobody laid his hand on him, for his time still had not come.
QUENYA: Tá névelte mapa se, mal úquen panyane márya sesse, an lúmerya en úme túlienwa.

ENGLISH: and said: For this reason a man will abandon his father and his mother and will stick to his wife, and they will be one flesh – ?
QUENYA: ar quente: Sina castanen nér autuva ataryallo ar amilleryallo ar himyuva verirya, ar nauvatte hráve er – ?

ENGLISH: Pursue love, and yet with a burning spirit seek the gifts of the spirit , above all that you will be able to speak like prophets.
QUENYA: Á roita melme, ananta uryala şúlenen á cesta i annar i faireo, or ilqua i poluvalde quete ve Erutercánor.

ENGLISH: But the matter of the crime is not like the matter of the gift. For though numerous ones died by one person's crime, the grace of God and the gift by the grace of one person – Jesus Christ – were much more abundant to numerous ones.
QUENYA: Mal natto i ongweo ua ve natto i anno. An ómu rimbali qualler er queno ongwenen, i lisse Eruo ar i anna i lissenen er queno – Yésus Hristo – náner ita ambe úvie rimbalin.

ENGLISH: and everyone who drinks of milk is not skilled about the word of righteousness, for he is a child.
QUENYA: an ilquen ye suce ilimo ua maite pa i quetta failiéva, an náse hína.

ENGLISH: When they did so, they enclosed a great multitude of fishes, and their nets were torn.
QUENYA: Íre carnelte sie, yórelte hoa rimbe lingwilíva, ar rembeltar náner narcaine.

ENGLISH: Also Joseph went up from Galilee, out of the city Nazareth, into Judea, to David’s city, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of David’s house and family,
QUENYA: Yando Yósef lende ama Alileallo, et i ostollo Nasaret, mir Yúrea, Laviro ostonna, ya ná estaina Vet-Lehem, pan anes maro ar nosseo Laviro,

ENGLISH: On their way down from the mountain, Jesus commanded them, saying: “Do not tell anyone about the sigth before the Son of man has been raised from the dead!”
QUENYA: Tieltasse undu i orontello, Yésus canne tien, quétala: “Áva nyare aiquenen pa i cenie nó i Atanyondo anaie ortana qualinillon!”

ENGLISH: “What do you want that I am to do for you?” He said: “Lord, allow me to receive sight!”
QUENYA: “Mana meril i caruvan lyen?” Eques: “Heru, ánin lave came céne!”

ENGLISH: His appearance was like lightening , and his garments were snow-white.
QUENYA: Ilcerya náne ve íta, ar larmaryar náner lossie.

ENGLISH: Therefore, we that are ready, let us have this matter in mind, and if you have another thing in your thoughts, God will reveal to you also this matter.
QUENYA: Etta, elve i nar manwe, alve same natto sina sámasse; ar qui samilde hyana nat sanweldassen, Eru apantuva len yando natto sina.

ENGLISH: On the first day of the week Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early, when was still dark, and she saw that the rock was taken away from the tomb.
QUENYA: I minya auresse i otsolo María Mahtaléne túle i noirinna arinyave, íre en enge mornie, ar cennes i náne i ondo mapaina oa i noirillo.

ENGLISH: Therefore Festus, when he received the power over the region , after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea,
QUENYA: Etta Festo, íre camnes i túre or i ména, apa rí nelde lende ama Yerúsalemenna Césareallo,

ENGLISH: Also with you, who were at a time strangers and of a hostile mind by your wicked deeds,
QUENYA: Yando as elde, i náner mi lú ettelear ar cotya sámo olce cardaldainen,

ENGLISH: And he took the children into his arms and blessed them, putting his hands on them.
QUENYA: Ar nampes i hini mir rancuryat ar aistane te, panyala máryat tesse.

ENGLISH: If that is possible, keep peace with all men, whenever that is possible for you.
QUENYA: Qui ta cárima ná, hepa raine as ilye atani, quiquie ta ece len.

ENGLISH: And the twelve that he chose were Simon, to whom he gave the after-name Peter,
QUENYA: Ar i yunque i cilles náner Símon, yen antanes i epesse Péter,

ENGLISH: If a brother or a sister is naked and lacks bread for the day,
QUENYA: Qui háno hya néºa ná helda ar pene matso i auren,

ENGLISH: And he brought them with him in that hour and washed their stripes, and he and all that were with him were baptized without waiting.
QUENYA: Ar talleset óse yana lúmesse ar sóve rimpeltar, ar isse ar illi i enger óse náner sumbane pen hopie.

ENGLISH: No, what did you go forth to see? A man having soft clothes? Behold, those that have soft clothes are in the houses of kings!
QUENYA: Lá, mana etelendelde cenien? Nér arwa mussi lannaron? Yé, i arwar mussi lannaron ear coassen araniva!

ENGLISH: Judas, not Iscariot, said to him: “Lord, what has happened, since you will reveal self to us and not to the world?”
QUENYA: Yúras, lá Iscáriot, quente senna: “Heru, mana amartie, pan apantuval immo men ar lá i marden?”

ENGLISH: For my flesh is real food, and my blood is a real drink.
QUENYA: An ninya hráve ná nanwa matso, ar ninya serce ná nanwa yulda.

ENGLISH: And people will say to you: 'See there!' or 'See here!' Do not go there and do not run behind them.
QUENYA: Ar queni quetuvar lenna: 'Cena tasse!', hya: 'Cena sisse!' Áva lelya tar ar áva nore ca te.

ENGLISH: Then the Devil went away from him, and behold! angels came and served him.
QUENYA: Tá i Arauco oante sello, ar yé! valali túler ar veuyaner se.

ENGLISH: May every bitterness and wrath and anger and outcry and blasphemy be taken away from you, with every evil.
QUENYA: Nai ilya sárie ar rúşe ar orme ar yamie ar naiquetie nauvar mapaine oa lello, as ilya ulco.

ENGLISH: But the part of the scripture that he read was this: “Like a sheep he was being brought to the slaughter, and like a lamb that is voiceless before ho cuts off its wool, he did not open his mouth.
QUENYA: Mal i ranta i tehteleo ya hentanes náne si: “Ve máma anes talaina i nahtienna, ar ve eule ye ómalóra ná epe ye hocire tórya, uas pantane antorya.

ENGLISH: “The scribes and the Pharisees are sitting on the chair of Moses.
QUENYA: “I parmangolmor ar Farisar hárar Móseo hammasse.

ENGLISH: The truth I am telling in Christ – I am not lying, since my conscience is my witness with me, in the Holy Spirit –
QUENYA: I nanwie nyáran i Hristosse – uan húra, pan immotuntienya astarmonya ná asinye, i Aire Feasse –

ENGLISH: And they said: “Is this man not Jesus son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How may he say: I have come down from heaven – ?”
QUENYA: Ar quentelte: “Ma nér sina ua Yésus Yosefion, yeo atar ar amil istalve? Manen lertas quete: Utúlien undu menello – ?”

ENGLISH: In my letter I wrote to you: Do not remain among fornicators.
QUENYA: Mi tecettanya tencen lenna: Áva lemya mici hrupuhtor.

ENGLISH: For he has set a day in which he will judge earth in righteousness by a man that he has chosen, and he has given to all men security by raising him out of dead.”
QUENYA: An asáties ré yasse namuvas cemen failiesse nernen ye icílies, ar ánies ilye atanin varnasse ortavénen se et qualinallon.”

ENGLISH: “With whom, then, shall I compare this generation?
QUENYA: “As man, tá, sestuvan nónare sina?

ENGLISH: All these evils come from inside and soil a person.”
QUENYA: Ilye ulqui sine tulir mityallo ar vahtar quén.”

ENGLISH: Are you filled even now? Are you rich even now? Have you become kings without us? I wish that you did indeed become kings, for us to rule with you!
QUENYA: Ma nalde quátine yando sí? Ma nalde lárie yando sí? Ma olólielde arani pen elme? Merin i é ollelde arani, turielman aselde!

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “But you, who do you say that I am?” In answer Peter said: “God's Christ!”
QUENYA: Tá quentes téna: “Mal elde, man quetilde i nanye?” Hanquentasse eque Peter: “Eruo Hristo!”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “Come, have breakfast!” No one of the disciples dared to ask him: “Who are you?”, since they knew that he was the Lord.
QUENYA: Eque téna Yésus: “Tula, sama arinwat!” Úquen i hildoron veryane maquete senna: “Man elye?”, pan sintelte i anes i Heru.

ENGLISH: Then he began to say to them: “Today this scripture has been made true while you heard it.”
QUENYA: Tá yestanes quete téna: “Síra tehtele sina anaie carna nanwa íre hlasseldes.”

ENGLISH: in order to cause the Christ to dwell in your heart by your faith, in love having a root and a foundation,
QUENYA: tyarien i Hristo mare indoldasse savieldanen, melmesse arwe şunduo ar talmo,

ENGLISH: For everything is for your good, and so the grace, reaching to people ever more numerous, will bring more thanksgiving, to the glory of God.
QUENYA: An ilqua ná márieldan, ar sie i Erulisse, rahtala queninnar oi ambe rimbe, taluva amba hantalenna, Eruo alcaren.

ENGLISH: May you have grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: Nai samuvalde lisse ar raine ho Eru Atarelva yo i Heru Yésus Hristo.

ENGLISH: For this ministry is not done solely to fill the needs of the holy ones, but it also causes an abundance of thanksgiving to God.
QUENYA: An núromolie sina ua carna eryave quatien i airion mauri, mal tyaris yando úve hantaléva Erun.

ENGLISH: Then they understood that he said to them that they were to watch out, not concerning the leaven of breads, but concerning the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
QUENYA: Tá hanyanelte i quentes téna i ettirumnelte, lá pa i pulmaxe massaron, mal pa i peantie Farisaron ar Sandúcearon.

ENGLISH: He said to them: “What number of breads to you have? Go and see!” After inquiring they said: “Five, and also two fishes.”
QUENYA: Quentes téna: “Mana nóte massaron samilde? Mena ar cena!” Apa ceşie quentelte: “Lempe, ar yando hala atta.”

ENGLISH: With him I send Onesimus, my steadfast and beloved brother, who is from among you. All the matters here they will make known to you.
QUENYA: Óse mentan Onesimo, voronda ar melda hánonya, ye mici lello ná. Ilye i nattor sisse caruvatte sinwe len.

ENGLISH: Pilate said to him: “What is truth?” After saying this he went out again to the Jews and said to them: “I do not find guilt in him.
QUENYA: Eque senna Piláto: “Mana nanwie?” Apa quetie si etemennes ata i Yúrannar ar quente téna: “Uan hire cáma sesse.

ENGLISH: Therefore the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and the other who were crucified with him.
QUENYA: Etta i ohtari túler ar rancer i telcu i minyo ar i exeo yet nánet tarwestaine óse.

ENGLISH: Then he went out from the land of the Chaldeans and dwelt in Haran. And from there, after his father died, God caused him to move to this land in which you now dwell.
QUENYA: Tá lendes et i nórello Caldeaiva ar marne mi Ħáran. Ar talo, apa atarya qualle, Eru tyarne se leve nóre sinanna yasse elde sí marir.

ENGLISH: Now evening was come, and the boat was in the middle of the sea, but he was alone on land.
QUENYA: Sí şinye náne túlienwa, ar i lunte náne i earo endesse, mal sé náne erinqua i noresse.

ENGLISH: But while they sailed he slept. Now a storm fell upon the lake, and their boat was filled, and they were in danger.
QUENYA: Mal íre cirnelte humnes. Sí raumo lantane i ailinna, ar luntelta náne quátina, ar anelte raxesse.

ENGLISH: But the angel said to him: “Do not fear, Zechariah, for your petition has been heard, and Elizabeth your wife will be mother to a son to you, and you are to give him the name John.
QUENYA: Mal i vala quente senna: “Áva ruce, Secaría, an arcandelya anaie hlárina, ar Elísavet verilya nauva amil yondon lyen, ar alye anta sen i esse Yoháno.

ENGLISH: And he was in wonder about their lack of faith. Then he went from place to place in a circle to the villages, teaching.
QUENYA: Ar anes elmendasse pa penielta saviéva. Tá lendes nómello nómenna rindesse i mastonnar, peantala.

ENGLISH: In answer he said to him: 'Lord, allow it do stand also this year, and I will dig around it and will place muck there.
QUENYA: Hanquentasse quentes senna: 'Heru, ásen lave tare yando loa sinasse, ar sapuvan os se ar panyuva múco tasse.

ENGLISH: This is the rock which was counted as nothing by you that built, which has been made the head of the corner.
QUENYA: Si ná i ondo ya náne nótina ve munta lo elde i carastaner, ya olólie i vinco cas.

ENGLISH: The good fight I have fought, I have run the race to the end, I have kept the faith.
QUENYA: I mára mahtie amahtien, onórien i norie i mettanna, ehépien i savie.

ENGLISH: The man answered: “And who is he, lord, that I can believe in him?”
QUENYA: I nér hanquente: “Ar man náse, heru, i polin save sesse?”

ENGLISH: Concerning him we have many things to say – and making you understand them is difficult, since your hearing has been made slow.
QUENYA: Pa sé samilme rimbe nati quetien – ar tyarie le hanya tai ná urda, pan hlarielda anaie carna lenca.

ENGLISH: Thus every good tree bears good fruit, but every rotten tree produces foul fruit.
QUENYA: Sie ilya mára alda cole mára yáve, mal ilya quelexima alda care şaura yáve.

ENGLISH: is for us a single God, the Father from whom all things are, and is a single Lord, Jesus Christ by whom all things are, an we by him.

ENGLISH: He went away from Nazareth and came and dwelt in Capernaum beside sea, in Zebulon's and Naphtali's regions,
QUENYA: Oantes Násaretello ar túle ar marne Capernaumesse ara ear, Sevulondo ar Naftalio ménassen,

ENGLISH: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and righteous to forgive us our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
QUENYA: Qui etequentalve úcarelvar, náse voronda ar faila apsenien ven úcarelvar ar vi-sovien ilya úfailiello.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to her: “Did I not say to you that if you believe, you will see God’s glory?”
QUENYA: Eque senna Yésus: “Ma uan quente lyenna i qui savil, cenuval Eruo alcar?”

ENGLISH: For I gave over to you, among the first things, that which I also received, that Christ died for our sins as the Scripture says,
QUENYA: An antanen olla len, mici i minye nati, ta ya yú camnen, i Hristo qualle úcarilvain ve i Tehtele quete,

ENGLISH: And God's word grew, and the number of the disciples rose quickly in Jerusalem, and a huge crowd of priests subjected themseves the faith.
QUENYA: Ar Eruo quetta alle, ar i hildoron nóte oronte lintave Yerúsalemesse, ar hoa şanga airomolíva panyaner inte nu i savie.

ENGLISH: And I saw standing in midst of the throne and the four living creatures, and in midst of the elders, a lamb that had the appearance of being slain , having seven horns and seven eyes, which are God’s seven spirits, the ones sent into the entire earth.
QUENYA: Ar cennen tárala endesse i mahalmo ar i coition canta, ar endesse i amyáraron, eule ye sáme i ilce náveo nanca, arwa rassion otso ar hendion otso, yar nar Eruo fairi otso, i mentanar mir i quanda cemen.

ENGLISH: is not Jew or Greek, is not thrall or free person, is not man or woman; for you are all one, in Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: Ua ea Yúra hya Hellenya, ua ea mól hya léra quén, ua ea nér hya nís; an nalde illi er, Hristo Yésusse.

ENGLISH: when men shall be sick with fear, foreseeing the things coming upon world. For the powers of heaven will be shaken.
QUENYA: íre atani nauvar hlaiwe caurenen, apacénala i nati túlala ambarenna. An menelo túri nauvar páline.

ENGLISH: Luke, the beloved physician, greets you, as does Demas.
QUENYA: Lúcas, i melda nestando, suila le, ve care Lémas.

ENGLISH: Behold how profound are God's riches and wisdom and knowledge are! How unsearchable his judgements, and how impossible to find his paths!
QUENYA: Yé manen tumne Eruo lar ar sailie ar istya nar! Manen alacestime namieryar, ar manen alahírime tieryar!

ENGLISH: again he indicates a day, by saying after a long time in David's song: "Today" – as he said formerly – "Today, if you hear his voice, do not make your heart hard!"
QUENYA: ata teas aure, quetiénen apa anda lúme Laviro lírisse: "Síra" – ve quentes yá – "Sira, qui hlarilde ómarya, áva care endalda hranga!"

ENGLISH: And he went down with them and came to Nazareth, and he heeded their commands. And his mother kept all these things in her heart.
QUENYA: Ar lendes undu asette ar túle Nasaretenna, ar cimnes canwattar. Ar amillerya hempe ilye nati sine endaryasse.

ENGLISH: And that hallows and that are hallowed all come from One, and for this reason he is not ashamed about calling them brothers,
QUENYA: An ye airita ar i nar airinte illi tulir ho Er, ar sina castanen uas naityana pa estie te hánor,

ENGLISH: Furthermore, they struck him on his head with a reed and spat at him and went down on their knees and fell down before him.
QUENYA: Ente, penteltes caryasse liscenen ar piutaner senna ar lender undu occaltatse ar lantaner undu epe se.

ENGLISH: Now we see as if in a mirror, obscurely, but then we shall see from face to face. Now I know in part, but then I shall know fully, as I am also known.
QUENYA: Sí cenilve ve mi cilintilla, nullave, mal tá cenuvalve cendelello cendelenna. Sí istan mi ranta, mal tá istuvan aqua, ve nanye yú sinwa.

ENGLISH: He asked him many questions, but he answered him nothing.
QUENYA: Maquentes senna rimbe maquetier, ono sé hanquente sen munta.

ENGLISH: But I, though I am away in the body, but with you in the spirit, have judged even now – as if I were there – the man that has behaved so:
QUENYA: Ono inye, ómu nanye oa i hroasse, mal aselde i fairesse, anámie yando sí – ve au anen tasse – i nér ye elengie sie:

ENGLISH: By faith he left Egypt, but without fearing the king, and he was faithful as if he saw the Invisible One.
QUENYA: Saviénen oantes Mirrandorello, mal ú ruciéno i aranello, and an anes voronda ve qui cennes i Alacénima.

ENGLISH: But Jesus answered them, saying: “The hour has come when the Son of Man will be glorified.
QUENYA: Mal Yésus hanquente túna, quétala: “I lúme utúlie yasse i Atanyondo nauva alcaryaina.

ENGLISH: “What is to us and to you, Jesus from Nazareth? Have you come to undo us? I know who you are – God's Holy One!”
QUENYA: “Mana men ar lyen, Yésus Nasaretello? Ma utúliel nancarien me? Istan man nalye – Eruo Aire!”

ENGLISH: But if there is a widow with whom there are children or children's children, let them first learn to behave with godly reverence in their own house and give a proper recompensation to their parents , for that is good in God's eyes.
QUENYA: Mal qui ea verulóra as ye ear hínali hya hínali hínaron, lava tien minyave pare lenga ainocimiénen véra coaltasse ar anta vanima nampaityale nostarultant, an ta ná mára Eruo hendusse.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he did not come to sacrifice himself frequently, like the chief priest goes into the sanctuary from year to year, bringing blood which is not is own.
QUENYA: Ente, uas túle yacien inse rimbave, ve i héra airimo mene mir i ainas loallo loanna, túlula serce ya ua vérarya.

ENGLISH: And I saw a thing like a lake of glass, in a blend with fire, and who had conquered the beast and its image and the number of its name stood next to the lake of glass, having harps of God.
QUENYA: Ar cennen nat ve ailin calcava, ostimesse as náre, ar i turunelyaner i hravan ar emmarya ar esseryo nóte tarner ara i ailin calcava, arwe ñandélion Eruva.

ENGLISH: But you know how he showed his steadfastness – that like a child with father he laboured with me for the gospel.
QUENYA: Mal istalde manen tannes voronwerya – i ve hína as atar móles óni i evandilyonen.

ENGLISH: From there we went aroud the coast and came to Rhegium, and after one day was a wind from the south, and we arrived in Puteoli on the second day.
QUENYA: Talo lendelme os i falasse ar túler Rehiumenna, ar apa er ré enge súre hyarmello, ar tennelme Puteolisse mí attea ré.

ENGLISH: After going a short walk forward, he fell upon his face, praying and saying: “My Father, if that is possible, may this cup pass away from me! And yet, not as I wish, but as you wish!”
QUENYA: Apa menie şinta vanta ompa, lantanes cendeleryanna, hyámala ar quétala: “Atarinya, qui ta ná cárima, nai yulma sina autuva nillo! Ananta, lá ve inye mere, mal ve tyé mere!”

ENGLISH: But you do not allow them to induce you into doing that, for more than forty men among them are lying hidden waiting for him, and they have bound themselves with an oath that they will not eat or drink before they have killed him, and now they are ready, waiting for your assent.”
QUENYA: Mal elye áva lave tien şahta lye mir carie ta, an ambe lá canaquean neri mici te cáyar nurtane hópala se, ar unútielte inte vandanen in ualte matuva hya sucuva nó anahtieltes, ar sí nalte manwe, hópala şáquetielyan.”

ENGLISH: And was a woman called Anna, daughter of Fanuel of the tribe of Asher, who was a prophet. She was old and had many years, after she dwelt with a man for seven years after her virginhood,
QUENYA: Ar enge nís estaina Anna, yelderya Fanuel nosseo Ahyero, ye náne Erutercáne. Anes yára ar sáme rimbe loali, apa marnes as nér ter loar otso apa venesserya,

ENGLISH: You do well if indeed you behave by the royal law, as the Scriptures say: "Love your neighbor as yourself."
QUENYA: Carilde mai qui é lengalde i arna ºanyenen, ve i Tehtele quete: "Mela armarolya ve imle."

ENGLISH: Pilate said to them: “You have guards. Go and make it as safe as you know!”
QUENYA: Piláto quente téna: “Samilde cundor. Mena ar ása care ve varna ve istalde!”

ENGLISH: After they received such command, he threw them into the inmost gaol and fastened the their feet to the block .
QUENYA: Apa camnelte taite canwa, hanteset mir i ammitya mando ar tance taluttat i panonna.

ENGLISH: For this reason I say to you: Her numerous sins are forgiven her, for she loved much; but to whom a little is forgiven, loves little.”
QUENYA: Sina castanen quetin lyenna: Rímbe úcareryar nar apsénine sen, an méles ole; mal yen pitya ná apsénina, mele pityave.”

ENGLISH: Anyone who confesses that Jesus Christ is the Son of God, in him God remains, and he in God.
QUENYA: Aiquen ye etequenta i Yésus Hristo i Eruion ná, sesse Eru lemya, ar sé Erusse.

ENGLISH: Day after day I was with you in the temple, and you did not put your hands on me. But this is your hour, and darkness rules.”
QUENYA: Aure apa aure engen aselde i cordasse, ar ualde panyane máldat nisse. Mal si ná lenya lúme, ar mornie ture.”

ENGLISH: Therefore some of the crowd that heard these words said: “This person is indeed the Prophet.”
QUENYA: Etta quelli i şango i hlasser quettar sine quenter: “Quén sina é ná i Erutercáno.”

ENGLISH: You did not ever see him, and yet you love him. You do not look at him now, and yet you believe in him and have a joy glorious beyond words,
QUENYA: Ualde oi cenne se, ananta melildes. Ualde yéta se sí, ananta savilde sesse ar samir alasse alcarinqua han quettar,

ENGLISH: For if Abraham was made just by deeds, he would have been able to praise himself, but not before God.
QUENYA: An au Avraham náne carna faila cardainen, lertiévanes laita inse, mal lá epe Eru.

ENGLISH: and you will be hated by all because of my name.
QUENYA: ar nauvalde tévine lo illi essenyanen.

ENGLISH: They said to him: “In Bethlehem of Judea, for so is written by the prophet:
QUENYA: Quentelte senna: “Vet-Lehemesse Yúreo, an sie ná técina lo i Erutercáno:

ENGLISH: For a prophecy was not ever brought by man's will, but some men spoke from God, being carried by Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: An apacen úne oi tulúna atano nirmenen, mal atalli caramper Erullo, nála cóline Aire Feanen.

ENGLISH: Yes, brother: may I have gain from you in the Lord. You renew my warm feelings in Christ.
QUENYA: Ná, háno: nai inye samuva ñetie lyello i Herusse! Alye envinyata lauce felmenyar Hristosse.

ENGLISH: Finally, brothers, we ask of you and encourage you by the Lord Jesus: As you received from us the knowledge about how it is necessary for you to behave and to please God, so you indeed behave, but do it more fully.
QUENYA: Teldave, hánor, arcalme lello ar hortar le i Heru Yésunen: Tambe camnelde mello i istya pa manen mauya len lenga ar fasta Eru, síve é lengalde, mal cara sa ambe aqua.

ENGLISH: Therefore great fear came upon the entire congregation and upon all that heard about these things.
QUENYA: Etta túra rucie túle or i quanda ocombe ar or illi i hlasser pa nati sine.

ENGLISH: For I do not wish that you, brothers, are to lack knowledge about this secret, to stop you from being wise in your own eyes: is a part of Israel whose perceptions have become blunt until the full time when the fullness of the nations shall come in.
QUENYA: An uan mere in elde, hánor, penuvar istya pa fóle sina, pustien le návello saile mi vére henduldat: Ea ranta Israélo ion tuntier olólier ilaice tenna utúlie i quanta lúme yasse i nórion quantie tuluva minna.

ENGLISH: Philip said to him: “Lord, show us the Father, and that is enough for us.”
QUENYA: Eque senna Filip: “Heru, ámen tana i Atar, ar ta farya men.”

ENGLISH: By faith Rahab the harlot did not die with that were not obedient, since she received hte spies in peace.
QUENYA: Saviénen Ráhav i imbacinde ua qualle as i uar canwacimye, pan camnes i larmor rainesse.

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus did not more walk openly among Jews, but he went away from there to the land near to the desert, to a city called Ephraim, and there he remained with his disciples.
QUENYA: Etta Yésus ua ambe vantane pantie mici Yúrar, mal oantes talo i nórenna hare i erumenna, ostonna estaina Efraim, ar tasse lemyanes as hildoryar.

ENGLISH: Do not be quickly shaken from your wits or stirred, by a spirit's revelation or by a word or by a letter said to come from us, saying that the Lord's day has come.
QUENYA: Áva na lintiénen páline handeldallo hya valtaine, faireo apantiénen hya quettanen hya tecettanen quétina tule mello, quétala in i Heruo aure utúlie.

ENGLISH: But when they turn to the Lord, the veil is taken away.
QUENYA: Mal íre querilte inte i Herunna, i vaşar ná mapaina oa.

ENGLISH: And he went from city to city and from village to village, teaching while he was travelling to Jerusalem.
QUENYA: Ar lendes ostollo ostonna ar mastollo mastonna, peantala íre lelendes Yerúsalemenna.

ENGLISH: And though now you did well if you were teachers, for you it is necessary that someone teaches you again the first things of God's word. You have need of milk, not of firm food,
QUENYA: An ómu sí carnelde arya qui anelde peantalli, elden mauya i quén peanta len ata i minye nati Eruo quetto. Samilde maure ilinwa, lá ronda matsova,

ENGLISH: And they threw stones at Stephen while he was praying and saying: “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”
QUENYA: Ar hantelte sarneli Stefánonna lan hyamanes ar quétane: “Heru Yésus, cama fairenya!”

ENGLISH: In the end they went to him and woke him up, saying: “Teacher, teacher, we are dying!” But after rising he rebuked the wind and the violence of the water, and they were made at rest, and was a silence.
QUENYA: I mettasse lendelte senna ar eccoitaner se, quétala: “Peantar, peantar, quálalme!” Mal apa ortie naityanes i şúre ar i neno orme, ar anelte cárine sende, ar enge quilde.

ENGLISH: For the Law was given through Moses, but the grace and the truth came through Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: An i Şanye náne antaina ter Móses, mal i lisse ar i nanwie túler ter Yésus Hristo.

ENGLISH: For to me life is Christ, and dying, to receive more.
QUENYA: An inyen coivie ná Hristo, ar qualie, came amba.

ENGLISH: Therefore we praise ourselves concerning you among God's congregations, by reason of your steadfastness and your faith in all your persecutions and the tribulations that you bear,
QUENYA: Etta elme laitar imme pa lé mici Eruo ocombi, castanen voronwieldo ar savieldo mi ilye roitieldar ar i şangier yar cólalde,

ENGLISH: “Do not fear, daughter of Zion! Look! Your king is coming, sitting on the colt of an ass.”
QUENYA: “Áva ruce, Síoniel! Yé! Aranelya túla, hámala pellopeo onnasse.”

ENGLISH: But they said to him: 'Lord, he has ten minas!'
QUENYA: Mal quentelte senna: 'Heru, samis minar quean!'

ENGLISH: But behold, one among that were with Jesus reached out with his hand and drew his sword and struck the chief priest's thrall and cut off his ear.
QUENYA: Mal yé, quén mici i náner as Yésus rahtane máryanen ar tunce macilya ar pente i héra airimo mól ar aucirne hlarya.

ENGLISH: but he returned and sat in his cart reading Isaiah the prophet.
QUENYA: mal nanwennes ar hamne norolleryasse hentala Isaia i Erutercáno.

ENGLISH: by whom we have our ransom, the forgiveness of our sins.
QUENYA: yenen samilve nanwerelva, i apsenie úcarelvaiva.

ENGLISH: And how so? Since I do not love you? God knows that I do!
QUENYA: Ar manen sie? Pan uan mele le? Eru ista i carin!

ENGLISH: If, then, a person who is not circumcised keeps the Law's just commandments, will his lack of circumcision not be counted as circumcision?
QUENYA: Qui, tá, quén ye ua oscirna hepe i Şanyeo faile axani, ma penierya osciriéva ua nauva nótina ve oscirie?

ENGLISH: Therefore the crowd that stood there and heard it said that it was thunder. Others said: “An angel has spoken to him.”
QUENYA: Etta i şanga ya tarne tasse ar sa-hlasse quente i anes hundie. Exeli quenter: “Vala acarpie senna.”

ENGLISH: If I bear witness about self, my witness is not true.
QUENYA: Qui inye vetta pa immo, vettienya ui nanwa.

ENGLISH: And yet I ask: Have they indeed not heard? Indeed “into all the earth their sound went forth, and their sayings to the ends of the world.”
QUENYA: Ananta maquetin: Ma é ualte ahlárie? É “mir i quanda cemen lammalta etelende, ar quetieltar mettannar ambaro.”

ENGLISH: who believes in him shall not be judged. who does not believe has been judged even now, since he has not believed in the name of the only-born Son of God.
QUENYA: Ye save sesse lá nauva námina. Ye ua save anaie námina yando sí, pan uas asávie mí esse i ernóna Eruiono.

ENGLISH: Jesus and his disciples now went away to the villages in Caesarea Philippi, and on the road he asked his disciples, saying to them: “Who do people say that I am?”
QUENYA: Yésus ar hildoryar sí oanter i mastonnar mi Caisarea-Filippi, ar i mallesse maquentes hildoryannar, quétala téna: “Man queni quetir i nanye?”

ENGLISH: May I not do what I want to my own things? Or is your eye wicked since I am good? Thus the last ones will be first, and the first ones last!”
QUENYA: Ma uan lerta care ya merin vére natinyain? Hya ma hendelya olca ná pan inye mane ná? Sie i métimar nauvar minye, ar i minyar métime!”

ENGLISH: Now, before he went up to Jerusalem, Jesus led the twelve disciples to a private place and said to them:
QUENYA: Sí, nó lendes ama Yerúsalemenna, Yésus tulyane i hildor yunque véra nómenna ar quente téna:

ENGLISH: Thus is also written: “The first man, Adam, became a living creature.” The last Adam became a spirit giving life.
QUENYA: Sie yú ná técina: “I minya nér, Atan, olle coirea onna.” I métima Atan olle faire antala coivie.

ENGLISH: or depth or every other created thing – will be able to take us away from God's love which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.
QUENYA: hya tumnie hya ilya hyana ontana nat – poluva vi-mapa oa Eruo melmello ya ea mi Hristo Yésus Herulva.

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Therefore every scribe, instructed about the kingdom of heaven, is like a man, a householder, who brings out from his treasure things new and old!”
QUENYA: Tá quentes téna: “Etta ilya parmangolmo, peantana pa menelo aranie, ná ve nér, coantur, ye tala et harmaryallo vinyali ar yárali!”

ENGLISH: But turn yourself away from empty and unholy sayings, for they lead into ever deeper godlessness,
QUENYA: Mal quera imle oa cumne ar úairi quetiellon, an tulyuvalte mir oi ambe tumna ainolórie,

ENGLISH: Therefore, if we have food and clothes, let them suffice for us.
QUENYA: Etta, qui samilve matta ar larmar, lava tain farya ven.

ENGLISH: And since is not good in their eyes to have knowledge about God, God gave them over to a worthless mind, for them to do immoral things,
QUENYA: Ar pan úne mára hendultatse same istya pa Eru, Eru antane te olla úmirwa sáman, carieltan úmani nati,

ENGLISH: We overturn thought-constructions and every lofty thing that is raised against the knowledge of God, and we put every thought in gaol to cause it to adhere to the commands of the Christ.
QUENYA: Nuquerilme sanweataqui ar ilya varanda nat ya ná ortaina i istyanna Eruo, ar panyalme ilya sanwe mandosse tyarien sa himya i Hristo canwar.

ENGLISH: But brothers, we do not wish that you are to be ignorant about the slumbering ones . Thus would will not have the same grief that the others have, they that do not have hope.
QUENYA: Mal hánor, ualme mere i nauvalde laistie pa i lornar. Sie ualde samuva i imya naire ya i exi samir, té i uar same estel.

ENGLISH: were some Greeks among who went up to worship at the festival.
QUENYA: Enger Hellenyali mici i lender amba tyerien i aşaresse.

ENGLISH: Do not sigh one at the other, or maybe you will be judged. Behold! The Judge is standing before the doors.
QUENYA: Áva sique quén i exenna, hya cé nauvalde námine. Yé! I Námo tára epe i fennar.

ENGLISH: Whenever anyone does not receive you or listens to your words, when you go away form that house or from that city, shake the dust from your feet .
QUENYA: Quiquie aiquen ua came le hya lasta quettaldannar, íre autalde sana coallo hya sana ostollo, á pale i asto taluldalto.

ENGLISH: But when Herod heard it, he said: “That John whose head I cut off, he has been raised!” For Herod himself sent and seized John and bound him, by reason of Heriodias, wife of Philip his brother, since Herod got married to her.
QUENYA: Mal íre Herol hlasse sa, quentes: “Tana Yoháno yeo cas inye aucirne, sé anaie ortaina!” An Herol immo mentane ar nampe Yoháno ar nunte se, castanen Heroliasso, Filip hánoryo veri, pan Herol veryane senna.

ENGLISH: Now we are making known to you, brothers, the grace that God has given to the congregations of Macedonia.
QUENYA: Sí cáralme sinwa len, hánor, i lisse ya Eru ánie Maceronio ocombin.

ENGLISH: For does not exist good tree producing foul fruit; again does not exist foul tree producing good fruit.
QUENYA: An ua ea mára alda cárala şaura yáve; ata ua ea şaura alda cárala mára yáve.

ENGLISH: Jesus said: “Again is written: Do not test the Lord your God!”
QUENYA: Eque Yésus: “Ata ná técina: Áva tyasta i Heru Ainolya!”

ENGLISH: Then he threw the silver pieces into the temple and went off, and he went away and hanged himself.
QUENYA: Tá hantes i telpemittar mir i corda ar oante, ar lendes oa ar lingane inse.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to the centurion: “Go! As you have believed, so let it happen for you!” And the servant was healed in that hour.
QUENYA: Tá Yésus quente i tuxanturenna: “Mena! Síve asáviel, tambe á marta lyen!” Ar i núro náne nestana yana lúmesse.

ENGLISH: But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, causing the abundant power to be from God and not from ourselves.
QUENYA: Mal samilme harma sina cemne venessen, tyárala i úvea túre náve Erullo ar lá elmello.

ENGLISH: And they went away and fount the things as he said to them , and they prepared for the passover.
QUENYA: Ar oantette ar hirne i nati ve quentes túna, ar manwanette i lahtien.

ENGLISH: Now Herod the farthing-ruler heard about everything that happened, and he was confused, since was said by some that John was raised out of dead,
QUENYA: Sí Herol i canastantur hlasse pa ilqua ya martane, ar anes rúcina, pan náne quétina lo quelli i Yoháno náne ortaina et qualinillon,

ENGLISH: And behold! I send you that of which my father gave promise. But you stay in the city until you shall be covered with power from on high.”
QUENYA: Ar yé! inye menta lenna ta pa ya Atarinya antane vanda. Mal elde hara i ostosse tenna nauvalde tópine túrenen et tarmenello.”

ENGLISH: And he said to the man having the withered hand: “Arise and stand in the middle!”
QUENYA: Ar quentes i nerenna arwa i hessa máo: “Á orta ar tara i endesse!”

ENGLISH: For as the Scripture says: «Behold, I put in Sion a chosen stone, a founding corner-stone, precious, and anyone who believes in it shall by no means be shamed.»
QUENYA: An ve i Tehtele quete: «Yé, panyan Sionde cílina ondo, tulcala vincondo, mirwa, ar aiquen ye save sasse laume nauva naityana.»

ENGLISH: Then was a strife among them about who was the greatest among them.
QUENYA: Tá enge cos mici te pa man náne i antúra mici te.

ENGLISH: Thus you as well, when you see that these things happen, know that he is near, before the doors.
QUENYA: Sie yando elde, íre cenilde i nati sine martar, istar i náse hare, epe i fennar.

ENGLISH: One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls full of the seven last plagues came to speak with me and said: “Come! I will show you the bride, the Lamb’s wife.”
QUENYA: Quén i valion otso i sámer i tolpor otso quante i métime ungwaleron otso túle quetien óni ar quente: “Tula! Lyen-tanuvan i indis, i Euleo veri.”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, is a danger that not only this our work will be despised, but also that the temple of the great Artemis will be counted as nothing, putting an end also to her greatness, before which all Asia and world bow.”
QUENYA: Ente, ea raxe i lá rie sina molielva nauva nattíraina, mal yú i corda i túra Artemisso nauva nótaina ve munta, metyala yú túrierya, epe ya quanda Asia ar ambar luhtar.”

ENGLISH: I urge you about my child which I begat in my chains: Onesimus,

ENGLISH: Furthermore, who abides by his commandment remains in him, and he himself in the other, and so we know that he remains in us, by the spirit that he gave us.
QUENYA: Ente, ye himya axanya lemya sesse, ar sé immo i exesse, ar sie istalve i lemyas vesse, i fairenen ya ven-antanes.

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to him: “If you do not see signs and wonders, you do not believe at all.”
QUENYA: Mal Yésus quente senna: “Qui ualde cene tannar ar elmendar, laume savilde.”

ENGLISH: Thus they said that they did not know.
QUENYA: Sie quentelte i ualte sinte.

ENGLISH: For I say to you: Numerous prophets and kings wished to see the things that you behold, but they did not see them, and hear the things that you hear, but they did not hear them.”
QUENYA: An quetin lenna: Rimbe Erutercánoli ar aralli merner cene i nati yar elde yétar, mal ualte cenne tai, ar hlare i nati yar elde hlarir, mal ualte hlasse tai.”

ENGLISH: When the sixth hour came, darkness fell on the whole land until the ninth hour.
QUENYA: Íre i enquea lúme túle, mornie lantane i quanda nórenna tenna i nertea lúme.

ENGLISH: For is danger that complaints about uprising will be brought against us after what has happened today, for we do not have a single reason to give concerning this clamour.”
QUENYA: An ea raxe i nurreli pa amortie nauvar talaine venna apa ya amartie síra, an ualve same erya casta antaven pa yalme sina.”

ENGLISH: And in that same hour they arose and returned to Jerusalem, and they found the eleven and that were gathered with them,
QUENYA: Ar mi yana imya lúme orontette ar nanwennette Yerúsalemenna, ar hirnette i yunque ar i náner ocómienwe aselte,

ENGLISH: is not servant to whom it is possible to be a slave for two lords, for he will hate one and love the other, or he will stick to one and despise the other. It is not possible for you to be slaves for God and for riches alike.”
QUENYA: Ua ea núro yen ece náve mól heru attan, an tevuvas er ar meluva i exe, hya himyuvas er ar nattiruva i exe. Ua ece len náve móli Erun ar laren véla.”

ENGLISH: Therefore, by our faith in his name, his name has made this man strong, him whom you look at and whom you know, and the faith which is through him has given him health before your eyes.
QUENYA: Etta, saviemmanen esseryasse, esserya acárie nér sina polda, sé ye yétalde ar ye istalde, ar i savie ya ea ter se ánie sen mále epe henduldat.

ENGLISH: For of the wine of anger of her fornication all nations have drunk, and the kings of earth committed fornication with her, and the tradesmen of earth became rich by the power of her abundance without bonds!”
QUENYA: An i limpeo ormeva hrupuhtieryo usúcier ilye nóri, ar cemeno arani hrupuhtaner óse, ar cemeno macari oller lárie i túrenen úveryo pen landar!”

ENGLISH: added also this thing to all those deeds: he put John in prison.
QUENYA: napanne yando nat sina ilye tane cardain: panyanes Yoháno mandosse.

ENGLISH: Then how is that you look at the sedge in your brother's eye, but does not heed the rafter in your own eye?
QUENYA: Tá manen ná i yétal i lisce hanolyo hendesse, mal ua cime i pano véra hendelyasse?

ENGLISH: And I persecuted this Way to the death, binding and giving over into prison men and women alike,
QUENYA: Ar roitanen Tie sina i qualmenna, nútala ar antala olla mir mando neri ar nissi véla,

ENGLISH: This tent was an image of the time that now has come, and as the image was, gifts and sacrifices are now sacrificed. But they cannot make the man who does service, perfect concerning his conscience,
QUENYA: Lancoa sina náne emma pa i lúme ya sí utúlie, ar ve i emma náne, annali ar yancali nar sí yácine. Mal tai uar pole care i nér ye care núromolie, ilvana pa immotuntierya,

ENGLISH: Therefore, if is encouragement in Christ, if is comfort of love, if is a sharing of spirit, if are mercy and compassion,
QUENYA: Etta, qui ea hortie Hristosse, qui ea tiutale melmeo, qui ea etsatie faireva, qui ear oravie ar ofelme,

ENGLISH: No, what did you go out to see? A man having soft clothes? Behold, those having soft clothes are in the houses of kings!
QUENYA: Lá, mana etelendelde cenien? Nér arwa mussi lannion? Yé, i arwar mussi lannion ear coassen araniva!

ENGLISH: Do not fail to show friendliness to strangers, for through it some, without knowing, have received angels as their guests.
QUENYA: Áva loita anta nilme etteleain, an ter sa queneli, ú istiéno, acámier valali ve aşaliltar.

ENGLISH: Jesus look at him and said: “How difficult is for that have money to come into God's kingdom!
QUENYA: Yésus yente se ar quente: “Manen urda ná in samir telpe tule mir Eruo aranie!

ENGLISH: But now, since you were freed from sin but have become servants to God, you have your fruit leading to holiness, and the end will be eternal wife.
QUENYA: Ono sí, pan anelve leryane úcarello mal olólier móli Erun, samilde yávelda tulyala airenna, ar i metta nauva oira coivie.

ENGLISH: You desire, but you do not have. You slay and you long, and yet you cannot receive. You fight and you make war. You do not have, since you do not ask.
QUENYA: Merilde, mal ualde same. Nahtalde ar milyalde, ananta ualde pole came. Mahtalde ar ohtacarilde. Ualde same, pan ualde arca.

ENGLISH: For are numerous ones – I spoke about them frequently, but now I am speaking about them with grief – that walk as enemies of the cross of the Christ.
QUENYA: An ear rimbali – quenten pa te rimbave, mal sí quétan pa té arwa nyéreo – i vantar ve ñottoli i tarweo i Hristo.

ENGLISH: And the Word changed into flesh and dwelt among us, and we saw his glory, such glory as an only-born son has from his father; and he was full of grace and truth.
QUENYA: Ar i Quetta ahyane mir hráve ar marne imíca me, ar cennelme alcarerya, taite alcar ya ernóna yondo same ataryallo; ar anes quanta Erulisseo ar nanwiéno.

ENGLISH: But to Abraham the promises were given, and to his seed. It does not say 'and to his seeds', as if are numerous ones, but as if is one: 'And to your seed,' who is the Christ.
QUENYA: Mal Avrahámen i vandar náner quétina, ar erderyan. Sa ua quete 'ar erderyain', ve qui ear rimbeli, mal ve qui ea er: 'Ar eldelyan,' ye ná i Hristo.

ENGLISH: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the servant of the chief priest and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
QUENYA: Tá Simon Péter, ye sáme macil, tunce sa ar pente i héra airimo núro ar aucirne forya hlarya. I núro esse né Malcus.

ENGLISH: Another comparison he said to them: “The kingdom of heaven is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three big measures of flour, until everything was raised!”
QUENYA: Hyana sestie quentes téna: “Menelo aranie ná ve pulmaxe, ya nís nampe ar nurtane hoe lestassen nelde moleva, tenna ilqua náne ortaina!”

ENGLISH: For I am sure that nothing – death or life or angels or lordships, or that are now or that will come, or powers,
QUENYA: An nanye tanca i munta – qualme hya coivie hya valar hya héri hya yar ear sí hya yar tuluvar, hya túri,

ENGLISH: Then he said to him: 'Child, you have always been with me, and all mine are yours,
QUENYA: Tá quentes senna: 'Hína, illume anaietye asinye, ar ilye ninyar nar tyenyar,

ENGLISH: Jesus said to them: “Truly, truly I say to you, before Abraham was, I am.”
QUENYA: Yésus quente téna: “Násie, násie quetin lenna, nó Avraham enge, inye ea.”

ENGLISH: Therefore I also – since I have heard about your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love of all the holy ones –
QUENYA: Etta yando inye – pan ahlárien pa savielda mí Heru Yésus ar melmelda ilye i airiva –

ENGLISH: Therefore that received his word were baptized, and on that day around three thousand souls were added.
QUENYA: Etta i camner quettarya náner sumbane, ar yana auresse os fear húmi nelde náner napánine.

ENGLISH: And this story went out to that entire region.
QUENYA: Ar nyarna sina ettúle quanda sana ménanna.

ENGLISH: I will come soon. Keep which you have, to stop anyone from taking your crown.
QUENYA: Tuluvan ron. Hepa ya samil, pustien aiquen mapiello ríelya.

ENGLISH: for I have not kept myself from telling you God's entire plan.
QUENYA: an uan ehépie imne nyariello len Eruo quanda pano.

ENGLISH: Then people will give you over into tribulation and will kill you, and you will be hated by all the nations by reason of my name.
QUENYA: Tá queneli antauvar le olla mir şangie ar nahtuvar le, ar nauvalde tévaine lo ilye i nóri castanen essenyo.

ENGLISH: When he saw that he could do nothing beneficial, but that sooner an uprising was going to arise, Pilate took water and washed his hands before the crowd, saying: “I do not have guilt of the blood of this man! You see to it!”
QUENYA: Íre cennes i poldes care munta aşea, mal ambe ron amortie ortumne, Piláto nampe nén ar sóve máryat epe i şanga, quétala: “Uan same cáma serceo nér sino! Elde cena sanna!”

ENGLISH: Our twelve tribes have the hope that they will see the promise made true if they serve him with vigour through night and day. Concerning this hope the Jews say that I have committed crimes, o King.
QUENYA: Nosselmar yunque samir i estel i cenuvalte i vanda carna nanwa qui veuyalte se veassenen ter lóme yo aure. Pa estel sina i Yúrar quetir i acárien ongweli, a Aran.

ENGLISH: And he says to me: “The waters that you saw, on which the harlot is sitting, are peoples and throngs and nations and tongues.
QUENYA: Ar eques ninna: “I neni yar cennel, yassen hára i imbacinde, nar lier ar şangar ar nóri ar lambi.

ENGLISH: the oath that he gave to Abraham our father,
QUENYA: i vanda ya antanes Avraham atarelvan,

ENGLISH: And they threw dust upon their head and cried in tears and grief, and said: ‘Woe, woe – the great city, where all who have ships at sea became rich by her great wealth, for in a single hour she was destroyed!’
QUENYA: Ar hantelte asto careltanna ar yámer mi nier ar naire, ar quenter: ’Horro, horro – i túra osto, yasse illi i samir ciryar earesse oller lárie túra almaryanen, an erya lúmesse anes nancarna!’

ENGLISH: Behold! Your house is left to you!
QUENYA: Yé! Coalda ná len hehtana!

ENGLISH: And all the prophets, from Samuel to those that followed him – all that have spoken – have also made known these days.
QUENYA: Ar ilye i Erutercánor, ho Samuel innar hilyaner se – illi i equétier – yú acárier sinwe auri sine.

ENGLISH: But I stay in Ephesus until the Festival of Weeks ,
QUENYA: Mal lemyan Efesusse tenna Aşar Otsolaron,

ENGLISH: His disciples said: “Look! Now you are speaking openly, and you do not speak comparison!
QUENYA: Hildoryar quenter: “Yé! Sí quétal pantie, ar ual quete sestie!

ENGLISH: For the eyes of the Lord are turned against just ones, and his ears to their petitions, but the Lord has set his face against who do evil things .»
QUENYA: An i Héruo hendu nát quérine failannar, ar hlaryat arcandeltanna, mal i Héru apánie cendelerya ana i carir ulqui.»

ENGLISH: He is not God of dead, but of living ones, for all among them are alive to him.”
QUENYA: Uas qualinion Aino, mal coivearon, an illi mici te nar coivie sen.”

ENGLISH: But the tax collector also did not wish to raise his eyes towards heaven, but he beat his breast, saying: 'O God, have mercy on me, a sinner!'
QUENYA: Mal i tungwemo yando ua merne orta henyat menelenna, mal palpanes ambosterya, quétala: 'A Eru, órava nisse, úcarindo!'

ENGLISH: “Teacher, Moses has written for us: 'If a man's brother dies without child, after he married a woman, it is necessary for his brother to get married to the woman and rise up seed for his brother.'
QUENYA: “Peantar, Móses etécie men: 'Qui nero háno quale ú híno, apa veryanes nís, mauya hánoryan verya i nissenna ar orta erde hánoryan.'

ENGLISH: How is it possible for you to say to your brother: 'Brother, allow me to take the straw out of your eye,' when you do not look at the plank in your own eye?
QUENYA: Manen ece lyen quete hánolyanna: 'Háno, lava nin mapa i lisce et hendelyallo,' íre elye ua yéta i pano véra hendelyasse?

ENGLISH: Therefore let die the body-parts that you have on earth, concerning fornication, uncleanness, sexual lust, wicked desire and greed, which is idol-worship.
QUENYA: Etta lava quale i hroarantain yar samilde cemende, pa hrupuhtie, úpoicie, yére, olca íre ar milcie, ya cordontyerie ná.

ENGLISH: Did you really not read this scripture? 'The stone which the builders turned away, it has become head of the corner.
QUENYA: Lau hentanelde tehtele sina? 'I ondo ya i şamnor querner oa, sá olólie cas i vinco.

ENGLISH: But if you are led by spirit, you are not under law.
QUENYA: Mal qui nalde tulyaine fairenen, ualde nu şanye.

ENGLISH: If God so adorns the plants in the field, that exist today and tomorrow are thrown into an oven, how much more will he adorn you, you of little faith!
QUENYA: Qui Eru sie netya i celvar i restasse, i ear síra ar enwa nar hátine mir urna, manen ole ambe netyuvas lé, elde pitya saviéno!

ENGLISH: Father, glorify your name!” Therefore a voice came out of heaven: “I both glorified it and I shall glorify it again!”
QUENYA: Atar, á alcarya esselya!” Etta óma túle et menello: “Yúyo alcaryanenyes ar alcaryuvanyes ata!”

ENGLISH: then you count some among you more precious than others, and you are judges that pronounce wicked judgements. Is this not true?
QUENYA: – tá notilde quelli mici le mirwe lá exeli, ar nalde námoli i quetir olce námier. Ma si ua nanwa?

ENGLISH: Furthermore, you will be given over by parents and by brothers and by your kin and by friends, and they will cill some among you,
QUENYA: Ente, nauvalde antaine olla yando lo nostaru ar lo hánor ar lo nosselda ar lo meldor, ar nahtuvalte quelli mici le,

ENGLISH: In this manner, therefore, also in this time is a remaining part, by the choice of God's grace.
QUENYA: Mi lé sina, etta, yú lúme sinasse ea lemyala ranta, Erulisseo cilmenen.

ENGLISH: I have also some other sheep, that are not among these sheep; them as well is necessary for me to lead, and they will listen to my voice, and they will be a single flock, a single shepherd.
QUENYA: Samin yando hyane mámali, i uar mici mámar sine; yando té mauya nin tulya, ar lastuvalte ómanyanna, ar nauvalte erya lámáre, erya mavar.

ENGLISH: But to that works the reward is counted, not as grace, but as a debt.
QUENYA: Mal yen mole i paityale ná nótina, lá ve lisse, mal ve rohta.

ENGLISH: The true light, shining for all men, was coming into the world.
QUENYA: I nanwa cala, caltala ilye atanin, né túlala mir i mar.

ENGLISH: in order to make known his abundant glory to the vessels of mercy, that he beforehand prepared for glory –
QUENYA: carien sinwa úvea alcarerya i venin oraviéva, yar nóvo manwanes alcaren

ENGLISH: For I have set for you an example , that as I have done, you too will do.
QUENYA: An apánien len emma, i ve inye acárie, yando lé caruvar.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “You know well how to a Jew is wholly against the Law to unite himself to a person of another nation, or to go into his house. And yet God showed me that I am not to call anyone defiled or unclean.
QUENYA: Ar quentes téna: “Istalde mai manen Yúran ná aqua ana i Şanye erta inse quenen hyana nóreo, hya mene mir coarya. Ananta Eru tanne nin i ávan esta aiquen vahtana hya úpoica.

ENGLISH: But by God's grace I am who I am. And the grace that he gave to me was not for nothing, but I labored more than them all, and yet not I, but God's grace that is in me.
QUENYA: Mal Eruo lissenen nanye ye nanye. Ar i lisse ya antanes nin úne muntan, mal mólen ambe lá te illi, ananta lá inye, mal Eruo lisse ya ea asinye.

ENGLISH: And they sat down, row by row, in hundreds and fifties .
QUENYA: Ar hamunelte, téma ara téma, mi tuxali ar lepenquealli.

ENGLISH: And leaving them he went back to the boat and went away to the other shore.
QUENYA: Ar te-hehtala nanwennes i luntenna ar oante i hyana hrestanna.

ENGLISH: Jesus spoke about his death, but they thought that he spoke about resting in sleep.
QUENYA: Yésus carampe pa qualmerya, mal té sanner i carampes pa serie húmesse.

ENGLISH: The people sitting in darkness saw a great light, and to who sat in the region of death-shadow, light arose.”
QUENYA: I lie hámala morniesse cenne hoa cala, ar in hamner ñuruhuineo ménasse cala oronte!”

ENGLISH: And if is there a friend of peace, your peace will rest upon him. But if is not one, it will return to you.
QUENYA: Ar qui ea tasse meldo raineo, rainelda seruva senna. Mal qui ua ea er, nanwenuvas lenna.

ENGLISH: But now I am writing to you: Do not remain with anyone called a brother who is a fornicator, or a person who speaks mockery, or who drinks too much, or who is a robber. Furthermore, do not eat with such a person.
QUENYA: Mal sí técan lenna: Áva lemya as aiquen estaina háno ye hrupuhto ná, hya quén ye quete yaiwe, hya ye suce acca ole, hya ye arpo ná. Ente, áva mate as taite quén.

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “But now it is necessary for who has a purse to bring it, in the same manner a food-box, and it is necesssary for how lacks a sword to sell his cloak and get a sword for the money.
QUENYA: Tá quentes téna: “Mal sí mauya yen same pocolle tala sa, mi imya lé yando matsocolca, ar mauya yen pene macil vace collarya ar ñete macil i telpen.

ENGLISH: and after he gave thanks, he broke it and said: “This is my body, which is being given in your behalf. Do this in remembrance of me.”
QUENYA: ar apa antanes hantale, ranceses ar quente: “Si ná hroanya, ya ná antaina rá len. Cara si enyalien ní.”

ENGLISH: and for being found in him, not by my own righteousness, that which comes by the Law, but by which exists by faith in Christ, the rigtheousness which comes from God by the faith,
QUENYA: ar náven hírina sesse, lá véra failienyanen, ta ya tule i Şanyenen, mal yanen ea saviénen Hristosse, i failie ya tule Erullo i saviénen,

ENGLISH: Concerning all that are servants under a yoke: Let them count their lords worthy of every honor, to stop anyone from speaking mockery about God's name and the teaching.
QUENYA: Pa illi i nar móli nu yanta: Á notir herultar valde ilya laitiéno, pustien aiquen quetiello yaiwe pa Eruo esse ar i peantie.

ENGLISH: Now my soul is troubled, and what am I to say? Father, save me from this hour! But for this reason I have come to this hour.
QUENYA: Sí feanya tarastaina ná, ar mana quetuvan? Atar, áni rehta et lúme sinallo! Mal casta sinan utúlien lúme sinanna.

ENGLISH: I thank God, I speak in tongues more numerous than all among you speak !
QUENYA: Hantan Erun, quetin lambessen rimbe lá illi mici elde quetir!

ENGLISH: Therefore you as well be ready, for the Son of Man will come in an hour when you do not think so.
QUENYA: Etta yando elde na manwe, an i Atanyondo tuluva mi lúme yasse ualde sana sie.

ENGLISH: Indeed the secret of reverence is great: He was revealed in the flesh, pronounced righteous in the spirit, showed himself to angels, was preached in the nations, believed in the world, received up in glory.
QUENYA: É i fóle ainocimiéva ná hoa: Anes apantaina i hrávesse, quétina faila i fairesse, tannexe valalin, náne nyardaina i nóressen, sávina i mardesse, cámina ama alcaresse.

ENGLISH: While Paul was waiting for them in Athens, his spirit was being disturned by seeing how the city was full of idols.
QUENYA: Lan Paulo hópane tun mi Aşen, fairerya náne tarastaina ceniénen manen i osto náne quanta cordonion.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “My soul is heavy until death with grief. Remain here and keep yourselves awake!”
QUENYA: Ar quentes téna: “Feanya ná lunga tenna qualme nyérenen. Á lemya sisse ar hepa inde coive!”

ENGLISH: And all that dwelt in Lydda and Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.
QUENYA: Ar illi i marner mi Lirda ar Hyaron cenner se, ar querneltexer i Herunna.

ENGLISH: For the body indeed is not one part, but numerous ones.
QUENYA: An i hroa é ua er ranta, mal rimbe.

ENGLISH: The sick man answered him: “Lord, I do not have a man to put me in the pool when the water is disturbed, and when I am coming, another goes down before me.”
QUENYA: I hlaiwa nér hanquente senna: “Heru, uan same nér panien ni i ailinde íre i nén tarastaina ná, ar íre inye túla, exe lelya undu nó ni.”

ENGLISH: Then Mary took a pound of fragrant oil – genuine, most precious nard – and anointed Jesus’ feet and dried his feet with her hair. The scent of the fragrant oil filled the house.
QUENYA: Tá María nampe lungwe níşima millova – anwa, ammirwa alanarda – ar líve Yésuo talu ar parahtane talyat findileryanen. I ne i níşima millo quante i coa.

ENGLISH: When the brothers perceived that, they brought him to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus.
QUENYA: Íre i hánor túner ta, talleltes undu Césareanna ar mentaner se oa ana Tarsus.

ENGLISH: Thus your faith could be established, not on men's wisdom, but on God's power.
QUENYA: Sie ence savieldan náve tulcana, lá to atanion sailie, mal to Eruo túre.

ENGLISH: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and everything that you will bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and everything that you loose on earth will be loosened in heaven!”
QUENYA: Antauvan lyen menelo araniéno latili, ar ilqua ya nutuvalde cemende nauva nútina menelde, ar ilqua ya lehtal cemende nauva lehtaina menelde!”

ENGLISH: As a gift, by his grace, they are made just by the ransom in Jesus Christ,
QUENYA: Ve anna, lisseryanen, nalte cárine faile i nanwerenen Yésus Hristosse,

ENGLISH: But everyone in his own time: Christ the first fruit, thereafter that are Christ at his coming,
QUENYA: Mal ilquen véra lúryasse: Hristo i minya yáve, epeta i nar Hristova tulesseryasse,

ENGLISH: I say to you: If he does not rise and give to him since he is his friend, indeed he will rise and give to him because of his persistence .
QUENYA: Quetin lenna: Qui uas orta ar anta sen pan náse meldorya, é ortuvas ar antuva sen vorongandeleryanen.

ENGLISH: For the sum of the whole Law is one saying: “Love your neighbor as yourself.”
QUENYA: An i quanda Şanyeo nonwe ná er quetiesse: “Mela armarolya ve imle.”

ENGLISH: And another angel, who had an incense vessel of gold, came and stood beside the altar, and a great measure of incense was given to him, to make a blend with the prayers of all the holy ones, on the altar of gold before the throne.
QUENYA: Ar hyana vala, ye sáme nisquema maltava, túle ar tarne ara i yangwa, ar náne sen antana hoa lesta nisqueo, carien ostime as i hyamier ilye i airion, i yangwasse maltava epe i mahalma.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, if anyone runs in a race, he does not receive a crown if he does not run according to the rules.
QUENYA: Ente, qui aiquen nore noriesse, uas came ríe qui uas nore ve i şanyer.

ENGLISH: And since he has had sufferings when he was tested, he can help that are tested.
QUENYA: An pan sé asámie perperiéli íre anes tyastaina, polis manya i nar tyastaine.

ENGLISH: Peter began to say to him: “Behold, we have abandoned everything and have followed you.”
QUENYA: Péter yestane quete senna: “Yé, elme ehehtier ilqua ar ihílier lyé.”

ENGLISH: But you, child, shall be called prophet of the Most High, for you will go before the Lord to prepare his ways,
QUENYA: Mal tyé, hína, nauva estaina Erutercáno i Antaro, an menuvatye epe i Heru manwien malleryar,

ENGLISH: and you do not understand that it is beneficial for you that a single man is to die on behalf of the people, that the whole nation will not be undone.”
QUENYA: ar ualde hanya i ná len aşea i erya atan qualuva rá i lien, i lá nauva i quanda nóre nancarna.”

ENGLISH: After looking up towards heaven Jesus sighed and said to him: “Ephphatha!” – that is: “Be opened!”
QUENYA: Apa yétie ama menelenna Yésus síque ar quente senna: “Effata!” – ta ná: “Na latyaina!”

ENGLISH: And the sound of harpers and singers and flutists and trumpeters will by no means be heard in you more, and craftsmen of all crafts will by no means be found in you more, and the sound from a mill-stone will by no means heard in you more,

ENGLISH: and forgive us our sins, for also we forgive everyone who has a debt to us; and do not lead us into temptation.”

ENGLISH: But from now the Son of Man shall sit beside God's right hand of power.”
QUENYA: Mal ho sí i Atanyondo haruva ara Eruo forma túreva.”

ENGLISH: And he asked them: “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered him: “You are the Christ!”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he spoke this comparison: “No one cuts a cloth-piece from a new cloak and sews it in an old cloak, but if one indeed does so, then the new cloth-piece tears away; furthermore, the cloth-piece from the new cloak is not similar to the old.
QUENYA: Ente, quentes téna sestie: “Úquen cire lanneranta ho vinya colla ar neme sa yára collasse, mal qui mo é care sie, tá i vinya lanneranta narca oa; ente, i lanneranta ho i vinya colla ua vávea i yáran.

ENGLISH: He made us sufficient servants of a new covenant, not of a written law, but of the spririt; for the written law kills, but the spirit gives life.

ENGLISH: and who see me sees also who sent me.

ENGLISH: in nothing terrified by that stand against you. That is to them a sign of undoing, but to you, of salvation. Also this sign comes from God.

ENGLISH: By faith Enoch was taken away, to stop him from seeing death, and he was not found, since God took him away. Before he was taken away he received the witness that he was good in God's eyes.
