QUENYA: náveldan envinyante i fairesse sámaldo

ENGLISH: and where he goes inside say to the master of the house: The Teacher says: Where is my guest-room, where I can eat the Passover with my disciples?”
QUENYA: ar yasse menis minna queta i coanturenna: I Peantar quete: Masse aşalşambenya, yasse ece nin mate i Lahtie as hildonyar?”

ENGLISH: They are the two olive trees and the two lampstands that stand before the Lord of earth.
QUENYA: Tú nát i milpialda atta ar i calmatarma atta yar tarir epe i Heru cemeno.

ENGLISH: But the storm lay extremely heavy upon us, and on the following day they threw the goods into the sea,
QUENYA: Mal i raumo ita lumnane men, ar i hilyala auresse hantelte i armar mir i ear,

ENGLISH: They were slain with stones, they were tested, they were sawn into peaces, they died being slain with swords, they covered themselves with skins of sheep and goats, while they were in need, in tribulation, suffering evil behavior.
QUENYA: Anelte nance sarnelínen, anelte tyastaine, anelte saraine mir rantali, quallelte nála nance macillínen, tompeltexer helmalínen mámaron ar nyéniron, íre anelte mauresse, şangiesse, perpérala ulca lengie.

ENGLISH: For nobody does anything secretly if he seeks to be known.
QUENYA: An úquen care aiqua nuldave qui cestas náve sinwa. Qui caritye nati sine, á apanta immo i marden!”

ENGLISH: They fixed a day when they were going to see him and came to where he lived, more numerous than they were the first time. From morning to evening he told and witnessed to them about God's kingdom, and from the Law and from the prophets he tried to give them understanding about Jesus.
QUENYA: Tancelte aure yasse velumneltes ar túler yanna marnes, rimbe lá ya anelte mí minya lú. Arinello şinyenna nyarnes ar vettanes tien pa Eruo aranie, ar i Şanyello ar i Erutercánollon néves anta tien hande pa Yésus.

ENGLISH: But I say: Walk by spirit, and you will by no means follow the desire of the flesh!
QUENYA: Mal quetin: Á vanta fairenen, ar laume hilyuvalde i hráveo íre!

ENGLISH: Do not let anyone take away your crown of victory who has his joy in “lowliness” and worship of angels. His thoughts are fixed on the things that he has seen in vision, and he praises himself without reason, by his fleshly mind.
QUENYA: Áva lave aiquenen mapa oa ríelda apaireva ye same alasserya mi “naldie” ar tyerme valaiva. Sanweryar nar tácine i natissen yar ecénies mi maur, ar laitas inse ú casto, sámaryanen hráveva.

ENGLISH: You husbands, dwell with your wives with understanding, giving them glory as to a weaker vessel, the feminine, since you are also heirs with them to the grace of life – or your prayers will be hindered.
QUENYA: A veruvi, mara as verildar handenen, antala tien alcar ve ambe milya venen, i inya, pan nalde yando aryoni aselte i Erulisseo coiviéva – hya hyamieldar nauvar hampe.

ENGLISH: One of the dciples, Andrew the brother of Simon Peter, said to him: “ is here a small boy having five breads of barley and two fishes. But what are they for so many people?”
QUENYA: Quén i hildoron, Andréas i háno Símon Pétero, quente senna: “Ea sís pitya seldo arwa massaron findoriva lempe ar hala atto. Mal mana tai ta rimbe quenin?”

ENGLISH: And for this purpose Christ died and came back to life: to be Lord of dead ones and of living ones alike.
QUENYA: An sina ennen Hristo qualle ar nanwenne coivienna: náven Heru qualinaron ar coirearon véla.

ENGLISH: That is the smallest of all seeds, but having grown it is the biggest of the vegetables and has been made a tree, and so heaven's birds came and find rest in its branches!”
QUENYA: Ta ná i ampitya ilye erdion, mal álienwa náse i anhoa i quearon ar anaie carna alda, ar sie menelo aiwi tulir ar hirir sére olvaryassen!”

ENGLISH: – also on my behalf, for me to receive words when I open my mouth, allowing me with boldness to make known the secret of the gospel,
QUENYA: – yando rá inyen, camienyan quettar íre pantan antonya, lávala nin veriénen care sinwa i evandilyono fóle,

ENGLISH: But who has become one with the Lord is one spirit with him.
QUENYA: Mal ye olólie er as i Heru faire er ná óse.

ENGLISH: Then they went back to prepare spices and fragrant oils. But they rested on the sabbath, according to the commandment.
QUENYA: Tá nanwennelte manwien tyávelasseli ar níşime milloli. Mal sendelte i sendaresse, i axannen.

ENGLISH: And recalling it, Peter said to him: “Rabbi ,behold! The fig tree that you cursed is withered up.”
QUENYA: Ar enyálala sa, Péter quente senna: “Rappi, ela! I relyávalda ye huntel hestiéla ná.”

ENGLISH: For the word of promise was thus: “At this time I shall return, and will be a son with Sarah.”
QUENYA: An i quetta vando sie né: “Lúme sinasse nanwenuvan, ar euva yondo as Sara.”

ENGLISH: Wishing that, surely I was not too free? Or the things that I make my goal, did I wish to do them in the manner of the flesh, and so was with me 'Yes, Yes' and 'No, no'?
QUENYA: Mérala ta, lau anen acca léra? Hya i nati yar carin mehtinya, ma mernen caritat mi lé i hráveo, ar sie enger asinye 'Ná, Ná' ar 'Ui, ui'?

ENGLISH: After him Judas from Galilee arose, in the days in which the people was counted, and he drew away some people after himself. And yet that man died, and all that heeded his commands were scattered.
QUENYA: Apa sé Yúras Alileallo oronte, mí rí yassen i lie náne nótina, ar tunces oa queneli apa inse. Ananta sana nér qualle, ar illi i cimner canwaryar náner vintane.

ENGLISH: There were occasions when you were openly given to mockeries and tribulations alike, and on some occasions you had a part with others that went through such things.
QUENYA: Enger lúli yassen anelde pantave antaine yaiwelin ar şangiélin véla, ar lúlissen sámelde ranta as exeli i lender ter síti nati.

ENGLISH: When the day came, the council of elders of the people, the chief priests and the scribes alike, assembled. And they drew him before their council, saying:
QUENYA: Íre i aure túle, i ocombe amyáraron i lieo, i hére airimor ar i parmangolmor véla, ocomner. Ar tunceltes epe ocombelta, quétala:

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he has still more profound feelings towards you when he recalls how you heeded his commands, how you received him in fear and trembling.
QUENYA: Ente, samis en ambe tumne felmeli lenna íre enyalis manen cimnelde canwaryar, manen camneldes ruciesse ar paliesse.

ENGLISH: May you have grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ,
QUENYA: Nai samuvalde lisse ar raine ho Eru Atarelva ar i Heru Yésus Hristo,

ENGLISH: And when they came to the other disciples, they saw a great crowd around them, and scrubes quarrelling with them.
QUENYA: Ar íre túlelte i hyane hildonnar, cennelte hoa şanga os te, ar parmangolmoli costala aselte.

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to Peter: “Put your sword in the sheath! The cup that the Father has given me, am I really not to drink it?”
QUENYA: Mal Yésus quente Péterenna: “Á panya macilelya i vainesse! I yulma ya i Atar ánie nin, lau sucuvanyes?”

ENGLISH: “I say to you: Rise, take your stretcher, and go to your house!”
QUENYA: “Quetin lyenna: Á orta, mapa colmalya, ar mena coalyanna!”

ENGLISH: so reminding the young women that it is necessary for them to love their husbands, love their children,
QUENYA: sie rentala i nesse nissi i mauya tien mele verultar, mele hínaltar,

ENGLISH: is necessary for us to do the work of who sent me while is day; the night is coming when nobody can work.
QUENYA: Mauya ven care i molie yeo ni-mentane íre ea aure; i lóme túla yasse úquen pole mole.

ENGLISH: Thereafter, when he lay by the table in the house, behold! many tax collectors and sinners came and lay there with Jesus and his disciples.
QUENYA: Epeta, íre caines ara i sarno i coasse, yé! rimbe tungwemóli ar úcarindoli túler ar cainer tasse as Yésus ar hildoryar.

ENGLISH: For if you give praise by spirit, how will the man that is sitting in the place of the ordinary person say “amen” when you give thanks, since he does not understand what you are saying?
QUENYA: An qui antalde laitale fairenen, manen i nér ye hára i şanya queno nómesse quetuva “násie” íre antalde hantale, pan uas hanya mana quétalde?

ENGLISH: But when the disciples surrounded him, he arose and went into the city. And on the following day he went away with Barnabas, going to Derbe.
QUENYA: Mal íre i hildor pelder se, orontes ar menne mir i osto. Ar i hilyala auresse oantes as Varnavas, lelyala Lervenna.

ENGLISH: Now the congregation in all of Judea and Galilee had peace and was being built up, and while they walked in fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, their number rose.
QUENYA: Sí i ocombe mi quanda Yúrea ar Alilea sáme raine ar náne carastaina ama, ar lan vantanelte ruciesse i Herullo ar mí Aire Feo tiutale, nótelta oronte.

ENGLISH: But when he saw the woman, Jesus called her to himself and said: “Woman, you are freed from the illness making you weak.”
QUENYA: Mal íre cennes i nís, Yésus yalle se insenna ar quente: “Nís, nalye leryaina i hlívello lye-cárala milya.”

ENGLISH: Therefore be awake, recalling how through three years, at night and at day, I did not stop instructing you with tears.
QUENYA: Etta na coive, enyalila manen ter loar nelde, lómisse yo auresse, uan pustane peanta len nírelínen.

ENGLISH: having all lowliness of mind and a mild manner, suffering one another with love,
QUENYA: arwe quanda naldiéno sámo ar milya léo, perpérala quén i exe melmenen,

ENGLISH: And you know and have believed the love that God has for us. God is love, and who remains in love remains in God, and God remains in him.
QUENYA: Ar elve istar ar asávier i melme ya Eru same elveva. Eru ná melme, ar ye lemya melmesse lemya Erusse, ar Eru lemya sesse.

ENGLISH: To do so was indeed good in their eyes, and yet they were debtors to them, for if the nations have a part in their matters of spirit, they also owe to be servants for them with matters of the flesh.
QUENYA: Care sie é náne mára mi hendulta, ananta anelte rohtandor tien, an qui i nóri samir ranta mi nattoltar faireva, yú rohtalte náve núror tien nattoinen i hráveo.

ENGLISH: But when Paul's sister's son heard that they were lying hidden to kill him, he went to him, and when he came to the camp he told it to him.
QUENYA: Mal íre Paulo néşo yondo hlasse i caitumnelte nurtane nahtien se, lendes senna, ar íre túles i estolienna sa-nyarnes sen.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, brother shall give brother over to death, and a father a child, and children shall rise against parents and cause their death,
QUENYA: Ente, háno antuva háno olla qualmenna, ar atar hína, ar híni ortuvar nostarunna ar tyaruva qualmetta,

ENGLISH: For David says concerning him: 'I always saw the Lord before my eyes, for he is by my right hand, to stop me from being shaken.
QUENYA: An Lavir quete pa sé: 'Illume cennen i Héru epe hendunyat, an náse ara formanya, ni-pustien návello pálina.

ENGLISH: When they still spoke about these things, Jesus himself stood in their midst and said to them: “May you have peace!”
QUENYA: Íre en quentelte pa nati sine, Yésus immo tarne endeltasse ar quente téna: “Nai samuvalde raine!”

ENGLISH: By him we have the ransom by his blood: the forgiveness of our sins, by the riches of his grace.
QUENYA: Sénen samilve i nanwere serceryanen: i apsenie úcarilvaiva, lisseryo larnen.

ENGLISH: But the chief of the synagogue, being angry since Jesus healed on the day of rest, said to the crowd: “There are six days in which it is necessary to work. There come on them to be healed, and not on the day of rest!”
QUENYA: Mal i turco i yomencavo, nála rúşea pan Yésus nestane i sendaresse, quente i şanganna: “Ear auri enque yassen mauya mole! Etta tula mi tai náven nestaina, ar lá i sendaresse!”

ENGLISH: The anger between them was so sharp that it caused them to abandon one another, and Barnabas took Mark and sailed away to Cyprus.
QUENYA: I rúşe imbe tu náne ta aica i tyarneset hehta quén i exe, ar Varnavas nampe Marco ar cirne oa Ciprusenna.

ENGLISH: I indeed thought that it was necessary for me to stand against the name of Jesus Christ from Nazareth in numerous manners,
QUENYA: Inye é sanne i mauyane nin tare ana i esse Yésus Hristova Násaretello mi rimbe léli,

ENGLISH: and I will ask of the Father, and he will give you another helper that will be with you forever,
QUENYA: ar inye arcuva i Atarello, ar antuvas len hyana şámo ya euva aselde tennoio,

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “What is your reason for seeking me? Did you not know that it is necessary for me to be in the house of my Father?”
QUENYA: Mal quentes túna: “Mana castasta cestien ni? Ma uaste sinte i mauya nin náve i coasse Atarinyava?”

ENGLISH: furthermore, for the wailing to be as if they were not wailing, and for that have joy as if they lacked joy, and for that trade to be as those that do not possess,
QUENYA: ente, i yaimeain náve ve au únelte yaimie, ar in samir alasse náve ve au pennelte alasse, ar in mancar ve i uar harya,

ENGLISH: Therefore, my brothers, be faithful, firm – always doing an abundance in the work of the Lord, knowing that your work is not for nothing in the Lord.
QUENYA: Etta, hánonyar, na voronde, tulce – illume carila úve mí Heruo molie, istala i molielda ua muntan i Herusse.

ENGLISH: My children, keep yourselves from idols!
QUENYA: Hinyar, hepa inde cordonillon!

ENGLISH: What is born by flesh is flesh, and what is born by spirit is spirit.
QUENYA: Ya ná nóna hrávenen hráve ná, ar ya ná nóna fairenen faire ná.

ENGLISH: But as is written: “ that eye has not seen and ear has not heard, that a man's heart did not think, those God has prepared for that love him.”
QUENYA: Mal ve ná técina: “Yar hen ua ecénie ar hlas ua ahlárie, yar atano enda ua sanne, tai Eru amanwie in melir se.”

ENGLISH: To the One who can keep you firm by the gospel that I brought and by making known Jesus Christ, by the revelation of the mystery that has been kept in silence for eternities,
QUENYA: Yen pole hepe le tulce i evandilyonnen ya tallen ar cariénen sinwa Yésus Hristo, i apantiénen i fóleva ya anaie hépina quildesse ter oireli,

ENGLISH: you are to give this man over to Satan. Thus his flesh will be destroyed, but the spirit will be saved on the Lord's day.
QUENYA: alde anta taite nér olla Sátanen. Sie hráverya nauva nancarna, mal i faire nauva rehtana mí Heruo ré.

ENGLISH: But the chief priests made plans to kill Lazarus as well,
QUENYA: Mal i hére airimor carner panoli nahtien yando Lásarus,

ENGLISH: and he will go before him in Elijah's spirit and power, to turn back the hearts of fathers to children and the refusers to the insight of just ones, to put before the Lord a prepared people.”
QUENYA: ar sé menuva epe se mi Elío faire ar túre, nanquerien atarion endar hínannar ar i avari i tercenna failaron, panien epe i Héru manwaina lie.”

ENGLISH: She said to him: “Lord, you have no water-vessel, and the well is deep. From where, then, do you have the living water?
QUENYA: Eques senna: “Heru, ual same calpa, ar i tampo ná núra. Mallo, tá, samil i coirea nén?

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “You answered well; do so and you will have life.”
QUENYA: Yésus quente senna: “Hanquentes mai; cara sie ar samuval coivie.”

ENGLISH: But the spirit says in straight words that in last times some will fall away from the faith, heeding spirits that cause others to stray, and the teachings of demons,
QUENYA: Mal i Faire quete tére quettalínen i mí métime lúmi queneli lantuvar oa i saviello, címala faireli i tyarir exi ranya, ar i peantier raucoron,

ENGLISH: But after three days he summoned who were among the prominent men of the Jews. After they assembled he said to them: “Men, brothers, though I did nothing against the people or the customs from our fathers, I was given over from Jerusalem into hands of Romans.
QUENYA: Mal apa rí nelde yaldes i náner imíca i minde neri i Yúraron. Apa ocomnelte quentes téna: “Neri, hánor, ómu fcarnen munta ana i lie hya i haimi atarilvaron, inye náne antana olla Yerúsalemello mannar Rómearon.

ENGLISH: And who went before him and who came behind him cried: “Hosanna! Blessed be who is coming in the name of the Lord!
QUENYA: Ar i lender epe se ar i túler ca se yámer: “Hosanna! Na aistana ye túla i Héruo essenen!

ENGLISH: Was there no one who returned to give glory to God, except this man from another nation?”
QUENYA: Ma enge úquen ye nanwenne antien alcar Erun, hequa nér sina hyana nórello?”

ENGLISH: When the days of purification were completed by the Law of Moses, they brought him to Jerusalem to place him before the Lord,
QUENYA: Íre i auri poiciéva náner telyaine Móseo Şanyenen, tallettes Yerúsalemenna panien se epe i Héru,

ENGLISH: He said: “The Jews together have made a plan that they will ask that tomorrow you will bring Paul down to the High Council, as if they want to learn more certainly what he has done.
QUENYA: Hé quente: “I Yúrar uo acárier pano in arcuvalte in enwa taluval Paulo undu i Tára Combenna, ve qui merilte pare ambe tancave mana acáries.

ENGLISH: by him was life, and the life was the light of men.
QUENYA: sénen coivie né, ar i coivie náne Atanion cala.

ENGLISH: The other Jews also followed him in hypocrisy, until also Barnabas was led away with them in their hypocrisy.
QUENYA: I hyane Yúrar yando hilyaner se imnetiesse, tenna yando Varnavas náne tulyaina oa aselte imnetieltasse.

ENGLISH: Then a mighty storm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, until the boat was near to being filled.
QUENYA: Tá túrea raumo oronte, ar i falmar penter mir i lunte, tenna i lunte náne hare návenna quátina.

ENGLISH: When they fell upon a place where the sea struck from both directions, they brought the ship onto ground. The prow was fixed and could not move, but the back of the ship was broken into pieces by the violence of the sea.
QUENYA: Íre lantanelte nómenna yanna ear pente yúyo tiello, tallelte i cirya talamenna. I lango náne tanca ar ua polde leve, mal i ciryo ponte náne rácina mir rantar ormenen i earo.

ENGLISH: Then, quickly, he compelled his disiples to go into the boat and go before him to the other shore, while he sent the crowds away.
QUENYA: Tá, lintiénen, mauyanes hildoryar mene mir i lunte ar lelya epe se i hyana fáranna, íre mentanes i şangar oa.

ENGLISH: Thus we see that they might not come in because of lack of faith.
QUENYA: Sie cenilve i ualte lertane tule minna peniénen saviéva.

ENGLISH: They brought them and put them before the High Council. And the chief priest said: “We gave you the command: Cease to teach in this name! And yet, behold! you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and you want to bring this man's blood upon us!”
QUENYA: Talleltet ar panyaner te epe i Tára Combe. Ar i héra airimo quente: “Antanelme len i canwa: Á pusta peanta esse sinasse! Ananta, yé! aquátielde Yerúsalem peantieldanen, ar merilde tala ner sino serce menna!”

ENGLISH: and all ate the same food of spirit,
QUENYA: ar illi manter i imya matta faireva,

ENGLISH: One person has faith to eat everything, but who is weak eats vegetables.
QUENYA: Er quén same savie matien ilqua, mal ye milya ná mate quear.

ENGLISH: But the chief priests and the elders talked the crowds into requesting Barabbas, but that they were to destroy Jesus.
QUENYA: Mal i hére airimor ar i amyárar mirquenter i şangar arcienna Varavas, mal i nancarumnelte Yésus.

ENGLISH: But after evening came, people brought to him many that were possessed by demons, and he threw out the demons with a word, and he healed all that were suffering,
QUENYA: Mal apa şinye túle, queni taller senna rimbali i náner haryane lo raucor, ar et-hantes i raucor quettanen, ar nestanes illi i perpéraner,

ENGLISH: for he is before all things, and all things were by him caused to exist,
QUENYA: ar sé ea nó ilye nati, ar ilye nati sénen náner tyárine ea,

ENGLISH: The scribe said to him: “Teacher, you spoke well as is true: He is one, and there is nobody except him;
QUENYA: I parmangolmo quente senna: “Peantar, quentel mai ve nanwa ná: Náse er, ar ea úquen hequa sé;

ENGLISH: But he denied it, saying: “I do not know him, woman!”
QUENYA: Mal laquentes sa, quétala: “Uan ista se, nís!”

ENGLISH: Anything that you do, work with your entire soul, as for the Lord and not for men.
QUENYA: Aiqua ya carilde, mola quanda fealdanen, ve i Herun ar lá atanin.

ENGLISH: how they said to you: «In the last time will come people speaking mockery, walking in their own desires of wicked things.»
QUENYA: manen quentelte lenna: «I métima lúmesse tuluvar quelli quétala yaiwe, vantala vére íreltassen olce nativa.»

ENGLISH: And the multitude from the cities surrounding Jerusalem assembled, carrying sick ones and that were being tormented by unclean spirits, and everyone among them was healed.
QUENYA: Ar i liyúme i ostollon pelila Yerúsalem ocomne, cólala hlaiwali ar i náner nwalyaine lo úpoice fairi, ar ilquen mici te náne nestana.

ENGLISH: And he said to him: “Jesus, recall me when you come in your kingdom!”
QUENYA: Ar quentes senna: “Yésus, áni enyale íre tulil aranielyasse!”

ENGLISH: And when he saw their faith he said: “Man, your sins are forgiven you!”
QUENYA: Ar íre cennes savielta quentes: “Atan, úcarelyar nar apsénine lyen!”

ENGLISH: By faith he made the Passover and the splashing of the blood, to stop the Destroyer from touching their firstborn.
QUENYA: Saviénen carnes i Lahtie ar i palastie i serceva, pustien i Nancarindo appiello minnónaltar.

ENGLISH: He said: “Therefore may the mighty among you come down to speak of his crimes, if there is anything irregular about him.”
QUENYA: Eques: “Etta nai i taurar mici le tuluvar undu quetien pa ongweryar, qui ea aiqua úşanya pa se.”

ENGLISH: For this reason I therefore requested to see you and to speak to you, for by reason of the hope of Israel I am carrying this chain.”
QUENYA: Casta sinanen etta arcanen le-vele ar quete lenna, an castanen i estelo Israélo cólan limil sina.”

ENGLISH: But when the Sun arose, they were burnt , and for lacking root they withered.
QUENYA: Mal íre Anar oronte, anelte urtaine, ar peniénen şundo hestanelte.

ENGLISH: and cover yourselves with the new man, who by knowledge is renewed by the image of who created him.
QUENYA: ar topa inde i vinya atannen, ye istyanen ná envinyanta i emmanen yeo ontane se.

ENGLISH: But Silas thought it was good for him to tarry there.
QUENYA: Ono Sílas sanne i náne mára sen lemya tasse.

ENGLISH: Has anyone among the rulers or Pharisees believed in him?
QUENYA: Ma aiquen imíca i turcor hya Farisar asávie sesse?

ENGLISH: concerning which I have been set aside as a herald and an apostle and a teacher.
QUENYA: pa ya inye anaie sátina ve tercáno ar apostel ar peantar.

ENGLISH: It is terrible to fall into the hands of the living God!
QUENYA: Ná rúcima lantie mir i coirea Eruo mát!

ENGLISH: and Amon begat Jeconiah and his brothers, at the time that the people was led away as exiles to Babel .
QUENYA: ar Yosía óne Yeconya ar hánoryar, i lúmesse ya i lie náne tulyana oa ve etyar Vávelenna.

ENGLISH: Now the apostles and the brother that were in Judea heard that some non-Jews also received God's word.
QUENYA: Sí i aposteli ar i hánor i enger Yúreasse hlasser in Úyúrali yú camner Eruo quetta.

ENGLISH: and they will thrown them into the oven of fire. There will be their tears and their grinding of teeth.
QUENYA: ar hatuvaltet mir i urna náreva. Tasse euvar nieltar ar mulielta nelciva.

ENGLISH: knowing that such a person has turned himself from the path and is sinning, being judged by himself.
QUENYA: istala i taite quén equériexe i tiello ar úcára, nála námina insenen.

ENGLISH: Christ as well died a single time concerning sins, a righteous person on behalf of unrighteous ones, for it to be possible for him to bring you to God, after he saw death in the flesh, but was made alive by the spirit.
QUENYA: Yando Hristo qualle erya lú pa úcari, faila quén rá úfailain, ecien sen le-tulya Erunna, apa cennes qualme i hrávesse, mal náne carna coirea i fairenen.

ENGLISH: Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine will be like an intelligent man, who built his house on the rock.
QUENYA: Etta ilquen ye hlare sine quettanyar nauva ve handa nér, ye carastane coarya i ondosse.

ENGLISH: Thus Jesus, when he saw that she cried, and that the Jews who were with her cried, groaned in his spirit and was shaken.
QUENYA: Sie Yésus, íre cennes i nítanes, ar i nítaner i Yúrar i enger óse, ñónane faireryasse ar náne pálina.

ENGLISH: You do not have a part or a portion in this matter, for your heart is not straight before God.
QUENYA: Ualye same ranta hya masse mi natto sina, an endalya ua téra epe Eru.

ENGLISH: The second one is similar: You shall love your neighbor as yourself.
QUENYA: I attea vávea ná: Alye mele armarolya ve imle.

ENGLISH: What he has seen and he has heard, about that he witnesses, but no one receives his witness.
QUENYA: Ya ecénies ar ahláries, pa ta vettas, mal úquen came vettierya.

ENGLISH: But "my righteous one shall have life by his faith", but if "he pulls himself away, my soul does not have joy by him".
QUENYA: Mal "failanya samuva coivie saviénen", ono qui "tucis inse oa, feanya ua same alasse sénen".

ENGLISH: Thereafter I saw four angels standing in the four corners of earth, holding back the four winds of earth, to stop wind from blowing on earth or at sea or at every tree.
QUENYA: Epeta cennen vali canta tárala i vincassen canta cemeno, avaleryala i súri canta cemeno, pustien súre hlapuyello cemende hya earesse hya ilya aldasse.

ENGLISH: In the same manner also the chief priests, one with the other, laughed at him with scorn with the scribes, saying: “Others he has saved; himself he cannot save.
QUENYA: Mí imya lé yando i hére airimor, quén as i exe, lander senna yaiwenen as i parmangolmor, quétala: “Exeli erehties; inse uas pole rehta.

ENGLISH: Through Silvanus, whom I count as a faithful brother, I have written in few words, urging and witnessing that this is the true grace of God; stand firm in it.
QUENYA: Ter Silváno, ye notin ve voronda háno, etécien mance quettalissen, hortala ar vettala i si ná i nanwa lisse Eruo; tara tulce sasse.

ENGLISH: Then they kept a fast and prayed and put their hands upon them and let them go.
QUENYA: Tá hempelte lamate ar hyamner ar panyaner máltat tunna ar láver tun lelya.

ENGLISH: And if anyone says to you: What is your reason for doing this?, then say: The Lord has need of it, and soon he will send it back.”
QUENYA: Ar qui aiquen quete lenta: Mana castasta carien si? – tá queta: I Heru same maure séva, ar rongo se-nanwentuvas.”

ENGLISH: When others spoke to him with scorn, he did not speak with scorn to them. When he was tormented, he did not threaten, but put his case before who judges justly.
QUENYA: Íre exeli caramper senna yaiwenen, uas carampe yaiwenen téna. Íre anes ñwalyaina, uas ordane, mal panyane nattorya epe ye name failave.

ENGLISH: May everyone remain in the condition in which he was called.
QUENYA: Nai ilquen lemyuva i sómasse yasse anes yálina.

ENGLISH: And the story about him went into all of Syria, and they brought to him all ill ones, tormented by illnesses and by torments of many kinds: demon-possessed ones and moon-sick ones and impeded ones – and he healed them.
QUENYA: Ar i nyarie pa se lende mir quanda Síria, ar tulunelte senna ilye engwar, nwalyaine hlívelínen ar nwalmelínen rimbe nostaleron: raucoharyainali ar ránahlaiwali ar taptali – ar nestanes te.

ENGLISH: But nobody among who were lying by the table knew the reason why he said this to him.
QUENYA: Mal úquen imíca i cainer ara i sarno sinte i casta yanen quentes si senna.

ENGLISH: Blessed be the coming kingdom of David our father! Hosanna in the high places!”
QUENYA: Na aistana i túlala aranie Lavir atarelvo! Hosanna i tarmenissen!”

ENGLISH: But its mother answered and said: “No, but its name shall be John.”
QUENYA: Mal amillerya hanquente ar eque: “Vá, mal esserya nauva Yoháno.”

ENGLISH: and that he was brought to his grave, and he has been raised up on the third day as the Scripture says,
QUENYA: ar in anes talana sapsaryanna, ar anaies ortana ama i neldea auresse ve i Tehtele quete,

ENGLISH: From the fig tree learn this comparison: As soon as its branch is made soft and it sprouts its leaves, you know summer is near.
QUENYA: I relyávaldallo para sestie sina: Ve rongo ve olvarya olle musse ar tuias lasseryar, istalde laire hare ná.

ENGLISH: In answer Jesus said to them: “ that have health do not have need of a healer, but that are sickly.
QUENYA: Hanquentasse Yésus quente téna: “I samir mále uar same maure nestondova, mal i nar engwe.

ENGLISH: And I saw another angel rising from the sunrise, having the seal of the Living God, and he cried with a mighty voice to the four angels to whom was permitted to harm earth and sea,
QUENYA: Ar cennen hyana vala ortala anarórello, arwa i lihto Eru Coireáva, ar yámes taura ómanen i valannar canta in náne lávina mala cemen earye,

ENGLISH: Then what? If some persons among them failed to believe, does their lack of belief perhaps make God's faithfulness without power?
QUENYA: Tá mana? Qui ennoli mici te loitaner save, ma penielta saviéva cé care Eruo voronwe pen túre?

ENGLISH: For anyone who desires to save his life, to him it will be lost; but anyone whose life is lost for my sake , will find it.
QUENYA: An aiquen ye mere rehta cuilerya, sen nauvas vanwa; mal aiquen yeo cuile ná vanwa márienyan, hiruva sa.

ENGLISH: And it opened its mouth in mockeries against God, to speak mockeries against his name and against his abode, and of who dwell in heaven.
QUENYA: Ar latyanes antorya yaiwessen Erunna, quetien yaiwi esseryanna ar vehteryanna, ar innar marir menelde.

ENGLISH: except that in every city the Holy Spirit witnesses to me that bonds and tribulations are waiting for me.
QUENYA: hequa in ilya ostosse i Aire Fea vetta nin i núteli ar şangiéli hópar nin.

ENGLISH: What, then, am I do say? That that which has been sacrificed to an idol is an actual thing, or that the idol is an actual thing?
QUENYA: Mana, tá, quetuvan? I ta ya anaie yácina cordonen anwa nat ná, hya i cordon anwa nat ná?

ENGLISH: And they went. Again he went out around the sixth and the ninth hour, and he did the same thing.
QUENYA: Ar lendelte. Ata lendes ettenna os i enquea ar i nertea lúme, ar carnes i imya nat.

ENGLISH: since you are receiving the goal of your faith, the salvation of your souls.
QUENYA: pan cámalde i met savieldo, i rehtie fealdaivar.

ENGLISH: Therefore you are to know – men, brothers – that through this man the forgiveness of sins is made known to you.
QUENYA: Etta alde ista – neri, hánor – i ter nér sina i apsenie úcariva ná len carna sinwa.

ENGLISH: For you followed in our path and in the Lord's path, receiving the word in harsh tribulation, having joy by Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: Ar hilyanelde tielmasse ar i Heruo tiesse, camila i quetta mi naraca şangie, arwe alasseo Aire Feanen.

ENGLISH: While they were in wonder about this, behold! two men with radiant garments stood beside them.
QUENYA: Íre anelte elmendasse pa si, yé! nér atta arwe alcarinque larmar tarnet ara te.

ENGLISH: and who devour the houses of widows and make long prayers in order to be seen by others. They will receive a heavier judgment.”
QUENYA: ar i ammatir verulóraron coar ar carir ande hyamier náven cénine lo exi. Té camuvar ambe lunga námie.”

ENGLISH: Do you think that I have come to give peace on earth? No, I say to you, but division!
QUENYA: Ma sanalde i utúlien antien raine cemende? Ui, quetin lenna, mal şancie!

ENGLISH: Anyone who has broken the Law of Moses dies without mercy, when are two or three that are witnesses.
QUENYA: Aiquen ye arácie Móseo Şanye quale ú oraviéno, íre ear atta hya nelde i náner astarmor.

ENGLISH: But behold! on the same day two among them were on their way to a city called Emmaus, two and a quarter leagues from Jerusalem,
QUENYA: Mal yé! i imya auresse atta mici te nánet tiettasse mastonna estaina Emmaus, lár atta ar canasta Yerúsalemello,

ENGLISH: I tell you: In that night two will be in one bed; one will be brought , but the other will be abandoned.
QUENYA: Nyarin lenna: Mi enta lóme atta euvat er caimasse; er nauva talaina, mal i exe nauva hehtaina.

ENGLISH: For in the law of Moses is written: “You are not to stop a bull from eating while it is crushing the grain.” Are bulls important to God?
QUENYA: An Móseo şanyesse ná técina: “Ávalye pusta mondo matiello lan rácas i ore.” Ma mondor nar valde Erun?

ENGLISH: Then he returned up, broke the bread and ate, and he talped until dawn and then went away.
QUENYA: Tá nanwennes ama, rance i massa ar mante, ar carampes tenna ára ar tá oante.

ENGLISH: And they requested of him that he would not send them into the abyss.
QUENYA: Ar arcanelte sello i ávas mentumne te mir i undume.

ENGLISH: But when Jeus heard it he said: “This illness is not for death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of Man will be glorified by it.”
QUENYA: Mal íre Yésus sa-hlasse quentes: “Hlíve sina ua qualmen, mal Eruo alcaren, i nauva i Atanyondo alcaryaina sanen.”

ENGLISH: Therefore be firm in your heart that you will not make plans beforehand about how you will speak for yourselves,
QUENYA: Etta na tance endaldasse i ualde caruva panor nóvo pa manen quetuvalde inden,

ENGLISH: and heal the sick ones in it, and tell them: 'God's kingdom has come near to you.'
QUENYA: ar á nesta i hlaiwar sasse, ar nyara tien: 'Eruo aranie utúlie hare lenna.'

ENGLISH: for I did not receive it from man or was instructed in it, except by revelation from Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: an inye ua camne sa ho atan hya náne peantaina sasse, hequa apantiénen Yésus Hristollo.

ENGLISH: But whenever you come into a city and they do not receive you, go into their broad ways and say:
QUENYA: Mal quiquie tulilde mir osto ar ualte came le, mena mir palle malleryar ar queta:

ENGLISH: And he stood above the woman and rebuked the fever, and that went away from her. In the same moment she arose and served for them.
QUENYA: Ar tarnes or i nís ar naityane i úre, ar ta oante sello. Mí imya lú orontes ar veuyane tien.

ENGLISH: For the grief that is of God causes a mind-change concerning which no one can have second thoughts, but the world's grief causes death.
QUENYA: An i nyére ya ná Eruo tyare inwis pa ya úquen pole same attie sanwi, mal i mardo nyére tyare qualme.

ENGLISH: For the heap of her sins reaches to heaven, and God has recalled her unrighteous deeds.
QUENYA: An i hahta úcareryaiva rahta menelenna, ar Eru enaiálie úfaile cardaryar.

ENGLISH: If your right eye seduces you, tear it out and throw it away from you! For if one among your body parts is lost, that is for you better than that your entire body is thrown into Gehenna.
QUENYA: Qui forya hendelya le-sahta, ása narca ettenna ar ása hate oa lyello! An qui er mici hroamittalyar vanwa ná, ta ná len arya epe i quanda hroalya ná hátina mir Ehenna.

ENGLISH: These are the two commandments by which the entire Law hangs, and the Prophets!”
QUENYA: Sine nát i axan atta yanten i quanda Şanye linga, ar i Erutercánor!”

ENGLISH: Always, at night and at day, he was among the graves and in the mountains, crying and beating himself with stones.
QUENYA: Illume, lómisse yo auresse, anes imíca i sapsar ar i orontissen, yámala ar palpala inse sarnínen.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, if you are calling to the Father who does not heed who anyone is, but judges as everyone's work is, behave with fear while you dwell as exiles.
QUENYA: Ente, qui yálalde i Atarenna ye ua cime man aiquen ná, mal name ve ilqueno mótie ná, á lenga ruciénen íre marilde ve etyali.

ENGLISH: and I make a covenant with you, like my Father has made with me a covenant, about a kingdom,
QUENYA: ar carin vére aselde, ve Atarinya acárie asinye vére, pa aranie,

QUENYA: Íre i canaquea lóme lantane ar anelme hátaine sir ar tar Arria-earesse, endesse i lómio i ciryamor intyaner i anelte túlala hare er norenna.

ENGLISH: And if Satan throws out Satan, he is split against himself; then how will his kingdom stand?
QUENYA: Ar qui Sátan et-hate Sátan, náse şanca insenna; tá manen aranierya taruva?

QUENYA: An ve réryar Noaħ náner, sie euva mí Atanyondo tulesse.

ENGLISH: And being angry, his lord gave him over to the jailers, until he was going to pay his entire debt.
QUENYA: Ar nála rúşea, herurya antane se ollo i mandonturin, tenna paityumnes quanda rohtarya.

ENGLISH: You have made known to me the paths of life; you will fill me with joy from your face.'
QUENYA: Acáriel sinwe nin i tier coiviéva; ni-quantuval alassenen cendelelyallo.'

QUENYA: Tá hínali náner talaine senna, panieryan máryat tesse ar hyamieryan tien, mal i hildor naityaner te.

QUENYA: Ar antanes queneli ve apostelli, queneli ve Erutercánoli, queneli quetien i evandilyon, queneli ve mavalli ar peantalli.

QUENYA: Nai ye same hlas hlaruva ya i Faire quete i ocombennar!”

ENGLISH: But if anyone wants strife, that is not our custom, or the custom of God's congregations.
QUENYA: Mal qui aiquen mere cos, ta ua haimelva, hya Eruo ocombion haime.

ENGLISH: And at a meeting with the elders they made consideration, and they gave a sufficient number of silver-pieces to the soldiers
QUENYA: Ar yomeniesse as i amyárar carnelte úvie, ar antanelte fárea nóte telpemittalíva i ohtarin

ENGLISH: that passed by blasphemed against him, shaking their heads
QUENYA: I lahtaner naiquenter senna, pálala cariltar

ENGLISH: For a camel to go through a needle's eye is easier than for a rich person to come into God's kingdom.”
QUENYA: Ulumpen mene ter nelmo assa ná ancárima lá lára quenen tule mir Eruo aranie.”

ENGLISH: For this is God's will: By doing good stop the witless talk of people that lack knowledge!
QUENYA: An si ná Eruo indóme: Cariénen márie á pusta i úhandea carpie quenion i penir istya!

ENGLISH: After the angel who spoke to him went away, he called two of the servants of his house and a reverent soldier from among those that remained with him,
QUENYA: Apa i vala ye quente senna lende oa, yaldes atta i núroron coaryo ar ainocimya ohtar ho imíca i lemner óse,

ENGLISH: And Pilate judged that they were going to get what they wanted.
QUENYA: Ar Piláto namne i ñetumnelte ya mernelte.

ENGLISH: it is necessary for the women to be silent in the congrations, for is not permitted to them to speak, but it is necessary that they are in subjection , as the Law also says.
QUENYA: mauya i nissin náve quilde i ocombessen, an ua lávaina tien quete, mal mauya i nalte nu túre, ve i Şanye yú quete.

ENGLISH: Fot this thing is my choice: that I will not come to you again in grief.
QUENYA: An nat sina ná cilmenya: i uan tuluva lenna ata nyéresse.

ENGLISH: “I the true vine, and my Father is the cultivator.
QUENYA: ”Inye i nanwa liantasse, ar Atarinya i alamo ná.

ENGLISH: Also, do not test the Lord, as some among them tested him and were destroyed by the serpents.
QUENYA: Ente, ávalve tyasta i Héru, ve ennoli mici té tyasanter se ar náner nancarne i leucainen.

ENGLISH: Therefore, holy brothers who have a part in the calling to heaven, give heed to the apostle and chief priest that we confess – Jesus.
QUENYA: Etta, airi hánor i samir ranta i yaliénó menelenna, cima i apostel ar héra airimo ye etequentalve – Yésus.

ENGLISH: Jesus answered him: “I have spoken to the world openly. Always I taught in synagogue and in the temple, where all Jews come together, and I said nothing in secret.
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente senna: “Acarpien i mardenna pantave. Illume peantanen yomencoasse ar i cordasse, yasse ilye Yúrar tulir uo, ar quenten munta nuldiesse.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, when he sat on the seat of judgement, his wife sent to him, saying: “May there be nothing between you and that righteous man, for I had great pain today in a dream concerning him!”
QUENYA: Ente, íre hamnes i hammasse namiéva, verirya mentane senna, quétala: “Nai nauva munta imbi lyé ar tana faila nér, an sámen túra naice síra oloresse pa sé!”

ENGLISH: For in this our home we do groan, longing to put on ourselves our heavenly home.
QUENYA: An marelma sinasse é ñonalme, milyala panya immesse meneldea marelma.

ENGLISH: And Peter, finding himself, said: “Now I know that the Lord sent his angel and delivered me from Herod's hand and from everything that the people of the Jews is waiting for.»
QUENYA: Ar Péter, hírala inse, quente: “Sí istan i mentane i Heru valarya ar ni-etelehtane ho Herolo má ar ilquallo ya i Yúralie hópa.”

ENGLISH: Thus his parents answered: “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind.
QUENYA: Sie nostaryat hanquentet: “Istamme i si ná yondomma ar i anes nóna lomba.

ENGLISH: and said: These last ones have worked a single hour, and yet you give them the same that you give to us that have carried the burden of the day and the heat!
QUENYA: ar quenter: “Métimar sine omólier erya lúme, ananta antal tien i imya ya antal men i ocólier i aureo cólo ar i úre!”

ENGLISH: And yet he did not answer him, not with a single word. Therefore the governor had great wonder.
QUENYA: Ananta uas hanquente senna, lá erya quettanen. Etta i nórecáno sáme túra elmenda.

ENGLISH: But it is not so among you. On the contrary, for anyone who wishes to be great among you it is necessary to be your servant,
QUENYA: Mal ua ea sie mici lé. Úsie, aiquenen ye mere náve túra mici lé mauya náve núrolda,

ENGLISH: But the scribes and the Pharisees brought to him a woman seized in adultery. Placing her in their midst
QUENYA: Mal i ingolmor ar i Farisar tuluner senna nís mapaina úpuhtiesse. Panyala se endeltasse

ENGLISH: And for three days he saw nothing, and he did not eat or drink.
QUENYA: Ar ter rí nelde cennes munta, ar uas mante hya sunce.

ENGLISH: Now they were on the road rising towards Jerusalem, and Jesus went before them. And they were in wonder, but who followed were afraid. Again he brought the twelve to a private place and began to speak to them about that were going to happen to him: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be given over to the chief priests and to the scribes, and they shall judge him to death and give him over to the gentiles,
QUENYA: Sí anelte i mallesse ortala Yerúsalemenna, ar Yésus lende epe te. Ar anelte elmendasse, mal i hilyaner runcer. Ata talles i yunque véra nómenna ar yestane carpa téna pa yar martumner sen: “Yé, lelyealve ama Yerúsalemenna, ar i Atanyondo nauva antaina olla i hére airimoin ar i parmangolmoin, ar namuvaltes qualmen ar antuvar se olla i nóreain,

ENGLISH: Therefore it is possible for him also to completely save who come to God through him, since he is always alive, to petition for them.
QUENYA: Etta ece sen yando aqua rehta i tulir Erunna ter sé, pan náse illume coirea, arcien tien.

ENGLISH: And running beforehand to a place before them, he climbed into a sycamore tree, to see him, for Jesus was going to pass by that place.
QUENYA: Ar nórala nóvo nómenna epe te, rentes mir vilwarinda alda, cenien se, an Yésus langumne sana nóme.

ENGLISH: But concerning him I have nothing certain to write to my lord. Therefore I brought him out before you, and above all before you, King Agrippa: After the interrogation I will know what I am to write.
QUENYA: Mal pa sé samin munta tanca tecien herunyanna. Etta ettallenyes epe lé, ar or illi epe elye, Aran Árippa: Apa i ceşie istuvan mana tecuvan.

ENGLISH: Indeed the good fruit that was your soul's desire has passed away from you, and all the dainty things and the beautiful things are lost to you, and one will not ever find them again.
QUENYA: É i mára yáve ya náne fealyo íre oantie lyello, ar ilye i netye nati ar i calwe nati nar vanwe lyen, ar mo ua oi enhiruva tai.

ENGLISH: With what am I to compare this generation? They are like children sitting in the market places , crying to the other children: 'We played the flute for you, but you did not dance; we were wailing, but you did not beat yourselves in grief.'
QUENYA: As mana sestuvan nónare sina? Nalte ve híni hámala i mancanómessen, yámala i hyane hínannar: 'Tyaldelme i simpe len, mal ualde liltane; anelme yaimie, mal ualde pente inde nairesse.'

ENGLISH: And yet I hold a few matters against you, that there are with you who keep the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak to put a stumbling block before the sons of Israel, and so they ate that were sacrificed to idols and fornicated.
QUENYA: Ananta samin nótime nattoli ana lye, in ear aselye i hepir i peantave Valamo, ye peantane Valacen panie sar taltiéva epe Israelindi, ar sie mantelte yar náner yácine cordonin ar hrupuhtaner.

ENGLISH: And another sign was seen in heaven, and behold! a huge fiery-red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and on its heads it has seven diadems.
QUENYA: Ar hyana tanwa náne cénina menelde, ar yé! hoa narwa hlóce, arwa carion otso ar rassion quean, ar caryassen samis şarnuntar otso.

ENGLISH: Then Ananias the chief priest commanded that stood by him that they were to strike him on the mouth.
QUENYA: Tá Ananías i héra airimo canne in tarner ara se i petumneltes i antosse.

ENGLISH: Thus your tested faith, far more valuable than gold that is corruptible though it is tested by fire, will be found a cause of praise and glory and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: Sie tyastaina savielda, mirwa ambela malta ya ná hastima ómu nas tyastaina nárenen, nauva hírina ve casta laitaleo ar alcaro ar laitiéno i apantiesse Yésus Hristova.

ENGLISH: And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they could destroy him, since they feared the people.
QUENYA: Ar i hére airimor ar i parmangolmor cestaner manen pollelte nancaritas, pan runcelte i liello.

ENGLISH: But was a beggar whose name was Lazarus, placed by his gate, full of ulcers.
QUENYA: Mal enge iquindo yeo esse náne Lásaro, panyaina ara andorya, quanta sistelínen.

ENGLISH: For you were at that time without Christ, foreign to the kindred of Israel and strangers to the covenants of the promise, and you did not have hope and were without God in the world.
QUENYA: An anelde mi yana lúme ú Hristo, ettelie nossen Israélo ar ettelear i vérin i vandava, ar ualde sáme estel ar náner ú Eruo i mardesse.

ENGLISH: For indeed by one spirit we were all baptized into one body – not heeding if we are Jews or Greeks, not heeding if we are thralls or free ones. And all among us received the same spirit to drink.
QUENYA: An é er fairenen anelve illi sumbane mir er hroa – lá címala qui nalve Yúrar hya Hellenyar, lá címala qui nalve móli hya lérar. Ar illi mici vi camner i imya faire sucien.

ENGLISH: Thus tongues are a sign, not to that believe, but to that do not believe; but speaking as a prophet is not for that do not believe, but for that believe.
QUENYA: Sie lambi nar tanwa, lá in savir, mal in uar save; ono quetie ve Erutercáno ua in uar save, mal in savir.

ENGLISH: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
QUENYA: Ar i hildo atta hlasset se quéta, ar hilyanette Yésus.

ENGLISH: and said to them: “Anyone who receives this child in my name receives me, and anyone who receives me receives the one who sent me. The smallest among you is the greatest.”
QUENYA: ar quente téna: “Aiquen ye came hína sina essenyasse came ní, ar aiquen ye came ní came ye ni-mentane. I ampitya mici le ná i antúra.”

ENGLISH: For when anyone says: “I am for Paul”, but another: “I am for Apollos”, do you not behave like men?
QUENYA: An íre aiquen quete: “Inye ná Paulon,” mal exe: “Inye ná Apollon”, ma ualde lenga ve atani?

ENGLISH: But when he said to them: “I he,” they stood back and fell to the ground.
QUENYA: Mal íre quentes téna: “Inye sé”, nantarnelte ar lantaner i talamenna.

ENGLISH: For in that day you will not ask me about anything. Truly, truly I say to you: Anything that you pray for from the Father in my name he will give to you.
QUENYA: Ar aure entasse ualde maquetuva ninna pa aiqua. Násie, násie quetin lenna: Aiqua ya arcalde i Atarello essenyanen antuvas len.

ENGLISH: Therefore many of the Jews who had come to Mary and saw what he did believed in him.
QUENYA: Etta rimbali i Yúraron i náner túlienwe Maríanna ar cenner ya carnes sáver sesse.

ENGLISH: But he said: “Truly I say to you that there is not prophet that is well received in his own region.
QUENYA: Mal eques: “Násie quetin lenna i ua ea Erutercáno ye ná mai cámina véra ménaryasse.

ENGLISH: And do not be called leaders, for you have a single Leader, the Christ.
QUENYA: Ar áva na estaine tulyandor, an samilde erya Tulyando, i Hristo.

ENGLISH: Everyone who lacks the Son also lacks the Father. who confesses the Son confesses also the Father.
QUENYA: Ilquen ye pene i Yondo yando pene i Atar. Ye etequenta i Yondo etequenta yando i Atar.

ENGLISH: But the Jews that did not believe stirred up the non-Jews and made them hostile against the brothers.
QUENYA: Mal i Yúrar i uar sáve valtaner i Úyúrar ar carner te cotye i hánonnar.

ENGLISH: Jesus did also many other signs before the disciples, that are not written in this book;
QUENYA: Yésus carne yando rimbe hyane tannali epe i hildor, yar uar técine parma sinasse;

ENGLISH: asking that the God of Jesus Christ our Lord will give you a spirit of wisdom and revelation for you to have knowledge about him,
QUENYA: arcala i Yésus Hristo Herulvo Aino antuva len faire sailiéva ar apantiéva samieldan istya pa se,

ENGLISH: Therefore I wish that you know that nobody, when he is speaking by God's spirit, can say: “Jesus is accursed!”, and no one can say: “Jesus is Lord”, except by Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: Etta merin in istalde in úquen, íre quétas Eruo fairenen, pole quete: “Yésus húna ná!”, ar úquen pole quete: “Yésus Heru ná“, hequa Aire Feanen.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, people will not say: 'See here!' or 'There!' For behold, God's kingdom exists in your midst.”
QUENYA: Ente, queni uar quetuva: 'Cena sisse!' hya 'Tasse!' An yé, Eruo aranie ea endeldasse.”

ENGLISH: And if you do good to that do good to you, how will that be beneficial for you? Also the sinners do the same.
QUENYA: Ar qui carilde márie in carir márie elden, manen ta nauva aşea len? Yando i úcarindor carir i imya.

ENGLISH: But Jerusalem on High is free, and she is our mother.
QUENYA: Mal Yerúsalem Tarmende ná léra, ar sé amillelva ná.

ENGLISH: For everyone asking receives, and everyone seeking finds, and to everyone knocking will be opened.
QUENYA: An ilquen arcala came, ar ilquen cestala hire, ar ilquenen tambala nauva latyana.

ENGLISH: But he went away into the deserts, praying.
QUENYA: Ono lendes oa mir i erumi, hyámala.

ENGLISH: When the ten others heard about this, they were angry with the two brothers.
QUENYA: Íre i exi quean hlasser pa si, anelte rúşie i háno attanna.

ENGLISH: After cleansing your souls by heeding the truth, which gives brotherly love without hypocrisy, love one another profoundly from the heart.
QUENYA: Apa poitie fealdar cimiénen i nanwie, ya anta hánonilme ú etyanetiéno, mela quén i exe tumnave i endallo.

ENGLISH: Therefore, if the Son frees you, you will indeed be free.
QUENYA: Etta, qui i Yondo le-lerya, é nauvalde lére.

ENGLISH: If you forgive peoples’ sins, they are forgiven them; if you retain peoples’ sins, they are retained.”
QUENYA: Qui apsenilde quenion úcari, nalte apsénine tien; qui tulcalde quenion úcari, nalte tulcaine.”

ENGLISH: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called the Twin, was not with them when Jesus came.
QUENYA: Mal Tomas, quén i yunqueo, estaina i Onóno, úme aselte íre Yésus túle.

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to her: “Woman, what do I have with you? My hour still has not come.”
QUENYA: Mal eque senna Yésus: “Nís, mana samin asetye? Lúmenya en ua utúlie.”

ENGLISH: For from them arise that cleverly enter into houses and snare frail women that carry a burden of sin, led by various desires.
QUENYA: An ho té ortar i fincave tulir mir coar ar rembar nípe nissi i colir cólo úcariva, tulyaine lo alavéle íreli.

ENGLISH: Paul, apostle of Jesus Christ through God's will, and Timothy our brother, to God's congregation which is in Corith, with all the holy ones that are in all of Achaia:
QUENYA: Paulo, Yésus Hristo apostel ter Eruo indóme, ar Timoşeo hánolma, Eruo ocombenna ya ea Corintesse, as ilye i airi i ear mí quanda Acaia:

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to them: “I ask of you: Is it allowed on the day of rest to do good or to do evil, to save a person or to destroy him?”
QUENYA: Tá Yésus quente téna: “Maquetin lello: Ma ná lávina i sendaresse care márie hya care ulco, rehta quén hya nancare se?”

ENGLISH: He had his haunt among the graves, and until that time no one yet could bind him, also not with fetters.
QUENYA: Sámes vehterya imíca i sapsar, ar tenna lúme yana úquen ena polde nutitas, yando lá naxainen.

ENGLISH: Keep your mind on yourself and on your teaching! Remain in these things, for so doing you save yourself and that listen to you alike.
QUENYA: Hepa sámalya imlesse ar peantielyasse! Á lemya sine natissen, an sie cárala rehtal imle ar i lastar lyenna véla.

ENGLISH: All their doings they do in order to be seen by men, for they make their phylacteries broad and their fringes broad.
QUENYA: Ilye carieltar carilte náven cénine lo atani, an carilte colcalleltar palle ar laniltar hoe.

ENGLISH: And behold! the curtain in the temple was torn into two, from top to bottom, and the earth shook, and the rocks were split.
QUENYA: Ar yé! i fanwa i cordasse náne narcana mir atta, telmello talmanna, ar i cemen palle, ar i ondor náner şance.

ENGLISH: They said to him: “John's discipels frequently fast and make supplications, but your ones eat and drink.”
QUENYA: Quentelte senna: “Hildoryar Yoháno rimbave avamatir ar carir arcandeli, mal lyenyar matir ar sucir.”

ENGLISH: If anybody does not remain in me, he is thrown outside as a branch and is dried , and people gather those branches and throw them into the fire, and they are burnt.
QUENYA: Qui aiquen ua lemya nisse, náse hátina etsenna ve olva ar ná parahtaina, ar queni hostar tane olvar ar hatir tai mir i ruine, ar nalte urtaine.

ENGLISH: For God said: 'Give glory to your father and to your mother', and: 'Anyone who speaks evil about father or mother, will without fail die.'
QUENYA: An Eru quente: 'Á anta alcar atarelyan yo amillelyan,' ar: 'Aiquen ye quete ulco pa atar hya amil, é qualuva.'

ENGLISH: And yet in the congreation I want to speak five words with my mind above ten thousand words in a tongue.
QUENYA: Ananta i ocombesse merin quete quettar lempe sámanyanen or quettar húmi quean lambesse.

ENGLISH: But they did not understand the saying that he said to them.
QUENYA: Mal uatte hanyane i quetie ya quentes túna.

ENGLISH: We know that God causes all things to work together for who love God, for their good – the that are called for his purpose.
QUENYA: Istalve in Eru tyare ilye nati mole uo in melir Eru, márieltan – i nar yáline enneryan.

ENGLISH: And they came to Bethsaida. Here people carried to him a blind man, and they petitioned of him to touch him.
QUENYA: Ar túlelte Vetsairanna. Sisse queni coller senna lomba nér, ar arcanelte sello appa se.

ENGLISH: Then the soldiers cut the ropes of the boat and let it float way.
QUENYA: Tá i ohtari cirner i rappar i lunteo ar láver san lutta oa.

ENGLISH: If the world hates you, you know that it hated me before you.
QUENYA: Qui i mar yelta le, istalde i yeltanes ní nó le.

ENGLISH: It is necessary that a person tests himself, and thereafter he may eat of the bread and drink from the cup.
QUENYA: Mauya i quén tyasta inse, ar epeta lertas mate i masso ar suce i yulmallo.

ENGLISH: And from the angel’s hand, before God, the smoke from the incense rose with the prayers of the holy ones.
QUENYA: Ar ho i valo má, epe Eru, i usque i nisqueo oronte as i hyamier i airion.

ENGLISH: For in every place where people do not heed you, when you are going away from that city shake the dust from your feet as a witness to them.”
QUENYA: Ar mi ilya nóme yasse queni uar cime le, íre autealde sana ostollo á pala i asto taluldalto ve vettie tien.”

ENGLISH: And they petitioned him, saying: “Send us into the pigs, so we can come into them!”
QUENYA: Ar arcanelte sello, quétala: “Áme menta mir i polcar, tulielman mir té.”

ENGLISH: Take heed, be awake, for you do not know when the hour shall come.
QUENYA: Cima, na coive, an ualde ista i lú yasse tuluva i lúme.

ENGLISH: He went into God's house, at the time of Abiathar the High Priest, and ate the breads of showing, which are not permitted food for anyone except for the priests, and he gave also to the men that were with him.”
QUENYA: Lendes mir coarya Eru, Avyaşar i Héra Airimo lúmesse, ar manter i mastar taniéva, yar uar lávina matta aiquenen hequa i airimoin, ar antanes yando i nerin i náner óse.”

ENGLISH: But when he talked about justice and self-control and the coming judgement, Felix was scared and answered: “For this time go away, but when I have an opportunity, I will summon you again.”
QUENYA: Mal íre carampes pa failie ar immoturie ar i tulila namie, Felix náne ruhtana ar hanquente: “Lú sinan á auta, mal íre samin ecie, lye-tultuvan ata.”

ENGLISH: And again he denied it, with an oath: “I do not know the man!”
QUENYA: Ar ata laquentes ta, vandanen: “Uan ista i nér!”

ENGLISH: Beloved, you are doing a faithful work in everything that you do for the brothers, also for strangers,
QUENYA: Melda, cáral voronda molie ilquasse ya caril i hánoin, yando etteleain,

ENGLISH: Where is forgiveness of them , is no more sacrificing concerning sin.
QUENYA: Yasse ea apsenie taiva, ua ea en yacie pa úcare.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, we had the fathers of our flesh to give us chastisement, and we had awe for them. Will we not much more do well if we subject ourselves to the Father of spirits, in order to have life?
QUENYA: Ente, sámelve hrávelvo atari antien ven paimesta, ar sámelve áya tien. Lau ita ambe carilve mai qui panyalvexe nu i Atar fairion, samien coivie?

ENGLISH: May I not ever praise myself, except by the cross of Jesus Christ, by whom the world has been crucified for me, and I for the world.
QUENYA: Nai inye ua oi laituva imne, hequa i tarwenen Yésus Hristo, yenen i mar anaie atarwestaina inyen, ar inye i marden.

ENGLISH: But when I still exist in this tent I count proper to urge you, by causing you to remember.
QUENYA: Mal íre en ean mi lancoa sina notin vanima hortie le, tyariénen le enyale.

ENGLISH: and he did not allow anyone to carry a tool through the temple.
QUENYA: ar uas láve aiquenen cole tamma ter i corda.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “Come, you yourselves alone, to a lonely place and rest a little.” For numerous came and went, and they did not have time even to eat.
QUENYA: Ar quentes téna: “Tula, elde erinque, eressea nómenna ar sera pityave.” An rimbali túler ar oanter, ar ualte sáme lúme yando matien.

ENGLISH: for those days are days of vengeance, to make true all things that have been written.
QUENYA: an ente auri nar auri ahtariéva, carien nanwe ilye nati i anaier técine.

ENGLISH: Thus your fasting will not be visible to men, but to your Father who is in secret; and your Father, who secretly is watching, will pay you.
QUENYA: Sie lamatelta ua nauva cénima atanin, mal Atarelyan ye ea nuldasse; ar Atarelya, ye nuldave tíra, paityuva len.

ENGLISH: She was heavy with child, and she cries in her pains and in her agony to bear .
QUENYA: Anes lunga hínanen, ar yamas naiceryassen ar ñwalmeryasse colien.

ENGLISH: Now when they saw him they were in wonder, and his mother said to him: “Child, what is your reason for doing so to us? Behold, your father and I were tormented, seeking you!”
QUENYA: Sí íre cennettes anette elmendasse, ar amillerya quente senna: “Hína, mana castatya carien ment sie? Yé, ataretya yo inye nánet ñwalyaine, cestala tye!”

ENGLISH: We pray to God that you will do nothing evil, not to show that we have passed when we were tested, but for you to do good, even if will seem that we have failed.
QUENYA: Hyamilme Erunna i caruvalde munta ulca, lá tanien i elme alahtier íre anelme tyestaine, mal carieldan márie, yando qui şéyuva i elme oloitier.

ENGLISH: And Jesus said: “Then I as well will not tell you by what authority I to these things.”
QUENYA: Ar eque Yésus: “Tá yando inya ua quetuva lenna mana túrenen carin nati sine.”

ENGLISH: This man listened to Paul when he talked, and when Paul looked at him and saw that he had the faith to be healed,
QUENYA: Nér sina lastane Paulonna íre carampes, ar íre Paulo yente se ar cenne i sámes i savie náven nestana,

ENGLISH: Then they seized him andd led him away and brought him into the chief priests's house, but Peter followed nearby.
QUENYA: Tá nampeltes ar tulyane se oa ar talle se mir i héra airimo coa, mal Péter hilyane haiya.

ENGLISH: Therefore also I, Paul, who for Jesus Christ is in gaol on behalf of you that are of the nations ...
QUENYA: Etta yando inye, Paulo, ye Yésus Hriston mandosse ná rá elden i nar i nórion ...

ENGLISH: 'And in the last days,' God says, 'I will pour of my spirit upon all flesh, and your sons and your daughters will speak like prophets, and your young men will see visions, and your old men will dream dreams will be dreamt with dreams],
QUENYA: 'Ar i métime auressen,' Eru quete, 'ulyauvan fairenyo ilya hrávenna, ar yondoldar ar yeldeldar quetuvar ve Erutercánor, ar nesse nerildar cenuvar mauri, ar yáre nerildain óluva olollínen,

ENGLISH: Therefore in the same hour I sent to you, and you did well by coming here. And so in this hour all among us are here before God, to hear all the things that the Lord has commanded you to say.”
QUENYA: Etta mí imya lúme mentanen lyenna, ar carnel mai tuliénen sir. Ar sie lúme sinasse illi mici me nar sisse epe Eru, hlarien ilye i nati yar i Heru acánie lyen quete.”

ENGLISH: I am not worthy to still be called your son. Make me like one of the paid people that work for you.'
QUENYA: Uan valda en náven estaina yondotya. Áni care ve er i paityane quenion i molir tyen.'

ENGLISH: The Spirit and the bride are saying: “Come!”And let who hears say: “Come!” And let the thirsty one come; let the one who wishes, take the water of life for nothing.
QUENYA: I Faire ar i indis quétar: “Tula!” Ar lava yen hlare quete: “Tula!” Ar lava i soican tule; lava yen mere, mapa i nén coiviéva muntan.

ENGLISH: They shall not be hungry or thirsty again; the sun shall not strike them, or burning heat.
QUENYA: Ualte nauva maite hya soice ata; Anar ua petuva te, hya urtala úre.

ENGLISH: Happy are the pure of heart, for they shall see God!
QUENYA: Valime nar i poicar endo, an té cenuvar Eru!

ENGLISH: But he did not answer her a word. And his disciples came to him and petitioned of him, saying: “Send her away, for she is crying behind us!”
QUENYA: Mal isse ua hanquente senna quetta. Ar hildoryar túler senna ar arcaner senna, quétala: “Áse menta oa, an yámas ca vi!”

ENGLISH: After eating the food that we wanted, we made the ship less heavy by throwing the grain into the sea.
QUENYA: Apa matie i matta ya mernelte, carnelte i cirya mis lunga hatiénen i ore mir i ear.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, do not cause grief to God's holy spirit, by which you have been sealed for the day of ransom.
QUENYA: Ente, áva tyare nyére Eruo aire fean, yanen anaielde lihtaine i auren nanwereva.

ENGLISH: He boright his head in a dish and gave it to the maiden, and the maiden gave it to her mother.
QUENYA: Talles carya venesse ar antane sa i venden, ar i vende antane sa amilleryan.

ENGLISH: And he commended them that they would say nothing to anyone, but the more he commanded them, the more they made it known.
QUENYA: Ar canneset i quetumnelte munta aiquenna, mal i ambe te-cannes, i ambe sa-carnelte sinwa.

ENGLISH: On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, when the doors were closed where the disciples were, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood among them and said to them: “Peace be to you!”
QUENYA: I şinyesse aure yano, i minya ré i otsolo, íre i fennar náner pahte yasse i hilmor enger, ruciénen i Yúrallon, Yésus túle ar tarne mici te ar quente téna: “Raine na len!”

ENGLISH: Jesus cried.
QUENYA: Yésus nítane.

ENGLISH: And the tradesmen of earth are in tears and lament her, for now there is nobody to whom they can sell their goods,
QUENYA: Ar cemeno macari nar níessen ar se-nainar, an sí ea úquen yen polilte vace armaltar,

ENGLISH: By this you know God’s spirit: Every spirit that confesses Jesus Christ come in the flesh is of God,
QUENYA: Sinen istalde Eruo faire: Ilya faire ye etequenta Yésus Hristo túlienwa i hrávesse ná Eruo,

ENGLISH: After going inside to Pilate he asked for Jesus' body.
QUENYA: Apa menie minna Pilátonna arcanes Yésuo hroa.

ENGLISH: And they cried with a mighty voice, saying: “How long, holy and true Sovereign, will you not pass judgment and avenge our blood on those who dwell on earth?”
QUENYA: Ar yámelte taura ómanen, quétala: “Manen andave, aire ar şanda Hér, ual namuva ar ahtaruva sercelma issen marir cemende?”

ENGLISH: Therefore these men, sent by the Holy Spirit, went down into Seleucia, and from there they sailed away to Cyprus.
QUENYA: Etta neri sine, mentane lo i Aire Fea, lender undu mir Seleucia, ar talo cirnette oa Ciprusenna.

ENGLISH: They said to her: “Woman, for what reason are you crying?” She said to them: “They have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have put him.”
QUENYA: Quentette senna: “Nís, mana i casta yanen níteal?” Quentes túna: “Amápielte oa Herunya, ar uan ista yasse apánieltes.”

ENGLISH: Therefore he answered them again: “Whom are you seeking?” They said: “Jesus from Nazareth.”
QUENYA: Etta hanquente téna ata: “Man cestealde?” Quentelte: “Yésus Nasaretello.”

ENGLISH: But their entire host cried: “Take away this man, but release to us Barabbas!”
QUENYA: Mal quanda liyúmelta yáme: “Á mapa oa nér sina, mal ámen lehta Varavas!”

ENGLISH: for John still was not thrown into prison.
QUENYA: an Yoháno en úme hátina mir mando.

ENGLISH: Thus many of the Jews read this sign, since the place where Jesus was crucified lay near to the city, and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin and in Greek.
QUENYA: Sie rimbali i Yúraron hentaner tanwa sina, pan i nóme yasse Yésus náne tarwestaina caine hare i ostonna, ar anes técina Heveryasse, Latinde ar Hellenyasse.

ENGLISH: Then the scroll of Isaiah the Prophet was given to him, and he opened the book and found the place where was written:
QUENYA: Tá Isaia i Erutercáno toluparma náne antaina sen, ar pantanes i parma ar hirne i nóme yasse náne técina:

ENGLISH: And they were both righteous before God, walking in all the commandments and laws in a perfect manner.
QUENYA: Ar anette yúyo faile epe Eru, vantala ilye i axanissen ar şanyessen mi ilvana lé.

ENGLISH: You see that a person is justified by acts, and not by faith alone.
QUENYA: Cenil i ná quén failanta cardainen, ar lá saviénen erinqua.

ENGLISH: I am pursuing the goal, seeking the reward – God's calling to on high by Christ Jesus.
QUENYA: roitean i met, cestala i paityale – Eruo yalie tarmenna Hristo Yésunen.

ENGLISH: And if your foot is causing your fall, cut it off; going lame into life is better for you than being thrown into Gehenna having two feet.
QUENYA: Ar qui talalya tyára lantelya, ása aucire; menie úlévima mir coivie ná lyen arya lá náve hátina mir Ehenna arwa tál atto.

ENGLISH: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those that have been sent to her – how often I wanted to gather your children like a hen gathers her young under her wings! But you did not want to.
QUENYA: Yerúsalem, Yerúsalem, ye nahta i Erutercánor ar sarya i anaier mentaine senna – manen rimbave mernen comya hínalyar ve poroce comya nessaryar nu rámaryat! Mal ualde merne.

ENGLISH: My father is glorified by this, that you bear much fruit and show yourselves as my disciples.
QUENYA: Atarinya ná alcaryaina sinen, i colilde olya yáve ar tanar inde ve hildonyar.

ENGLISH: For if you had countless people instructing you in Christ, you indeed do not have numerous fathers , for in the Christ Jesus I became your father by the gospel.
QUENYA: An au sámelde únótime queni peantala len Hristosse, é ualde same rimbe atalli, an i Hristo Yésusse ollen atarelda i evandilyonnen.

ENGLISH: I have been made a servant to this gospel by the grace of God, which has been given me by his power working in me.
QUENYA: Anaien carna núro evandilyon sinan i lissenen Eruo, ya anaie antaina nin túreryanen mólala nisse.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, if the Christ has not been raised, your faith is for nothing; you are still in your sins.
QUENYA: Ente, qui i Hristo lá anaie ortana, savielda muntan ná; nalde en úcarieldassen.

ENGLISH: For you have need of endurance, for you to receive that of which God gave his promise, after doing his will.
QUENYA: An samilde maure voronwiéva, camieldan ta pa ya Eru ánie vandarya, apa carie indómerya.

ENGLISH: And the scribes an the Pharisees started to think, saying: “Who is this man that is speaking blasphemies? Who may forgive sins except God alone?”
QUENYA: Ar i parmangolmor ar i Farisar yestaner sana, quétala: “Man ná nér sina ye quéta naiquetiéli? Man lerta apsene úcari hequa Eru erinqua?”

ENGLISH: And when they went away from him, Peter said to Jesus: “Teacher, it is good that we are here. Therefore let us erect three tents, one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah” – for he did not know what he said.
QUENYA: Ar íre tú oantet sello, Péter quente Yésunna: “Peantar, mára ná i nalme sisse. Etta alme orta lancoar nelde, er elyen ar er Mósen ar er Elían” – an uas sinte ya quentes.

ENGLISH: If anyone does not love the Lord, may he be accursed! Maran atha!
QUENYA: Qui aiquen ua mele i Heru, nai nauvas húna! Maran ata!

ENGLISH: It happened that the beggar died, and the angels carried him away to the bosom of Abraham. Furthermore, also the rich man died and was brought to his grave.
QUENYA: Túle i qualle i iquindo, ar i valar colle se oa Avrahámo súmanna. Ente, yando i lárea nér qualle ar náne talaina sapsaryanna.

ENGLISH: For you behold his calling of you, brothers: that not numerous ones that were wise in the manner of the flesh were called, not numerous mighty ones, not numerous ones born as nobles.
QUENYA: An yétalde yalierya eldeva, hánor: i lá rimbar i náner saile mí hráveo lé náner yáline, lá rimbe taurar, lá rimbar nóne ve arator.

ENGLISH: For by their lawless deeds, that just man was tormented in his just soul by which he saw and heard when he dwelt among them.
QUENYA: An ºanyelóre cardaltainen, sana faila nér náne ñwalyaina faila fearyasse yainen cennes ar hlasses íre marnes imíca te.

ENGLISH: heeding not your own matters alone, but also the matters of the others.
QUENYA: címala lá vére nattoldar erinque, mal yando i exion nattor.

ENGLISH: And God can give you every grace in abundance, to case you to always have everything in sufficiency and an abundance for every good deed,
QUENYA: Ar Eru pole anta len ilya lisse úvesse, tyarien le illume same ilqua fáresse ar úve ilya mára cardan,

ENGLISH: For the kingdom of heaven is like a man, an householder, who went out early to find workers that he could pay for them to work in his garden of vines .
QUENYA: TATT An menelo aranie ná ve nér, coantur, ye etelende arinyave hirien molindoli in poldes paitya molieltan tarwaryasse liantassion.

ENGLISH: But God raised him by loosening the bonds of death, for it was not possible for death to keep him.
QUENYA: Mal Eru ortane se lehtiénen qualmeo núti, an úne cárima qualmen hepitas.

ENGLISH: But Jesus answered him: “ is written: Man shall not have life by bread alone.”
QUENYA: Mal Yésus hanquente senna: “Ná técina: Atan ua samuva coire massanen erinqua.”

ENGLISH: Therefore we send Judas and Silas, to tell you the same things by word.
QUENYA: Etta mentalme Yúras ar Sílas, nyarien i imye nati quettanen.

ENGLISH: If I do not know what the language means, I will be foreign to who speaks, and he will be foreign to me.
QUENYA: Qui uan ista ya i lambele tea, nauvan ettelea yen quete, ar isse nauva ettelea inyen.

ENGLISH: At the same moment his mouth was opened and his tongue loosened, and he spoke, blessing God.
QUENYA: Mí imya lú antorya náne pantaina ar lamberya lehtaina, ar quentes, aistala Eru.

ENGLISH: for I have five brothers – for him to witness to them, to stop them as well from coming to this place of torment!”
QUENYA: an samin hánor lempe – vettieryan tien, pustien yando té tuliello nóme sinanna ñwalmeva!”

ENGLISH: But what your reason for going out? To see a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and much more than a prophet!
QUENYA: Mal mana castalda etelelien? Cenie Erutercáno? Ná, quetin lenna, ar ambela Erutercáno!

ENGLISH: And then numerous ones will fall away and will betray one another and will hate one another.
QUENYA: Ar tá rimbali lantuvar oa ar vartuvar quén i exe ar tevuvar quén i exe.

ENGLISH: fornicators, men that lie with men, abductors , people who lie and break their promises, and every other thing that stands against the healthy teaching
QUENYA: hrupuhtari, neri i caitar as neri, aumapandor, quenir i hurir ar racir vandaltar, ar ilya hyana nat ya tare i málea peantienna

ENGLISH: “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?” They said to him: “David's!”
QUENYA: “Mana sanalde pa i Hristo? Mano yondo náse?” Quentelte senna: “Laviro!”

ENGLISH: and you are sure that you are leading the blind, a light to that are in darkness,
QUENYA: ar nalye tanca i nalye tulyala i laceníti, cala in nar morniesse,

ENGLISH: Simon, Simon, behold! Satan has demanded to sift you like grain!
QUENYA: Símon, Símon, yé! Sátan acánie silta le ve ore!

ENGLISH: three gates to East, three gates to North, three gates to south, and three gates to West.
QUENYA: andor nelde Rómenna, andor nelde Formenna, andor nelde Hyarmenna, ar andor nelde Númenna.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, he did not refrain from punishing the ancient world, but kept Noah, herald of righteousness, in safety with seven others when he brought a flood upon a world of wicked people. Furthermore, he judged the cities Sodom and Gomorrah by changing them into dust, making a danger-sign for wicked people in coming ages.
QUENYA: Ente, uas pustanexe paimetiello i enwina mar, mal hempe Noha, tercáno failiéva, mi varnasse as hyane otso ire tulunes oloire mardenna olce quenion. Ente, namnes i ostu Sorom yo Omorra vistiénen tu mir asto, cárala raxetanwa olce quenin túlala randalissen.

ENGLISH: For all that are being led by God's spirit, they are God's sons.
QUENYA: An illi i nar tulyaine lo Eruo faire, té nar Eruo yondor.

ENGLISH: and turned God Immortal's glory into something like the image of mortal man – and of birds and of beasts and of creeping creatures.
QUENYA: ar querne Eru Ilfirino alcar mir nat ve emma fírima atano – ar aiwion ar lamnion ar hlicila onnaron.

ENGLISH: A second time the voice from heaven answered: Do not call unclean that God has cleansed!
QUENYA: Attea lú i óma menello hanquente: Áva esta úpoice yar Eru opoitie!

ENGLISH: Therefore you are to take the talent from him and give it to the one that has the ten talents!
QUENYA: Etta alde mapa i talent sello ar ása anta yen same i talenti quean!

ENGLISH: Then he told a comparison to the men that were invited, when he perceived how they close the most prominent places for themselves, saying to them:
QUENYA: Tá nyarnes sestie i nerin i náner tultaine, íre túnes manen cillelte i amminde nómi inten, quétala téna:

ENGLISH: And behold! a Canaanite woman from those countries came out and cried, saying: “Have mercy on me, Son of David! My daughter is badly possessed by a demon!”
QUENYA: Ar yé! Canáanya nís ente nóriellon ettúle ar yáme, quétala: “Órava nisse, Lavirion! Selyenya ná ulcave haryana lo rauco!”

ENGLISH: For the flesh stands against the spirit by its desire, and the spirit against the flesh; for they are hostile, one against the other, to stop you from doing that you wish.
QUENYA: An i hráve tare i fairenna íreryasse, ar i faire i hrávenna; an natte cotye, er i exenna, pustien le cariello yar merilde.

ENGLISH: For Christ went into, not a sanctuary made by hands, but heaven itself, to come before God's face on our behalf.
QUENYA: An Hristo lende mir, lá ainas cárina mainen, mal menel imma, tulien epe Eruo cendele rá ven.

ENGLISH: and through many days he was being seen by those that had gone with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, that are now his witnesses to the people.
QUENYA: ar ter rimbe réli anes cénaina lo i lendelyaner óse Alileallo Yerúsalemenna, i nar sí astarmoryar i lien.

ENGLISH: They went forth from us, but they were not of our kind, for if they were of our kind, they remained with us. But it happened so that would be shown that they are not all of our kind.
QUENYA: Etemennelte vello, mal úmelte nostalelvo, an qui anelte nostalelvo, lemyanelte aselve. Mal martanes i umne tanaina i umilte illi nostalelvo.

ENGLISH: son of Joanan, son of Rhesa, son of Zerubbabel, son of Shealtiel, son of Neri,
QUENYA: yondorya Yoanan, yondorya Resa, yondorya Seruvável, yondorya Hyealtiel, yondorya Neri,

ENGLISH: Going to the other, he said the same thing. But in answer he said: I do not want to. But afterwards he changed his mind and went.
QUENYA: Lelyala i exenna, quentes i imya nat. Mal hanquentasse hé quente: Uan mere. Ono epeta vistanes sámarya ar lende.

ENGLISH: saying: “What are we to do to these men? For a sign which people know has happened through them, easy to see to all that dwell in Jerusalem, and it is not possible for us to deny it.
QUENYA: quétala: “Mana caruvalve sine nerin? An tanwa ya queni istar amartie ter tu, aşcénima illin i marir Yerúsalemesse, ar ua ece ven laquete sa.

ENGLISH: I know your deeds, that you are not cold or hot. Would that you were cold or hot!
QUENYA: Istan cardalyar, in ual ringa hya lauca. Auve anel ringa hya lauca!

ENGLISH: But that we will not make them angry, you go to the sea, throw a hook, and take the first fish coming up – and when you open its mouth, you will find a stater. Take that and give it to them for me and for you!”
QUENYA: Mal in uangwe caruva te rúşie, alye lelya i earenna, hata ampa, ar á mapa i minya lingwe tulila ama – ar íre latyal antorya, hiruval stater. Á mapa ta ar áten anta sa nin ar lyen!”

ENGLISH: But gather for yourselves treasures in heaven, where moth and erosion do not devour, and where thieves do not break in and steal.
QUENYA: Mal á comya len harmar menelde, yasse malo ar ñwarie uar ammate, ar yasse arpor uar race minna ar pilir.

ENGLISH: But you have a custom that I release to you a man at the Passover. Do you wish, then, that I release to you the king of Jews?”
QUENYA: Mal samilde haime i senin len nér i Lahtiesse. Ma merilde, tá, i senuvan len i aran Yúraron?”

ENGLISH: “If you are the Christ, tell us!” But he said to them: “Also if I told you, you were by no means going to believe it.
QUENYA: “Qui elye ná i Hristo, ámen nyare!” Mal quentes téna: “Yando qui nyarnen len, laume savumneldes.

ENGLISH: The woman was Greek, of Syro-Phonecian descent, and she petitioned of him that he would throw out the demon from her daughter.
QUENYA: I nís náne Hellenya, Siro-Foinicea ontaleo, ar arcanes sello i et-hatumnes i rauco selyeryallo.

ENGLISH: It is possible for you to learn that only twelve days ago I went up to worship in Jerusalem.
QUENYA: Ece lyen pare i rie auri yunque yá lenden ama tyerien Yerúsalemesse.

ENGLISH: But the crowd spoke firmly to them, for them to be silent; and yet they cried the more: “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David!”
QUENYA: Mal i şanga carampe túna tulcave, návettan quilde; ananta yámette i ambe: “Heru, órava metse, Lavirion!”

ENGLISH: Epaphras, who is in prison with me in Jesus Christ, greets you ;
QUENYA: Epafras, ye ea mandosse óni Yésus Hristosse, suila lye;

ENGLISH: Therefore I say to you: The Kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a nation making its fruits.
QUENYA: Etta quetin lenna: Eruo aranie nauva mapana oa lello ar antana nóren cárala yáveryar.

ENGLISH: And he taught every day in the temple. But the chielf priests and the scribes and the prominent ones of the people sought to destroy him,
