QUENYA: Ar peantanes ilya auresse i cordasse. Mal i hére airimor ar i parmagolmor ar i lieo mindar cestaner nancare se,

ENGLISH: And Paul arose, and making a gesture with his hand he said: “Men, Israelites and you who fear God, listen!
QUENYA: Ar Paulo oronte, ar cárala hwerme máryanen quentes: “Neri, Israelyar ar elde i rucir Erullo, á lasta!

ENGLISH: Father, I wish that where I am, also that you have given me will be with me, that they will see my glory that you have given me, because you loved be before the world was established.
QUENYA: Atar, merin i yasse inye ea, yando i ánietye nin euvar asinye, i cenuvalte alcarinya ya ánietye nin, pan méletye ni nó i mar náne tulcaina.

ENGLISH: But when he said these things was a cloud that overshadowed them, and they were terrified when they went into the cloud.
QUENYA: Mal íre quentes nati sine enge lumbo ya teltane te, ar anelte ruhtaine íre mennelte mir i lumbo.

ENGLISH: You yourselves witness to me that I said: I am not the Christ, but I am sent in front of him.
QUENYA: Lé inde vettar nin i quenten: Inye ui i Hristo, mal nanye mentaina opo sé.

ENGLISH: He does not stick to the head, him from whom the entire body – kept together and having its support by its joints and bonds – grows with the growth that God gives.
QUENYA: Uas himya i cas, sé yello i quanda hroa – hépina uo ar arwa tulcuryo oxaryainen ar núteryainen – ale i aliénen ya Eru anta.

ENGLISH: Truly, truly I say to you: When you were younger, you girded yourself and walked where you wished. But when you shall be old, you will reach out with your hands and another will gird you and lead you where you do not wish.”
QUENYA: Násie, násie quetin lyenna: Íre anel ambe nessa, quiltanel immo ar vantane yasse mernel. Mal íre nauval yára, eterahtuval mályanten ar exe lye-quiltuva ar lye-tulyuva yanna ual mere.”

ENGLISH: She did what she could; beforehand she has put fragrant oil on my body before it is brought to the tomb.
QUENYA: Carnes ya poldes; nóvo apánies níşima millo hroanyasse nó nás talaina i noirinna.

ENGLISH: Like obedient children, do not be shaped according to the desires that you formerly had, when you lacked knowledge.
QUENYA: Ve canwacimye híni, áva na cátine ve i íri yar yá sámelde, íre pennelde istya.

ENGLISH: Children, be obedient to your parents in the Lord, for that is just.
QUENYA: Híni, na canwacimye nostaruldant i Herusse, an ta faila ná.

ENGLISH: When the time came near for the promise which God made known to Abraham, the people grew and rose to a great number in Egypt,
QUENYA: Íre i lúme túle hare i vandan ya Eru carne sinwa Avrahámen, i lie alle ar oronte túra nótenna Mirrandoresse,

ENGLISH: by the power of signs and portents, by the power of Holy Spirit. And thus, from Jerusalem and in a circuit as far as Illyricum, I have made known the whole gospel about the Christ.
QUENYA: i túrenen tanwaron ar tannaron, i túrenen Aire Feo. Ar sie, Yerúsalemello ar rindesse tenna Illiricum, acárien sinwa i quanda evandilyon pa i Hristo.

ENGLISH: Again, I write to you a new commandment, which is true for him and for you, since the darkness is passing, and the true light is shining even now.
QUENYA: Ata, tecin lenna vinya axan, ya ná nanwa sen ar len, pan i mornie auta, ar i nanwa cala caltea yando sí.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, for they love to pray when they are standing on the corners of the roads, in order to be visible to men.
QUENYA: Ente, íre hyamilde, áva na ve i imnatyandor, an melilte hyame íre táralte i malleron vincassen, náven cénime atanin.

ENGLISH: persecution and tribulation, upon the soul of every person that does evil, of the Jew first and also that of the Greek;
QUENYA: roitie ar şangie, i feanna ilya queno ye care ulco, i Yúro minyave ar yú i Hellenyo;

ENGLISH: Around that time Herod the King laid hands on some persons of the congregation, to evil to them.
QUENYA: Os yana lúme Herol i Aran panyane mát ennolinnar i ocombeo, carien tien ulco.

ENGLISH: And the soldiers made a crown of some thorns and put it on his head and threw a purple raiment around him,
QUENYA: Ar i ohtari carner ríe necellíva ar sa-panyaner caryasse ar hanter luicarne larma os se,

ENGLISH: I answered: 'Who are you, Lord?' And he said to me: 'I am Jesus from Nazareth, whom you pursue.'
QUENYA: Hanquenten: 'Man nalye, Heru?' Ar quentes ninna: 'Nanye Yésus Nasaretello, ye elye roita.'

ENGLISH: And all the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate them one from the other, as when a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
QUENYA: Ar ilye i nóri nauvar comyane epe se, ar te-ciltuvas quén i exello, ve íre mavar cilta i mámar i nyénillon.

ENGLISH: Therefore the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter: “He is the Lord!” Thus Simon Peter, hearing that he was the Lord, girded himself with his jacket, for he was naked, and threw himself into the sea.
QUENYA: Etta i hildo ye Yésus méle quente Péterenna: “Náse i Heru!” Sie Símon Péter, hlárala i anes i Heru, quiltane immo vaccoryanen, an anes helda, ar hante immo mir i ear.

ENGLISH: Therefore they took him and led him into the Areopagus, saying: “May we know what it is, this teaching that you are speaking?
QUENYA: Etta nampeltes ar tulyane se mir i Areopahus, quétala: “Ma lertalme ista mana nás, peantie sina ya quétal?

ENGLISH: Therefore, if God gave the same gift to them as to ourselves that have believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who am I, that I will be able to stop God?”
QUENYA: Etta, qui Eru antane i imya anna tien ve elven i asávier mí Heru Yésus Hristo, man inye ná, i poluvan pusta Eru?”

ENGLISH: Therefore, do not throw away from yourselves your courage, which carries with it a great reward.
QUENYA: Etta, áva hate oa indello huorelda, ya cole as insa túra paityale.

ENGLISH: Jesus arose and said to her: “Woman, where are they? Did nobody judge you?”
QUENYA: Yésus oronte ar quente senna: “Nís, masse nalte? Ma úquen namne lye?”

ENGLISH: And a strong angel lifted up a huge mill-stone and threw it into sea, saying: “Thus, quickly, Babylon the Great will be thrown down, and she will not ever be found again.
QUENYA: Ar polda vala ortane haura mulondo ar sa-hante mir ear, quétala: ”Sie, lintave, Vável Túra nauva hátina undu, ar uas oi nauva enhirna.

ENGLISH: But a Samaritan man travelling on the road came to him, and when he saw him, his heart went out to him.
QUENYA: Mal Samárea nér lelyala i mallesse túle senna, ar íre cenneses, endarya etelende senna.

ENGLISH: one Lord, one faith, one baptism,
QUENYA: er Heru, er savie, er tumyale,

ENGLISH: For all among them saw him and were scared. But in the same moment he spoke to them, and he said to them: “Courage! It is I; do not fear.”
QUENYA: An illi mici te cenner se ar náner ruhtaine. Mal mí imya lú carampes téna, ar quentes téna: “Huore! Inye ná; áva ruce!”

ENGLISH: And if I give all my goods as food for others, and if I give away my body for it to be burnt, but I do not have love, that is not beneficial for me at all.
QUENYA: Ar qui antan ilye armanyar ve matta exin, ar qui antan olla hroanya náveryan urtana, mal uan same melme, ta ua aşea nin aqua.

ENGLISH: The others of the dead did not come to life before the thousand years were passed. This is the first resurrection.
QUENYA: I exi i qualinaron uar túle coivienna nó i loar húme náner vanwe. Si i minya enortie ná.

ENGLISH: And they began to greet him: “Good day , king of the Jews!”
QUENYA: Ar yestanelte suila se: “Hara máriesse, aran Yúraron!”

ENGLISH: And coming into the temple he began to throw out who sold ,
QUENYA: Ar túlala mir i corda yestanes et-hate i vancer,

ENGLISH: When an unclean spirit comes out of a man, it passes through try regions seeking a place of rest, and when it does not find one, it says: 'I will return to my house from which I moved.'
QUENYA: Íre úpoica faire tule et nerello, langas ter parce ménar cestala nóme séreva, ar íre uas hire, quetis: 'Nanwenuvan coanyanna yallo léven.'

ENGLISH: He was in the beginning with God.
QUENYA: Sé enge i yestasse as Eru.

ENGLISH: He did not do sin, and lie was not found in his mouth.
QUENYA: Uas carne úcare, ar huru úne hírina antoryasse.

ENGLISH: But who gives seed to who sows and bread for eating will give you your seed and will make it abundant, and the fruits of your righteousness he will make rich.
QUENYA: Mal ye anta erde yen rere ar masta matien antuva len erdelda ar caruva sa úvea, ar failieldo yávi caruvas lárie.

ENGLISH: Peter said to them: “Find repentance, and may everyone among you be baptized by the name of Jesus Christ for forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: Péter quente téna: “Hira inwis, ar nai ilquen mici le nauva sumbana Yésus Hristo essenen apsenien úcarildaiva, ar camuvalde i anna Aire Feava.

ENGLISH: We are of God. who knows God listens to us; he who is not of God does not listen to us. Thus we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of lie.
QUENYA: Vé nar Eruo.Ye ista Eru lasta venna; ye ui Eruo ua lasta venna. Sie istalve i faire nanwiéno ar i faire huruo.

ENGLISH: Therefore produce fruits worthy of repentance. And do not begin to say to yourselves: 'As father we have Abraham.' For I say to you that God can rise children to Abraham from these stones.
QUENYA: Etta cara yávi valde inwisto. Ar áva yesta quete indenna: 'Ve atar samilve Avraham.' An quetin lenna i Eru pole orta híni Avrahámen sine sarnollon.

ENGLISH: But when they were told in a dream about the danger of returning to Herod, they went to their land by another road.
QUENYA: Mal íre náne tien nyárina oloresse pa i raxe nanweniéno Herolenna, lendelte nóreltanna hyana mallenen.

ENGLISH: And Jesus said to him: “See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest, and sacrifice the gift that Moses commanded, as a witness to them!”
QUENYA: Ar Yésus quente senna: “Cena i quetil munta aiquenna, mal mena, á tana imle i airimon, ar yaca i anna ya Móses canne, ve vettie tien!”

ENGLISH: They went out of the city and came to him.
QUENYA: Lendelte et i ostollo ar túler senna.

ENGLISH: Everyone whom the Father gives me will come to me, and who comes to me I will by no means throw out,
QUENYA: Ilquen ye i Atar nin-anta tuluva ninna, ar ye tule ninna laume hatuvan etsenna,

ENGLISH: I am crucified with Christ. I am alive, and yet that is not me, but Christ who is alive in me. The life that I now have in flesh, I have by believing in God's son, he who has loved me and has given himself for me.
QUENYA: Nanye tarwestaina as Hristo. Nanye coirea, ananta ta ua ní, mal Hristo ye ná coirea nisse. I coivie ya sí samin hrávesse, samin i saviénen yondosse Eruo, sé ye emélie ni ar ánie inse inyen.

ENGLISH: for they were filled will all unrighteousness, wickedness, greed, evil – people full of envy, of murder, of strife, of deceit, of a wicked disposition – whispering,
QUENYA: an anelte quátine ilya úfailiéno, olciéno, milmeo, ulcuo – queni quante hrúceno, nahtiéno, costo, huruleo, olca óreo – hlussala,

ENGLISH: I and the Father are one.
QUENYA: Ní ar i Atar nát er.”

ENGLISH: Therefore he said to the crowds coming to be baptized by him: ”Children of serpents, who has told you how to escape from the coming wrath?
QUENYA: Etta quentes i şangannar ettúlala náven tumyaine lo sé: “A hínar leucoron, man anyárie len manen uşe i túlala rúşello?

ENGLISH: For by a single sacrifice he has made that are hallowed perfect forever.
QUENYA: An erya yaciénen acáries i nar airinte ilvane tennoio.

ENGLISH: After she and his family were baptized, she said in entreaty: “If you judge me faithful to the Lord, come into my house and remain!” And she compelled us to come.
QUENYA: Apa isse ar nosserya náner sumbane, quentes arcandesse: “Qui namilde ni voronda i Herun, tula mir coanya ar á lemya!” Ar me-mauyanes tule.

ENGLISH: Seeing that, the Pharisee who invited Jesus said to himself: “This man, if he was a prophet, would know who and of what kind is this woman that is touching him – that she is a sinner!”
QUENYA: Cénala ta, i Farisa ye yalle Yésus quente insenna: “Nér sina, qui anes Erutercáno, istumne man ar mana nostaleo ná nís sina ye appea se – i náse úcarinde!”

ENGLISH: Perhaps you intend to kill me, like you killed the Egyptian yesterday?'
QUENYA: Cé telil nahta ni, ve nacantel i Mirra noa?'

ENGLISH: When half of the festival had passed, Jesus went up into the temple and taught.
QUENYA: Íre perta i aşaro náne autienwa, Yésus lende amba mir i corda ar peantane.

ENGLISH: But also Judas, who betrayed him, knew the place, since Jesus at numerous times met with with his disciples there.
QUENYA: Mal yando Yúras, ye vartane se, sinte i nóme, pan Yésus rimbe lúlissen velde as hildoryar tasse.

ENGLISH: The disciples and the officers had made a coal fire, for was cold, and they stood warming themselves. Also Peter stood with them warming himself.
QUENYA: I núror ar i cánor náner cárienwe hyulmaruine, an ringa né, ar tarnelte lautala inte. Yando Péter tarne aselte lautala immo.

ENGLISH: Therefore I speak to them in comparisons, since looking they will not see, and hearing they will not perceive or understand,
QUENYA: Etta carpan téna sestiessen, pan yétala ualte cenuva, ar hlárala ualte tuntuva hya hanyuva,

ENGLISH: Thus you are no more a thrall, but a son; and if a son, also an heir through God.
QUENYA: Sie ual ambe mól, mal yondo; ar qui yondo, yando aryon ter Eru.

ENGLISH: But know this: If the master of the house knew in what watch the thief will come, he was awake and did not allow anyone to break into his house.
QUENYA: Mal á ista si: Qui i coantur sinte mi mana tiresse i arpo tuluva, anes cuiva ar ua láve aiquenen race mir coarya.

ENGLISH: The greater part of the crown spread out their cloaks on the road, while others cut off branches from the trees and spread them out in the road.
QUENYA: I ambe hoa ranta i şango pantaner collaltar i mallesse, íre exeli hocirner olvali i aldallon ar pantaner tai i mallesse.

ENGLISH: Before the festival of the Passover, Jesus knew that now his time had come to pass away from this world to go to the Father, and after loving his own who were in the world, he loved them until the end.
QUENYA: Nó i aşar i Lahtiéno Yésus sinte i sí lúmerya né túlienwa autien mar sinallo menien i Atarenna, ar apa melie véryaryar i enger i mardesse, méleset tenna i metta.

ENGLISH: But I have said to you: you have seen me, and yet you do not believe.
QUENYA: Mal equétien lenna: ecénielden, ananta ualde save.

ENGLISH: All things are clean to clean ones, but to people that are defiled and without faith nothing is pure, but their mind and their conscience alike are defiled.
QUENYA: Ilye nati nar poice poicain, mal quenin i nar vahtaine ar ú sáviéno munta poica ná, mal sámalta ar immotuntielta véla nar vahtaine.

ENGLISH: Therefore I was frequently impeded from coming to you.
QUENYA: Etta anen rimbave tapta tuliello lenna.

ENGLISH: But for who is the greatest among you it is necessary to be your servant.
QUENYA: Mal yen ná i antúra mici le mauya náve núrolda.

ENGLISH: and a man's enemies are the people of his house.
QUENYA: ar atano ñottor nar i queni coaryasse.

ENGLISH: And in answer the king will say to them: 'Truly I say to you: In the measure that you did that to one among these smallest brothers of mine, in the same measure to me you did it.'
QUENYA: Ar hanquentasse i aran quetuva téna: 'Násie quetin lenna: I lestasse ya carnelde ta quenen mici ampitye hánonyar sine, mí imya lesta inyen carneldes.'

ENGLISH: After sending the crowd outside he went inside and took her hand, and the maiden arose.
QUENYA: Apa mentave i şanga ettenna lendes minna ar nampe márya, ar i vende oronte.

ENGLISH: For you know how it is necessary for you to follow in our path, by doing as we did, since we did not behave among you in an improper manner,
QUENYA: An elde istar manen mauya len hilya tielmasse, pan ualme lengane imíca te mi úvanima lé,

ENGLISH: and bound around your feet with the prepared state that the gospel of peace gives.
QUENYA: ar nótine os taluldat i manwaina sómanen ya i evandilyon raineva anta.

ENGLISH: All things are given to me by my Father, and no one wholly knows the Son except the Father; furthermore, no one wholly knows the Father except the Son and anyone to whom the Son wishes to reveal him.
QUENYA: Ilye nati nar nin antane lo Atarinya, ar úquen aqua ista i Yondo hequa i Atar; ente, úquen aqua ista i Atar hequa i Yondo ar aiquen yen i Yondo mere apanta se.

ENGLISH: And concerning that I give my thoughts, for that will be beneficial for you who began, not the doing alone, but also your wishing to do it, one year ago.
QUENYA: Ar pa ta antan sanwenyar, an ta nauva aşea elden i yestaner, lá i carie erinqua, mal yando merielda caritas, er loa yá.

ENGLISH: For a man does not do well if he covers his head, for he is God's image and glory, but the woman is the man's glory.
QUENYA: An nér ua care mai qui topis carya, an náse Eruo emma ar alcar, mal i nís i nero alcar ná.

ENGLISH: As the truth of Christ exists in me, I shall not be stopped from so praising myself in the congrations of Macedonia.
QUENYA: Ve Hristo nanwie ea nisse, uan nauva pustaina sie laitiello imne Maceronio ocombessen.

ENGLISH: And the Lord turned and looked at Peter, and Peter recalled the saying of the Kord when he said to him: “Before a cock sounds today, you will deny me thrice.”
QUENYA: Ar i Heru querne inse ar yente Péterenna, ar Péter enyalle i Heruo quetie íre quentes senna: “Nó tocot lamya síra, ni-laquetuval nel.”

ENGLISH: Though that caused him grief, the king commanded that one was to give it to the maiden,
QUENYA: Ómu ta tyarne sen naire, i aran canne i mo antauvane sa i venden,

ENGLISH: After looking from person to person Jesus said to his disciples: “How difficult coming into God's kingdom is for people having money!”
QUENYA: Apa yétie quenello quenenna Yésus quente hildoryannar: “Manen urda tule mir Eruo aranie ná quenin arwe telpeo!”

ENGLISH: After these things were made so, the priests went into the first tent-room at all times to do acts of service ,
QUENYA: Apa nati sine náner cárine sie, i airimor lender mir i minya lancoa-şambe ilye lúmessen carien núromolier,

ENGLISH: Therefore go and make all nations disciples, baptizing them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit,
QUENYA: Etta á lelya ar cara ilye nóri hildoli, sumbala te mí esse i Ataro ar i Yondo ar i Aire Feo,

ENGLISH: Therefore the gospel was brought also to dead ones, for them to be judged in the flesh, in the manner of Men, but for them to have life in the spirit, in the manner of God.
QUENYA: Etta i evandilyon náne tulúna yando qualinnar, náveltan námine i hrávesse, mi Atanion lé, mal samieltan coivie i fairesse, mi Eruo lé.

ENGLISH: And which was a test to you in my flesh you did not despise or spat upon it, but like an angel of God you received me, like Christ Jesus.
QUENYA: Ar ya náne tyastie len hrávenyasse ualde nattirne hya piutane sanna, mal ve Eru vala camnelde ni, ve Hristo Yésus.

ENGLISH: Therefore, since you are dear to us, we thought well about giving you a part, not in God's gospel alone, but also in our own soul, since you have become dear to us.
QUENYA: Etta, pan nalde melde men, sannelme mai pa antave len ranta, lá rie mi Eruo evandilyon, mal yú mi véra fealma, pan olólielde melde men.

ENGLISH: Remain in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit if it does not remain in the vine, so you cannot , if you do not remain in me.
QUENYA: Á lemya nisse, ar inye lesse. Tambe i olva ua pole cole yáve qui uas lemya mí liantasse, sie lé uar pole, qui ualde lemya nisse.

ENGLISH: And all the things that you request in prayer, having faith, you will receive!”
QUENYA: Ar ilye i nati yar arcalde hyamiesse, arwe saviéno, camuvalde!”

ENGLISH: In that hour he healed numerous ones, freeing them from illnesses and from sufferings and from wicked spirits, and many blind ones he caused to see.
QUENYA: Lúme yanasse nestanes rimbali, leryala te hlívellon ar perperiellon ar olce fairellon, ar rimbe cénelóralin tyarnes céne.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, bring some horses. Thus, letting Paul ride, you will bring him in safety to Felix the governor.”
QUENYA: Ente, á tala roccoli. Sie, lávala Paulon norta, taluvaltes mi varnasse Felix i nórecánonna.”

ENGLISH: naked, and you covered me. I was sick and you cared for me, I was in prison and you came to me.'
QUENYA: helda, ar tumpelde ni. Anen hlaiwa ar cimbanelde ni, anen mandosse ar túlelde ninna.'

ENGLISH: Thus Peter was kept in prison, but the entire congregation was intensely praying to God for him.
QUENYA: Sie Péter náne hépina mandosse, mal i quanda ocombe veassenen hyámane Erunna sen.

ENGLISH: Keep your conscience clean! . Thus, when you receive hostile words, the people that speak evil about your good behavior in Christ will be shamed.
QUENYA: Hepa immotuntielda mára! Sie, íre camilde cotye quettali, i queni i quetir ulco pa mára lengielda Hristosse nauvar naityaine.

ENGLISH: Do not be slow, abandoning the urgency; be burning in the spirit, be thralls for the Lord!
QUENYA: Áva na lence, hehtala i horme; na uryala i fairesse, na móli i Herun!

ENGLISH: After the evening meal he did the same with the cup, saying: “This cup is the new covenant in my blood. Do this, at every time that you drink it, in remembrance of me.”
QUENYA: Apa i şinyemat carnes i imya i yulmanen, quétala: “Yulma sina ná i vinya vére sercenyasse. Cara si, mi ilya lú ya sucildes, enyalien ní.”

ENGLISH: Who among the two did the father's will?” They said: “The second one!” Jesus said to them: “Truly I say to you: The tax collectors and the harlots go before you into God's kingdom.
QUENYA: Man imíca i atta carne i ataro nirme?” Quentelte: “I attea!” Yésus quente téna: “Násie quetin lenna: I tungwemor ar i imbacindi lelyar epe lé mir Eruo aranie.

ENGLISH: He said to him: “If you are God's son, throw yourself down, for is written: He will command his angels concerning you, and they will carry you on their hands, to stop your foot from striking against stone.”
QUENYA: Quentes senna: “Qui elye Eruo yondo ná, hata inse undu, an ná técina: Canuvas valaryain pa lye, ar coluvaltel máltatse, pustien talelya petiello sarnenna!”

ENGLISH: But when he again sends his Only-begotten into the world, he says: "And may all God's angels worship him!"
QUENYA: Mal íre ata mentas Ernónarya mir ambar, quetis: "Ar nai ilye Eruo vali tyeruvar se!"

ENGLISH: Furthermore, every man that runs in a race shows control of himself in all things. They do so to receive a wreath that withers, but we a wreath that will not ever wither.
QUENYA: Ente, ilya nér ye nore i normesse tana turie inseva mi ilye nati. Té carir sie camien ríe ya hesta, mal elve ríe ya ua oi hestuva.

ENGLISH: Then the chief priest tore his tunic and said: “What more need do we have of testimony?
QUENYA: Tá i héra airimo narcane lauperya ar quente: “Mana amba maure samilve vettiéva?

ENGLISH: For is easily seen that you are a letter from Christ, a fruit of our ministry, written not with ink but by the spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone, but on tablets of flesh – on hearts.
QUENYA: An ná aşcénima i nalde menta Hristollo, yáve núromolielmo, técina lá moronen mal i coirea Eruo fairenen, lá palmassen ondova, mal palmassen hráveva – endassen.

ENGLISH: and they understood nothing until the Flood came and carried them off, so the coming of the Son of Man will be.
QUENYA: ar hanyanelte munta tenna i Oloire túle ar colde te illi oa, síve i Atanyondo tulesse euva.

ENGLISH: For if that which was going to fade was established in glory, much more will that which remains have glory.
QUENYA: An qui ta ya firumne náne tulcaina mi alcar, ole ambe ta ya lemya samuva alcar.

ENGLISH: Other seeds fell upon the rock, where they did not have deep soil, and they rose up quickly , for lacking deep soil.
QUENYA: Hyane erdeli lantaner i ondonna, yasse ualte sáme núra cemen, ar orontelte lintiénen, peniénen núra cemen.

ENGLISH: But now Jesus has received a more splendid position as servant , for thus he is an intermediary of a covenant which in a similar manner is better, founded upon better promises.
QUENYA: Mal sí Yésus acámie ambe maira núronóme, ar sie náse enelmo véreo ya mi vávea lé ná arya, tulcaina arye vandalinnar.

ENGLISH: This wisdom no one of that rule in this age has known, for if they knew it, they did not crucify the Lord of glory.
QUENYA: Sailie sina úquen ion turir mi randa sina isistie, an au sinteltes, ualte tarwestane i Heru alcaro.

ENGLISH: But may our own also learn to do good works and fill the pressing needs, so as not to lack fruit.
QUENYA: Mal nai véralvar yando paruvar care máre cardar ar quate i nírala mauri, uien pene yáve.

ENGLISH: Seeing the crowds he went up into the mountain, and when he sat down his disciples came to him.
QUENYA: Cénala i şangar lendes ama mir i oron, ar íre hamunes hildoryar túler senna.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus was led by the spirit up into the desert, to be tempted by the Devil.
QUENYA: Tá Yésus náne tulyana lo i Faire ama mir i erume, náven sahtana lo i Arauco.

ENGLISH: Then he spoke to them many things in comparisons, saying: “Look! A sower went out to sow.
QUENYA: Tá quentes téna rimbe natali sestielissen, quétala: “Yé! Rerindo lende ettenna rerien.

ENGLISH: And when the Chief Shepherd shall be revealed, you will receive the glorious crown which is not fading.
QUENYA: Ar íre i Héra Mavar nauva apantaina, camuvalde i alcarinqua ríe ya ua fifírula.

ENGLISH: For the heart of this people has become blunt, and their ears are heavy of hearing, and their eyes they have closed – stopping them from perceiving with their eyes and from hearing with their ears and from understanding with their heart and from finding repentance , for me to heal them.'
QUENYA: An lie sino enda olólie ilaica, ar hlarultat nát lunge hlariéno, ar hendultat apahtielte – te-pustala tuntiello hendultanten ar hlariello hlarultanten ar haniello endaltanen ar hiriello inwis, nestienyan te.'

ENGLISH: But Pilate said to them: “Then what is the evil that he has done?” But they cried with a terrible clamor: “Crucify him!”
QUENYA: Mal Piláto quente téna: “Tá mana i ulco ya acáries?” Ono té yámer rúcima yalmenen: “Áse tarwesta!”

ENGLISH: And they brought him tot he place called Golgotha, which means Skull Place .
QUENYA: Ar talleltes i nómenna estaina Olyoşa, ya tea Caraxomen.

ENGLISH: And that we shall do, if God allows.
QUENYA: Ar ta caruvalve, qui Eru lave.

ENGLISH: You know that when you were of the nations, you were drawn away, being led to the dumb idols.
QUENYA: Istalde in íre anelde i nórion, anelde túcine oa, tulyaine i úpe cordonnar.

ENGLISH: And when he came to his home territory, he instructed them in their synagogue. Thus they were filled with wonder and said: “From where did this man receive this wisdom and these mighty deeds?
QUENYA: Ar íre túles vehteryanna, peantanes tien yomencoaltasse. Sie anelte quátine elmendanen ar quenter: “Mallo nér sina camne sailie sina ar i taure cardar sine?

ENGLISH: That man was a burning and shining lamp, and for an hour you wanted to rejoice in his light.
QUENYA: Sana nér náne uryala ar caltala calma, ar ter lúme mernelte alasta calaryasse.

ENGLISH: But the angel said to them: ”Do not be afraid, for I am making known to you a great joy that will be for the entire people,
QUENYA: Mal i vala quente téna: ”Áva ruce, pan inye cára sinwa len túra alasse ya nauva i quanda lien,

ENGLISH: “Lord, they have slain your prophets , they have torn down your altars, and I alone remains, and they are seeking my life.”
QUENYA: “Héru, anahtielte tercánolyar, anarcielte undu yangwalyar, ar inye erinqua lemya, ar cestealte cuilenya.”

ENGLISH: And behold, they brought to him a lame man lying on a bed. Seeing their faith Jesus said to the lame one: “Courage, child! Your sins are forgiven!”
QUENYA: Ar yé, tallelte senna lalevíte nér caitala caimasse. Cénala savielta Yésus quente i lalevítenna: “Huore, hína! Úcaretyar nar apsénine!”

ENGLISH: And now, behold, bound in the spirit I go to Jerusalem, though I do not know that will happen to me in it,
QUENYA: Ar sí, yé, nútina i fairesse lelyan Yerúsalemenna, ómu uan ista yar martuvar nin sasse,

ENGLISH: Happy is that thrall, whom his master when he comes will find doing so.
QUENYA: Valima ná mól tana, ye herurya íre tulis hiruva cára sie.

ENGLISH: For you have had five husbands, and whom you have now is not your husband, Of this thing you spoke the truth.”
QUENYA: An asámiel veruvi lempe, ar ye samil sí ui lyenya veru. Pa nat sina quentel i nanwie.”

ENGLISH: For “everyone who calls on the Lord's name will be saved”.
QUENYA: An “ilquen ye yale i Heruo essenen nauva rehtana”.

ENGLISH: And our fathers that received it brought it with Joshua into the land being possessed by the peoples that God threw out before our fathers. There it remained until David's days.
QUENYA: Ar atarilvar i camner sa yú talle sa as Yosua mir i nóre haryaina lo i lier yar Eru et-hante epe atarilvar. Tasse sa lemne tenna Laviro auri.

ENGLISH: And he went away from them, about a stone's throw, and he fell to his knees and prayed,
QUENYA: Ar sé lende oa telo, os hatie sarneva, ar lantanes occaryanta ar hyamne,

ENGLISH: But when I shall come there, I will send the men of your choosing to Jerusalem with letters, to carry your gift.
QUENYA: Mal íre tuluvan tar, mentauvan cilmeldo neri Yérusalemenna arwe tecettaron, colien annalda.

ENGLISH: But you, brothers, are children by the promise, as was Isaac.
QUENYA: Mal elve, hánor, nar híni i vandanen, ve náne Ísac.

ENGLISH: for you know that everyone, if he does anything good, shall receive back this deed from the Lord, not matter whether he is a slave or free.
QUENYA: an istalde i ilquen, qui caris aiqua mára, nancamuva carda sina i Herullo, lá címala qui náse mól hya léra.

ENGLISH: Heed well who has borne such hostile talk from who sin against themselves; then you will not be tired and give out in your soul.
QUENYA: Cima mai ye ocólie taite cotya carpie ho i úcarir intenna; tá ualde nauva lumbe ar taltuva fealdasse.

ENGLISH: and they returned from the tomb and told all these things to the eleven and to all the others.
QUENYA: ar nanwennelte i noirillo ar nyarner ilye nati sine i minquen ar ilye i exin.

ENGLISH: And all ate and were filled, and they gathered the remaining pieces: seven full baskets.
QUENYA: Ar illi manter ar náner quátine, ar comyanelte i lemyala rantar: quante vircolcar otso.

ENGLISH: For God, to whom I am a servant with my spirit concerning the gospel of his Son, is my witness about how I without cease name you always in my prayers,
QUENYA: An Eru, yen nanye núro fairenyanen pa Yondoryo evandilyon, astaronya ná pa manen pen hautie estan le illume hyamienyassen,

ENGLISH: But was there a great flock of swine on pasture in the mountain, and they requested of him that he would allow them to pass into them. And he allowed them.
QUENYA: Mal enge tasse hoa lámáre polcaiva nesselesse mí oron, ar arcandelte sello i lavumnes tien auta mir té. Ar láves tien.

ENGLISH: For God did not call us to uncleanness, but in sanctification.
QUENYA: An Eru ua vi-yalde úpoicienna, mal airitávesse.

ENGLISH: And in those days people shall seek death, but they shall by no means find it; they shall long to die, but death shall escape from them.
QUENYA: Ar mí ente rí queni cestuvar ñuru, mal laume hiruvalte sa; milyuvalte quale, mal ñuru uşuva tello.

ENGLISH: And I say to you: From now you will not see me until you say: 'Blessed is he that is coming in the name of the Lord.'”
QUENYA: An quetin lenna: Ho sí ualde ni-cenuva tenna quetuvalde: Aistana ná ye túla i Héruo essenen!”

ENGLISH: Jesus answered: “This man did not sin, or his parents, but this happened that God’s deeds were to be revealed by means of him.
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente: “Nér sina ua úcarne, hya nostaryat, mal si martane i umner Eruo cardar apantaine senen.

ENGLISH: But happy are your eyes, for they look, and your ears, for they hear.
QUENYA: Mal valime nát henduldat, an yétatte, ar hlaruldat, an hlaritte.

ENGLISH: He said: “To you is given to know the secrets of God's kingdom, but to the others it is in comparisons, causing them to look without seeing and hear without understanding.
QUENYA: Eques: “Elden ná antaina ista Eruo araniéno fóler, mal i exin nas sestiessen, tyárala te yéta ú ceniéno ar hlare ú haniéno.

ENGLISH: And he went away from them and prayed for a third time, saying the same word again.
QUENYA: Ar lendes oa tello ar hyamne mi neldea lú, quétala i imya quetta ata.

ENGLISH: Thus Joseph, who from the apostles received the nickname Barsabba – which means Son of Comfort – one of the Levites, born at Cyprus,
QUENYA: Sie Yósef, ye i apostellon camne i epesse Varsappa – ya tea Tiutaleo Yondo – quén i Leviron, nóna Ciprusse,

ENGLISH: The sower sows the word.
QUENYA: I rerindo rere i quetta.

ENGLISH: and he is head of his body: the congregation. He is the beginning, the firstborn from dead, for him to be in all things the first.
QUENYA: ar sé ná cas hroaryo: i ocombe. Náse i yesta, i minnóna qualinallon, náveryan mi ilye nati i minya.

ENGLISH: Thereafter they also glorified us with numerous gifts, and when we sailed away, they gave us things for our needs.
QUENYA: Epeta yú alcaryanelte me rimbe annalínen, ar íre cirnelme oa, antanelte men natali maurelmain.

ENGLISH: Because you have kept the word of my faithfulness, I too will keep you from the hour of trial that shall come upon the whole world, to test those who dwell on earth.
QUENYA: Pan ehépiel i quetta voronwienyo, yú inye lye-hepuva i lúmello tyastiéva ya tuluva i quanda ambarenna, tyastien i marir cemende.

ENGLISH: Bring Mark and make him come with you, for he is helpful for me in my service .
QUENYA: Á tala Marco ar áse care tule aselye, an náse aşea nin mi núromolienya.

ENGLISH: Now the Passover, the festival of Jews, was near.
QUENYA: Sí i Lahtie, i aşar Yúraron, náne hare.

ENGLISH: His mother said to those who served: “Do anything that he says to you!”
QUENYA: Amillerya quente innar veuyaner: “Á care aiqua ya quetis lenna!”

ENGLISH: But Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch, where they and numerous others made known the gospel about the Lord's word.
QUENYA: Mal Paulo yo Varnavas termarnet mi Antioc, yasse tú ar rimbe exeli carner sinwa i evandilyon pa i Heruo quetta.

ENGLISH: formerly without use for you, but now being of use to you and me alike.
QUENYA: yá ú yuhtiéno elyen, mal sí nála yuhtiéno lyen ar nin véla.

ENGLISH: But he said: “No, father Abraham, but if a person will come to them from the dead, they will find repentance!”
QUENYA: Mal sé quente: “Vá, atar Avraham, mal qui quén tuluva téna qualinillon, hiruvalte inwis!”

ENGLISH: That happened by reason of the false brothers brought inside in silence, that came in secretly to spy on the freedom that we have by Jesus Christ, to make us thralls.
QUENYA: Ta martane castanen i úanwe hánoron talaine minna quildesse, i túler minna nuldave ettirien i lérie ya samilve Yésus Hristonen, vi-carieltan móli.

ENGLISH: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all among you! Amen!}
QUENYA: Yésus Hristo Herulvo lisse na euva as illi mici le! Násie!}

ENGLISH: Keep yourselves away from things sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from strangled animals, and from fornication. If you keep yourselves away from these things, you will do well. Health to you!”
QUENYA: Hepa inde oa ho nati yácine cordonin, ar sercello, ar quórine celvallon, ar hrupuhtiello. Qui hepildexer oa sine natillon, caruvalde mai. Mále len!”

ENGLISH: and all flesh will see God's salvation.”
QUENYA: ar ilya hráve cenuva Eruo rehtie.”

ENGLISH: For the Law made nothing perfect, but the bringing of a better hope did so: the hope by which we come near to God.
QUENYA: An i Şanye carne munta ilvana, mal i talie arya estelwa carne sie: i estel yanen túlalve hare Erunna.

ENGLISH: And they were steadfast in the teaching of the apostles and the brotherhood, in the breaking of the bread and in the prayers.
QUENYA: Ar anelte voronde mí peantie i apostolion ar mí otornasse, i raciesse i massava ar i hyamiessen.

ENGLISH: But our Lord's grace was extremely abundant, with faith and love in Christ Jesus.
QUENYA: Mal Herulvo lisse náne ita úvea, as savie ar melme mi Hristo Yésus.

ENGLISH: But Tychicus I have sent to Ephesus .
QUENYA: Mal Tihico ementien Efesonna.

ENGLISH: Jesus answered them: “I showed you many good deeds from the Father. Concerning what of those deeds do you want to stone me?”
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente téna: “Tannen len rimbe máre cardali i Atarello. Pa mana tane cardaron merilde sarya ni?”

ENGLISH: But who was injust to his neighbor pushed him away, saying: 'Who made you chief and judge over us ?
QUENYA: Mal ye náne úfaila armaroryan nirne se oa, quétala: 'Man carne lyé turco ar námo or met?

ENGLISH: Then he said to them: “Do you still not understand?”
QUENYA: Tá quentes téna: “Ma en ualde hanya?”

ENGLISH: In answer Jesus said to them: “I as well will ask you about one thing. If you tell me, I too will tell you about the authority with which I do these things.
QUENYA: Hanquentesse Yésus quente téna: “Yú inye maquetuva lenna pa er nat. Qui nyarilde nin, yú inye nyaruva len pa i hére yanen carin nati sine.

ENGLISH: Philip found Nathanael and said to him: “We have found the one of whom Moses in the Law and the Prophets wrote: Jesus son of Joseph from Nazareth.”
QUENYA: Filip hirne Natanael ar quente senna: “Ihírielme i quén pa ye Móses i Şanyesse ar i Erutercánor tencer: Yésus Yosefion Nasaretello.”

ENGLISH: To such people we give this command and exhortation by the Lord Jesus Christ: They are to eat their own bread by laboring in silence.
QUENYA: Taiti quenin antalme sina canwa ar hortale i Heru Yésus Hristonen: Á matir véra mastalta moliénen quildesse.

ENGLISH: Thus, when the men saw the signs that he did, they said: “This man truly is the prophet who was to come into the world.”
QUENYA: Sie, íre i atani cenner i tannar yar carnes, quentelte: “Nér sina nanwave ná i Erutercáno ye tulumne mir i mar.”

ENGLISH: but they found nothing, though numerous lying witnesses came forward. In the end, two came forward
QUENYA: mal hirnelte munta, ómu rimbe húrala astarmoli túler ompa. Mí tyel, atta túlet ompa

ENGLISH: God is faithful, by whom you were called to have a part with his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.
QUENYA: Eru voronda ná, lo ye anelde yáline samien ranta as Yondorya, Yésus Hristo Herulva.

ENGLISH: Therefore he says: “Be awake, you who are sleeping, and rise from dead, and the Christ shall shine upon you.”
QUENYA: an ilqua ya ná apantaina, cala ná. Etta quetis: “Na coiva, elye ye húma, ar á orta qualinillon, ar i Hristo caluva lyenna.”

ENGLISH: When you keep a fast, do not be like the hypocrites, who make their face disfigured in order to make their fast visible to men. Truly I say to you: They are receiving their entire reward.
QUENYA: Íre helpilde lamate, áva na ve imnatyandor, i carir cendelelta úvanima carien lamatelta cénima atanin. Násie quetin lenna: Cámalte quanda paityalelta.

ENGLISH: And after six days Jesus lead away Peter and James and John with himself and brought them into a lofty mountain, they alone. And he was changed before them,
QUENYA: Ar apa auri enque Yésus tulyane oa Péter ar Yácov ar Yoháno as inse ar te-talle mir tára oron, té erinque. Ar anes vistaina epe te,

ENGLISH: You ask , and yet you do not receive, for you ask for a wrong reason, to use it on your lust for the joys of the flesh.
QUENYA: Arcalde, ananta ualde came, an arcalde &perqua castanen, sa-yuhtien maileldasse alassiva i hráveo.

ENGLISH: And I saw in the right hand of who sat on the throne a book written on the inside and on the outside, sealed with seven seals.
QUENYA: Ar cennen i formasse yeo hande i mahalmasse parma técina mityave ar i ettesse, lihtana lihtainen otso.

ENGLISH: For I say to you that heaven and earth will pass before a single smallest letter or a single mark will pass away from the Law, before everything has been made true.
QUENYA: An quetin lenna i menel cemenye autuvat nó erya ampitya tengwa hya erya tehta autuva i Şanyello, nó ilqua anaie carna nanwa.

ENGLISH: you will be witnesses of these things.
QUENYA: elde nauvar vettoli pa nati sine.

ENGLISH: Now while they went on the road, they came to a place where was water, and the minister said: “Look, water! What stops me form being baptized?”
QUENYA: Sí íre lendette i mallesse, túlette nómenna yasse enge nén, ar i arandur quente: “Ela, nén! Mana pusta ni návello sumbana?”

ENGLISH: we have with one mind made the choice that we will send some men to you with our dear ones, Barnabas and Paul,
QUENYA: er sámanen acárielme i cilme i mentauvalme nelli lenna as meldalmar, Varnavas yo Paulo,

ENGLISH: When you come into the house, greet it,
QUENYA: Íre tulilde mir i coa, ása suila,

ENGLISH: In the same manner Abraham “believed in the Lord, and that was counted to him as justice”.
QUENYA: Mi imya lé Avraham “sáve i Hérusse, ar ta náne nótina sen ve failie”.

ENGLISH: But if you will indeed have difficulty because of doing good, happy you are! Do not fear from them, and do not be terrified,
QUENYA: Ono qui é samuvalde urdie carieldanen márie, valime nalde! Ávalde ruce tello, ar áva na ruhtaine,

ENGLISH: But in those days, after that tribulation, the Sun will become black, and the Moon will not give its light,
QUENYA: Mal ente auressen, apa enta şangie, Anar oluva morna, ar Işil ua antuva calarya,

ENGLISH: And the tombs were opened, and many bodies of the sleeping holy ones were raised,
QUENYA: Ar i noiri náner pantane, ar rimbe hroali i lorne airion náner ortane,

ENGLISH: They were nobler than those that lived in Thessalonica, and they received the word with all good will, and every day they searched the Scriptures to see if these things were so.
QUENYA: Té náner arte lá i marner Şessalonicasse, ar camnelte i quetta ilya mára nirmenen, ar ilya auresse cenşelte i Tehteler cenien qui nati sine náner sie.

ENGLISH: This man was seized by the Jews and was near to being slain by them, but I fell upon them with the soldiers and saved him, since I learnt that he was a Roman.
QUENYA: Nér sina náne mapana lo i Yúrar ar náne hare návenna nahtana lo te, mal lantanen téna as i ohtari ar se-rehtane, pan parnen in náse Rómea.

ENGLISH: and he said to his servants: “This is John the Baptist. He has been raised from the dead, and therefore the mighty deeds happen by him!”
QUENYA: ar quentes núroryannar: “Si ná Yoháno i Sumbando. Anaies ortana qualinallor, ar etta i taure cardar martar sénen!”

ENGLISH: but narrow is the gate and narrow is the road leading into life, and few are that find it.
QUENYA: mal náha ná i ando ar lenwa i malle tulyala mir coivie, ar mance nar i hirir sa.

ENGLISH: Therefore, in the same moment, the men that were going to examine him by torture stood away from him, and fear seized the army commander when he found that he was Roman, after he had bound him.
QUENYA: Etta, mí imya lú, i neri i ceşumner se ñwalmenen tarner oa sello, ar caure nampe i hosseturco íre hirnes in é anes Rómea, apa se-nuntelyanes.

ENGLISH: You do the deeds of your father.” They said to him: “We are not born by fornication; we have a single Father, God.”
QUENYA: Carilde i cardar atareldo.” Quentelte senna: “Umilme nóne úpuhtiénen; samilme erya Atar, Eru.”

ENGLISH: Believe me that I am in the Fatehr and the Father in me; if not, believe because of the deeds as such!
QUENYA: Á save i inye ea i Ataresse ar i Atar inyesse; qui lá, á save i cardainen ve taiti!

ENGLISH: He went into the synagogue and spoke boldly for three months, talking and bringing others to an understanding of God's kingdom.
QUENYA: Lendes mir i yomencoa ar quente canyave astassen nelde, carpala ar tálala exeli handenna pa Eruo aranie.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus said to them: “My children, have you not got fishes?” They said to him: “We have not.”
QUENYA: Tá Yésus quente téna: “Hinyar, ma ualde same lingwi?” Hanquentelte senna: “Penilme.”

ENGLISH: and I will say do myself: 'Now you have numerous good things in store for many years. Rest, eat, drink, have joy!'
QUENYA: ar quetuvan imninna: 'Sí samil rimbe máre natali haurasse rimbe loalin. Sera, mata, suca, sama alasse!'

ENGLISH: and yet Eliah was not sent to anyone among them, but to Zarephath in the land of Sidon, to a widowed woman there.
QUENYA: ananta Elía úne mentaina aiquenna mici té, mal Sarefatenna mi Sírono nóre, verulóra nissenna tasse.

ENGLISH: Faithful is the word, and these things I wish that you firmly establish; thus that have believed in God can fix their minds on the doing of good works. These things are good and beneficial to men.
QUENYA: Voronda ná i quetta, ar nati sine merin i tancave tulcal; sie i asávier Erusse polir tace sámaltar i cariesse máre cardaiva. Nati sine nar máre ar aşie atanin.

ENGLISH: Therefore, brothers, we have been comforted concerning you by your faithfulness, in all our need and our tribulation.
QUENYA: Etta, hánor, anaielme tiutana pa le voronweldanen, mi ilya maurelma ar şangielma.

ENGLISH: Does not the Scripture say that the Christ comes of the seed of David, and from Bethlehem, the village where David was?”
QUENYA: Ma i Tehtele ua quete i tule i Hristo i erdo Laviro, ar Vet-Lehemello, i masto yasse enge Lavir?”

ENGLISH: Everything was created by means of him, and except by him not a single thing was created. which was created
QUENYA: Ilqua né ontaina sénen, ar hequa sénen erya nat úme ontaina. Ya né ontaina

ENGLISH: Therefore, since a promise remains about coming into his rest, let us fear, for it seems that among you there are some that have fallen short of it.
QUENYA: Etta, pan vanda lemya pa tulie mir sérerya, alve ruce, an şéya i míci le ear queneli i oloitier sa.

ENGLISH: By faith Jacob, near to his death, blessed both of Joseph's sons and worshiped leaning on the top of his staff.
QUENYA: Saviénen Yácov, íre anes hare qualmenna, aistane yúyo yondoron Yósefo ar tyerne nírala vandilyo inganna.

ENGLISH: If they did, did one not stop sacrificing, the worshippers being cleansed a single time and forever, no more perceiving sin in themselves?
QUENYA: Qui carnelte, ma mo ua pustane yace, i tyerindor nála poitaina erya lú ar tennoio, lá ambe tuntala úcare intesse?

ENGLISH: For you died, and your life has been hidden with the Christ, in God.
QUENYA: An quallelde, ar coivielda anaie nurtaina as i Hristo, Erusse.

ENGLISH: He is the one of whom I said: Look! A man is coming who is now in front of me, for before me he existed.
QUENYA: Sé ná i quén pa ye quenten: Yé! Túla nér ye sí ná opo ni, an nó ni enges.

ENGLISH: Also do not give oaths by your head, for you cannot make a single hair white or black.
QUENYA: Yando áva anta vandar carelyanen, an ualye pole care erya finde ninque hya morna.

ENGLISH: I have revealed your name to the men that you gave me out of the world. They were yours, and you gave them to me, and they have abided by your word.
QUENYA: Apantanien essetya i atanin i antanetye nin et i mardello. Anelte tyenye, ar antanetyet inyen, ar ihímielte quettatya.

ENGLISH: Do not be afraid, o little flock, for your Father has thought well to give you the kingdom!
QUENYA: Áva ruce, á pitya lámáre, an Atarelda asánie mai anta len i aranie!

ENGLISH: And they went with urgency and found Mary and Joseph and the infant lying in the manger.
QUENYA: Ar lendelte hormenen ar hirner María ar Yósef ar i vinimo caitala i salquecolcasse.

ENGLISH: For still they did not know the scripture, that was necessary for him to rise from dead.
QUENYA: An en uatte sinte i tehtele, i mauyane sen orta qualinillon.

ENGLISH: In reply he said: “To you it is given to understand the secrets of the kingdom of heaven, but to those people it is not given.
QUENYA: Hanquentasse quentes: “Len ná antana hanya menelo araniéno fóler, mal sane quenin uas antana.

ENGLISH: And after looking from person to person among them with anger, in grief since their heart was so hard, he said to the man: “Reach out with your hand!” And he reached out with it, and his hand was restored .
QUENYA: Ar apa yétie quenello quenenna mici te arwa rúşeo, nyéresse pan endalta náne ta hranga, quentes i nerenna: “Á rahta mályanen!” Ar rahtanes sanen, ar márya náne envinyanta.

ENGLISH: Therefore be awake, for you do not know what day your Lord will come.
QUENYA: Etta na cuive, an ualde ista mi mana ré Herulda tuluva.

ENGLISH: Pray, then, thus: Our Father in heaven, holy be your name!
QUENYA: Hyama, tá, sie: Átarelma menelde, na aire esselya!

ENGLISH: for was with him a daughter, his only child, who had about twelve years, and she near to death.
QUENYA: an enge óse yelde, erya hínarya, ye sáme os loar yunque, ar sé náne hare qualmenna.

ENGLISH: Thinking that he was among the people traveling together, they went a distance of one day; then they sought him among the people of their kin and the people that they knew.
QUENYA: Sánala i anes imíca i queni lelyala uo, lendette er aureo tie; tá cestanettes mici i queni nossetto ar i queni i sintette.

ENGLISH: Or if he asks for a fish – surely he will not give him a snake?
QUENYA: Hya qui arcas lingwe – lau antauvas sen leuca?

ENGLISH: For every chief priest taken from among men is put on behalf of men over God's things, to sacrifice gifts and sacrifices concerning sins.
QUENYA: An ilya héra airimo mapaina ho mici atani ná panyaina rá atanin or nati Eruva, yacien annar ar yancar pa úcari.

ENGLISH: On the following day he saw Jesus come to him, and he said: “Behold God’s Lamb who takes away the world’s sin!
QUENYA: I hilyala auresse cennes Yésus túla senna, ar eques: “Ela Eruo Eule ye mapa oa i mardo úcare!

ENGLISH: And happened when he returned, after receiving the kingdom, that he commanded that they were to call to him these thralls that he gave the money to, for him to know what they got by trade.
QUENYA: Ar túle íre nanwennes, apa camie i aranie, i cannes i yalumnelte senna móli sine in antanes i telpe, istieryan mana ñentelte mancalénen.

ENGLISH: When he said: “From the foreigners,” Jesus said to him: “Then the sons are indeed free.
QUENYA: Íre hé quente, “I etteleallon,” Yésus quente senna: “Tá i yondor é nar lére.

ENGLISH: that also creation itself will be freed from being a thrall of corruption into the glorious freedom of God's children.
QUENYA: i yú Ontie imma nauva leryana návello mól hastiéno mir i alcarinqua lérie Eruhínion.

ENGLISH: But we know, as the truth is, that God's judgement falls upon that do such things.
QUENYA: Mal istalve, ve i nanwie ná, in Eruo namie lanta innar carir taiti nati.

ENGLISH: For I think it is senseless if I send a bound person but fail to indicate the complaints against him.
QUENYA: An sanan i úhanda ná qui mentan nútina quén mal loita tea i nurri senna.

ENGLISH: But in all these things we have the victory, by that loved us.
QUENYA: Ono mi ilye sine nati samilve i apaire, yenen méle vi.

ENGLISH: And numerous ones assembled, until there was no more space, not even before the door, and he spoke the word to them.
QUENYA: Ar rimbali ocomner, tenna lá enge amba nóme, yando lá epe i fenna, ar quentes téna i quetta.

ENGLISH: concerning burning faith: persecuting the congregation, concerning the righteousness that is by Law: a person who was perfect.
QUENYA: pa uryala savie: roitala i ocombe, pa i failie ya ná Şanyenen: quén ye ilvana né.

ENGLISH: And who sat on the throne said: “Behold! I make all things new!” And he says: “Write, for these words are faithful and true!”
QUENYA: Ar ye hande i mahalmasse quente: “Yé! Envinyatan ilye nati!” Ar eques: “Teca, an quettar sine nar voronde ar şande!”

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you that this generation shall not pass away before all these things happen.
QUENYA: Násie quetin lenna i laume autuva nónare sina nó ilye nati sine martar.

ENGLISH: And they tried to give him wine with a sleep-inducing gum , but he did not want to drink it.
QUENYA: Ar névelte anta sen limpe arwa lornatála suhteo, mal uas merne sucitas.

ENGLISH: Jesus answered him and said: “If anyone loves me, he will abide by my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and will dwell with him.
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente ar eque: “Qui aiquen mele ni, himyuvas quettanya, ar Atarinya meluva se, ar tuluvamme senna ar maruvat óse.

ENGLISH: After Jesus again crossed to the other side with the boat, a large host gathered to him, and he was beside the sea.
QUENYA: Apa Yésus ata lahtane i hyana hrestanna i luntenen, hoa liyúme ocomne senna, ar anes ara i ear.

ENGLISH: Or does the potter not have power over the earth to make from the same lump a vessel for a glorious purpose, and another for a purpose that is not glorious?
QUENYA: Hya ma i cemnaro ua same túre or i cén carien i imya umbollo vene alcarinqua ennen, ar exe ennen ya ua alcarinqua?

ENGLISH: Who will speak evil against that God as chosen? God is who has spoken them just;
QUENYA: Man quetuva ulco innar Eru icílie? Eru ná ye equétie te faile;

ENGLISH: But the chief priests and the scribes arose and talked about crimes that they said he did.
QUENYA: Mal i hére airimor ar i parmangolmor oronter ar caramper pa ongweli yar quentelte carnes.

ENGLISH: But beloved ones, do not fail to perceive this: To the Lord a single day is like a thousand years, and thousand years as a single day.
QUENYA: Mal a meldar, áva loita tunta si: I Hérun erya ré ná ve loar húme, ar loar húme ve erya ré.

ENGLISH: And now, brothers, I know that you did so in lack of knowledge, as your rulers also did.
QUENYA: Ar sí, hánor, istan i carnelde sie peniesse istyava, ve turcoldar yú carner.

ENGLISH: The wind is blowing where it wants, and you hear the sound of it, but you do not know where it comes from or where it is goes to. So is everone who is born by the spirit.”
QUENYA: I súre ná hlápula yasse meris, ar hlaril lammarya, mal ual ista yallo tulis hya yanna lelyas. Sie ná ilquen ye ná nóna i fairenen.”

ENGLISH: who is not with me is my enemy, ar who does not gather with me, scatters.
QUENYA: Ye ua asinye ñottonya ná, ar ye ua comya asinye, vinta.

ENGLISH: This mystery is great – I am speaking about Christ and the congregation.
QUENYA: Fóle sina túra ná – inye quéta pa Hristo yo i ocombe.

ENGLISH: There were the altar of incence and the Ark of the Covenant, wholly covered by gold, in which was the receptable of gold having the manna and Aaron's staff which sprouted and the tablets of the covenant;
QUENYA: Tasse enger i yangwa nisqueo ar i Vérecolca, aqua tópina maltanen, yasse enge i camma maltava arwa i máno ar Árono vandil ya tuiane ar i palmat i véreo;

ENGLISH: But people saw them when they left, and many knew, and from all the cities they ran there on foot and came before them.
QUENYA: Mal queni te-cenner íre oantelte, ar rimbali sinter, ar ilye i ostollon nornelte tar talanen ar túler nó te.

ENGLISH: Since he wished, he caused us to exist by the word of truth, for us to be first fruits of his creatures.
QUENYA: Pan mernes, vi-tyarnes ea i quettanen nanwiéno, návelvan minye yáveli onnaryaron.

ENGLISH: But when this son of yours has come who devoured your livelihood with whores, you kill the fattened young bull for him!'
QUENYA: Mal íre utúlie yondotya sina ye ammante laulestatya as imbacindeli, nahtatye i maitana mundo sen!'

ENGLISH: But they understood nothing of these things, but this saying was hidden from them, and they did not know the things said.
QUENYA: Mal hanyanelte munta sine nation, mal quetie sina náne nurtaine tello, ar ualte sinte i nati quétine.

ENGLISH: And the chief priests heard it, and they sought how they could undo him, for they feared him, for his teaching filled the entire crowd with wonder.
QUENYA: Ar i hére airimor hlasser sa, ar cestanelte manen ence ten nancare se, an runcelte sello, an peantierya quante i quanda şanga elmendanen.

ENGLISH: See that you do not turn away who is speaking! For if they did not escape that turned him away when they received warning on earth, much more shall we not, if we turn away from who speaks from heaven.
QUENYA: Cena i ualde quere oa ye quéta! An qui té uar úşe i querner se oa íre camnelde orie cemende, ita ambe elve lauvar, qui querilvexer yello quete menello.

ENGLISH: Therefore humble yourselves under God's mighty hand, for him to make you exalted when the time comes.
QUENYA: Etta nucuma inde nu Eruo taura má, carieryan le arte íre i lúme tule.

ENGLISH: Again he went into a synagogue, and was there a man having a withered hand,
QUENYA: Ata lendes mir yomencoa, ar enge tasse nér arwa hessa máo,

ENGLISH: Though we spoke to you thus, beloved ones, concerning you we are sure of the better things that lead to salvation.
QUENYA: Ómu quetilme lenna sie, meldar, pa lé nalme tance i arye nation yar tulyar rehtienna.

ENGLISH: For all among us shall stand before the judgement seat of the Christ, and so everyone will receive his reward for the things done in the flesh, good or bad.
QUENYA: An illi mici vi taruvar epe i námohamma i Hristova, ar sie ilquen camuva paityalerya i natin cárine i hroanen, máre hya ulce.

ENGLISH: Therefore I am writing these things when I am away, to stop myself from behaving in a harsh manner when I shall be with you, by the power that the Lord gave me – to build up and not to tear down.
QUENYA: Etta técan nati sine íre nanye oa, pustien imne lengiello mi naraca lé íre euvan aselde, i túrenen ya i Heru antane nin – carastien ama ar lá narcien undu.

ENGLISH: For when God made his promise to Abraham, he gave his promise by himself, since there did not exist anyone greater by whom it it was possible for him to give it.
QUENYA: An íre Eru carne vandarya Avrahámen, antanes vandarya insenen, pan ua enge aiquen ambe túra yenen ence sen anta sa.

ENGLISH: And he sighted in his spirit and said: “What is the reason that this generation seeks a sign? Truly I say: This generation will not receive a sign.”
QUENYA: Ar síques faireryasse ar quente: “Mana i casta yanen nónare sina cesta tanwa? Násie quetin: Nónare sina ua camuva tanwa.”

ENGLISH: At that time came some Pharisees that said to him: “Go out and go away from here, for Herod wishes to kill you!”
QUENYA: Lúme yanasse túler Farisáli i quenter senna: “Mena ettenna ar á auta silo, an Herol mere nahta lye!”

ENGLISH: In answer John said: “Teacher, we saw a man expelling demons by your name, and we tried to stop him, since he was not with us.”
QUENYA: Hanquentasse eque Yoháno: “Peantar, cennelme nér et-háta raucor esselyanen, ar névelme pusta se, pan únes aselme.”

ENGLISH: to eat flesh of kings, flesh of commanders and flesh of strong men, flesh of horses and of who sat on them, the flesh of all, of rich ones and of slaves, of small ones and great ones.
QUENYA: matien hráve aranion, hráve cánoron ar hráve polde nerion, hráve roccoron ar ion hammer tesse, i hráve illion, léraron ar mólion, pityaron yo túraron.”

ENGLISH: Then the lust, when it conceives, bears sin, and when the sin has been done, it causes death.
QUENYA: Tá i maile, íre nostas, cole úcare, ar íre i úcare anaie cárina, tyaris qualme.

ENGLISH: And he took the dragon, the ancient serpent, who is the Devil and Satan, and bound him for a thousand years.
QUENYA: Ar nampes i hlóce, i yára leuca, ye i Arauco ar Sátan ná, ar avaleryane hé loain húme.

ENGLISH: But you carried the tent of Moloch and the star of Rephan your god, the images that you made to worship them. Therefore I will take you away, beyond Babel .'
QUENYA: Mal coldelde i lancoa Moloqua ar i elen Réfan ainoldava, i emmar yar carnelde tyerien tai. Etta mapuvan le oa, Vável pella.'

ENGLISH: The chief priests and the High Counsil sought lying testimony against Jesus, for them to kill him,
QUENYA: I hére airimor ar i Tára Combe cestaner húrala vettie Yésunna, nahtieltan se,

ENGLISH: The woman said to him: “Lord, I see that you are a prophet.
QUENYA: I nís quente senna: “Heru, cenin i elye Erutercáno ná.

ENGLISH: I have given your word to them, but the world has hated them, since they are not a part of the world, as I am not a part of the world.
QUENYA: Ánien quettatya tien, mal i mar etévie te, pan umilte ranta i mardo, síve inye ua ranta i mardo.

ENGLISH: and when they saw him, they fell down before him, but some among them were not firm in the faith.
QUENYA: ar íre cenneltes, lantanes undu epe se, mal queneli úner tance i saviesse.

ENGLISH: By faith he dwelt as a foreign person in the land of promise as in a foreign land, and he dwelt in tents with Isaac and Jacob, that were heirs with him of the same promise.
QUENYA: Saviénen marnes ve ettelea quén i nóresse vandava ve ettelea nóresse, ar marnes lancoalissen as Ísac ar Yácov, i aner aryolli óse i imya vando.

ENGLISH: But if we walk in the light as he is in the light, we have a part one with the other, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.
QUENYA: Ono qui vantalve i calasse tambe sé ea i calasse, samilve ranta quén as i exe, ar i serce Yésus Yondoryo vi-sove ilya úcarello.

ENGLISH: For since they do not know God's righteousness, but try to establish their own, they did not subject themselves to God's righteousness.
QUENYA: An pan ualte ista Eruo failie, mal nevir tulca véralta, ualte panyane inte nu Eruo failie.

ENGLISH: The story about them came to the ears of the congregation which was in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas as far as Antioch.
QUENYA: I nyarna pa te túle i hlarunna i ocombeo ya enge Yerúsalemesse, ar mentanelte Varnavas tenna Antioc.

ENGLISH: Have the same mind that also existed in Christ Jesus!
QUENYA: Sama i imya sáma ya yando enge mi Hristo Yésus!

ENGLISH: May my love be with all among you in Christ Jesus.
QUENYA: Nai melmenya euva as illi mici le mi Hristo Yésus.

ENGLISH: In answer Jesus said to him: “ is written: The Lord your God you are to worship, and for him alone you are to serve.”
QUENYA: Hanquentasse Yésus quente senna: “Ná técina: I Héru Ainolya alye tyere, ar sen erinqua alye veuya.”

ENGLISH: For this son of mine was dead and has come back to life; he was lost and has been found!' And they began to have joy.
QUENYA: An yondonya sina náne qualin ar enutúlie coivienna; anes vanwa ar anaie hírina!' Ar yestanelte same alasse.

ENGLISH: sincerely trying to keep the oneness of the spirit with a bond of peace.
QUENYA: holmo návala hepe i erie i faireo nútenen raineva.

ENGLISH: They answered him: “Our father is Abraham!” Jesus said to them: “If you are Abraham’s children, do Abraham’s deeds!
QUENYA: Hanquentes senna: “Atarelma Avraham ná!” Eque téna Yésus: “Qui nalde Avrahámo híni, cara Avrahámo cardar!

ENGLISH: Indeed I have joy in God's Law by my inner man,
QUENYA: É samin alasse Eruo Şanyesse mitya ataninyanen,

ENGLISH: I know your tribulation and your poverty – but you are rich – and the mockery of who call themselves Jews, and yet they are not, but are Satan’s synagogue:
QUENYA: Istan şangielya ar únielya – mal nalye lárea – ar i yaiwe ion estar inte Yúrar, ananta ualte, mal nar Sátano yomencoa:

ENGLISH: Then he spoke this comparison to them:
QUENYA: Tá quentes sestie sina téna:

ENGLISH: When they say: “Peace and security!”, then destruction will with a sudden twist come upon them, just as when the sharp pain seizes a woman heavy with child before she bears her child, and they will by no means escape.
QUENYA: Íre quetilte: “Raine yo varnasse!”, tá nancarie rincenen tuluva téna, aqua ve i aice mapa lapselunga nís nó colis hínarya, ar laume uşuvalte.

ENGLISH: But a man ruled by his nature does not receive that come from God's spirit, for to him they are foolishness, and he cannot know them, for they are inquired into in the manner of the spirit.
QUENYA: Mal atan turúna nasseryanen ua came yar tulir Eruo fairello, an sen nalte úhandie, ar lá ece sen ista tai, an nalte minaşúraine mí faireo lé.

ENGLISH: Surely you are not greater than Jacob our father, who gave us the well and who himself drank from it with his sons and his animals?”
QUENYA: Lau elye ná túra lá Yácov aterelma, ye antane men i tampo ar ye immo sunce sallo as yondoryar ar celvaryar?”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, what one seeks in overseers is that everyone is being found faithful.
QUENYA: Ente, ya mo cesta mi ortirmor ná in ilquen híraina voronda ná.

ENGLISH: And he said to me: “These words are faithful and true. The Lord, the God of the spirits of the prophets, has sent his angel to show his servants things that soon will happen.
QUENYA: Ar eques ninna: “Quettar sine nar voronde ar şande. I Héru, i Aino fairion i Erutercánoron, ementaye valarya tanáven núroryain yar ron martuvar.

ENGLISH: But it is necessary that the Lord's slave does not quarrel, but that he is gentle to all, knowing to instruct, restraining himself when he suffers evil,
QUENYA: Ono mauya in i Heruo mól ua costa, mal i náse moica illin, istala peanta, avaleryala inse íre perperis ulco,

ENGLISH: By itself the earth bears fruit: first leaves, then it makes head of the straw, finally full grain in head of the straw.
QUENYA: Insanen i cemen cole yáve: minyave lasseli, tá caris cas i sirpeo, teldave quanta ore caresse i sirpeo.

ENGLISH: Be, then, perfect, as your Father in heaven is perfect.
QUENYA: Na, tá, ilvane, tambe Atarelda menelde ilvana ná.

ENGLISH: they took branches of palm trees and went out to meet him. And they cried: “Hosanna! Blessed is who comes in the name of the Lord, the king of Israel!”
QUENYA: nampelte olvali nindornelion ar etemenner omentien se. Ar yámelte: “Hosanna! Aistana ná ye tule i Héruo essenen, i aran Israélo!”

ENGLISH: As if I am not coming to you, some have elevated themselves,
QUENYA: Ve au uan túla lenna, ennoli orortayer inte,

ENGLISH: For that hear law are not the just ones before God, but the ones that do law will be made just.
QUENYA: An i hlarir şanye uar i failar epe Eru, mal i carir şanye nauvar cárine faile.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, Levi made a great feast for him at his house, and was a great crowd, tax collectors and others, that were with them at the table.
QUENYA: Ente, Lévi carne túra merende sen coaryasse, ar enge hoa şanga, tungwemóli ar exeli, i náner aselte ara i sarno.

ENGLISH: When they went through the entire island as far as Paphos, they met a man who was a wizard, a false prophet .
QUENYA: Íre lendelte ter i quanda tol tenna Pafos, veldelte nér ye náne sairon, hurutercáno.

ENGLISH: Do not look down on speaking like a prophet.
QUENYA: Áva nattire quetie ve Erutercáno.

ENGLISH: And another said: 'I have traded to myself five yokes of oxes, and I am going to test them. I beg of you, do not think evil about me since it is not possible for me to come.'
QUENYA: Ar exe quente: 'Amancien imnin yantar lempe mundoron, ar ménan tyastien te. Iquin lyello, áva sana ulco pa ni pan ua ece nin tule.'

ENGLISH: Therefore, it is necessary that he has a good witness from people on the outside, to stop him from falling into rebuke and the Devil's snare.
QUENYA: Ente, mauya i samis mára vettie quenillon i ettesse, pustien se lantiello mir tulcarpie ar i Arauco remma.

ENGLISH: In answer Jesus said to them: “Truly I say to you: If you have faith and are not uncertain, you will not do only what I did to the fig tree, but also if you say to this mountain: Be lifted and thrown into the sea!, that will happen.
QUENYA: Hanquentasse Yésus quente téna: “Násie quetin lenna: Qui samilde savie ar uar iltance, ualde rie caruva ya inye carne i relyávaldan, mal yú qui quetilde oron sinanna: Na ortana ar hátina mir i ear!, ta martuva.

ENGLISH: They brought the man who formerly was blind to the Pharisees.
QUENYA: Tulunelte i nér ye yá náne lomba i Farisannar.

ENGLISH: And when he went into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, petitioning of him
QUENYA: Ar íre lendes mir Capernaum, tuxantur túle senna, arcala senna

ENGLISH: Indeed he was known beforehand before the founding of the world, but he was revealed at the end of times for your good,
QUENYA: É anes sinwa nóvo nó i tulcie i mardeva, mal anes apantaina i mettasse lúmion márieldan,

ENGLISH: And not just that, but we also bless ourselves in God, through Jesus Christ our Lord, through whom peace has now been established for us.
QUENYA: Ar lá rie ta, mal yú laitalvexer Erusse, ter Yésus Hristo Herulva, ter ye raine sí anaie tulcana ven.

ENGLISH: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you are like whitened graves, which indeed seem beautiful on the outside, but on the inside they are full of bones of dead ones and every kind of uncleanness.
QUENYA: Horro len, parmangolmor ar Farisar, imnetyandor, an nalde ve ninquinte sapsar, yar é şéyar vanye i ettesse, mal i mityasse nalte quante axoinen qualinion ar ilya nostalénen úpoitiéva.

ENGLISH: Thrice I have been beaten with rods; one time I have been stoned. Thrice the ship on which I was went down; for a night and a day I have been in the deep waters,
QUENYA: Nel anaien palpaina vandillínen; lú er anaien saryaina. Nel i cirya yasse anen lende undu; ter lóme yo aure anaien i núre nenissen,

ENGLISH: Do not for food tear down what God has made! All things are indeed clean, but they are evil to a man who perceives it as a fall when he eats.
QUENYA: Áva mattan narca undu ya Eru acárie! Ilye nati é nar poice, mal nalte ulce atanen ye tunta sa ve lante íre matis.

ENGLISH: For by the catch of fishes he was struck with wonder, he and all that were with him,
QUENYA: An i mapiénen lingwilíva anes pétina elmendanen, sé ar illi i náner óse,

ENGLISH: After Jesus finished commanding his twelve disciples, he sent them forth from there, to teach and to make the message known in their cities.
QUENYA: Apa Yésus telyane cane hildoryain yunque, etementanes te talo, peantien ar carien i menta sinwa ostoltassen.

ENGLISH: And one of the crowd answered him: “Teacher, I brought my son to you since he is possessed by a dumb demon, and every time when it seizes him, it throws him to ground, and he foams and grinds his teeth and is made stiff. And I petitioned of your disciples that they would throw it out, but they could not.”
QUENYA: Ar quén i şango hanquente senna: “Peantar, tallen yondoya lyenna pan náse haryaina lo úpa rauco; ar ilya lú yasse se-mapas, se-hatis talamenna, ar falastas ar mule nelciryar ar ná cárina tauca. Ar arcanen hildolyallon i etehatumneltes, mal ualte polde.”

ENGLISH: What, then, are we to say? Are we to remain in sin, to make grace abundant?
QUENYA: Mana, tá, quetuvalve? Ma lemyuvalve úcaresse, carien Erulisse úvea?

ENGLISH: You did not anoint my head with oil, but this woman anointed my feet with fragrant oil.
QUENYA: Ual líve carinya millonen, mal nís sina líve talunyat níşima millonen.

ENGLISH: But you, beloved ones, build yourselves with your most holy faith, and pray with Holy Spirit.
QUENYA: Mal elde, a meldar, á carasta inde amaire savieldanen, ar hyama Aire Feanen.

ENGLISH: But the hour is coming, and it is now, when the true worshippers will worship the father with spirit and with truth, for such worshippers the Father seeks.
QUENYA: Mal i lúme túla, ar eas sí, yasse i nanwe tyerindor tyeruvar i Atar fairenen ar nanwiénen, an taiti tyerindor i Atar cesta.

ENGLISH: From there he arose and went into the regions of Tyre and Sidon. And he went into a house and did not wish that anyone was to know, but he could not remain hidden.
QUENYA: Talo orontes ar lende mir i ménar Tíro ar Sírono. Ar lendes mir coa ar ua merne i aiquen istumne, mal uas polde lemya muina.

ENGLISH: though I indeed have reasons for believing that I have security also by the flesh.
QUENYA: ómu inye é same castali savien i samin varnasse yando i hrávenen.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “If my will is that he will remain until I come, what is that to you? You follow me!”
QUENYA: Eque senna Yésus: “Qui şelmanya ná i lemyuvas tenna tulin, mana ta lyen? Elye áni hilya!”

ENGLISH: You be awake and pray, that you do not come into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.
QUENYA: Alde na coive ar alde hyame, i ualde tule úsahtienna. I faire mérala ná, mal i hráve milya ná.”

ENGLISH: Hear another comparison: There was a man, a householder, who planted a garden of vines , surrounded it with a fence, dug a wine-press and built a tower. Then he let some cultivators use it for money, and went to foreign country.
QUENYA: Hlara hyana sestie: Enge nér, coantur, ye empanne tarwa liantassion, pelde sa pelonen, sampe limpevorma ar carastane mindo. Tá láves alamólin yuhta sa telpen, ar lende ettelea nórenna.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to him: “Do you believe because of seeing me? Happy are those who have not seen and yet believe.”
QUENYA: Yésus quente senna: “Ma savil ceniénen ni? Alassie nar i uar ecénie ananta savir.”

ENGLISH: Thus it is just in God's eyes to pay back tribulation to those that cause tribulation to you,
QUENYA: Sie ná faila Eruo hendusse nampaitya şangie in tyarir şangie len,

ENGLISH: son of Amminadab, son of Arni, son of Hezron,
QUENYA: yondorya Amminarav, yondorya Arni, yondorya Hesron, yondorya Peres, yondorya Yehúra,

ENGLISH: And he said to him: “When I come, I shall heal him!”
QUENYA: Ar quentes senna: “Íre tulin, nestuvanyes!”

ENGLISH: Therefore, if you are the Christ's, indeed you are Abraham's seed, heirs by the promise.
QUENYA: Ente, qui nalde i Hristova, é nalde Avrahámo erde, aryoni i vandanen.

ENGLISH: And he sprinkled the tent and all the vessels of the service in the same manner, with the blood.
QUENYA: Ar palastanes i lancoa ar ilye i veni i veviéno mí imya lé, i sercenen.

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “When I sent you without purse and food-box and shoes, surely you did not lack a single thing?” They said: “We did not.”
QUENYA: Ar quentes téna: “Íre le-mentanen ú pocolleo ar matsocolco ar hyapato, lau pennelte erya nat?” Quentelte: “Lánelme.”

ENGLISH: The young man said to him: “I have kept all these commandments; what do I still lack?”
QUENYA: I nessa nér quente senna: “Ihímien ilye axani sine; mana en penin?”

ENGLISH: Receive others into your houses, not grumbling.
QUENYA: Cama exeli mir coaldar, lá nurrula.

ENGLISH: Therefore his disciples took him and sent him down by rope in a basket through a hole in the wall.
QUENYA: Etta hildoryar namper se ar mentaner se undu rappanen vircolcasse ter assa i rambasse.

ENGLISH: But anyone who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not ever receive forgiveness, but carries the guilt of eternal sin.”
QUENYA: Mal aiquen ye naiquete i Aire Feanna ua oi camuva apsenie, mal cole i cáma oira úcareo.”

ENGLISH: Or let these men say what evil they found in me when I stood before the High Council,
QUENYA: Hya lava sine nerin quete mana ulco hirnelte nisse íre tarnen epe i Tára Combe,

ENGLISH: Therefore they cut away the anchors and let them fall into the sea, and at the same time they loosened the lashes of the rudder. Then they raised the forward sail towards the wind and went against the beach.
QUENYA: Etta aucirnelte i ciryampar ar láver tain lanta mir i ear, ar mí imya lú lehtanelte i lattar i tullo. Tá ortanelte i pota-velunte i súrinna ar lender ana i hresta.

ENGLISH: He said to them: “The harvest is abundant, but those who work are few. Therefore ask of the Lord of the harvest, for him to send people to gather his harvest.
QUENYA: Quentes téna: “I yavie ná úvea, mal i molir nar mance. Etta á arca i yaviéno Herullo, mentieryan queni hostien yavierya.

ENGLISH: For our God is also a consuming fire.
QUENYA: An Ainolva na yando ammátala ruive.

ENGLISH: by means of whom God has wished to make known among the nations what the glorious riches of this secret are. That is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
QUENYA: inen Eru emérie care sinwa imíca i nóri mana i alcarinque lari fóle sino nar. Ta ná Hristo lesse, i estel alcaro.

ENGLISH: And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests to give Jesus over to them.
QUENYA: Ar Yúras Iscariot, quén i yunqueo, oante i hére airimonnar antien Yésus olla ten.

ENGLISH: In the same manner the Spirit also helps us when we are weak. We do not know what we would do well by requesting it, but the Spirit itself petitions for us, with unutterable words.
QUENYA: Mí imya lé i Faire yú vi-manya íre nalve milye. Ualve ista mana carumnelve mai arciénen sa, mal i Faire imma arca ven, alaquétime quettainen.

ENGLISH: He is sitting by God's right hand, for he went away to heaven, and angels and authorities and powers have been put under him .
QUENYA: Háras ara Eruo forma, an oantes menelenna, ar vali ar héri ar túri anainer panyaine nu se.

ENGLISH: And his hearing was opened, and the bond of his tongue was loosed, and he spoke normally.
QUENYA: Ar hlárerya náne latyaina, ar lambaryo núte náne lehtaina, ar carampes şanyave.

ENGLISH: But on my journey, when I came near to Damascus, around the middle of the day, suddenly out of heaven a great line shone at me,
QUENYA: Mal lendanyasse, íre túlen hare Lamascusenna, os ende i aureo, rincanen et menello hoa cala caltane ninna,

ENGLISH: Therefore do this thing that we tell you: are with us four men that have a vow.
QUENYA: Etta cara nat sina ya nyarilme len: Ear aselme neri canta i samir vanda.

ENGLISH: Judge for yourselves: Is it proper if a woman without cover prays to God?
QUENYA: Nama elden: Ma vanima ná qui nís pen tópo hyame Erunna?

ENGLISH: Do not carry a pouch, or a bag for food, or a pair of shoes; and do not greet anyone on the road.
QUENYA: Áva cole pocolle, hya poco matson, hya hyapat; ar áva suila aiquen i mallesse.

ENGLISH: though it would have been possible for us to be a heavy burden as Christ's apostles.
QUENYA: ómu éciévane men náve lunga cólo ve Hristo aposteli.

ENGLISH: And was given to it to make war on the holy ones and to conquer them, and it received authority over every tribe and people and tongue and nation.
QUENYA: Ar náne sen antana care ohta i airinnar ar turue te, ar camnes hére or ilya nosse ar lie ar lambe ar nóre.

ENGLISH: In the fifteenth year in which Tiberius ruled as High King , when Pontius Pilate was governor , and Herod ruled as farthing-ruler in Galilee, and Philip his brother ruled as farthing-ruler in the regions Iturea and Traconitis, and Lysenias was the farthing-ruler of Abilene,
QUENYA: I lepenquea loasse yasse Tivério turne ve Ingaran, íre Pontio Piláto náne nórecáno Yúreo, ar Herol turne ve canastatur mi Alilea, ar Filip hánorya turne ve canastatur mí ménar Ituréa ar Traconitis, ar Lisánias náne i canastatur Aviléneo,

ENGLISH: Hearing that, Jesus said to him: “ is still one thing that you lack. Sell everything that you have and distribute the money to poor ones, and you will have a treasure in heaven; then come and follow me.”
QUENYA: Hlárala ta, Yésus quente senna: “Ea en er nat ya penil. Vaca ilqua ya samil ar etsata i telpe penyain, ar samuval harma menelde; tá tula ar áni hilya.”

ENGLISH: And a rod like a staff was given to me, and one said: “Rise and measure the temple of God and the altar and those who worship in it,
QUENYA: Ar sirpe ve vandil náne nin antana, ar mo quente: “Á orta ar á lesta i corda Eruva ar i yangwa ar i tyerir sasse,

ENGLISH: wild waves of the sea, foaming with their own reasons for being ashamed, errant stars, for whom the gloom of darkness is reserved forever.
QUENYA: hravani falmali i earo, falastala vére castaltainen náven naityana, ránie tinweli, in i huine morniéva ná sátina tennoio.

ENGLISH: And yet wisdom is shown just by all its children.”
QUENYA: Ananta sailie ná tanaina faila lo ilye hínaryar.”

ENGLISH: Thereafter, after not many days, the younger son gathered everything and went away into a remote land, and here he threw away his money on a wild life.
QUENYA: Epeta, apa lá rimbe auri, i ambe nessa yondo comyane ilqua ar lende oa mir haira nóre, ar tasse hantes oa telperya verca coiviesse.

ENGLISH: and sailing difficultly by the shore we came to a place called Fair Havens, near to the city Lasea.
QUENYA: ar círala urdave ara i falasse túlelme nómenna estaina Vanime Hópar, hare i ostonna Laséa.
