ENGLISH: But we urge you, brothers: Show the right path to the errant ones, speak with comfort to that lack courage, help the ones that are weak, have patience towards all.
QUENYA: Mal hortalme le, hánor: Á tana i téra tie i ráneain, queta tiutalénen innar penir huore, á manya i nar milye, sama cóle illin.

ENGLISH: Keep the belt on your hips and your lamps burning,
QUENYA: Hepa i quilta oşweldasse ar calmaldar uryala,

ENGLISH: Therefore for Tyre and to Sodom the judgement will be more bearable than for you!
QUENYA: Etta Tíren ar Síronen i namie nauva cólima lá lent!

ENGLISH: The officers said: “No man has ever spoken like this.”
QUENYA: I cánor hanquenter: “Atan ua oi acarpie sie.”

ENGLISH: But who among you, having a thrall who works with the plow or as a shepherd, will say to him when he comes from the field: 'Come here quickly and lie down at the table'?
QUENYA: Mal man mici le, arwa mólo ye mole i hyarnen hya ve mavar, quetuva senna íre tulis i restallo: 'Tula sir lintiénen ar á caita undu ara i sarno'?

ENGLISH: Furthermore, without faith it is not possible to be good from his perspective, for it is necessary for that comes near to God to believe that he exists, and that he rewards anyone who seeks him.
QUENYA: Ente, ú saviéno ua cárima náve mára sen, an mauya yen tule hare Erunna save i eas, ar i paityas aiquen ye cesta se.

ENGLISH: After the reading out of the Law and of the Prophets, the synagogue chiefs sent to them, saying: “Men, brothers, if you have a word of comfort for the people, tell it!”
QUENYA: Apa i et-hentie i Şanyeva ar i Erutercánoiva, i yomencoanturi mentaner túna, quétala: “Neri, hánor, qui samiste quetta tiutaléva i lien, ása nyare!”

ENGLISH: And he went down to Capernaum, a city in Galilee. And he taught them on the day of rest,
QUENYA: Ar lendes undu Caparnaumenna, osto Alileasse. Ar peantanes tien i sendaresse,

ENGLISH: And they went away by the boat to a lonely place, they alone.
QUENYA: Ar oantelte i luntenen eressea nómenna, té erinque.

ENGLISH: For there is nothing that is hidden except in order to be revealed; nothing has been concealed except for it to come into the open.
QUENYA: An ea munta ya ná nurtaina hequa náven apantaina; munta anaie halyaina hequa tulieryan mir i pantie.

ENGLISH: I write to you, not because you do not know the truth, but because you know it, and because there is not lie that comes from the truth.
QUENYA: Tecin lenna, lá pan ualde ista i nanwie, mal pan istaldes, ar pan lá ea huru ya tule i nanwiello.

ENGLISH: For the foolish thing of God is wiser than men, and a weak thing of God is stronger than Men.
QUENYA: An i úhanda nat Eruo ná saila lá Atani, ar milya nat Eruo ná polda lá Atani.

ENGLISH: Instead, you did well if you said: "If the Lord wants, we shall still be alive and also do this or that."
QUENYA: Mí men, carnelde mai qui quentelde: "Qui i Heru mere, nauvalve en coirie ar yando care si hya ta."

ENGLISH: But to that does not work, but believes in that makes just the godless one, his faith is counted as righteousness.
QUENYA: Mal yen ua mole, mal save yesse care faila i ainolóra, savierya ná nótina ve failie.

ENGLISH: For the multitude of the people followed him, crying: “Kill him!”
QUENYA: An i liyúme i lieo hilyane te, yámala: “Áse nahta!”

ENGLISH: in order to walk worthily before the Lord, giving him perfect joy when you bear fruit and grow in the knowlege of God,
QUENYA: vantien valdave epe i Heru, antala sen ilvana alasse íre colilde yáve ar alir mí istya Eruo,

ENGLISH: and not solely for the nation, but that he would be able to gather into one the Children of God that are scattered.
QUENYA: ar lá rie i nóren, mal i polumnes comya mir er i Eruhíni i nar vintaine.

ENGLISH: Above everything, my brothers, do not give oaths – by heaven or by earth or by every other oath. May you say "yes, yes" – "no, no", or you will fall under judgement.
QUENYA: Or ilqua, hánonyar, áva anta vandar – menelden hya cemennen hya ilya hyana vandanen. Nai quetilde "ná, ná" – "vá, vá", hya lantuvalde nu námie.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, do not call anyone on earth your father, for you have a single Father, the heavenly one.
QUENYA: Ente, áva esta aiquen cemende atarelda, an samilde erya Atar, i meneldea.

ENGLISH: Do know this thing, my beloved brothers: For every man it is necessary to be quick about hearing, slow about speaking, slow about wrath;
QUENYA: Á ista nat sina, melde hánonyar: Ilya atanen mauya náve linta pa hlarie, lenca pa quetie, lenca pa orme;

ENGLISH: Come to me, all that toil and carry heavy burdens, and I will give you rest!
QUENYA: Tula ninna, illi i mótar ar colir lunge cólar, ar antauvan lyen sére!

ENGLISH: But there was a young man who followed him, having a linen raiment over his naked body; and they tried to seize him,
QUENYA: Mal enge nessa nér ye hilyane se, arwa páşelarmo or helda hroarya; ar rincelte mapa se,

ENGLISH: And yet now, by reason of the promise given to our fathers, I am standing here to be judged.
QUENYA: Ananta sí, castanen i vando antana atarilmain, táran náven námina.

ENGLISH: for I know that you are willing. Therefore I praise you in Macedonia, saying that Achaia was ready one year ago, and your burning spirit has spurred the majority .
QUENYA: an istan i nalde mérala. Etta le-laitan Maceroniasse, quétala i Acaia náne manwa er loa yá, ar uryala şúlelda avaltie i amarimbar.

ENGLISH: who has received his witness has put his seal on the faithfulness of God.
QUENYA: Ye acámie vettierya apánie lihtarya i voronwesse Eruo.

ENGLISH: But who has heard and does not do, is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. Against it the river beat, and in that moment it collapsed, and the collapse of that house was great.”
QUENYA: Mal ye ahlárie ar ua care, ná ve nér ye carastane coa i talamesse ú talmo. Sanna i síre pente, ar mí tana lú talantes, ar coa tano atalantie náne túra.”

ENGLISH: and will give him over to the nations, for them to behave towards him with scorn and for them to flay him and for them to crucify him, and on the third day he will be raised!”
QUENYA: ar antauvaltes olla i nórin, lengieltan senna yaiwenen ar riptieltan se ar tarwestieltan se, ar i neldea auresse nauvas ortana!”

ENGLISH: For they were around five thousand people. But he said to his disciples: “Make them lie down in groups of people around fifty in each group.”
QUENYA: An anelte os neri húmi lempe. Mal quentes hildoryannar: “Tyara te caita undu mi hostar queniva os lepenquean mi ilya hosta.”

ENGLISH: and yet they did not find what to do , for the entire people stuck to him to listen.
QUENYA: ananta ualte hirne mana carumnelte, an i quanda lie himyane se lastien.

ENGLISH: Take away the old leaven, for you to be a new dough which is without leaven. For our sacrifice of passover, Christ, has been slain.
QUENYA: Á mapa oa i yára pulmaxe, náveldan vinya maxe ya pen pulmaxe ná. An yancalva lahtiéva, Hristo, anaie nahtana.

ENGLISH: And who sent me is with me; he has not left me alone, because I always do which is pleasing to him.”
QUENYA: Ar ye ni-mentane ea asinye; uas ehehtie ni erinqua, pan inye illume care ya ná sen mára.”

ENGLISH: Now I find joy in our sufferings concerning you, and I am filling what is lacking of the sufferings of the Christ by means of my flesh, on behalf of his body, which is the congregation.
QUENYA: Sí hirin alasse perperielmassen pa elde, ar inye quáta ya pénina ná i perperiéron i Hristo hrávenyanen, rá hroaryan, ya i ocombe ná.

ENGLISH: But the scribes among the Pharisees, seeing that he ate with the sinners and the tax collectors, said to his disciples: “Does he eat with the tax collectors and sinners?”
QUENYA: Mal i parmangolmor imíca i Farisar, cénala i mantes as i úcarindor ar i tungwemor, quenter hildoryannar: “Ma matis as i tungwemor ar úcarindor?”

ENGLISH: Let the elders that stand before the congregation in a good manner, be counted worthy of double honor, above all the ones that toil in speaking and teaching.
QUENYA: Lava i amyárain i tarir epe i ocombe mi mára lé náve nótaine valde atwa laitiéno, or illi i mótar carpiesse ar peantiesse.

ENGLISH: But turning themselves from these things some have been turned to empty speaking ,
QUENYA: Mal quérala inte sine natillon quelli anaier quérine cumna quetienna,

ENGLISH: And now I ask of you, o lady, not as if I am writing to you a new commandment, but that which we had from the beginning: that we love one another.
QUENYA: Ar sí arcan lyello, a heri, lá ve qui técan lyen vinya axan, mal ta ya sámelve i yestallo: i melilve quén i exe.

ENGLISH: and «a stone of slipping and a stone causing people to fall». They fall because they do not heed the word; so they have been destined.
QUENYA: ar «sar taltiéva ar ondo tyárala queni lanta». Lantalte pan ualte cime i quetta; sie anaielte martyaine.

ENGLISH: The kings of earth have taken stand and the rulers have assembled as one, against the Lord and against his Christ.'
QUENYA: Cemeno arani atárier ar i cánor ócómier ve er, i Hérunna ar Hristoryanna.'

ENGLISH: and they made a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and a reed in his right hand.
QUENYA: ar carnelte ríe neceliva ar panyaner sa caryasse, ar esce formaryasse.

ENGLISH: to stop anyone from being pulled away by these tribulations. For you know that this thing is destined for us .
QUENYA: pustien aiquen návello túcina oa lo şangier sine. An elde istar i nat sina ná ven martyana.

ENGLISH: He knows to behave gently to who lack knowledge and are errant, since he as well always perceives his own weak state,
QUENYA: Istas lenga milyave in penir istya ar nar ránie, pan yando sé illume tunta véra milya sómarya,

ENGLISH: to comfort their heart, for them to be united in love and for them toreceive the whole riches of a full understanding, and for them to get knowledge of the mystery of God: Christ.
QUENYA: tiutien endalta, náveltan ertaine melmesse ar camieltan i quanda lar quanta handeo, ar ñetieltan istya i fóleo Eruo: Hristo.

ENGLISH: Therefore recall how you have received and how you heard, and keep it, and find repentance! If you do not become awake, I shall come like a thief, and you will by no means know the hour in which I shall come upon you.
QUENYA: Etta enyala manen acámiel ar manen hlassel, ar ása hepe, ar hira inwis! Qui ual oluva cuiva, tuluvan ve arpo, ar laume istuval i lúme yasse tuluvan lyenna.

ENGLISH: But if you heed faces , you sin, since you receive a rebuke from the Law, about breaking it.
QUENYA: Mal qui cimilde cendeler, úcarilde, pan camilde tulcarpie i ªanyello, pa racie sa.

ENGLISH: and all that heard perceived it in their heart, saying: “What indeed will this child be?” For also the Lord's hand was with him.
QUENYA: ar illi i hlasser túner sa endaltasse, quétala: “É mana nauva hína sina?” An yando i Héruo má enge óse.

ENGLISH: Thus all among them will be judged, since they did not believe the truth, but had joy in unrighteousness.
QUENYA: Sie illi mici te nauvar námine, pan ualte sáve i nanwie, mal sámer alasse úfailiesse.

ENGLISH: And behold! some people bearing on a bed a man that was lame, and they sought to bring him forward and put him before Jesus.
QUENYA: Ar yé! quelli cólala caimasse nér ye náne úlévima, ar cestanelte tala se ompa ar panya se epe Yésus.

ENGLISH: blocked the power of fire, escaped from the blades of swords, from a weak state were made strong; they were bold in war, they scattered foreign armies.
QUENYA: tamper ruiveo túre, úşer macillion maicallon, milya sómallo náner cárine polde; anelte canye ohtasse, vintanelte ettelie hosseli.

ENGLISH: Do not allow foul word to come out of your mouth, but speak every saying that is good in order to build up, as the need is, in order to give a grace to who listen.
QUENYA: Áva lave şaura quettan tule et antoldallo, mal queta ilya quetie ya mára ná carastien ama, ve i maure ná, antien lisse in lastar.

ENGLISH: When the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized disciples more numerous than the disciples of John –
QUENYA: Íre i Heru sinte i náner i Farisar hlárienwe i Yésus carne ar tumyane hildoli rimbe lá i hildor Yohanneo –

ENGLISH: And they spoke the Lord's word to him and to all that were in his house.
QUENYA: Ar quentette i Heruo quetta senna ar ilyannar i enger coaryasse.

ENGLISH: Woe to you, for you are like the tombs that are not easy to see, causing people to walk over them without knowing.”
QUENYA: Horro len, an nalde ve i noiri yar uar aşcénime, tyárala queni vanta olla tai ú istiéno.”

ENGLISH: For you have the same war that you saw that I had, and as you now are hearing that I still have.
QUENYA: An samilde i imya ohta ya cennelde i inye sáme, ar ve sí hláralde i en samin.

ENGLISH: Then the governor, when he saw what had happend, believed; and he was in wonder at the Lord's teaching.
QUENYA: Tá i nórecáno, íre cennes ya martanelyane, sáve; ar anes elmendasse i Heruo peantiénen.

ENGLISH: and I fell to earth and heard a voice say to me: 'Saul, Saul, what is your reason for persecuting me?'
QUENYA: ar lantanen cemenna ar hlasse óma quéta ninna: 'Saul, Saul, mana castalya roitien ni?'

ENGLISH: you shall give glory to your father and to your mother, and love your neighbour as yourself!”
QUENYA: alye anta alcar atarelyan ar amillelyan, ar mela armarolya ve imle!”

ENGLISH: When evening came, he lay at the table with the twelve disciples. While they were eating, he said: “Truly I say to you: One among you will give me over!”
QUENYA: Íre şinye túle, caines ara i sarno as i hildor yunque. Íre mátanelte, quentes: “Násie quetin lenna: Quén imíca le antauva ni olla!”

ENGLISH: Therefore take heed how you listen, for anyone who has, more will be given to him, but anyone who does not have, also which he believes he has will be taken from him.”
QUENYA: Etta cima manen lastalde, an aiquen ye same, amba nauva antaina sen, mal aiquen ye ua same, yando ya savis i samis nauva mapaina sello.”

ENGLISH: For anyone who is shamed concerning me and my words in this generation that breaks marriage and is full of sin, about him the Son of Man will be shamed when he shall come in his father's glory with the holy angels.”
QUENYA: An aiquen ye ná naityana pa ni ar quattanyar mi nónare sina ya race vestale ar ná quanta úcareo, pa sé i Atanyondo nauva naityana íre tuluvas Ataryo alcaresse as i airi vali.”

ENGLISH: But you have followed my instruction, my path in life, my aim, my faith, my patience, my steadfastness,
QUENYA: Ono elye ihílie peantienya, tienya coiviesse, mehtinya, savienya, cólenya, melmenya, voronwenya,

ENGLISH: And he did not do numerous mighty deeds there, since they lacked faith.
QUENYA: Ar uas carne tasse rimbe taure cardali, pan pennelte savie.

ENGLISH: For everyone will carry his own burden.
QUENYA: An ilquen coluva véra cólarya.

ENGLISH: Therefore that was “counted to him as righteousness”.
QUENYA: Etta ta náne “nótina sen ve failie”.

ENGLISH: For the life is more precious than food, and the body than clothes.
QUENYA: An i cuile ná mirwa lá matso, ar i hroa lá lanni.

ENGLISH: Emptily they worship me, teaching Men's teachings!”
QUENYA: Cumnave tyerilte ni, peantala Atanion peantier!”

ENGLISH: But in answer Jesus said: “Allow it to happen, for thus it is proper for us to do everything that is just.” Then he allowed him .
QUENYA: Mal hanquentasse Yésus quente: “Ásan lave marta, an sie ná vent vanima care ilqua ya faila ná!” Tá hé láve sen.

ENGLISH: And after crossing to the land they came to Gennesareth and fastened the boat there.
QUENYA: Ar apa lahtie i nórenna túlelte Ennesaretenna ar tancer i lunte tasse.

ENGLISH: For Christ sent me, not to baptize, but to make known the gospel, not with wisdom of speech, causing the cross of Christ to lack its power.
QUENYA: An Hristo ni-mentane, lá sumbien, mal carien sinwa i evandilyon, lá questo sailiénen, tyarila i Hristo tarwe pene túrerya.

ENGLISH: But the word about him scattered that much more, and great crowds came together to listen and to be healed from their sicknesses.
QUENYA: Mal i quetta pa se vintane ta ita ambe, ar hoe şangali túler uo lastien ar náven nestaine hlíveltallon.

ENGLISH: And the fourth poured his bowl upon the Sun, and was given to the Sun to burn men with fire.
QUENYA: Ar i cantea ulyane tolporya Anarenna, ar Anaren náne antana urta atani nárnen.

ENGLISH: But Jesus Christ was born in this manner: When his mother Mary was obliged to marry Joseph, she was found with child by Holy Spirit, before they were united.
QUENYA: Mal Yésus Hristo náne nóna mi lé sina: Íre amillerya María náne nauta vestien Yósef, anes hírina as hína i Aire Feanen, nó anette ertane.

ENGLISH: They were Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary mother of Jacob. Also the other women with them told the apostles these things.
QUENYA: Anelte María Mahtaléne, ar Yoanna, ar María amil Yácovo. Yando i hyane nissi aselte nyarner i apostelin nati sine.

ENGLISH: But when this mortal puts on itself an immortal state, then will occur the saying that is written: “Death has been undone forever!
QUENYA: Mal íre fírima sina panya insasse ilfirin sóma, tá martuva i quetie ya técina ná: “Qualme anaie nancarna tennoio!

ENGLISH: And yet you do not want to come to me, so that you will have life.
QUENYA: Ananta ualde mere tule ninna, i samuvalde coivie.

ENGLISH: Who will take us away from the love of the Christ? Will tribulation or pressure or persecution or famine or nakedness or danger or sword do so?
QUENYA: Man vi-mapuva oa i Hristo melmello? Ma şangie hya şahtie hya roitie hya saicele hya heldie hya raxe hya macil caruva sie?

ENGLISH: And behold! was there a woman who for eighteen years was possessed by a spirit making her weak: She was bent, and it was not possible for her to stand straight.
QUENYA: Ar yé! enge tasse nís ye ter loar toloque náne haryaina lo faire se-cárala milya: Anes cúna, ar ua ence sen tare téra.

ENGLISH: Surely is not father among you who, if his son asks for a fish, will perhaps give him a serpent instead of a fish?
QUENYA: Lau ea atar mici le ye, qui yondorya arca lingwe, cé antuva sen leuca mende lingwio?

ENGLISH: Then Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat down with his disciples.
QUENYA: Tá Yésus lende amba mir oron, ar tasse hamnes undu as hildoryar.

ENGLISH: Juda begat Perez and Zerah with Tamar, and Perez begat Hezron, and Hezron begat Ram,
QUENYA: Yehúra óne Peres ar Sera as Tamar, ar Peres óne Hesron, ar Hesron óne Ram,

ENGLISH: and Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary , by whom Jesus, who is called Christ, was born.
QUENYA: ar Yácov óne Yósef verurya María, lo ye Yésus, ye ná estaina Hristo, náne nóna.

ENGLISH: But since I have spoken these things, grief has filled your heart.
QUENYA: Mal pan equétien nati sine, nyére aquantie endalta.

ENGLISH: But if you seek anything beyond that, it is necessary that a regular assembly settles it.
QUENYA: Mal qui cestalde aiqua han ta, mauya i şanya combe tulca sa.

ENGLISH: Concerning the things of which you wrote: Not touching a woman is for a man beneficial,
QUENYA: Pa i nati yaron tencelde: Lá appie nís neren aşea ná,

ENGLISH: And after buying linen he took him down, and he wrapped him with the linen and put him in a rockhewn tomb , and he rolled a stone before the door of the tomb.
QUENYA: Ar apa mancie insen páşe nampeses undu, ar se-vaitanes i pásenen ar se-panyane hrótanoirisse, ar peltanes ondo epe i noirio fenna.

ENGLISH: Therefore, as when the worthless plants are gathered and burnt by fire, so it will be at the conclusion of the age:
QUENYA: Etta, ve íre i úmirwe olvar nar comyaine ar urtaine nárenen, sie euva i rando tyelde:

ENGLISH: I give thanks that I did not baptize any among you expect Crispus and Gaius.
QUENYA: Antan hantale i uan sumbane aiquen mici le hequa Hrispo ar Aio.

ENGLISH: He said to them: ”What are these words that you are exchanging while you are walking?” And they stood , with grief in their face.
QUENYA: Quentes túna: “Mana quettar sine yar quapteaste íre vanteaste?” Ar tarnette arwe nyére mi cendeletta.

ENGLISH: They tried to understand what is the time that the Spirit in them indicated for the Christ, when it witnessed beforehand about Christ's torments and the glories that were going to come after them.
QUENYA: Névelte hanya mana náne i lúme ya i Faire tesse tenge i Hriston, íre vettanes nóvo pa Hristo ñwalmi ar i alcari yar tulumner apa tai.

ENGLISH: For all these gave gifts out of their abundance, but this woman gave the entire livelihood that she had.”
QUENYA: An illi sine antaner annar et úveltallo, mal nís sina antane i quanda laulesta ya sámes.”

ENGLISH: Then people came out to see which had happened, and they came to Jesus and found the man from whom the demons had come out, bearing clothes and in health of mind, sitting by Jesus' feet, and they were terrified.
QUENYA: Tá queni ettúler cenien ya náne martienwa, ar túlelte Yésunna ar hirne i nér yello i raucor náner ettúlienwe, cólala lanneli ar málesse sámo, hámala ara Yésuo talu, ar anelte ruhtaine.

ENGLISH: They said: “Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved, you and your family.”
QUENYA: Quentette: “Sava i Heru Yésusse, ar nauval rehtana, elye ar nosselya.”

ENGLISH: Then the soldier host and the centurion and the officers of the Jews took Jesus and bound him.
QUENYA: Tá i ohtarhosta ar i tuxantur ar i cánor i Yúraron namper Yésus ar nunter se.

ENGLISH: But without your permission I do not want to do anything, and thus your good deed will not be by compulsion, but by your own free choise.
QUENYA: Mal ú lavielyo uan mere care aiqua, ar sie mane cardalya ua nauva maustanen, mal véra léra cilmelyanen.

ENGLISH: May the Lord be with your spirit! May his grace be with you!
QUENYA: Nai i Heru euva as fairelya! Nai lisserya euva aselde!

ENGLISH: But also if we, or an angel from heaven, bring to you another gospel not like the gospel that we made known to you – may he be cursed!
QUENYA: Mal yando qui elme, hya vala menello, talar lenna hyana evandilyon lá ve i evandilyon ya carnelme sinwa len – nai nauvas húna!

ENGLISH: And after he remained three months there, he was going to said away to Syrian, but since the Jews made plans against him, he made the choice that he was going to return through Macedonia.
QUENYA: Ar apa termarnes astar nelde tasse, cirumnes oa Sirianna, mal pan i Yúrar carner panoli ana se, carnes i cilme i nanwenumnes ter Maceronia.

ENGLISH: like I as well make all happy in all things – not seeking which is beneficial to me, but which will be beneficial for the greater number of people, for them to be saved.
QUENYA: ve yú inye care illi valime mi ilye nati – lá cestala ya aşea nin ná, mal ya nauva aşea i ambe rimbe quenin, náveltan rehtane.

ENGLISH: But may all these things happen in a proper and arranged manner.
QUENYA: Mal nai ilye nati sine martuvar mi vanima ar partana lé.

ENGLISH: For the law causes anger, but where does not exist law, also does not exist crime.
QUENYA: An i Şanye tyare rúşe, mal yasse lá ea şanye, yú lá ea ongwe.

ENGLISH: But those that were scattered went through the land, making known the gospel about the Word.
QUENYA: Mal i náner vintane lender ter i nóre, cárala sinwa i evandilyon pa i Quetta.

ENGLISH: When we exist in this tent we indeed groan under the burden, for we wish, not to put it away, but to put on ourselves the other, causing which is mortal to be devoured by life.
QUENYA: Íre ealme lancoa sinasse é ñonalme nu i cóla, an merilme, lá panya sa oa, mal panya messe i exe, tyárala ya ná fírima náve ammátina i coiviénen.

ENGLISH: But thanks to God, for he gives us the victory through Jesus Christ our Lord!
QUENYA: Mal hantale Erun, an antas ven i apaire ter Yésus Hristo Herulva!

ENGLISH: Do not think that I will accuse you before the Father. who accuses you is Moses, in whom you have put your hope.
QUENYA: Áva sana i ulquetuvan le epe i Atar. Ye le-ulquete ná Móses, yesse apánielde estelelda.

ENGLISH: And again, a different scripture says: “They will look at whom they have pierced.”
QUENYA: Ar ata, hyana tehtele quete: “Yétuvalte yenna etérielte.”

ENGLISH: Then the angel took the incense vessel and filled it with fire from the altar. And he threw it upon earth; and there were thunders and voices and flashes and a shaking of the earth.
QUENYA: Tá i vala nampe i nisquema ar sa-quante nárenen i yangwallo. Ar sa-hantes cemenna; ar enger hundiéli ar ómali ar ítali ar palie cemeno.

ENGLISH: Others received scorns and lashings, indeed more than those, bonds and prisons.
QUENYA: Exeli camner yaiweli ar ripiéli, é amba la tai, nútelínen ar mandolínen.

ENGLISH: For also in Thessalonica, one time and two times alike, you sent to me for my need.
QUENYA: An yando Şessalonicasse, er lú ar lú atta véla, mentanelde ninna maurenyan.

ENGLISH: Therefore receive him in the Lord, in all joy, and let such men be precious to you,
QUENYA: Etta áse came i Herusse, mi ilya alasse, ar lava taiti nerin náve mirwe len,

ENGLISH: They make the Christ known out of love, for they know that I have been put here to protect the gospel.
QUENYA: Té carir i Hristo sinwa et melmello, an istalte i anaien panyaina sisse varien i evandilyon.

ENGLISH: to fulfill which was said through Isaiah the Prophet, who said:
QUENYA: carien anwa ya náne quétina ter Yesaia i Erutercáno, ye quente:

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus came out, bearing the crown of thorns and the purple raiment. And he said to them: “Behold the man!”
QUENYA: Etta Yésus ettúle, cólala i ríe neceliva ar i luicarne larma. Ar quentes téna: “Ela i atan!”

ENGLISH: But Peter arose and went to the tomb, and bending forward he saw the wrappings alone. Then he went away, in wonder about what had happened.
QUENYA: Mal Péter oronte ar norne i noirinna, ar cúnala ompa cennes i vaimar erinque. Tá lendes oa, elmendasse pa mana náne martienwa.

ENGLISH: And when he came near to the gate of the city, a dead man was carried outside, the only-born son of his mother. Furthermore, her husband was dead. A great crowd from the city was also with the woman.
QUENYA: Ar íre túles hare i osto andonna, qualin nér náne cólina ettenna, amilleryo ernóna yondo. Ente, verurya náne qualin. Hoa şanga i ostollo enge yando as i nís.

ENGLISH: For if, when we were enemies, peace was established between us and God by the death of his Son, that much more we shall be saved by his life now that we have peace with him.
QUENYA: An qui, íre anelve ñottor, raine náne tulcana imbi vi ar Eru i qualmenen Yondoryo, ta ita ambe nauvalve rehtane coivieryanen sí íre samilve raine óse.

ENGLISH: But not heeding if I or they did the work, this is what we make known , and so you have believed.
QUENYA: Mal lá cimila qui inye hya té carner i molie, si ná ya carilme sinwa, ar sie asávielde.

ENGLISH: And yet if I gave you grief with my letter , I do not have second thoughts about it. I had second thoughts formerly – for I see that my letter caused you grief, though for a short time only –
QUENYA: An yando qui antanen len nyére mentanyanen, uan same attie sanweli pa sa. Sámen attie sanweli yá – an cenin i mentanya tyarne len nyére, ómu şinta lúmen eryave –

ENGLISH: To them we did not allow to have their desire, not for a single moment – to cause the truth of the gospel to remain with you.
QUENYA: Tien ualme lave same írelta, lá erya lún – tyarien i evandilyono nanwie termare aselde.

ENGLISH: When the thousand years have passed, Satan will be freed from his prison.
QUENYA: Íre i loar húme avánier, Sátan nauva leryana mandoryallo.

ENGLISH: Everyone who does not remain in Christ’s teaching, but goes beyond it, does not have God. who remains in the teaching, he has the Father and the Son.
QUENYA: Ilquen ye ua lemya Hristo peantiesse, mal mene han sa, ua same Eru. Ye lemya i peantiesse, sé same i Atar yo i Yondo.

ENGLISH: stood beside Jesus’ cross his mother and his mother’s sister, Mary the mother of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
QUENYA: Tarner ara Yésuo tarwe amillerya ar amilleryo néşa, María verirya Clópas, ar María Mahtaléne.

ENGLISH: If you receive scorn because of Christ's name, happy you are, since the spirit of glory, indeed the spirit of God, lies upon you!
QUENYA: Qui camilde yaiwe Hristo essenen, valime nalde, pan i faire alcaro, é i faire Eruo, caita lenna!

ENGLISH: And he said to them: “The Son of Man is Lord of the day of rest.”
QUENYA: Ar quentes téna: “I Atanyondo ná Heru i sendareo.”

ENGLISH: This man went to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body. Then Pilate gave the order, and it was given to him.
QUENYA: Nér sina lende Pilátonna ar arcane Yésuo hroa. Tá Piláto antane i canwa, ar anes antana sen.

ENGLISH: If he does not listen to them , speak to the congregation. If he fails to listen to the congregation as well, he is to be to you as a person of the nations or as a tax collector.
QUENYA: Qui uas lasta túna, queta i ocombenna. Qui loitas lasta yú i ocombenna, nauvas lyen ve quén i nórion ar ve tungwemo.

ENGLISH: Thus, out of his riches he can give you by his spirit to be made mighty by might in your internal man,
QUENYA: Sie, et laryallo polis anta len faireryanen náve cárine taure melehtenen mitya ataneldasse,

ENGLISH: Indeed by their fruit you will know them!
QUENYA: É yáveltainen istuvaldet!

ENGLISH: But all that heard him were filled with wonder and said: “Is this man not who in Jerusalem destroyed all that call on this name, and who came here for the purpose that he was going to lead them bound to the chief priests?
QUENYA: Mal illi i hlasser se náner quátine elmendanen ar quenter: “Ma nér sina ua ye Yerúsalemesse nancarne illi i yalir sina essenen, ar ye túle sir i ennen i tulyauvanes te nútine i hére airimonnar?”

ENGLISH: who says: ”I know him”, but by his commandments he does not abide, he is a liar, and the truth is not in such a person.
QUENYA: Ye quete: ”Istanyes”, mal axanyar uas himya, sé hurindo ná, ar i nanwie lá ea mi síte quén.

ENGLISH: But this woman, who is a daughter of Abraham whom Satan has kept restrained for eighteen years – was it not necessary to loose her from this bond on the day of rest?”
QUENYA: Mal nís sina, ye ná Avraham yelde ye Sátan ehépie hampa ter loar toloque – ma ua mauyane se-lehta núte sinallo i sendaresse?”

ENGLISH: They are of the world; therefore they speak by the world’s manner, and the world listens to them.
QUENYA: Té nar i mardo; etta quetilte i mardo lénen, ar i mar lasta téna.

ENGLISH: Everyone who has been born from God does not do sin, since his seed remains in him, and he cannot sin, since he has been born from God.

QUENYA: Canye, nirmunque, ualte pale epe alcarinquar, mal naiquetir,

QUENYA: Ar quentes senna: “Ilye nati sine antauvan elyen qui lantal undu ar tyeril ni!”

ENGLISH: and thereafter she was widowed until she now had eighty-four years. She was not ever away from the temple, but she served God day and night, fasting and calling upon him.
QUENYA: ar epeta anes verulóra tenna sí sámes loar canta toloquean. Únes oi oa i cordallo, mal veuyanes Eru auresse yo lómisse, avamátala ar yálala senna.

ENGLISH: Therefore I have the hope that I will send this man, as soon as I have seen how my matters stand.
QUENYA: Etta samin i estel i nér sina mentuvan, ve rato ve ecénien manen nattonyar tarir.

ENGLISH: What do you think? If a man has a hundred sheep, and one among them strays, does he not go away from the ninti-nine on the mountains, and he goes to seek the straying sheep?
QUENYA: Mana sanalde? Qui nér same mámar tuxa, ar er mici te ranya, ma uas auta ho i nerte neterquean i orontissen, ar menis cestien i ranyala máma?

ENGLISH: May the brothers have peace and love from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ!
QUENYA: Nai i hánor samuvar raine ar melme ho Eru i Atar ar i Heru Yésus Hristo!

ENGLISH: For I am a witness to them that they have a burning spirit for God, but not by knowledge.
QUENYA: An nanye astarmo tien i samilte uryala súle Erun, mal lá istyanen.

ENGLISH: Thus it will be possible for you to praise yourselves in Jesus Christ in an abundant manner – concerning me, by my being with you again.
QUENYA: Sie ecuva len laita inde Hristo Yésusse mi úvea lé – pa ní, návenyanen aselde ata.

ENGLISH: This is not the love that comes from on high, but it is from earth – animal-like, demonic.
QUENYA: Si ua i melme ya tule tarmenello, mal nas cemello – celvavea, raucea.

ENGLISH: All the holy ones, but above all who are in the house of the High King, greet you!
QUENYA: Ilye i airi, mal or illi i ear i coasse i Ingaranwa, suilar le!

ENGLISH: And the kings of earth, who committed fornication with her and dwelt with her in abundance without bonds, will be in tears and will beat themselves because of grief for her, when they look at the reek from her burning .
QUENYA: Ar cemeno arani, i hrupuhtaner óse ar marner óse úvesse pen landar, nauvar níessen ar palpuvar inte nairenen sen, íre yétalte i usque ruiveryallo.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to her: “Do not touch me, for I have not yet risen up to my Father. But go to my brothers and say to them: I am ascending to my Father and your Father, my God and your God.”
QUENYA: Yésus quente senna: “Ávani appa, an en uan ortanie amba Atarinyanna. Mal mena hánonyannar ar queta téna: Ortean Atarinyanna ar Atareldanna, Ainonyanna ar Ainoldanna.”

ENGLISH: For the fear of him the guards shook and were like dead.
QUENYA: Ruciénen sello i cundor paller ar náner ve qualine.

ENGLISH: Aristarchus, who is in gaol with me, greets you. So do Mark, the cousin of Barnabas – concerning him you have received commands: if he comes to you, receive him well –
QUENYA: Aristarco, ye ná mandosse óni, suila le. Sie carir Marco, Varnavasso rendo – pa sé acámielde canwali: qui tulis lenna, áse came mai –

ENGLISH: Then how is that you did not put my money on a table? Then, when I came, I was going to receive it with an added sum.'
QUENYA: Tá manen ná i ual panya telpenya sarnosse? Tá, íre túlen, camumnenyes as napánina nonwe.'

ENGLISH: that are beside the road are that have heard; then the Devil comes and takes away the word from their heart, to stop them from believing and from being saved.
QUENYA: I nar ara i malle nar i ahlárier; tá i Arauco tule ar mapa oa i quetta endaltallo, pustien te saviello ar návello rehtaine.

ENGLISH: Who you to judge another's servant? For his own lord he stands or he falls. Indeed he shall stand, for the Lord is able to cause him to stand.
QUENYA: Man elye namien exeo núro? Véra heruryan taris hya lantas. É taruvas, an ece i Herun tyaritas tare.

ENGLISH: But if they wish to learn something, it is necessary for them to ask their own husbands in the home, for speaking in the congration is a humilation for a woman.
QUENYA: Mal qui merilte pare nat, mauya tien maquete vére verultar i maresse, an quetie i ocombesse nucumnie ná nissen.

ENGLISH: Therefore the sisters sent word to him, saying: “Lord, see! whom you love is ill.”
QUENYA: Etta i néşar mentaner quetta senna, quétala: “Heru, yé! ye melilye hlaiwa ná.”

ENGLISH: The signs of a true apostle was done among you with all patience, with signs and wonders and powerful deeds.
QUENYA: Nanwa apostelo tanwar náner cárine mici le ilya cólenen, tanwalínen ar elmendalínen ar túrie cardar.

ENGLISH: And after they covered him they asked: “Speak like a prophet! Who was that struck you?”
QUENYA: Ar apa tompeltes maquentelte: “Queta ve Erutercáno! Man náne ye pente lye?”

ENGLISH: And they fell down to him and returned to Jerusalem having great joy.
QUENYA: Ar lantanelte undu sen ar nanwenner Yérusalemenna arwe túra alasseo.

ENGLISH: He made the lordships and the powers naked and openly showed them forth for mockery, after he had his victory over them on the cross.
QUENYA: Carnes i héri ar i túri helde ar pantave ettanne tai yaiwen, apa sámes apairerya or tai i tarwesse.

ENGLISH: exist numerous kinds of servant-work , but the Lord is the same.
QUENYA: Ear rimbe nostalélion núromolie, mal i Heru i imya ná.

ENGLISH: son of Symeon, son of Judas, son of Josef, son of Jonam, son of Eliakim,
QUENYA: yondorya Símeon, yondorya Yúras, yondorya Yósef, yondorya Yónam, yondorya Elyacim,

ENGLISH: But he said to them: “ is I; do not fear!”
QUENYA: Mal eques téna: “Inye ná; áva ruce!”

ENGLISH: but into the second room the chief priest alone goes, a single time in one year, not without blood, which he sacrifices for himself and for the people's sins that are done without knowledge.
QUENYA: mal mir i attea şambe i héra airimo erinqua lelya, erya lúmesse mi loa er, lá ú serceo, ya yacis insen ar i lieo úcarin yar nar cárine ú istyo.

ENGLISH: And in the same moment a cock again sounded, and Peter recalled the saying that Jesus said to him: “Before a cock sounds two times, you will deny he thrice.” And he collapsed in tears.
QUENYA: Ar mí imya lú tocot ata lamyane, ar Péter enyalde i quetie ya Yésus quente senna: “Nó tocot lamya lú atta, ni-laluval nel.” Ar talantes nírelissen.

ENGLISH: for you know that you will receive from the Lord your reward, the part that you will possess as heirs. Be servants to the Lord Jesus.
QUENYA: An istalde i camuvalde i Herullo paityalelda, i ranta ya haryuvalde ve aryoni. Na móli i Heru Yésun.

ENGLISH: I do not leave you orphaned. I am coming to you.
QUENYA: Uan hehtuva le nostarence. Túlan lenna.

ENGLISH: They came to Ephesus, and he left them there, but he went into the synagogue and spoke with the Jews.
QUENYA: Túlelte Efesusenna, ar tu-hehtanes tasse, mal isse lende mir i yomencoa ar quente as i Yúrar.

ENGLISH: You are of God, my children, and you have conquered them, since who is in you is greater than who is in the world.
QUENYA: Lé nar Eruo, hinyar, ar orutúrielde te, pan ye ea lesse ná túra lá ye ea i mardesse.

ENGLISH: I make petition concerning them. I do not make petition concerning the world, but about that you have given me, since they are yours,
QUENYA: Arcan pa te. Uan arca pa i mar, mal pa i ánietye nin, pan nalte tyenye,

ENGLISH: not stealing, but showing good faith, thus adorning the teaching of our Savior, God, in all things.
QUENYA: lá pilila, mal tánala mára savie, sie netyala i peantie Rehtolvo, Eru, mi ilye nati.

ENGLISH: For this people's heart has been made fat, and with their ears they hear without reply, and they have shut their eyes; thus they will not ever see with their eyes or hear with their ears and understand with their heart and find repentence, for me to heal them!”
QUENYA: An lie sino enda anaie carna tiuca, ar hlarultanten hlarilte ú hanquento, ar oholtielte hendultat; sie ualte oi cenuva hendultanten hya hlaruva hlarultanten ar hanyuva endaltanen ar hiruva inwis, nestienyan te!”

ENGLISH: But now I am coming to you, and I say these things in the world that they will have full joy in themselves.
QUENYA: Mal sí túlan tyenna, ar quetin nati sine i mardesse i samuvalte quanta alassenya intesse.

ENGLISH: As at day, let us behave well, not in wild parties and drunken bouts , not in fornication and loose conduct, not in quarreling or envy.
QUENYA: Ve auresse, alve lenga mai, lá mi verce merendi ar accasucier, lá mi hrupuhtie ar lehta lengie, lá mi costie ar hrúcen.

ENGLISH: The wife does not have mastery over her own body, but her husband has. In the same manner, the husband as well does not have mastery over his own body, but his wife has.
QUENYA: I veri ua same túre or véra hroarya, mal verurya same. Mí imya lé, yú i veru ua same túre or véra hroarya, mal verirya same.

ENGLISH: They show that they have the matters of the law written in their heart, when their conscience witnesses with them and, in their own thoughts, their heart/conscience tells them that they carry guilt or perhaps lack guilt
QUENYA: Tanalte i samilte i şanyeo nattor técine endaltasse, íre immotuntielta vetta aselte ar, vére sanweltassen, ore tien i colilte cáma hya cé penir cáma

ENGLISH: will be two women grinding on the same mill; one will be brought along, but the other will be abandoned.
QUENYA: Euva nís atta múlala i imya mulmanen; er nauva talaina, mal i exe nauva hehtaina.

ENGLISH: They said to him: “Lord, may our eyes be opened!”
QUENYA: Quentette senna: “Heru, nai hendummat nauvat pantaine!”

ENGLISH: came behind him and touched the rim of his cloak, and in the same moment the flood of blood stopped.
QUENYA: túle ca se ar appane collaryo lane, ar mí imya lú i celume serceva pustane.

ENGLISH: Therefore it was necessary for him to be like his brothers in all things, for him to be a merciful and faithful chief priest, to sacrifice guilt-offerings about the sins of the people.
QUENYA: Etta mauyane sen náve ve hánoryar ilye natisssen, náveryan órávala ar voronda héra airimo, yacien cámayancali pa i lieo úcari.

ENGLISH: Then he brought the twelve away to a private place and said to them: “Behold! We are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things written by the prophets about the Son of Man will be completed.
QUENYA: Tá talles i yunque oa véra nómenna ar quente téna: “Yé! Ménalve ama Yerusalemenna, ar ilye i nati técine lo i Erutercánor pa i Atanyondo nauvar telyaine.

ENGLISH: After he seized him, he put him in prison, giving him into the hands of four groups, each having four soldiers, for he intended to show him to the people.
QUENYA: Apa nampes hé, panyanes he mandosse, antala he mannar combion canta, ilya arwa ohtarion canta, an teldes tana he i lien apa i Lahtie.

ENGLISH: When he knocked on the door, a female slave whose name was Rhoda came to open,
QUENYA: Íre tambanes ana i fenna, inya mól yeo esse náne Rola túle latien,

ENGLISH: Death, where your victory? Death, where is your sting?”
QUENYA: Qualme, masse apairelya? Qualme, masse nastalya?”

ENGLISH: But Zechariah was troubled at seeing him, and fear fell upon him.
QUENYA: Mal Secaría náne tarastaina ceniénen se, ar caure lantane senna.

ENGLISH: John also witnessed, saying: “I saw the Spirit come down out of heaven as a dove, and it remained on him.
QUENYA: Yoháno yando vettane, quétala: “Cennen i Faire túla undu et menello ve cucua, ar lemyanes sesse.

ENGLISH: May every person subject himself to the higher authorities, for there is not any authority except by God; the authorities that exist have been put there by God.
QUENYA: Nai ilya quén panya immo nu i ambe táre héri, an lá ea hére hequa Erunen; i héri yar ear anaier panyane tasse lo Eru.

ENGLISH: Being touched to his heart, Jesus touched their eyes – and in the same moment it was possible for them to see, and they followed him.
QUENYA: Ápaina endaryanna, Yésus appane henduttat – ar mi yana lú ence tunt cene, ar hilyanettes.

ENGLISH: For as the Christ's sufferings are abundant in us, so the comfort that we receive is also abundant by the Christ.
QUENYA: An ve i Hristo perperier nar úvie vesse, sie i tiutale ya camilve ná yando úvea i Hristonen.

ENGLISH: Therefore, who thinks that he stands, let him take heed that he does not fall.
QUENYA: Etta, ye sana i taris, isse na cimuva in uas lanta.

ENGLISH: Jesus answered and said to her: “Everyone who drinks of this water shall be thirsty again.
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente ar eque senna: “Ilquen ye suce nén sino nauva soica ata.

ENGLISH: that receives you receives also me, and that receives me receives also the one who sent me.
QUENYA: Ye came lé came yú ni, ar ye came ni came yú ye ni-mentane.

ENGLISH: I Jesus sent my angel to witness to you about these things for the congregations. I am David’s root and seed, and the bright morning star.”
QUENYA: Inye Yésus mentane valanya vettien lyen pa nati sine i ocombin. Inye Laviro şundo ar erde ná, ar i calima arintinwe.”

ENGLISH: He was about whom it has been written: 'Behold! I send my herald before your face, to prepare your way before you.'
QUENYA: Sé náne pa ye anaie técina: 'Yé! Mentan tercánonya epe cendelelya, manwien mallelya epe lye.'

ENGLISH: And I sanctify myself for them, that they will be sanctified with the truth.
QUENYA: Ar airitan immo tien, i nauvalte airinte i nanwiénen.

ENGLISH: Therefore I witness to all among you that I am clean from the blood of all men,
QUENYA: Etta vettan illin mici le i nanye poica i sercello ilye atanion,

ENGLISH: Thus the Lord knows to rescue reverent ones out of trial, but to reserve unjust ones for the day of judgement. Then they will be cut off,
QUENYA: Sie i Héru ista etelehta Erunildar et ºangiello, mal sate úfailar i auren namiéva. Tá nauvalte aucirne,

QUENYA: Tá i hildor túler ar quenter senna: “Ma istal in íre i Farisar hlasser i quetta, anelte rúşie?”

ENGLISH: The thief does not come except to steal and to kill and to destroy. I have come that they will have life and they will have abundance.
QUENYA: I arpo ua tule hequa pilien ar nahtien ar nancarien. Inye utúlie i samuvalte coivie ar samuvalte úve.

ENGLISH: After some years passed, I came to bring gifts of mercy to my nation, and to sacrifice.
QUENYA: Apa loali váner, túlen talien annali oraviéva nórenyanna, ar yacien.

ENGLISH: And I saw, and I heard a voice of numerous angels around the throne and the living creatures and the elders, and their number was like myriads of myriads and thousands of thousands,
QUENYA: Ar cennen, ar hlassen óma rimbe valalion os i mahalma ar i coiti ar i amyárar, ar nótelta náne ve quaihúmi quaihúmion ar húmi húmion,

ENGLISH: They went before us and waited for us in Troas,
QUENYA: Té lender epe me ar homper men Troasse,

ENGLISH: for he loves our nation, and he built for us the synagoge.”
QUENYA: an melis nórelva, ar sé carastane men i yomencoa.”

ENGLISH: But if he does not listen, bring with you one or two others, for by the mouth of two or three witnesses every affair shall be established.
QUENYA: Mal qui uas lasta, á tala aselye er hya atta ambe, an i antonen astarmor atto hya neldeo ilya natto nauva tulcana.

ENGLISH: And the second married her, but he died without leaving seed, and so also the third.
QUENYA: Ar i attea veryane senna, mal qualles ú hehtiéno erde, ar sie yando i neldea.

ENGLISH: And receiving a cup he gave thanks and said: “Take this and send it from person to person among you.
QUENYA: Ar cámala yulma antanes hantale ar quente: “Á mapa si ar ása menta quenello quenenna mici le.

ENGLISH: Jesus said to her: “Believe my word, woman: The hour is coming when you will not worship either on this mountain or in Jerusalem.
QUENYA: Eque senna Yésus: “Sava quetienya, nís: I lúme túla yasse ualde tyeruva i Atar var oron sinasse var Yerúsalemesse.

ENGLISH: And he chose twelve, whom he also called apostles, for them to be with him and for him to sent them out to preach
QUENYA: Ar cilles yunque, i yando estanes aposteli, náveltan óse ar etementieryan te nyardien

ENGLISH: Then I said: "Behold, I have come – in the scroll it is written about me – to do your will, God!"
QUENYA: Tá quenten: "Yé, utúlien – i toluparmasse ná técina pa ni – carien indómelya, Eru!"

ENGLISH: When he heard these words, Ananias fell down and expired. And a great fear came upon all that heard it.
QUENYA: Íre hlasses quettar sine, Ananías lantane undu ar effirne. Ar túra rucie túle illinnar i hlasser sa.

ENGLISH: But the king became angry, and he sent his armies and destroyed those murderers and burnt their city.
QUENYA: Mal i aran olle rúşea, ar mentanes hosseryar ar nancarne tane nahtari ar urtane ostolta.

ENGLISH: For anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man, to him it will be forgiven, but who speaks against the Holy spirit, that will not be forgiven him, in this age and the coming one alike.
QUENYA: An aiquen ye quete quetta i Atanyondonna, sen nauvas apsénina, mal ye quete i Airefeanna, ta ua nauva apsénina sen, mi randa sina ar i tulila véla.

ENGLISH: Peter said to him: “If it is necessary for me to die with you, I shall not ever deny you!” All the other disciples said the same thing.
QUENYA: Péter quente senna: “Qui mauya nin quale aselye, uan oi laquetuva lye!” Ilye i hyane hildor quenter i imya nat.

ENGLISH: And again he came and found them asleep, for their eyes were heavy, and they did not know what they were going to answer him.
QUENYA: Ar ata túles ar hirne te lorne, an hendultat nánet lunge, ar ualte sinte mana hanquetumnelte senna.

ENGLISH: Therefore, flee from the youthful desires, but pursue righteousness, faith, love, with that call to the Lord out of a pure heart.
QUENYA: Etta, uşa i nessime írellon, mal á roita failie, savie, melme, raine, as i yalir i Herunna et poica endallo.

ENGLISH: When he heard that this was Jesus from Nazareth, he began to shout and say: “Son of David, Jesus, have mercy on me!”
QUENYA: Íre hlasses i si náne Yésus Nasaretello, yestanes yame ar quete: “Lavirion, Yésus, órava nisse!”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, do not give your members to sin as weapons of unrighteousness, but give yourselves to God as the living ones from dead, also your members to God as weapons of righteousness.
QUENYA: Ente, áva anta hroarantaldar úcaren ve carmar úfailiéva, mal á anta inde Erun ve i coirear qualinallon, yú hroarantaldar Erun ve carmar failiéva.

ENGLISH: The haven was not good for remaining through the winter, and therefore the greater number thought that it was better to sail away from there, if in this or that manner it was possible for them to reach as far as Phoenix and remain there through the winter. That is a haven of Crete that is open towards the north-east and south-east.
QUENYA: I hópa úne mára termarien ter i hríve, ar etta i amarimbar sanner i náne arya cirie oa talo, qui mi tana hya sina lé ence tien rahta tenna Fénix ar lemya tasse ter i hríve. Ta ná hópa Créteo ya ná panta forrómenna ar hyarrómenna.

ENGLISH: Since the children have part in flesh and blood, he as well received a part in them , by death undoing that had the power to cause death, that is, the Devil,
QUENYA: Pan i híni samir ranta mi hráve yo serce, yando sé mi imya lé camne ranta mi tú, qualmenen nancárala ye sáme i túre tyarien qualme, ta ná, i Arauco,

ENGLISH: For when you eat it, everyone has eaten his own evening meal beforehand, and one person is hungry, while another is drunk.
QUENYA: An íre matildes, ilquen amátie véra şinyematterya nóvo, ar er quén maita ná, lan exe limpunqua ná.

ENGLISH: Then they were happy and said that they were willing to give him money.
QUENYA: Tá anelte valime ar quenter i anelte mérala anta sen telpe.

ENGLISH: On the first day of Unleavened Breads the disciples came to Jesus, saying: “Where do you wish that we prepare for you, for you to eat the Passover?”
QUENYA: Minya auresse Alapalúne Massaron i hildor túler Yésunna, quétala: “Masse meril i manwalme lyen, matielyan i Lahtie?”

ENGLISH: As they were eating he took a bread, said a blessing, broke it and gave it to them, and he said: “Take it, this is my body.”
QUENYA: Matieltasse nampes massa, quente aistie, rance sa ar antane sa tien, ar eques: “Ása mapa, si hroanya ná.”

ENGLISH: For anyone in the Lord who was called when he was a slave is Lord's freed ; in the same manner, who was called as a free person is Christ's slave.
QUENYA: An aiquen i Herusse ye náne yálina íre anes mól ná i Heruo leryana; mi imya lé, ye náne yálina ve léra quén ná Hristo mól.

ENGLISH: But sin, having an opportunity by the commandment, created in me greed of every kind, for away from law sin was dead.
QUENYA: Mal úcare, arwa eciéno i axannen, ontane inyesse milcie ilya nostaleo, an oa şanyello úcare qualina né.

ENGLISH: a man leading his own family, having reverent childer with every seriousness
QUENYA: nér tulyala véra nosserya, arwa canwacimye hínion ilya sanwelungiesse

ENGLISH: Jesus still had not come into the village, but he was still in the place where Martha met him.
QUENYA: Yésus en ua túlelyane mir i masto, mal enges ena i nómesse yasse Marşa velde se.

ENGLISH: Therefore, when you come together in a single place, you do not come to eat the Lord's evening meal.
QUENYA: Etta, íre tulilde uo mir erya nóme, ualde tule matien i Heruo şinyemat.

ENGLISH: But in the days in which the seventh angel shall be heard – when he shall sound his trumpet – then God’s mystery shall be completed, according to the gospel that he gave to his servants, the prophets.”
QUENYA: Mal mí rí yassen i otsea vala nauva hláraina – íre lamyuvas hyólarya – tá Eruo fóle nauva telyaina, ve i evandilyon ya antanes núroryain, i Erutercánor.”

ENGLISH: But I have not used a single of these things. Indeed I do not write these words in order to receive them. I would have wanted to die before I would have let anyone take away my reason for praising myself.
QUENYA: Mal uan uiuhtie erya ion nati sine. É uan tecin quettar sine camien tai. Meriévanen quale nó láviévanen aiquenen mapa oa castanya laitien imne.

ENGLISH: And they called Barnabas Zeus, but Paul Hermes, since he was who spoke for them .
QUENYA: Ar estanelte Varnavas Seus, mal Paulo Hermes, pan isse náne ye quente tún.

ENGLISH: When they requested from him to stay with them for a longer time, he did not want to,
QUENYA: Íre arcanelte senna lemya aselte an anda lúmesse, uas merne,

ENGLISH: And he expelled a dumb demon. After the demon came out, the dumb man spoke. And the crowds were in wonder.
QUENYA: Ar et-hantes úpa rauco. Apa i rauco ettúle, i úpa nér carampe. Ar i şangar náner elmendasse.

ENGLISH: Seeing the son, the cultivators said among themselves: “This is the heir; come, let us kill him and get his inheritance!”
QUENYA: Cénala i yondo, i alamor quenter mici inte: “Si i aryon ná; tula, alve nahta se ar ñete aryonierya!”

ENGLISH: But we speak God's wisdom in a mystery, the hidden wisdom, which God established beforehand before the ages, for our glory.
QUENYA: Mal quetilme Eruo sailie fólesse, i nurtana sailie, ya Eru tulcane nóvo nó i randar, alcarelvan.

ENGLISH: since they stop us from speaking to people of the nations for their salvation, and so they always fill the measure of their sins. But in the end the wrath has come upon them.
QUENYA: pan pustalte me carpiello queninnar i nórion rehtieltan, ar sie illume quatilte úcareltaron lesta. Mal i mettasse i rúşe utúlie téna.

ENGLISH: you are to leave your gift there before the altar, and go away: First make your peace with your brother, and then, when you have returned, you may bring your gift.

QUENYA: Mal i şanganen ualte polde colitas Yésunna. Etta nampelte oa i tópa or i nóme yasse anes, ar apa sapie assa mentanelte undu i colma yasse caine i úlévima.

ENGLISH: He said to them: “Elijah indeed comes first and shall renew all things, but what is the reason that is written about the Son of Man that it is necessary for him to bear many tortures and to be counted as nothing?
QUENYA: Quentes téna: “Elía é tule minya ar envinyatuva ilye nati, mal mana i casta i ná técina pa i Atanyondo i mauya sen cole rimbe ñwalmeli ar náve nótina ve munta?

ENGLISH: After evening fell he came with the twelve.
QUENYA: Apa şinye lantane túles as i yunque.

ENGLISH: I did not know him, but I came baptizing with water that he was to be revealed to Israel.”
QUENYA: Inye ua sinte se, mal túlen tumyala nennen i sé umne apantaina Israélen.”

ENGLISH: Thus, in the same moment, the king sent his bodyguard, commanding him to bring John's head. And he went away and cut off his head in the prison.
QUENYA: Sie, mí imya lú, i aran mentane hroacundo, cánala sen tala Yoháno cas. Ar lendes oa ar aucirne carya i mandosse.

ENGLISH: They were too good for this world. They wandered in deserts and caves and holes in earth.
QUENYA: Anelte acca mani mar sinan. Vantanelte mi erumeli ar rottoli ar eccali cemeno.

ENGLISH: Then the seventy returned with joy, saying: “Lord, also for the demons it is necessary to heed our orders in your name!”
QUENYA: Tá i otoquean nanwenner mi alasse, quétala: “Heru, yando i raucoin mauya cime canwalmar mi esselya!”

ENGLISH: But it is good to be sought for a good reason, and not solely when I am with you,
QUENYA: Mal mára ná náve cestaina mára castan, ar lá eryave íre ean aselde,

ENGLISH: But all this has happened to make the Scripture true!” Then all the disciples abandoned him and fled.
QUENYA: Mal ilqua sina amartie carien i Tehtele nanwa!” Tá ilye i hildor hehtaner se ar úşer.

ENGLISH: The Father loves the Son and has given all things into his hand.
QUENYA: I Atar mele i Yondo ar ánie ilye nati máryanna.

ENGLISH: And in his name the nations shall put their hope!”
QUENYA: Ar esseryasse i nóri panyuvar estelelta!”

ENGLISH: He did not say yes to their plan or their deed. He came from Arimathea, a city of the Jews, and looked forward to God's kingdom.
QUENYA: Sé ua quente ná panoltanna hya cardaltanna. Túles Arimaşeallo, osto i Yúraron, ye yente ompa Eruo aranienna.

ENGLISH: for I see that you are a poisonous gall and a bond of unrighteousness.”
QUENYA: an cenin i nalye hloirea sála ar naxa úfailiéva.”

ENGLISH: May he who has an hear which the Spirit says to the congregations: who has victory will by no means be harmed by the second death.
QUENYA: Nai ye same hlas hlaruva ya i Faire quete i ocombennar: Ye turue laume nauva malana i attea ñurunen.

ENGLISH: gathered together, and to the congregation of the firstborn recorded in heaven, and to God who is judge of all, and to spirits of the righteous ones that are made perfect, and to Jesus, the intermediary of a new covenant, and the blood of sprinkling, which speaks in a manner better than the blood of Abel.
QUENYA: ócómienwe, ar i ocombenna i minnónaron minatécine menelde, ar Erunna ye na illion námo, ar fairennar i failaron i nar cárine ilvane, ar Yésunna, i enelmo vinya véreo, ar i serce palastiéva, ya carpa mi lé arya epe Ávelo serce.

ENGLISH: And everyone who calls upon the Lord's name will be saved.
QUENYA: Ar ilquen ye yale i Héruo essenen nauva rehtana.'

ENGLISH: I gave her time to find repentance, but she does not want to seek repentance for her fornication.
QUENYA: Antanen sen lúme hirien inwis, mal uas mere cesta inwis pa hrupuhtalerya.

ENGLISH: Then I said: 'What am I to do, Lord?' The Lord said to me: 'Rise, go into Damascus, and there everything which is appointed to you to do will be told you.'
QUENYA: Tá quenten: 'Mana caruvan, Heru?' I Heru quente ninna: 'Á orta, mena mir Lamascus, ar tasse ilqua ya ná lyen sátina carien nauva nyárina lyen.'

ENGLISH: Now they led Jesus away to the chief priest, and all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes assembled.
QUENYA: Sí tulyanelte Yésus oa i héra airimonna, ar ilye i hére airimor ar i amyárar ar i parmangolmor ocomner.

ENGLISH: Passing from there, Jesus now went away into the regions of Tyre and Sidon.
QUENYA: Autala talo, Yésus sí lende oa mir i ménar Tíro ar Sírono.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, I have great joy in the Lord that now in the end you have renewed your thinking about me, to whom indeed you gave thought, but was nothing that you could do.
QUENYA: Ente, samin túra alasse mí Heru i sí i mettasse eceutielde sanielda pa ni, yen é antanelde sanwe, mal enge munta ya pollelde care.

ENGLISH: For you know that you were not saved from fruitless behavior by means of corruptible things, by means of silver or by means of gold.
QUENYA: An istalde i únelde rehtaine yávelóra lengiello hastime natalínen, telpenen hya maltanen.

ENGLISH: Who is who conquers the world if not who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?
QUENYA: Man ná ye orture i mar qui lá ye save i Yésus ná i Eruion?

ENGLISH: For God has loved the world as far as giving his only-born Son, that everyone who believes in him shall not be destroyed, but shall have eternal life.
QUENYA: An Eru emélie i mar tenna antie ernóna Yondorya, i ilquen ye save sesse lá nauva nancarna, mal samuva oira coivie.

ENGLISH: If he cannot fight against him, he sends people who will speak on his behalf while the other is still far away, seeking peace.
QUENYA: Qui uas pole mahta senna, mentas queni i quetuvar rá sen íre i exe en haira ná, cestala raine.

ENGLISH: When he came as far as the place where we were in Assos, we received him into the boat and went to Mitylene.
QUENYA: Íre túles tenna i nóme yasse anelme mi Assos, camnelmes mir i lunte ar lender Mitilenenna.

ENGLISH: To the weak I made myself weak, for me to gain the weak. To all I have become all things, for me to gain at least some people.
QUENYA: I milyain ollen milya, ñetienyan i milyar. Illin olólien ilye nati, ñetienyan i ampityasse ennoli.

ENGLISH: After some days passed, Agrippa the king and Bernice came to Caesarea to greet Festus.
QUENYA: Apa réli váner, Árippa i aran yo Vernice túlet Césareanna suilien Festo.

ENGLISH: If one indeed receives a perfect state through the priesthood of Levites – for that was a part when the Law was given to the people – how was there still a need that would arise another priest, after the manner of Melchizedek and not said to be after Aaron's manner?
QUENYA: Qui mo é camne ilvana sóma ter i airimosse Léviron – an ta náne ranta íre i Şanye náne antaina i lien – manen enge en maure i ortumne hyana airimo, Melciseréco lénen ar lá quétina náve Árono lénen?

ENGLISH: Around that time was not a small uprising concerning the Way.
QUENYA: Os lúme yana enge lá pitya amortie pa i Tie.

ENGLISH: For the Lord's love compels us, for so we have judged: One died for numerous ones, indeed all died,
QUENYA: An i Hristo melme mauya men, an sie anámielme: Er qualle rimbalin, é illi qualler,

ENGLISH: Simon Peter said to him: “Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head!”
QUENYA: Símon Péter quente senna: “Heru, lá talunyat erye, mal yando mányat ar carinya!”

ENGLISH: Therefore, my brothers, when you come together to eat it, wait one for the other.
QUENYA: Etta, hánonyar, íre tulilde uo matien sa, á hope quén i exen.

ENGLISH: But thanks be to God, who always leads us in victory with the Christ, and through us he spreads in every place the scent of the knowledge about him!
QUENYA: Mal hantale na Erun, ye illume tulyar me apairesse as i Hristo, ar ter elme vintas mi ilya nóme i ne i istyo pa sé!

ENGLISH: concerning things that are destined for destruction by being used, by the commands and teachings of men?
QUENYA: pa nati yar nar martyaine nancarien návenen yuhtaine, i canwainen ar peantiainen atanion?

QUENYA: Ar óma túle i mahalmallo, quétala: “Á laita Ainolva, ilye núroryar i rucir sello, i pityar yo i túrar!”

ENGLISH: The gaoler, when he was awakened and saw the doors of the prison opened, drew his sword and was going to kill himself, supposing that everyone in the gaol was gone.
QUENYA: I mandocundo, íre nánes eccoitana ar cenne i mando fennar pantane, tunce macilya ar nahtumne inse, intyala in ilquen i mandosse vanwa né.

ENGLISH: It happened in a day that he was teaching, and some Pharisees and teachers of the Law that had come from every village of Galilee and of Judea and of Jerusalem sat there, and the Lord's power was there, for him to be able to heal.

ENGLISH: and for those that use the world to be as that do not fully use it, for the form of this world passes away.
QUENYA: ar in yuhtar i mar náve ve i uar aqua yuhta sa, an mar sino canta auta.

ENGLISH: He was instructed in hte Lord's way, and since he was glowing with the spirit, he talked and taught what was true concerning Jesus, be he knew only John's baptism.
QUENYA: Anes peantana mí Heruo tie, ar pan anes lúşina i fairenen, carampes ar peantanes ya nanwa náne pa Yésus, mal sintes rie Yoháno sumbie.

ENGLISH: Now his mother and his brothers came, and standing on the outside they sent inside to him, to call him .
QUENYA: Sí amillerya ar hánoryar túler, ar tárala i ettesse mentanelte minna senna, yalien se.

ENGLISH: The foundations of the city wall were adorned with every kind of jewels: The first foundation stone was a jasper, the second sapphire, the third agate, the fourth emerald,
QUENYA: I talmar i ostorambo náner netyane ilya nostalénen mírion: I minya talmondo nambíre né, i attea lúle, i neldea ostimmir, i cantea laimaril,

ENGLISH: He is not here, for he has been raised, as he said. Come, see the place where he lay!
QUENYA: Uas sisse, an anaies ortana, ve quentes. Tula, cena i nóme yasse caines!

ENGLISH: Let them labour for good, for them to be rich in good deeds, happy in giving, ready to distribute what they have,
QUENYA: Á molir márien, náveltan láre máre cardassen, valime antiesse, manwe satien ya samilte,

QUENYA: Ar enge tasse nís ñwalyaina lo celume serceva ter loar yunque.

ENGLISH: saying to Aaron: 'Make for us gods that can go before us! For this Moses, who led us out of Egypt – we do not know what has happened to him.'
QUENYA: quétala Áronna: 'Cara men ainoli i polir mene epe me! An Móses sina, ye me-tulyane et Mirrandorello – ualme ista mana amartie sen.'

ENGLISH: When I was with them I protected them for your own name, and I have kept them, and none of them is destroyed except who was destined for destruction, to fulfill the scripture.

ENGLISH: But do not have joy about your control over the demons, but have joy since your names have been written in heaven.”
QUENYA: Mal áva same alasse pa turielda or i raucor, mal sama alasse pan esseldar anaier técine menelde.”

ENGLISH: For if you were cut off from an olive tree which by nature is wild, and contrary to nature you were put into the olive tree in the garden, how much more easy will it be for that by nature have their place there to be put into their own olive tree!
QUENYA: An qui anel hocirna milpialdallo ya nassenen ráva ná, ar ara nasse anel panyana mir i milpialda i tarwasse, manen ita ambe aşcárima nauva in nassenen samir nómelta tasse náve panyane mir véra milpialdalta!

ENGLISH: They brought him one. And he said to them: “Whose is this picture, and the writing?” They said to him: “The High King's.”
QUENYA: Té taller sen er. Ar quentes téna: “Mano ná emma sina, ar i tecie?” Té quenter senna: “I Ingarano.”

QUENYA: Ar íre latyanes i attea lihta, hlassen i attea coite quéta: “Tula!”

ENGLISH: but he commanded them firmly that they were not to make him known,

QUENYA: Eque téna Yésus: “Qui anelde lombe, pennelde úcare. Mal sí quetilde: Cenilme. Úcarelda lemya.”

QUENYA: Mahtala úcarenna, ualde en atárie tenna serce,

QUENYA: Á arca, ar nauva len antana; á cesta, ar hiruvalde, á tamba, ar nauva len latyana.

ENGLISH: Truly I say to you: In every place where the gospel is made known, in the whole world, also what this woman did will be told to commemorate her.”
QUENYA: Násie quetin lenna: Mi ilya nóme yasse i evandilyon ná carna sinwa, i quanda mardesse, yando ya nís sina carne nauva nyárina enyalien sé.”

ENGLISH: “Happy are the lacking ones in spirit, for they will possess the kingdom of heaven!
QUENYA: “Valime nar i penyar fairesse, an té haryuvar menelo aranie!

QUENYA: Nai ye same hlas hlaruva ya i Faire quete i ocombennar!

ENGLISH: Furthermore, may the Lord cause you to grow and have abundant love one for the other and for all, as also we have love for you,
QUENYA: Ente, nai i Heru tyaruva le ale ar same úvea melme quén i exeva ar illiva, ve yú elme samir melme eldeva,
