QUENYA: Etta i cánor nanwenner i hére airimonnar ar Farisannar, ar té quenter téna: “Manen ualde túlua se aselde?”

ENGLISH: And he went outside and broke down in tears.
QUENYA: Ar lendes ettenna ar talante níressen.

ENGLISH: Timothy, who labors with me, greets you, and so do Lucius and Jason and Sosipater, that are of my kin.
QUENYA: Timoşéo, ye mole óni, suila len, ar sie carir Lúcio ar Yáson ar Sosípater, i nar nossenyo.

ENGLISH: But far from them was a herd of many pigs on pasture.
QUENYA: Mal haira tello enge lámáre rimbe polcalíva nesselesse.

ENGLISH: “O land of Zebulon and Naphtali, the sea-road beyond Jordan, Galilee of the nations!
QUENYA: “A nóre Sevulondo ar Naftalio, i earmalle Yordan pella, Alílea i nórion!

ENGLISH: But Peter arose with the twelve and raised his voice and said to them: “Men from Judea and all you that dwell in Jerusalem, may this be known to you, and listen to my sayings:
QUENYA: Mal Péter oronte as i minque ar ortane ómarya ar quente téna: “Neri Yúreallo ar ilye elde i marir Yerúsalemesse, nai si nauva sinwa len, ar á lasta quetienyannar:

ENGLISH: And he is a covering sacrifice for our sins, and yet not for ours alone, but the whole world’s.
QUENYA: Ar náse tópala yanca úcarelvain, ananta lá venyain erinque, mal i quanda mardo.

ENGLISH: In the same moment Jesus reached out with his hand and seized him, and he said to him: “Man of little faith, how is that your faith was unsteady?”
QUENYA: Mi imya lú Yésus rahtane máryanen ar nampe se, ar quentes senna: “Nér pitya saviéno, manen ná i savielya náne iltanca?”

ENGLISH: But they were filled with great wonder, for they did not get understanding by the breads, but their heart was still hard.
QUENYA: Ono té náner quátine túra elmendanen, an ualte ñente hande i massainen, mal endalta náne en hranga.

ENGLISH: But those who want to be rich fall into temptation and a snare and many insensible and hurtful desires, which pull men down into undoing and downfall.
QUENYA: Mal i merir náve láre lantar mir úşahtie ar remma ar rimbe úhande ar harnala íreli, yar tucir atani undu mir nancarie ar atalantie.

ENGLISH: For I do not want to meet you now, passing through your region, for I have the hope that I will stay with you for a longer time, if the Lord allows.
QUENYA: An uan mere vele le sí, lahtala ménalda, an samin i estel i lemyuvan aselde ter ambe anda lúme, qui i Heru lave.

ENGLISH: Faithful the word: If anyone desires an office of overseer, he desires a good work.
QUENYA: Vórima i quetta: Qui aiquen mere ortírie, meris mára molie.

ENGLISH: Then Jesus arose and followed him, with his disciples.
QUENYA: Tá Yésus oronte ar se-hilyane, as hildoryar.

ENGLISH: I know your deeds – behold! I have placed before you an opened door, which nobody can close. For you have little might, but you kept my word and did not deny my name.
QUENYA: Istan cardalyar – yé! apánien epe lye latyana fenna, ya úquen pole holta. An elye same pitya melehte, mal hempel quettanya ar ua lalane essenya.

ENGLISH: Andrew , the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two disciples who heard which John said and followed Jesus.
QUENYA: Andréas, hánorya Símon Péter, náne quén i hildo atto yet hlasset ya quente Yoháno ar hilyanet Yésus.

ENGLISH: Bring them with you and purify yourself with them, and you pay for them, for them to cut the hair off their head. Then all will understand that what they have heard about you is not true, but that you follow the Law and keep it.
QUENYA: Áte tala aselye ar á poita imle aselte, ar alye paitya tien, cirieltan i findele careltallo. Tá illi hanyuvar i ya ahlárielte pa lye ua nanwa, mal i elye hilya i Şanye ar hepe sa.

ENGLISH: But you, brothers, are not in the dark, and so the day will not fall upon you like a thief,
QUENYA: Mal elde, hánor, uar i morniesse, ar sie i ré ua lantuva lenna ve arpo,

ENGLISH: For like the flash , shining from one part under heaven to another part under heaven, so the Son of Man will be.
QUENYA: An ve i íta, caltala er rantallo nu menel hyana rantanna nu menel, sie i Atanyondo nauva.

ENGLISH: Now this world is judged, now the ruler of this world will be thrown out!
QUENYA: Sí mar sina ná námina, sí i túr mar sino nauva hátina etsenna!

ENGLISH: Peter said to her: “Tell me, did you sell the field for this sum?” She said: “Yes, that was the sum.”
QUENYA: Péter quente senna: “Ánin nyare, ma vanceste i resta nonwe sinan?” Quentes: “Ná, ta náne i nonwe.”

ENGLISH: But put on yourselves the Lord Jesus Christ, and do not make plans for the desires of the flesh.
QUENYA: Mal á panya lesse i Heru Yésus Hristo, ar áva care panor i hráveo írin.

ENGLISH: But turn yourself away from foolish inquries and genealogies and quarrelings and disputes about the Law, for such things are without fruit and empty.
QUENYA: Mal quera imle oa ho auce centar ar ontaleparmar ar costier ar costi pa i Şanye, an taiti nati nar ú yáveo ar cumne.

ENGLISH: But what comes out from the mouth come out from the heart, and they soil a man!”
QUENYA: Mal yar ettulir i antollo ettulir i endallo, ar tai vahtar atan.

ENGLISH: My children, this is the last hour, and as you have heard that the Antichrist is coming, even now there are numerous Antichrists. Thus we know that this is the last hour.
QUENYA: Hinyar, si ná i métima lúme, ar ve ahlárielde i túla i Anahristo, yando sí ear rimbe Anahristoli. Sie istalve i si ná i métima lúme.

ENGLISH: For though I am free from all, I have made myself thrall of all, in order to save the greater number .
QUENYA: An ómu nanye léra ho illi, acárienyexe illion mól, rehtien i ambe rimbe.

ENGLISH: For what exalts you above others? Indeed what do you have that you have not received? But if you received it, how is that you praise yourself as if you did not receive it?
QUENYA: An mana orhale lyé or exi? É mana samil ya ual acámie? Mal qui camnelyes, manen ná i laitalyexe ve au ual camne sa?

ENGLISH: Without waiting, in that night the brothers sent both Paul and Silas to Beroea, and when they came there, they went into the synagogue of the Jews.
QUENYA: Pen hopie, lóme yanasse i hánor mentaner yúyo Paulo ar Sílas Veroianna, ar íre túlette tar, lendette mir i yomencoa i Yúraron.

ENGLISH: His feet were like gold-colored copper, glowing in an oven , and his voice was like the sound of many waters.
QUENYA: Talyat nánet ve laurea urus, lúşina urnasse, ar ómarya náne ve i lamma rimbe nenion.

ENGLISH: Thus it is necessary also for you to have patience and courage, for the Lord's coming is near.
QUENYA: Sie mauya yando len same cóle ar huore, an i Heruo tulesse ná hare.

ENGLISH: For how is it necessary for me to judge that are on the outside? Do not you judge that are on the inside,
QUENYA: An manen mauya nin name i ear i ettesse? Ma ualde namir i ear i mityasse,

ENGLISH: Jesus answered them: “I told you, and yet you do not believe. The deeds that I am doing in my Father’s name, they witness about me.
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente téna: “Nyarnen len, ananta ualde save. I cardar yar inye cára Atarinyo essenen, tai vettar pa ni.

ENGLISH: Our fathers worshipped on this mountain, but you say that Jerusalem is the proper place for worship.”
QUENYA: Atarilmar tyerner oron sinasse, mal lé quetir i Yerúsalem ná i vanima nóme tyerien.”

ENGLISH: Do not have a debt of a single thing to anyone, except to love one another, for who loves his neighbor has fulfilled the law.
QUENYA: Áva sama rohta erya natwa aiquenen, hequa mele quén i exe, an ye mele armarorya aquantie i şanye.

ENGLISH: But they could not stand against the wisdom and the spirit with which he talked.
QUENYA: Mal ualte polde tare i sailienna ar i fairenna yainen carampes.

ENGLISH: But the reason by which I received mercy was that by me it was possible for Christ Jesus to show his patience first, making me an example of who will believe in him, thus getting eternal life.
QUENYA: Mal i casta yanen camnen oravie náne i inyenen ence Hristo Yésun tana quanda cólerya minyave, cárala ní epemma ion savuvar sesse, sie ñetala oira coivie.

ENGLISH: Though they said about themselves that they were wise, they became fools
QUENYA: Ómu quentelte pa inte i anelte saile, ollelte aucor

ENGLISH: Or do you know that who has become one with a harlot is one body with her? For “the two”, he says, “will be one flesh”.
QUENYA: Hya ualde ista i ye olólie er as imbacinde hroa er ná óse? An “i atta”, quetis, “nauvat hráve er”.

ENGLISH: At that time Herod the Farthing-ruler heard the story about Jesus,
QUENYA: Lúme yanasse Herol i Canastatur hlasse i nyarna pa Yésus,

ENGLISH: But he shook the venomous creature into the fire and suffered nothing bad.
QUENYA: Mal palles i hloirea onna mir i ruine ar perpére munta olca.

ENGLISH: There was a man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of the army division called the Italian,
QUENYA: Enge nér Césareasse estaina Cornelio, tuxantur i hosseranto estaina i Itála,

ENGLISH: These men are springs without water, mists carried by storm, and for them the gloom of darkness is reserved.
QUENYA: Neri sine nar ehteléli ú neno, híºiéli cóline raumonen, ar tien i huine morniéva ná sátina.

ENGLISH: Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit in you, which you have from God? Furthermore, you do not possess yourselves,
QUENYA: Hya ma ualde ista i hroalda corda ná i Aire Faireva lesse, ya samilde Erullo? Ente, ualde haryaldexer,

ENGLISH: But since a plan against this man has been revealed to me, I sent him to you without waiting, and I command that have complaints about him that they must speak against him before you.”
QUENYA: Man pan pano ana nér sina anaie apantana nin, mentanenyes lyenna pen hopie, ar canin i samir nurreli pa se i mauya tien quete ana se epe lyé.”

ENGLISH: Be awake, to stop anyone from drawing you away with the philosophy and the empty deception which follows the teachings received from men – following the world's poor things and not Christ.
QUENYA: Na coive, pustien aiquen tuciello le oa i ingolénen ar i lusta hurulénen ya hilya i peantier cámine atanillon – hilyala i mardo penye nati ar lá Hristo.

ENGLISH: Leaving, Jesus went away, but his disciples came to him to show him the buildings of the temple.
QUENYA: Autala, Yesus lende oa, mal hildoryar túler senna tanien sen i cordo ataqui.

ENGLISH: Of course , nobody talked openly about him, for they feared the Jews.
QUENYA: Ve hanyaina, úquen carampe pantave pa sé, an runcelte i Yúrallon.

ENGLISH: Then they sought an answer from the father by gestures, what name he wanted for the child.
QUENYA: Tá cestanelte hanquenta i atarello hwermelínen, mana esse mernes i hínan.

ENGLISH: After he read the letter he asked about what region he came from, and learnt that he was from Cilicia.
QUENYA: Apa cendanes i menta maquentes pa mana ménallo hé túle, ar parne i hé náne Ciliciallo.

ENGLISH: for through him we, both peoples, may come near, in one spirit, to the Father.
QUENYA: an ter sé engwe, yúyo lie, lertat tule hare, mi faire er, i Atarenna.

ENGLISH: I wrote some words to the congregation, but Diotrephes, who loves being prominent among them, does not receive anything from us.
QUENYA: Tencen quettali i ocombenna, mal Liotréfes, ye mele náve minda mici te, ua came aiqua mello.

ENGLISH: Therefore I indeed came, without speaking against your calling when I was being summoned. Therefore I ask: What is your reason for sending to me?”
QUENYA: Etta é túlen, ú quetiéno ana yalielya íre anen tultaina. Etta maquetin: Mana castalya mentaven nin?”

ENGLISH: For into such freedom the Christ freed us. Therefore stand firm, and do not allow yourselves to be kept under a thrall's yoke.
QUENYA: An mir taite lérie i Hristo leryane ve. Etta tara tulce, ar áva lave inden náve hépine nu yanta mólo.

ENGLISH: They had also a few fishes, and after blessing those, he commanded them to put also them before the people.
QUENYA: Sámelte yando mance halali, ar apa aistie tai, cannes tien panya yando tai epe i queni.

ENGLISH: The others followed, some on planks, some on things from the ship. And thus all were brought safely to land.
QUENYA: I exi hilyaner, ennoli panolissen, ennoli natalissen i ciryallo. Ar sie illi náner talane varnave norenna.

ENGLISH: But this man sacrificed one sacrifice concerning sins forever and sat down at God's right hand,
QUENYA: Mal nér sina yance er yanca pa úcari oiale ar hamne undu ara Eruo forma,

ENGLISH: But if the person that does not believe wants to go away, let him/her go away; a brother or sister is not bound in such circymstances but God has called you to peace.
QUENYA: Ono qui i quén ye ua save mere auta, lava sen auta; háno hya néşa ua nútina taiti sómassen, mal Eru aiálie le rainenna.

ENGLISH: They answered him: “You were wholly born in sins, and yet you teach us?” And they threw him out.
QUENYA: Hanquentelte senna: “Elye náne aqua nóna úcarelissen, ananta peantal men?” Ar hanteltes etsenna.

ENGLISH: “A voice was heard in Rama, wailing and great lament – Rachel wailing for her children, and she did not want comfort, for they are gone.”
QUENYA: “Óma náne hlárina Ramasse, yaime ar túra nainie – Ráħel yaimea hínaryain, ar uas merne tiutale, an nalte vanwe!”

ENGLISH: But who indeed is a widow and has become destitute, has put her hope in God and remains in petitions and prayers at night and at day.
QUENYA: Ono ye é verulóra ná ar olólie úna, apánie estelya Erusse ar lemya arcandessen ar hyamiessen lómisse yo auresse.

ENGLISH: The Jews answered him: “We have a law, and by that law he is worthy of death, since he has made self God’s son.”
QUENYA: I Yúrar hanquenter senna: “Samilme şanye, ar sana şanyenen náse valda qualmeo, pan acárien immo Eruo yondo.”

ENGLISH: Then Herod secretly summoned the star-gazers and asked them about the first time that they saw the star.
QUENYA: Tá Herol nuldave tultane i elentirmor ar maquente te pa i minya lú ya cennelte i tinwe.

ENGLISH: And he said: “With what shall we compare God's kingdom, and what is the comparison that we shall make concerning it?
QUENYA: Ar eques: “As mana sestuvalve Eruo aranie, ar mana i sestie ya caruvalve pa sa?

ENGLISH: But if our unrighteousness highlights God's righteousness , what are we to say? Surely God is not unrighteous when he shows his wrath? I am speaking like a man.
QUENYA: Mal qui úfailielva care Eruo failie aşcénima, mana quetuvalve? Lau Eru úfaila ná íre tanas rúşerya? Quétan ve atan.

ENGLISH: Then the shepherds went back, giving glory and praise to God about everything that they heard and saw, wholly as that was told to them.
QUENYA: Tá i mavari nanwenner, antala alcar ar laitale Erun pa ilqua ya hlasselte ar cennelte, aqua ve ta náne nyárina ten.

ENGLISH: Therefore Jesus answered: “He is to whom I will give the piece of bread that I dip.” After dipping the piece he gave it to Judas the son of Simon Iscariot.
QUENYA: Etta Yésus hanquente: “Náse yen antuvan i ranta massava ya tumyan.” Apa tumie i ranta sa-antanes Yúras yondoryan Símon Iscáriot.

ENGLISH: And after we sailed from there on the following day we came beside Chios, and after one more day we reached as far as Samos, and on the following day we came into Miletus.
QUENYA: Ar apa cirnelme talo i hilyala auresse túlelme ara Cios, ar apa an ré rahtanelme tenna Samos, ar i hilyala auresse túlelme mir Miletus.

ENGLISH: And now I give you over to God and to the word of his grace, which can build you up and give you your part as heirs, with all the sanctified ones.
QUENYA: Ar sí antan le olla Erun ar lisseryo quettan, ya pole carasta le ama ar anta len rantalda ve indyoni, as ilye i airintar.

ENGLISH: and when she recognized Peter's voice, for her joy she did not open the gate, but ran inside and told that Peter was standing before the door.
QUENYA: ar íre atsintes Pétero óma, alasseryanen uas latyane i ando, mal nornes minna ar nyarne i Péter tára epe i ando.

ENGLISH: Its tail drags one third of the stars of heaven, and it throws them down upon earth. And the dragon stood before the woman who was ready to bear , for it to devour her child when she would bear .
QUENYA: Pimperya tuce nelesta i tinwion menelo, ar hantes tai undu cemenna. Ar i hlóce tarne epe i nís ye náne manwa colien, ammatieryan hínarya íre hé columne.

ENGLISH: And he went preaching in the synagogues of Judea.
QUENYA: Ar lendes nyardala Yúreo yomencoassen.

ENGLISH: And everybody who has this hope in him, purifies self as he is clean.
QUENYA: Ar ilquen ye same estel sina sesse, poita immo ve sé ná poica.

ENGLISH: “A sower went out to sow. In his sowing some seeds fell beside the road and were trampled down, and the birds of heaven ate them.
QUENYA: “Rerindo etelende rerien. Rerieryasse erdeli lantaner ara i malle ar náne vattaina undu, ar menelo aiwi manter tai.

ENGLISH: but it was necessary to a have joy and be glad, for this brother of yours was dead and returned to life, and he was lost and has been found!”
QUENYA: mal mauyane same alasse ar náve valime, an sina hánotya náne qualin ar nanwenne coivienna, ar anes vanwa ar anaie hírina!”

ENGLISH: And his sisters, are they not all with us? Where, then, did this man receive all these things?”
QUENYA: Ar néşaryar, ma ualte illi aselve? Masse, tá, nér sina camne ilye sine nati?”

ENGLISH: Reverence is indeed a path to great gain, together with sufficiency .
QUENYA: Ainocimie é ná tie hoa ñetienna, as fáre.

ENGLISH: Now the hour was around the eighth, and darkness fell upon the entire earth until the ninth hour,
QUENYA: Sí i lúme náne os i enquea, ar mornie lantane i quanda cemenna tenna i nertea lúme,

ENGLISH: A man on the roof is not to go down to bring his goods out of his house,
QUENYA: Nér i tópasse áva lelya undu talien armaryar et coaryallo,

ENGLISH: Nobody has a love greater than this, that a person gives his life for his friends.
QUENYA: Úquen same melme túra lá si, i quén anta coivierya meldoryain.

ENGLISH: Then he said: “All these things I have kept from youth.”
QUENYA: Tá quentes: “Ilye nati sine ehépien et néşello.”

ENGLISH: And quickly going away from the grave, having fear and great joy, they ran to tell that to the disciples.
QUENYA: Ar lintiénen autala i noirillo, arwa ruciéno ar túra alasseo, nornette ta-nyarien hildoryain.

ENGLISH: and in the midst of the lampstands one like a son of man, clad in a robe that reached to his feet and having a golden belt bound about the chest.
QUENYA: ar i endesse i calmatarmaron quén ve atanyondo, vaina vaimasse ya rahtane talyanta ar arwa laurea quilto nútina os i ambas.

ENGLISH: Jesus answered and said: “Even if I witness about self, my witness is true, since I know from whom I come and where I go away.
QUENYA: Yésus hanquente ar eque: “Yando qui vettan pa immo, vettienya nanwa ná, pan istan yallo tulin ar yanna autan.

ENGLISH: and happy is the one that in me finds nothing turning him away.
QUENYA: ar valima ná ye inyesse hire munta quérala se oa.

ENGLISH: If I do so by my free will, I have a reward, but if I do it under compulsion, I still have a overseership put upon me.
QUENYA: Qui carin sie léra nirmenyanen, samin paityale, mal qui carinyes nu mausta, en samin ortírie panyana nisse.

ENGLISH: Then, instructed by her mother, she said: “Give me here on a plate John the Baptist's head!”
QUENYA: Tá, peantaina lo amillerya, hé quente: “Ánin anta sisse venesse Yoháno i Sumbando cas!”

ENGLISH: I am the bread of life.
QUENYA: Inye ná i massa coiviéva.

ENGLISH: For if is the will, it is desirable by which one has, not by which one does not have.
QUENYA: An qui ea i nirme, nas írima yanen mo same, lá yanen mo ua same.

ENGLISH: I wish that you will allow a small measure of unwisdom from me. But indeed you allow it from me!
QUENYA: Merin i lavumnelde pitya lesta alasailiéva nillo. Mal é lavilde sa nillo!

ENGLISH: Thus they are no more two, but one flesh. Therefore, which God has put under one yoke, do not let man separate!”
QUENYA: Sie uatte ambe atta, mal hráve er. Etta, ya Eru apánie nu er yalta, áva lave atanen hyare!”

ENGLISH: But the others do it since they want the strife, not for pure reasons, for they suppose that they will cause tribulation against me in my fetters.
QUENYA: Mal i exi carir sa pan merilte i cos, lá poice castainen, an intyalte i tyaruvalte şangie nin naxanyassen.

ENGLISH: was said to them that they were not to harm the grass of earth or every green plant or a single tree, but only the people not having the seal of God on their forehead.
QUENYA: Náne tien quétina i ávalte malumne cemeno salque hya ilya laica olva hya erya alda, mal rie i queni lá arwe i lihto Eruva timbareltasse.

ENGLISH: From now may no one cause me difficulty, for I am carrying in my flesh the marks of Jesus Christ.
QUENYA: Ho sí nai úquen tyaruva nin urdie, an cólan hroanyasse i tanwar Yésus Hristova.

ENGLISH: – not like eye-servants, as if to please men, but like Christ's slaves, doing God's will sincerely.
QUENYA: – lá ve hendunúror, ve qui fastien atani, mal ve Hristo móli, cárala Eruo indóme holmo.

ENGLISH: Therefore, let us do everything that we can to come into that rest, to stop anyone from falling in the same manner: by failing to heed the commands.
QUENYA: Etta, alve care ilqua ya polilve tulien mir sére tana, pustien aiquen lantiello mi imya lé: loitiénen cime i canwar.

ENGLISH: And they told about that had happened on the road and how he was made known to them by breaking the bread.
QUENYA: Ar tú nyarnet pa yar náner martienwe i mallesse ar manen anes carna sinwa tun raciénen i massa.

ENGLISH: And look! he is speaking openly, and they say nothing to him. Surely the rulers have not really found that he is the Christ?
QUENYA: Ar yé! pantave quétas, ar quetilte munta senna. Lau i turcor nanwave ihírier i náse i Hristo?

ENGLISH: The purpose was that as sin ruled by death, so grace was going to rule by righteousness, bringing eternal life by Jesus Christ our Lord.
QUENYA: I enne náne i sive úcare turne qualmenen, tambe Erulisse turumne failiénen, tálala oira coivie Yésus Hristo Herulvanen.

ENGLISH: And again summoning the crowd he said to them: “Listen to me, all of you, and understand!
QUENYA: Ar ata tultala i şanga quentes téna: “Á lasta ninna, illi mici le, ar á hanya!

ENGLISH: Numerous ones gave lying testimony against him,, but the testimonies were not similar .
QUENYA: Rimbali antaner húrala vettie senna, mal i vettier úner vávie.

ENGLISH: Did you suffer that many things for nothing? If indeed it happened for nothing.
QUENYA: Ma perpérelde ta rimbe nati muntan? Qui é martanes muntan.

ENGLISH: Thus all the generations from Abraham to David were fourteen, and from David to the deportation to Babel there are fourteen generations, and from the deportation to Babel to Christ fourteen generations.
QUENYA: Sie ilye i nónari Avrahamello Lavirenna náner canaque, ar Lavirello i autulyalenna Vávelenna ear nónari canaque, ar i autulyalello Vávelenna i Hristonna nónari canaque.

ENGLISH: And in the first affair, men that are dying receive tithes, but in the second affair: a person who has the witness that he is living.
QUENYA: Ar i minya nattosse, nereli i quélar camir quaistar, mal i attea nattosse: quén ye same i vettie i náse coirea.

ENGLISH: And yet many also of the rulers believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him, that they that they were not going to be excluded from the synagogue.
QUENYA: Ananta rimbali yando i turcoron sáver sesse, mal Farisainen ualte etequentane se, i lá umnelte hehtaine i yomencoallo.

ENGLISH: Philip went down into the city of Samaria and made the Christ known to them.
QUENYA: Filip lende undu mir Samário osto ar carne i Hristo sinwa tien.

ENGLISH: Do you not have houses in which it is possible for you to eat and drink? Or do you despise God's congregation, and humiliate who have nothing? What am I to say to you? Am I to praise you? In this matter I do not praise you.
QUENYA: Ma ualde same coar yassen ece len mate ar suce? Hya ma nattirilde Eruo ocombe, ar nucumir i samir munta? Mana quetuvan len? Ma laituvan le? Mi natto sina uan laita le.

ENGLISH: For this oil one could sell for a sum of money over three hundred denarii and give it to the poor!” And they were wroth against her.
QUENYA: An millo sina mo polde vace telpenóten or lenári tuxar nelde ar anta sa i penyain!” Ar anelte rúşie senna.

ENGLISH: my persecutions, my sufferings – like those that happened to me in Antioch, in Iconum, in Lystra – and out of all the Lord has delivered me.
QUENYA: roitienyar, perperienyar – ve tai yar martaner nin mi Antiocía, mi Iconium, mi Listra – ar et ilyallon i Heru etelehtie ni.

ENGLISH: Work, not for the food that will pass away, but for the food that remains for eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you; for on him the Father, God, has set his seal.”
QUENYA: Mola, lá i matson ya autuva, mal i matson ya lemya oira coivien, ya i Atanyondo antuva len; an sesse i Atar, Eru, apánie lihtarya.”

ENGLISH: Thus even clothes and aprons were carried from his skin and put on the sick ones, and the illnesses went away from them, and the wicked spirits came out.
QUENYA: Sie yando lanneli ar quiltalanneli náner cóline helmaryallo ar panyane i hlaiwassen, ar i hlíwi váner tello, ar i olce fairi ettúler.

ENGLISH: and while the blood of Stephen your witness was being poured forth, I as well was standing near and thought well about what happened, and I was watching the cloaks of the people that killed him.'
QUENYA: ar lan Stefáno vettolyo serce náne etulyaina, yú inye tárane hare ar sanne mai pa ya martane, ar tíranen i collar i queniva i nacanter se.'

ENGLISH: And it happened , when he was in a place praying, that when he stopped one of his disciples said to him: “Lord, teach us to pray, like John also taught his disciples.”
QUENYA: Ar túle, íre enges nómesse hyámala, i íre pustanes quén hildoryaron quente senna: “Heru, ámen peanta hyame, ve Yoháno yando peantane hildoryain.”

ENGLISH: But who inquires into the perfect law of freedom, and endures in it – since he has made himself, not a hearer that recalls nothing, but a doer of labour – will be happy in his labour.
QUENYA: Mal ye ceºe i ilvana ºanye lériéva, ar perpere sasse – pan acáries inse, lá hlarindo ye enyale munta, mal carindo moliéno – nauva valima molieryasse.

ENGLISH: For the matter is like when a man who was going to travel to another country summoned his thralls and gave his goods into their keeping.
QUENYA: An i natto ná ve íre nér ye lelyumne hyana nórenna tultane mólyar ar antaner armaryar mir hepielta.

ENGLISH: He had great wrath against the people of Tyre and Sidon. As one they came to him, and they spoke with Blastus, the chief of the bedchamber of the king, and gained his support. Thereafter they asked for peace, for their land received its food from that of the king.
QUENYA: Sámes túra rú$e i lienna mi Tír ar Síron. Ve er túlelte senna, ar carampelte as Vlasto, i turco i caimaşambo i aranwa, ar ñenter penastarya. Tá arcanelte raine, an nórelta camne mattarya ho ta i aranwa.

ENGLISH: If is no resurrection from the dead, Christ as well has not been raised.
QUENYA: Qui enortáve qualinallon lá ea, yú Hristo ua anaie ortana.

ENGLISH: Therefore say to us what you think: Is it allowed to give tax to the High King, or not?
QUENYA: Etta queta menna ya sanalye: Ma ná lávaina anta tungwe i Ingaranen, hya lá?”

ENGLISH: And those that went in front of Jesus rebuked him, for him to be silent, but that much more he cried: “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
QUENYA: Ar i lender opo Yésus naityaner se, náveryan quilda, mal ta ole ambe yámes: “Lavirion, órava nisse!”

ENGLISH: When they heard these things they were cut in their heart, and they ground their teeth against him.
QUENYA: Íre hlasselde nati sine anelte círine endaltasse, ar múlelte nelciltar senna.

ENGLISH: Always, in every petition of mine for all among you, I make petition in joy
QUENYA: Illume, mi ilya arcandenya illin mici le, carin arcande mi alasse

ENGLISH: And he tried to see Jesus, but he could not because of the crowd, and he was not tall.
QUENYA: Ar néves cene Yésus, mal uas polle i şanyenen, an únes halla.

ENGLISH: And they answered Jesus and said: “We do not know.” And Jesus said to them: “Then I too refuse to tell you about the authority by which I do these things.”
QUENYA: Ar hanquentelte Yésunna ar quenter: “Ualme ista.” Ar Yésus quente téna: “Tá yando inye váquete nyare len pa i hére yanen carin nati sine.”

ENGLISH: and have tasted God's good word and the powers of the coming Arda ,
QUENYA: ar atyávier Eruo mára quetta ar i túlala Ardo túri,

ENGLISH: while the wise ones brought oil in their bottles with their lamps.
QUENYA: íre i sailar namper millo olpeltassen as calmaltar.

ENGLISH: And that were sent, when they returned to the house, found the slave in health.
QUENYA: Ar i náner mentaine, íre nanwennelte i coanna, hirner i mól málesse.

ENGLISH: And he came to the disciples and found them asleep, and he said to Peter: “Could you not keep yourselves awake for a single hour with me?
QUENYA: Ar túles i hildonnar ar hirne te lorne, ar quentes Péterenna: “Ma ualde polde hepe inde coive ter erya lúme asinye?

ENGLISH: and the two shall be one flesh. Thus they are no more two, but one flesh.
QUENYA: ar i atta nauvat er hráve. Sie uatte ambe atta, mal er hráve.

ENGLISH: Therefore the kingdom of heaven is like a man, a king, who wished to have a reckoning with his thralls.
QUENYA: Etta menelo aranie ná ve nér, aran, ye merne same onótie as móliryar.

ENGLISH: And some men came down from Judea and taught the brothers: “If you are not circumcised, by the tradition of Moses, it is not possible for you to obtain salvation.”
QUENYA: Ar nelli túler undu Yúreallo ar peantane i hánor: “Qui ualde oscírine, Móseo haimenen, lá ece len ñete rehtie.”

ENGLISH: Then he said to the disciple: “Behold your mother!” And from that hour the disciple took her into his own house.
QUENYA: Tá quentes i hildonna: “Ela amillelya!” Ar sana lúmello i hildo nampe se mir véra coarya.

ENGLISH: And I John was who heard and saw these things. And after hearing and seeing, I fell down to worship before feet of the angel who showed me these things.
QUENYA: Ar inye Yoháno náne ye hlasse ar cenne nati sine. Ar apa hlarie ar cenie, lantanen undu tyerien epe talu i valo ye nin-tanne nati sine.

ENGLISH: But if anyone says to you: “This thing has been sacrificed,“ do not eat, by reason of who told you that, and by reason of conscience.
QUENYA: Mal qui aiquen quete lenna: “Nat sina anaie yácina”, áva mate, castanen yeo nyarne len ta, ar castanen immotuntiéno.

ENGLISH: He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up again at the last day.
QUENYA: Ye mate hrávenya ar suce sercenya same oira coivie, ar enortuvanyes i métima auresse.

ENGLISH: But numerous ones of the crowd believed in him and said: “When the Christ shall come, surely he will not do deeds more numerous than that this man has done?”
QUENYA: Mal rimbali i şango sáver sesse ar quenter: “Íre i Hristo tuluva, lau caruvas cardar rimbe lá yar acárie nér sina?”

ENGLISH: and make straight ways for your feet. Thus which is paralyzed will not be put out of joint, but rather it will be healed.
QUENYA: ar cara tére maller taluldant. Sie ya ná úlévima ua nauva panyaina et lequettello, mal ambe rato nauvas nestaina.

ENGLISH: By this reason I fall upon my knees before the Father,
QUENYA: Sina castanen lantan occanyanta epe i Atar,

ENGLISH: I do not put away God's grace, for if is justice by law, the Christ actually died for nothing.
QUENYA: Uan panya oa Eruo lisse, an qui failie ea şanyenen, i Hristo anwave qualle muntan.

ENGLISH: For God sent his Son, not that he was to judge the world, but that the world was to be saved by him.
QUENYA: An Eru mentane Yondorya, lá i namumnes i mar, mal i umne i mar rehtaina sénen.

ENGLISH: and she went into the hpise of Zechariah and greeted Elizabeth.
QUENYA: ar mennes mir coarya Secaría ar suilane Elísavet.

ENGLISH: were some shepherds in that same country that dwelt in the field, watching their flocks in the night.

QUENYA: Ua mauya sen ilya auresse, ve yane hére airimor carner, yace yancali: minyave pa vére úcareryar ar tá pa i úcari i lieo (an ta carnes erya lú íre yances inse),

ENGLISH: For so is God's will: That you will be hallowed – that you will keep yourselves away from fornication.
QUENYA: An sie Eruo indóme ná: I nauvalde airinte – i hepuvalde inde oa hrupuhtiello.

ENGLISH: For when they rise from the dead, men do not marry and women are not given in marriage, bu they are as the angels in heaven.
QUENYA: An íre oryuvalte qualinillon, neri uar verya ar nissi uar vertaine, mal nalte ve vali menelde.

ENGLISH: And yet you did well by having a part with me in my tribulation.
QUENYA: Ananta carnelde mai samiénen ranta asinye şangienyasse.

ENGLISH: And to one among them he gave five talents, to another two, to another one – according to their skill. Then he went away.
QUENYA: Ar quenen mici te antanes talenti lempe, exen atta, exen er – ve fintielta. Tá lendes oa.

ENGLISH: Therefore, since we have these promises, beloved ones, let us cleanse ourselves from every stain of flesh and of spirit, seeking perfect holiness, in the fear of God.
QUENYA: Etta, pan samilve vandar sine, meldar, alve poita inwe ilya vaxello hráveo ar faireo, cestala ilvana aire, ruciesse Erullo.

ENGLISH: May who has an ear hear which the Spirit says to the congregations: To who conquers I shall give to eat from the Tree of Life, which is in the garden of God.
QUENYA: Nai ye same hlas hlaruva ya i Faire quete i ocombennar: Yen same i apaire antauvan mate i Aldallo Coiviéva, ya ea i tarwasse Eruva.

ENGLISH: And he went into a house.
QUENYA: Ar lendes mir coa.

ENGLISH: Therefore, since he was raised to God's right hand and received the Holy Spirit from his Father by the promise he had given, he poured forth this that you are seeing and you are hearing.
QUENYA: Etta, pan anes ortana Eruo formanna ar camne i Aire Fea Ataryallo i vandanen ya hé antanelyane, et-ulyanes si ya cénalde ar hláralde.

ENGLISH: For what is important is not circumcision or uncircumcision, but to be a new creature.
QUENYA: An ya ná valda ua oscirie hya úoscirie, mal náve vinya onna.

ENGLISH: But Jesus cried out and said: “ who believes in me does not believe in me, but in who sent me,
QUENYA: Mal Yésus etyáme ar eque: “Ye save nisse ua save nisse, mal yesse ni-mentane,

ENGLISH: Therefore do not fear them. For there is nothing covered that will not be revealed, and nothing secret that will not be known.
QUENYA: Etta áva ruce tello. An ea munta tópina ya ua nauva apantana, ar munta nulda ya ua nauva sinwa.

ENGLISH: And not do fear those that kills the body but cannot kill the soul; sooner fear that can undo soul and body alike in Gehenna.
QUENYA: Ar áva ruce illon nahtar i hroa mal uar pole nahta i fea; ambe rongo ruca yello pole nancare fea ar hroa véla Ehennasse.

ENGLISH: not to the entire people, but to witnesses chosen by God – to us, that ate and drank with him after his raising from dead.
QUENYA: lá i quanda lien, mal astarmolin cíline lo Eru – elmen, i manter ar suncer óse apa ortaverya et qualinallon.

ENGLISH: and all were baptized into Moses by the cloud and by the sea;
QUENYA: ar illi náner sumbane mir Móses i lumbunen ar i earnen;

ENGLISH: For Demas has forsaken me, since he loved this world, and he went away to Thessalonica, Crescens to Galatia, Titus to Dalmatia.
QUENYA: An Lémas ehehtie ni, pan méles Arda sina, ar oantes Şessalonicanna, Hrescens Alatianna, Títo Lalmatianna.

ENGLISH: For as the woman is out of man, so the man as well exists by the woman; but all things are out of God.
QUENYA: An ve i nís et i nerello ná, sie yú i nér ea i nissenen, mal ilye nati nar et Erullo.

ENGLISH: But do you want to know, o empty man, that without acts faith does nothing good?
QUENYA: Mal ma meril ista, a cumna atan, i ú cardaron savie care munta mára?

ENGLISH: Alexander the copper-smith did numerous evils to me – the Lord will pay him back as his deeds are –
QUENYA: Alexander i urustan carne rimbe ulculi nin – i Heru nampaityuva se ve cardaryar nar –

ENGLISH: and they put them before the apostles, and after praying they placed their hands on them.
QUENYA: ar panyaneltet epe i aposteli, ar apa hyamie panyanelte máltat tesse.

ENGLISH: And in that moment, while Jesus still spoke, came Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a crowd having swords and clubs, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
QUENYA: Ar mi yana lú, lan Yésus en carampe, túle Yúras, quén i yunqueo, ar óse şanga arwe macillion ar rundalion, ho i hére airimor ar i parmangolmor i amyárar.

ENGLISH: Then Ananias went, and he came into the house, and he put his hands on him and said: “Saul, brother – the Lord, the Jesus that showed himself to you on the road on which you came, has sent me for your to see again and for you to be filled with Holy Spirit.”
QUENYA: Tá Ananías lende, ar túles mir i coa, ar panyanes máryat sesse ar quente: “Saul, háno – i Heru, i Yésus ye tanne inse lyen i mallesse yasse túlel, ni-ementaye cenielyan ata ar návelyan quátina Aire Feo.”

ENGLISH: who has the Son has the life; who does not have the Son of God does not have the life.
QUENYA: Ye same i Yondo same i coivie; ye ua same i Eruion ua same i coivie.

ENGLISH: Then he said also to his disciples: “ was a man who was rich and had a person overseeing his house, but he heard a bad report about him – that he threw away his goods.
QUENYA: Tá quentes yando hildoryannar: “Enge atan ye náne lárea ar sáme quén ortírala coarya, mal hlasses ulca nyarie pa se – i hantes oa armaryar.

ENGLISH: It is necessary to stop their mouth, for these people subvert entire families by teaching what is not proper, in a desire for unjust gain.
QUENYA: Mauya holta antolta, an queni sine nuquerir quande nossi peantiénen pa ya ua vanima, íresse úfaila ñetiéva.

ENGLISH: Now Jews’ Passover was near, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
QUENYA: Sí Yúraron Lahtie né hare, ar Yésus lende amba Yerúsalemenna.

ENGLISH: but I punish my body and lead it as a thrall, that I who have instructed others will not be turned away.
QUENYA: mal paimetan hroanya ar tulya sa ve mól, in inye ye peánie exin ua nauva quérina oa.

ENGLISH: But turn away foolish and ignorant inquries, knowing that they lead to quarrelings.
QUENYA: Mal quera oa auce ar istyalóre minaşurier, istala i tulyalte costiennar.

ENGLISH: To anyone who seeks to keep his life it will be lost, but a person it is lost to, will save it.
QUENYA: Aiquenen ye cesta hepe cuilerya nauvas vanwa, mal quén yen nas vanwa rehtuva sa.

ENGLISH: For Jews ask for signs and Greeks seek wisdom,
QUENYA: An Yúrar arcar tanwar ar Hellenyar cestar sailie,

ENGLISH: that killed the Lord Jesus and the prophets alike, and persecuted us. Furthermore, they fail to please God, but they stand against the good of all men,
QUENYA: i nacanter i Heru Yésus ar i Erutercánor véla, ar roitaner mé. Ente, loitalte fasta Erun, mal tarilte i márienna ilye atanion,

ENGLISH: who had a field, sold it and brought the money and put it before the feet of the apostles.
QUENYA: ye sáme resta, vance sa ar talle i telpe ar panyane sa epe i apostelion talu.

ENGLISH: He has put his hope in God; now let him rescue him if he wants him, for he said: I am God's Son!”
QUENYA: Apánies estelya Erusse; sí lava hén etelehta se qui hé mere se, an quentes: Nanye Eruo Yondo!”

ENGLISH: But all these things are being worked by the one and the same spirit, distributing them as it wishes to every person.
QUENYA: Mal ilye nati sine nar mólaine lo i er ar i imya faire, etsátala tai ve meris ilya quenen.

ENGLISH: To his commands our fathers refused to listen, but they pushed him away and turned themselves in their heart to Egypt,
QUENYA: Canwaryannar atarilvar váquenter lasta, mal nirneltes oa ar querner inte endaltasse Mirrandorenna,

ENGLISH: And they gathered them in the place which in Hebrew is called Armageddon.
QUENYA: Ar comyaneltet i nómesse ya Heveryasse ná estaina Armahendon.

ENGLISH: But when I began to speak, the spirit fell upon them just as it fell also upon us in the beginning.
QUENYA: Mal íre inye yestane quete, i faire lantane téna aqua ve lantanes yú venna i yestasse.

ENGLISH: Thus also the debt of the husbands is loving the women like their own bodies. Who loves his wife loves himself,
QUENYA: Sie yando i veruion rohta ná melie i nissi ve vére hroaltar. Ye mele verirya mele inse,

ENGLISH: and yet not by his coming alone, but also by the comfort with which he was comforted concerning you, when he told how you long, how you have grief, how your spirit burns for me – which caused me to have joy still greater.
QUENYA: ananta lá tulieryanen erinqua, mal yando i tiutalénen yanen anes tiutaina pa elde, íre nyarnes manen milyalde, manen samilde nyére, manen şúlelda urya nin – ya tyarne ni same alasse en ambe túra.

ENGLISH: And he confessed and did not deny , but confessed: “I am not the Christ.”
QUENYA: Ar etequentanes ar ua lalane, mal etequentane: “Uan i Hristo.”

ENGLISH: And he found a Jew called Aquila, a man born in Pontus, who a short time ago had come from Italy with Priscilla his wife, since by the command of Claudius all Jews had gone away from Rome. And he came to them,
QUENYA: Ar hirnes Yúra estaina Aquila, nér nóna mi Pontus, ye şinta lúme yá náne tulinwa Italiallo as Priscilla verirya, pan Claurio canwanen ilye Yúrar oantelyaner Rómallo. Ar túles túna,

ENGLISH: Giving these orders to the brothers you will be Christ Jesus's good servant, who thrives on the words of faith and of the good teaching which you have followed.
QUENYA: Antala canwar sine i hánoin nauval Hristo Yésuo mára núro, ye ale i quettainen i saviéno ar i mára peantiéno ya ihíliel.

ENGLISH: And this word spread into all Judea and the whole around-lying country.
QUENYA: Ar quetta sina vistane mir quanda Yúrea ar i quanda oscaitala nórienna.

ENGLISH: And this is the message that we have heard from him and we are telling you, that God is light, and there is not at all darkness in him.
QUENYA: Ar si ná i menta ya ahlárielme sello ar nyáralme len, i Eru cala ná, ar mornie laume ea sesse.

ENGLISH: and again: “The Lord knows the thaughts of the wise ones, that they are empty.”
QUENYA: ar ata: “I Héru ista i sailaron sanwi, i nalte luste.”

ENGLISH: Therefore, when the first ones came, they supposed that they were going to receive more, but everyone among them also received one denarius.
QUENYA: Etta, íre i minyar túler, intyanelte i camumnelte amba, mal ilquen mici té yú camne er lenár.

ENGLISH: Also, some among us went away to the tomb, and they found that was so, just as the women said, but they did not see him.”
QUENYA: Yando, quelli mici me lender oa i noirinna, ar hirnelte i enge sie, aqua ve i nissi quenter, mal ualte cene sé.”

ENGLISH: But I say to you that numerous ones will come from East and West and will lie at the table with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven,
QUENYA: Mal quetin lenna i tuluvar rimbali Rómello ar Númello ar caituvar ara i sarno as Avraham ar Ísac ar Yácov menelo araniesse,

ENGLISH: In the same manner it is necessary that congregation-servants will be serious, not speaking with two tongues, not giving themselves to much wine, not greedily seeking unjust gain,
QUENYA: Mi imya lé, mauya i nauva ocombenduri sanwelunge, lá quetila lamba attanen, lá antala inte olya limpen, lá milcave cestala úfaila ñetie,

ENGLISH: Finally, be mighty in the Lord and in the might of his strength.
QUENYA: Teldave, na taure i Herusse ar i melehtesse poldoreryo.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, they crucified two robbers with him, one on his right and one on his left.
QUENYA: Ente, tarwestanelte pilu atta óse, quén foryaryasse ar quén hyaryaryasse.

ENGLISH: But one among them, Caiaphas, who was the chief priest that year, said to them: “You do not know anything at all,
QUENYA: Mal quén mici te, Caiafas, ye náne i héra airimo loa yanasse, quente téna: “Laume istalde aiqua,

ENGLISH: Rebuke sinners while all are watching, to cause also the others to fear.
QUENYA: Á naitya úcarindor íre illi tírar, tyarien yando i exi ruce.

ENGLISH: May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit!
QUENYA: Nai i Heru Yésus Hristo lisse euva as fairelda!

ENGLISH: Therefore, after the people that were assembled scattered, numerous ones among the Jews and the converts that feared God followed Paul and Barnabas, who spoke to them and urged them to remain in God's grace.
QUENYA: Etta, apa i queni i náner ocómienwe vintaner, rimbali imíca i Yúrar ar i quérinar i runcer Erullo hilyaner Paulo yo Varnavas, yet quentet téna ar te-hortanet lemya mi Eruo lisse.

ENGLISH: But if we say: From men, we will fear the crowd, for all mong them beliee that John was a prophet!”
QUENYA: Mal qui quetilve: Atanillon, rucuvalve i şangallo, an illi mici te savir i Yoháno náne Erutercáno!”

ENGLISH: Jesus said to her: “Daughter, your faith has saved you. Go in peace, and be in health from your painful illness.”
QUENYA: Yésus quente senna: “Selye, savielya erehtie lye. Mena rainesse, ar na málesse naicelea hlívelyallo.”

ENGLISH: They said: “The Lord has need of it.”
QUENYA: Quentette: “I Heru same maure seva.”

ENGLISH: But thus God has made true the things that beforehand he made known through the mouth of all his heralds : that his Christ was going to suffer.
QUENYA: Mal sie Eru acárie nanwe i nati yar nóvo carnes sinwe ter ilye tercánoryaron anto: i Hristorya perperumne.

ENGLISH: Therefore recall that formerly you were people of the nations concerning the flesh. You were called Uncircumcision by that which is called Circumcision, made in the flesh with hands.
QUENYA: Etta enyala i yá anelde queni i nórion pa i hráve. Anelde estaine Úoscirie lo ta ya ná estaina Oscirie, carna i hrávesse mainen.

ENGLISH: arose from the evening meal and put away his raiments. He took a linen cloth and girded himself. Thereafter he poured water into a bowl, and he started to wash the feet of the disiciples and to dry them with linen cloth with which he was girded.
QUENYA: oronte i şinyematello ar panyane oa larmaryar. Nampes paşelanne ar quiltane immo. Epeta ulyanes nén mir salpe, ar yestanes sove i hildoron talu ar parahta tú i paşelannenen yanen anes quiltaina.

ENGLISH: not like the covenant that I made with their fathers on the day that I took their hand and led them out of Egypt. For they did not remain in my covenant, and they are not important to me more, says the Lord.
QUENYA: lá ve i vére ya carnen as atariltar i auresse ya nampen málta ar te-tulyane et Mirrandorello. An té uar lemyane vérenyasse, ar ualte valdie nin ambe, quete i Héru.

ENGLISH: And the Devil who caused them to err was thrown into the lake of fire and sulphur, where both the beast and the false prophet were, and they shall be tormented at day and at night forever.
QUENYA: Ar i Arauco ye tyarne te vare náne hátina mir i ailin nárwa ar ussarneva, yasse yúyo i hravan ar i hurutercáno enget, ar nauvalte ñwalyaine auresse yo lómisse tennoio.

ENGLISH: and do not be formed by this age, but be changed by the renewal of your mind, letting you judge what God's will is, the good and pleasing and perfect.
QUENYA: ar áva na cátaine sina randanen, mal na vistaine i envinyatiénen sámaldava, lavila len name mana Eruo indóme ná, i mára ar fastala ar ilvana.

ENGLISH: And Paul said: “Brothers, I did not know that he is the chief priest. For is written: Do not speak evil of a chief of your people.”
QUENYA: Ar Paulo quente: “Hánor, uan sinte i náse i héra airimo. An ná técina: Áva quete ulco pa turco lielyo.”

ENGLISH: He is under stewards until the day that his father chose beforehand.
QUENYA: Náse nu mardili tenna i aure ya atarya cille nóvo.

ENGLISH: Therefore, always having courage, we know that when we dwell in the body, we are away from the Lord –
QUENYA: Etta, illume arwe huoreo, istalme i íre marilme i hroasse, nalme oa i Herullo –

ENGLISH: You are the world's light. A city upon a mountain is not possible to hide.
QUENYA: Elde nar i mardo cala. Osto orontesse ua cúvima.

ENGLISH: For to whom among angels has he ever said: "You are my son; I begat you today" – ? And again: "I shall be his father, and he shall be my son."
QUENYA: An manenna mici vali oi equéties: "Elye ná yondonya; ónen tye síra" – ? Ar ata: "Inye nauva atarya, ar sé nauva yondonya."

ENGLISH: and sitting there they were watching him.
QUENYA: ar hámala tasse tíraneltes.

ENGLISH: And one of the rulers said asked him: “Good teacher, what am I to do to be heir to eternal life?”
QUENYA: Ar er i cánoron maquente senna: “Mane peantar, mana caruvan náve aryon oira coiviéno?”

ENGLISH: Command who are rich in this age: Do not be haughty and do not put hope in riches, which are not steadfast, but in God, who gives us a rich measure of all things for our joy,
QUENYA: Cana in nar láre randa sinasse: Áva na turquime ar áva panya estel mi lar, ya ua tanca, mal mi Eru, ye anta ven lára lesta ilye nativa alasselvan.

ENGLISH: Therefore, if anyone purifies himself from them, he will be a vessel for a glorious purpose, hallowed, useful for who has it, prepared for every good deed.
QUENYA: Etta, qui aiquen poita inse ho tai, nauvas vene alcarinqua mehten, airinta, yuhtima yen same sa, manwaina ilya mára cardan.

ENGLISH: Abraham your father had great joy at the thought that he was to see my day, and he saw it and rejoiced.”
QUENYA: Avraham atarelda sáme túra alasse i sanwenen i cenumnes ninya aure, ar cenneses ar alastane.”

ENGLISH: And their corpses shall lie in the broad street in the huge city that in the manner of spirit is called Sodom and Egypt, where also their Lord was crucified.
QUENYA: Ar loicottat caituvat i palla mallesse i hoa ostosse ya mi lé i faireo ná estaina Sorom ar Mirrandor, yasse yú Herutta tarwestana né.

ENGLISH: A woman, when she is bearing a baby, has grief, because her time has come; but when she has borne the child, she does not more recall her tribulation, because of her joy that a man has been born into the world.
QUENYA: Nís, íre cólas lapse, same nyére, pan lúmerya utúlie; mal íre ocólies i hína, uas ambe enyale şangierya, alasseryanen i anaie atan nóna mir i mar.

ENGLISH: Furthermore, may Jesus Christ himself and God our Father, who loved us and gave us eternal comfort and good hope by grace,
QUENYA: Ente, nai Yésus Hristo immo ar Eru Atarelva, ye vi-méle ar antane ven oira tiutie ar mára estel Erulissenen,

ENGLISH: But a person will say: “How will dead be raised? What will be the kind of bodies that they come in?”
QUENYA: Mal quén quetuva: “Manen qualinar nauvar ortane? Mana nauva i nostale hroaron yassen tuluvalte?”

ENGLISH: Who is the faithful and wise thrall whom his lord put over the people of his house, to give them food in the proper hour?
QUENYA: Man ná i voronda ar saila mól ye herurya panyane or coaryo queni, antaven tien matta i vanima lúmesse?

ENGLISH: far above every government and power and lordship and every name called, not in this age alone, but also in the coming one.
QUENYA: haira or ilya turie ar túre ar hére ar ilya esse estaina, lá sina randasse erinqua, mal yando mí túlala.

ENGLISH: But if we have hope for that which we do not see, we are looking forward to it with endurance.
QUENYA: Mal qui samilve estel yan ualve cene, yétalve ompa sanna voronwiénen.

ENGLISH: We sought the disciples and found them, and we remained there for seven days. But by the Spirit they said to Paul: “Do not set foot in Jerusalem!”
QUENYA: Cestanelme i hildor ar hirner te, ar lemnelme tasse ter rí otso. Mal i Fairenen quentelte Paulonna: “Áva panya tál Yerúsalemesse!”

ENGLISH: Again I say to you: For a camel to go through a needle's eye is easier than coming into God's kingdom for a rich person.
QUENYA: Ata quétan lenna: Ulumpen menie ter nelmo assa ná ancárima epe tulie mir Eruo aranie lára quenen!”

ENGLISH: Whoever drinks of the water that I will give him will by no means be thirsty, but the water that I will give him will be in him a spring of water that rises up into eternal life.”
QUENYA: Aiquen ye suce i neno ya inye antuva sen laume nauva soica, mal i nén ya inye antuva sen nauva sesse ehtele nenwa ya orta amba mir oira coivie.”

ENGLISH: But Jesus said to him: “Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”
QUENYA: Mal Yésus quente senna: “Yúras, ma vartal i Atanyondo miquenen?”

ENGLISH: That will be for you an opportunity for witnessing.
QUENYA: Ta nauva len ecie vettien.

ENGLISH: And I heard that was like a voice of a huge multitude and like sound of many waters and like the sound of strong thunders, saying: “Hallelujah, for the Lord our God has been made king, the Almighty!
QUENYA: Ar hlassen ya náne ve óma hoa şango ar ve lamma rimbe nenion ar ve lamma polde hundiéron. quétala: “Hallelúya, an i Héru Ainolva anaie carna aran, i Iluvala!

ENGLISH: But when Paul asked to be kept for the judgment of His Majesty, I commanded that he is to be kept until I shall send him to the High King.”
QUENYA: Mal íre Paulo arcane náve hépina i námien Meletyaryo, cannen i nauvas hépina tenna mentauvan se i Ingaranna.”

ENGLISH: but some people stuck to him and believed. Among them were Dionysius who was a judge in the Areopagus, and a woman called Damaris, and some others beside them .
QUENYA: mal ennoli himyaner se ar sáver. Mici té náne Lionisio ye náne námo mí Areopahus, ar nís estaina Lamaris, ar exeli ara tu.

ENGLISH: Heaven’s armies followed him on white horses and clad in white and pure linen.
QUENYA: Menelo hossi se-hilyaner ninqui roccossen ar vaine mi ninque ar poica páşe.

ENGLISH: Two women will grind with the same mill; one will be brought and the other will be abandoned.
QUENYA: Nís atta muluvat i imya mulmanen: quén nauva talana ar i exe nauva hehtana.

ENGLISH: But if anyone says to you: 'What is your reason for loosing it?', you are to say: The Lord has need of it.”
QUENYA: Mal qui aiquen quete lenta: 'Mana castasta lehtien se?', aste quete: I Heru same maure seva.”

ENGLISH: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that hour about the things that it is necessary for you to say.”
QUENYA: an i Aire Fea peantuva lúme entasse pa i nati yar mauyar len quete.”

ENGLISH: And Jesus said to them: “What number of breads do you have?” They said: “Seven, and a few fishes!”
QUENYA: Ar Yésus quente téna: “Mana nóte massaron samilde?” Quentelte: “Otso, ar nótime lingwili!”

ENGLISH: Peter said to him: “Lord, how I cannot follow you now? I will give my life for you!”
QUENYA: Eque senna Péter: “Heru, manen uan pole hilya lye sí? Antuvan coivienya elyen!”

ENGLISH: Furthermore, they appointed for them elders in every congregation, and by praying and fasting they gave them into hand of the Lord in whom they believed.
QUENYA: Ente, santette amyárali tien ilya ocombesse, ar hyamiénen ar lamatenen antanettet manna i Heruo yesse sávelte.

ENGLISH: And this will be for you a sign: You will find an infant, swaddled and lying in a manger.”
QUENYA: Ar si nauva tanwa len: Hiruvalde vinimo, vaitana ar caitala salquecolcasse.”

ENGLISH: Therefore that were scattered by the tribulation that arose concerning Stephen went as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, but they spoke the word only to the Jews.
QUENYA: Etta i náner vintane i şangiénen ya oronte pa Stefáno lender tenna Fenícia ar Ciprus ar Antioc, mal quentelte i quetta rie i Yúrannar.

ENGLISH: He answered them: “You give them what they are to eat!” Then they said to him: “Are we to go and get breads for two hundred denarii to give to the people to eat?”
QUENYA: Hanquentes téna: “Elde áten anta ya matuvalte!” Tá quentelte senna: “Ma menuvalme ñetien massali lenárin tuxa atta antien i quenin matien?

ENGLISH: But when the Son of Man shall come in his glory, and all the angels with him, then he will sit down on his glorious throne.
QUENYA: Mal íre i Atanyondo tuluva alcareryasse, ar ilye i vali óse, tá hamuvas undu alcarinqua mahalmaryasse.

ENGLISH: You women , put yourselves under your husbands, as is proper in the Lord.
QUENYA: A nissi, á panya inde nu veruldar, ve vanima ná i Herusse.

ENGLISH: Thus I spoke an oath in my heart: They shall not come into my rest!"

ENGLISH: His eyes are like burning fire, and on his head are many diadems. He has a name written that nobody knows except he alone.

QUENYA: Nati sine haryar ilce sailiéva mi tyerie ya queni icílier inten, ar mi “naldie” ar lengie i hroanna mi naraca lé, mal ualte aşie pustien i hráveo íri návello quátine.

ENGLISH: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man, a king, who made a feast of marriage for his son.
QUENYA: “Menelo aranie ná ve nér, aran, ye carne veryangweo meren yondoryan.

ENGLISH: and he is asleep at night and rises at day, and the seed sprouts and grows tall – the man does not know how.
QUENYA: ar náse lorna lómisse ar orya auresse, ar i erde tuia ar ale halla – i nér ua ista manen.

ENGLISH: And when he came near to Bethphage and Bethany on the mountain called Mount of Olives, he sent froth two of the disciples,
QUENYA: Ar íre túles hare Vet-Fahenna ar Vetanianna i orontesse estaina Oron Milpieron, etementanes atta i hildoron,

ENGLISH: Or who is the woman who has ten drachmas who does not kindle a lamp and clean her house if one of them is lost, seeking closely until she finds it?
QUENYA: Hya man ná i nís ye same racmar quean ye ua narta calma ar poita coarya qui er mici tai ná vanwa, cestala harive tenna hirises?

ENGLISH: Paul and Timothy, thralls of Jesus Christ, to all the holy ones in Jesus Chrsit that are in Philippi, and to overseers and congregation servants:
QUENYA: Paulo ar Timoşeo, Yésus Hristo móli, ilye i airin Yésus Hristosse i ear Filippisse, ar ortirindoin ar ocombenúroin:

ENGLISH: When the crowds gathered, he said: “This generation is an evil generation. It asks for signs, but a sign will not be given to it, except the sign of Jonah.
QUENYA: Íre i şangar ocomner, quentes: “Nónare sina ná ulca nónare! Arcas tanwar, mal tanwa ua nauva antaina san, hequa Yóno tanwa.

ENGLISH: and secretly kept a part of the money that he got, as his wife also knew. He brought only a part and put it before the feet of the apostles.
QUENYA: ar nuldave hempe ranta i telpeo ya ñentes, ve yú verirya sinte. Talles eryave ranta ar panyane sa epe i apostolion talu.

ENGLISH: I have many things to say and to judge concerning you. But who sent me is true, and the things that I heard from him I am speaking in the world.”
QUENYA: Samin rimbe natali quetien ar namien pa lé. Mal ye ni-mentane şanda ná, ar i nati yar hlassen sello quétan i mardesse.”

ENGLISH: And they will go off into eternal punishment, but the just ones, into eternal life.
QUENYA: Ar autuvalte mir oira paime, mal i failar, mir oira coivie.

ENGLISH: Anyone who does the will of my father who is in heaven, he is my brother and sister and mother!”
QUENYA: Aiquen ye care i indóme Atarinyo ye ea menelde, isse ná hánonya ar néşanya ar amillinya!”
